25.06.2016, 0,75l bottle (2014 vintage) @ home: Tiny bubbly shortlasting head. Aroma is slightly fresh fruity, apple juice, sorrel, apple peel, hay, yeast, apple cores, minerals, grass, tiny hints of caramel. Taste is slightly sour-ish dry fruity, apple peel, sorrel, minerals, apple juice, hay, apple cores, yeast, alcohol, grapes, tiny hints of citrus. Medium bitterness, slightly dry mouthfeel, very soft carbonation. Fair enough.

Bottle at Danish Ratebeer Summer Gathering 2015, Ulfborg. Pours very light pale clear golden with virtually no head. Aroma of tart apples, green apples and a light funk. Flavour is over moderate sweet and light sour. Light medium bodied with flat carbonation.

Runder, ausgewogen süß-säuerlicher Apfelgeschmack. Die Süße setzt sich zum Mittelteil durch, trocken wird der Apfelwein erst später. Rund, süffig, würzig fruchtiges, ziemlich trockenes Ende. 7/9/9/11/9/11
Sampled @ Danish Summer Gathering 2015 Klare blass gelbe Farbe. Geruch nach süßen Äpfeln, Birnen. Geschmack nach säuerlichen Äpfeln, etwas trocken, interessant!
Bottle. Pale yellow colour. Moderate apple aroma. Moderate apple flavor. Semi sweet. Average finish. Oily palate.

At Danish Ratebeer Summer Gathering 2015 in Ulfborg. Day 2. Clear very pale yellow, no head. Funky overripe apple aroma, caramel, pear notes. Overripe apple flavor, caramel, funky, yeast notes, some alcohol.

Sampled at 8th Danish Ratebeer Gathering, Ulfborg 2015, day 2. Clear very pale yellow - golden, no head. Aroma is quite faint. Don’t really get anything. Taste is quite mellow and soft, some apple but soft and nicely balanced with sugary flavours. Maybe a bit on the sweet side for me to really like it but I certainly don’t dislike this one.

75cl bottle, many thanks to Gunnar! Pours a greenish gold. Overly sweet Kopparberg pear cider nose. Taste is bright and flavoursome. Smooth, sticky mouthfeel with grapes, green apple & perry notes with a wine-like feel. Great bottle design too!
How: Bottle Appearance: clear golden. Aroma: apples, floral. Palate: Medium body, average carbonation.

0.75l corked bottle. Yeah, it’s clear and normal golden looking in the glass this. Lots of big translucent bubbles that quickly fizzes away. It also has quite a lot of bubbles going on that’s rising in the glass. Smells sweet and quite nice. Apply, not to sweet with a light fresh sugary hint. Nice non extreme aroma. Soft dry apply mealy flavors. Some pink grapes with wood and soft sulfur blended with flowers. Well, it’s definitely tasty but not a instant favorite in my mouth. I did not notice the 10 percent alcohol even at the bottom of the glass. Well masked sir, well masked indeed. Don’t really see myself paying the somewhat steep price to have this again. 29.11.2013

on tap & growler-pours a tan head and copper/amber color. Aroma is medium malt-caramel/cocoa?/nutty, herbal hops, slight medium fruit. Taste is medium/dark malt-caramel/cocoa/nutty, earthy/herbal hops, slight medium fruit. Dry. Dusty mouth feel. A decent English style ESB, that’s mellow.

Somewhat flawed beer with an overly tart aspect that took over the beer. Light and thin bodied with a floral hop aroma, but little in the way of malt character, this brew poured a cloudy maize and way topped with a mid-sized fluffy white head.

I found this beer one year ago in a cafe in Antwerp, but I haven’t found it since than. Hoegaarden flavoured with peach and grapefruit, bottle wrapped in a gray plastic. Hazy light orange coloured with a sweet fruity malty aroma. There is still some hoegaarden aroma and taste, but it is sweeter and fruitier than the regular Hoegaarden. Finish is sweet fruity, little taste of peaches, with some strange touches. Not that bad.

The same with the Hoegaarden Peach Grapefruit, found this once in a cafe in Antwerp and never seen it again. The bottle also wrapped in a gray plastic. Strange hazy pale yellow coloured with an average white head and some light carbonation. Sweeter malty fruity aroma with hints of lime and some other strange touches (probably the cactus). Little artificial. Medium body, again there are clear touches of the Hoegaarden white beer, but this is sweeter and more fruity. Finish is strange sweet fruity, with some very light bitter touches. Average.
Tap at Wilde Rose, Bamberg - clear golden color, white head. taste is straw, light malts. not too much taste. okay body. average.
At Wilde Rose, bamberg. Golden yellow beer, medium head. Aroma is grain, taste is grain and sweet, some ’’brinta’’ porridge flavor.

Draught at Wilde Rose, Bamberg. Clear pale golden beer with s nice white head. Malty caramel aroma, bready, cream, citrus, some biscuits. Malty caramel flavor, biscuits, bread, some grassy citrusy hops. Fresh malt bomb.

Draft at Hotel Wilde Rose in Bamberg. Sparkling gold with a fine white head. Aroma impression is lemon, pepper, herbs, toasted malt, honeysuckle and dandelion. Lightly sweet with suitable bitterness, this is a lip-smacking and clean Helles with lively effervescence, fluffy and filling the mouth, just about the perfect balance and mouthfeel you want for the style, with lovely malt and hop expression. Light bodied but with a plump cushion of carbonation and savory malt make it seem more medium-bodied. Finish is juicy and scrumptious with enjoyably subtle bitterness. That magical baked baguette Pilsner malt and lemon-y noble hop combination is done well here, plus it’s superbly clean and savory. Overall a stellar example of a classic Bavarian Helles that is the definition of "beauty in simplicity".

Tap at the hotel. Crystal clear, with slow bubbles and a tall, fine head. Lemony hop nose, crisp saltine crackers. Classic Helles. Flavors of lemon, bread, grass, a touch of honey. Crisp, light, and very drinkable. Smooth stuff.

Bamberg jolly day 2 25/01/2014. On tap at the Brewpub in Bamberg. Pale yellow straw coloured pour with a big ol’ frothy white head. Aroma is sweet cereal, baked bread, nobel hop. Flavour is sweet cereal, slight wort, andnobel hop finish. Some earthy straw.
How: Draught. Where: At the Wild Rose Hotel. Appearance: Clear yellow colour with a white head. Aroma: Citrus, grass, malt. Body: Medium body, heavy carbonation. Flavour: Citrus, grass, hops, malt.

Day 2 of the post Xmas Bamberg Jolly, Tap at Wild Rose Hotel, 25/01/14. Clear golden with a good sized white head. Nose is light citrus, bread dough, grass - a little thin. Taste comprises pretty much the same, not much depth on this one. Medium bodied, fine carbonation, drying closure. Ok Helles but lacks depth at the business end.

On tap at Wilde Rose Gausthaus Bamberg. Clear pale gold lasting thick white head. Enormously clean. Subtle noble fragrant hop on the finish. It’s good I really like it. Just stupidly drinkable. Love the lemon curd flavour which lasts into the finish. Wow. Drank this way too quickly. Good.

Draught @ Gasthof Wilde Rose, Bamberg. Clear yellow / golden color with a average frothy good lacing white head. Aroma is moderate malty, grain, fruit, moderate hoppy, flowers. Flavor is moderate sweet nad light bitter with a average duration. Body is light to medium, body is watery to oily, carbonation is soft.

Aroma; coriander, flowers, sweet malts, strawberry note, bread. Look; fawn good head, hazy golden apricot body. Taste; juicy sweet malts, coriander, banana, apple, bread - nice n slick n sweet finish. Feel; normal body, soft co2, smooth’iesh. Overall; very good authentic German hefe! [@WildeRose in Bamberg city June2017 7384’16]
At Wilde Rose, bamberg. Orange hazy, medium head. Aroma is spices, yeast, wheat. Taste is the same. ok

On tap at the Wilde Rose Gasthaus in Bamberg. Cloudy orange amber colour esters orange melon clove enormously drinkable if you like orange inflected weizen. Good fullness in the mouth. I liked it very much. Good sweet fruit.

Draft @ Hotel-Gasthof Wilde Rose, Bamberg. Pours a hazy golden pale orange color with a small longlasting white head. Has a fruity wheat malty spicy banana aroma. Fruity wheat malty spicy banana flavor. Has a fruity wheat malty spicy banana finish.

Tap at the Hotel. Deep orange. Very cloudy and effervescent, with a tall, pillowy head. Lovely. Huge, classic nose, banana, clove, orange, a touch of smoke maybe? Bit of caramel, melon, fresh-baked doughy bread. Sweet flavor, caramel, banana, clove. A bit cloying, though tart melon and orange in the finish help to balance. Crisp, prickly carbonation works with the heavy body. Good, but a bit too sweet.

Bamberg jolly day 2 25/01/2014. On tap at the Brewpub in Bamberg. Burnt orange coloured pour with a big lasting white head. Aroma is orange, clove, toasted bready malts, semi-sweet. Flavour is composed of spicy clove, light banana yeast profile, wheat. Some chalk on the tongue.
How: Draught. Where: At the Wild Rose Hotel. Appearance: Amber colour with a white head. Aroma: Fruit, spices, banana, floral. Body: Medium body and carbonation. Flavour: Ester banana, spices, wheat.

Day 2 of the post Xmas Bamberg Jolly, Tap at Wild Rose Hotel/Gastahaus, 25/01/14. Hazed orange amber with a good sized off white head. Nose is bitter orange, light floral notes, pinch of spice, bread dough, toffee, nana. Taste comprises banana, bitter orange, straw, spice. Medium bodied with fine carbonation. Ok hefe.
On tap at the brewpub. Pours cloudy orange to light brown with nice white head. Aroma is wheat and bananas. Flavor is very full with wheat, bananas, spices and even some chocolate tones.

draft at Wilde Rose Bamberg. super turbid and cloudy orange body with a rocky white head. calcium / mineral nose with light bacterial armpit sweat notes (light enough to be suitable and well-placed in the nose, if you believe that). lots of gummy banana and orange citrus juice and acid in the nose as well. wondrously soft approach with slow-growing acid across the back: prickly, zesty and vibrant but tart juice / pulp / pith with a creamy texture and soft carbonation. though a bit sludgy and yeasty it’s very soft and nimble.

column2: Glens Falls, New York, United States
column5: 22 oz bottle. Hazy copper pour with an off-white head. Aroma of red apple, berry, caramel hints. Flavor is mostly toasted biscuit with some caramel and toffee, little hints of red apple and citrus. Kind of a tartness to it. Fairly thin for a doppelbock. Rather tame.

column2: Glens Falls, New York, United States
column5: Sampled from the tap at the brewpub. Poured a clear brownish red with a gray head that dissipated completely. Aroma was full of sweet grain that was balanced by a dark bread note and a bit of hay and roast. Flavor was similar with a sweet start that mellowed with dark grain and a hint of toast and roast.

column2: Glens Falls, New York, United States
column5: on tap-pours an offwhite/light tan head with brown color. Aroma is sweet malt. Taste is sweet medium malt, some hops. Nice. OK carbonation, a good beer.

column2: Glens Falls, New York, United States
column5: on tap-pours a thin white head with straw/yellow color. Aroma is grain, wheat, some raspberry. Taste follows.
Very smooth and creamy mouthfeel. Wonderful hop aroma and hop flavor. Well balanced - with no aftertaste.

Had on draft at McGregor’s in Chili. Orangy color. Unfortunately the bartender was just washing the dishes so the only aroma I could get was of dish soap. Great silky mouthfeel, full bodied, dry finish. Nice beer for a lager.

On tap at MacGregor’s in Henrietta. Light amber pour with very light toasted malt and just a touch of hops. A very non-offensive beginner beer. Miles ahead of any BMC, but very light in body and flavor.

on tap @ the southern tier brewery. pours a bronze color with a tanish head. like the others have said, it’s a hoppy aroma with roast malt, and little alcohol. taste is earthy with some sweetness, and hops. mid body with a lite bitter finish. not bad, not great.

On tap @ MacGregors Jefferson Ave. Disappointing. Wouldn’t classify this as a Scotch at all or If I was STier I’d be embarassed to. No balls or flavor on this. Watery, light to no aroma. slightly sweet even some cherry taste. Boo

(draft @ MacGregor’s - Canandaigua, NY) Dark copper color with a puffy tan head. Aroma is light with some hops and a decent amount of roasted malts. Flavor is slightly bitter with some hops and earth notes and a touch of sweet and caramel malts. Sweet and caramelly in the finish.

Tap at MacGregor’s - Henrietta, NY Reddish-orange body with a light head. Smooth mouthfeel though somewhat too hoppy in my opinion to be considered a Scotch Ale. Very light earth tones in the taste with a sweet ending.
On Tap on MacGregor’s in Chili. Nice sweet malty body to this beer. I did not notice any hops in there. Very enjoyable.
I was not overly impressed with this offering. Minimal aroma, bit of dough is all. Malty palate with an odd tasting hop underbite. I don’t know what the hops were doing in the scotch. Average.

On Tap on MacGregor’s in Henrietta. Very dark pour with a lasting head (probably from the tap). Aroma is very mild. Maybe just a touch of sweet smoke. The flavor brings out a bit more of the peat smokiness. Pretty sweet. The 6.5% or so of alcohol definitely brings some nice body to this beer, but it could use a bit more flavor.

Had on tap at Chili McGregor’s. Only a very small white head on this one. Nice aroma of cherries. Broke a ’Man Law’ with a fruited beer. It had nice cherry wheat flavor and went down fast. Good beer to start with when you are really thirsty.
Had on tap at Chili McGregor’s. Very high aroma of cherries (served with a cherry too - don’t fruit the beer...) Palate of cherries otherwise very light. Pale color.

Brewed for MacGregors due to Sam Adams’ rising cost of their cherry wheat. Fruit beers are not my favorite, so I am not the best person to rate this. Tastes like Cherry Wheat to me. It is Southern Tiers first fruit beer, so I give them credit for a decent first try.

On Tap at MacGregor’s in Henrietta. Super light yellow color. One or two shades away from water. There is a head, but I attribute that to the tap more than the beer. The aroma and flavor are very much like cherry cough syrup or a cough drop. The body is exceptionally light and the cherry flavor is really the only thing going on. Very weak and sad excuse for a beer, but I’m sure that is what MacGregor’s asked for.

Aroma is strong and fairly straightforward, with what I call chewy caramel followed by a spicey, alcoholic tinge. Dark brown in color with a thick and creamy head. Flavor is sweet and chocolaty, like a soft caramel covered in milk chocolate. Creamy, full body and high carbonation. On-tap at 2006 GTMW.

Tap @ GTMW 2006. Translucent and caramel-honey brown in color with a well-retained, foamy and off-white cap for the head. Sincere aroma presents rubbery chestnuts, almond-accented apple butter, nutmeg & spruce spice bread, caramel toffee and light fruited figs. Flavor semi-fulfills with a more pronounced body than the brewery’s doppelbock. Almond butter hits the dry milk chocolate cocoa powder with a mild chestnut smoothness. Something’s saying "Christmas eisbock." It’s easy going, just missing any element of stand-out ability. Milk chocolate smoothness hits talc like textures with an applewood and balsa wood scratch formality. Decent bock, but you don’t automatically get a good eisbock by freezing any old doppelbock.
Coffee and caramel, with some roast. Some booze. Pours black with decent mocha head and lacing. Bittersweet finish with a dose of finish. Tap at Plum Market in Detroit airport.

Pours dark brown with a foamy head that lingers. Aroma is bread, roast and hops. Taste is surprisingly bitter for a doppelbock, with hints of caramel and cereal. Finish is hoppy. Not what I was expecting from a doppelbock.
Nice acidic mouth feel that builds a mocha soft chocolate on the palate. A little bitterness is very faint in the back of your mouth. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Draft. Pours black. Aroma and taste are sweet caramel, and malty biscuits..
Bottle. Pours a cloudy amber with small off white head. The aroma is roast and caramel. Thin mouth spice, roasted malt, light bitter finish, good.

12 oz bottle. Poured an opaque dark brown/black with a frothy tan head and phenomenal lacing. Taste of brown sugar, vanilla, caramel with a slight dark chocolate bitterness finish. Fizzy carbonation, medium-full body, creamy texture. Overall, the alcohol is hidden well and the flavor is there, but it’s too faint for me and not as prominent as I’d like it to be.
Bottle - smells roasty and of bread. Sip adds metal and caramel with a slight grassiness. Really sweet with dark chocolate bitterness. Not what I would call a doppelbock. A little harsh.
Thanks drowland! Not a great beer. Weird metallic taste and a lot of caramel sweetness. Not much else. Not much nuance. Oh well.

6/26/15. 12oz bottle my dad brought down! Very dark brown pour with a small tan head, mild lacing. Huge metallic aroma, dusty, husky grains, toasted caramel. Bitter flavor, metallic, caramel, nutty, toasted caramel. Meh.

Missed my flight from Grand Rapids to Chicago because of the dumbass Chicago weather and so spent the night in the airport and pulled this out of my suitcase to drink with some Chex Mix. From the bottle, and so can’t tell what it looks like. Smells really malty with lots of caramel and toffee. Alcohol is noticeable. Decent beer.

column1: Three Floyds Red Tendon Baltic Porter
column5: Bottle as an extra from funkyaudio. Aroma and flavor is typical Baltic porter, but very good. Very smooth and enjoyable. Great beer. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

column1: Three Floyds Red Tendon Baltic Porter
column5: A good porter-- I agree with some other raters that the palate here is actually one of the more remarkable aspects, really nice thick creamy feel, without being too heavy. I must say, aside from the cool bottle art, nothing about this beer is very 3F. Fairly tradiitonal porter, no especially noteable hop notes. Good stuff that would hold its own against most any other porter.

column1: Three Floyds Red Tendon Baltic Porter
column5: nitrotap at the brewpub....rating number 100 which happened at FFF. woohoo!.....aroma: didn’t get too much out of this one except for the presence of some roasted malts and chocolate....appearance: looked very enticing coming out of the nitro. very creamy with a nice settling effect similar to a guinness pour. decent sized tan head....taste: sweet malts, chocolate, with a nice roastedness to it. excellent mouthfeel and creamy.....would go back just to have a few more of these.

column1: Three Floyds Red Tendon Baltic Porter
column5: I’m not sure why this is listed as a Baltic Porter... or as a "Special," for that matter, since it’s been on & off tap for some time now. Not bad looking, especially since nitro’ed, a deep ruby body with a creamy tan head. Good lacing. But the nose and flavor are both cloyingly sweet chocolate covered dark caramel. What does that have to do with the style? Or enjoyment? Three Floyds Brewing Company and Brewpub, Munster, IN

column1: Three Floyds Red Tendon Baltic Porter
column5: Poured off the nitro-tap at FFF. I was told that this was an aged version of the first batch. This beer poured a deep brown with ruby highlights around the edges of the glass. A thin, creamy beige head lasted forever. The sides of the glass were totally encompassed in lace. The aroma was made up of dark fruits, chocolate, and a bit of citrus hops. The flavor had a good amount of rasberry and chocolate. Also a good spicy hop finish. Towards the bottom of the glass, a very strong sweet aftertaste seems to take over. The mouthfeel is medium-bodied and very creamy. An excellent brew, but the sweetness tends to overwhelm the balance towards the end.

column1: Three Floyds Red Tendon Baltic Porter
column5: rating from memory, on nitro at the FFF brewpup. pours black with creamy tan head. not much in the nose, some grassy hops, light roastiness, subtle caramel. flavors of chocolate, coffee, licorice, molasses, and is pretty sweet. the flavor is rich, smooth, but sorta boring. perhaps the nitro is killing what this beer could be.

column1: Three Floyds Red Tendon Baltic Porter
column5: Had on tap at the brewpub on 9/29/06: Pours a transparent dark mahogany with a dense, creamy nitro head. Sweet, toasty, malty, but otherwise subtle aroma. Body starts with a sweet, viscous dark maltiness with some earthy milk chocolate and a smooth creamy finish. An enjoyable, fairly complex, Baltic porter.

column1: Three Floyds Red Tendon Baltic Porter
column5: GTMW. Dark brown body with creamy tan head. The aroma is roast, burnt and chocolate. The flavor is semi-sweet chocolate, coffee, roast and figs. Medium/full body with a soft ans smooth texture.

column1: Three Floyds Red Tendon Baltic Porter
column5: 9.5 ounce nitro pour at the brewpub. Dark brown with some red highlights. Creamy nitro style head. Aroma of cookies, graham crackers, fruity and chocolate. The flavor is very fruity. Some low levels of chocolate character. Pretty creamy on the palate. It was a good beer, but why the hell are they serving this with nitro?

column1: Three Floyds Red Tendon Baltic Porter
column5: GTM ’06 draught. Not much aroma; dry, reminiscent of an old ale or an alt. Dark red, almost opaque. Caskish, thin tan head with an oil slick of tan on top. Must be nitro. Streaks of head on the glass. Flavor is sweet and again, like an alt or old ale. Some smoke. Somewhat Germanic character, but also not all that different from the Baltic porters I’ve had in Russia.
dark brown w/ medium tan head. Spicy, cherry aromas. Spicy, dark cherry, cocoa, slight resin and hop/alcohol burn. nice change of pace.
bottle. thanks bri. brown pour with tasty looking head. aroma is hoppy, nutty and sweet, small wisky barrel and figs. full bodied. like sipping whisky. very sweet. creamy mouth. well balanced.
Heavy bourbon. Like a bad barleywine with a shot of JD in it. Actually couldn’t finish a bottle. The rest will go in the cellar.

On tap at the brewery. Light dark brown (if that makes sence) pour w/ a brownish small head and some light lacing. Aroma heavily of carmel and lots of bourbon notes, some definate grahm crackers, then some more bourbon (overdone if you ask me). Plate is pretty avg, some creaminess or maybe just alcohol in the swallow. Flavor was nothing special mostly the barreling that comes through and some real weak beer notes. Not very good.

On tap at the brewery. Clear dark brown color with a hint of cherry-wood. Small, but stable dark beige head. Bourbon sticky bun aromas. Lots of bourbon and caramel in the nose. Strong bourbon influence throughout. A strong brown, which translates to me as more caramel, with a really heavy dose of bourbon. Very strong with the typical bourbon notes. Even a slight burn in the finish. For me it is lacking malt depth. Perhaps its the style, and this just doesn’t hold the bourbon as well as I had hoped. Too much like a amber with a shot of whiskey in it.

Tap @ GTMW 2006. Semi-hazed and lucid light chestnut in color with saliva wisps to form the head. Caramel and bourbon fondness easily find the nose, teaming with maple syrup and amaretto scented honey graham crackers. Flavor easily transitions into said graham persona, with a mild numbing tingle at the tongue’s tip. Almonds realize a sugary grenadine brethren but bleed out to the bourbon-accented honey suckle rose. Kittle cocktails with bourbon added under the discretion of the house bartender and a hint of caramel cola underlying it all. Most of the roasty and chocolatey accents hang in the background, letting the other aforementioned elements take center stage. Medium-bodied inferences and hazelnut vanilla wafer graham crust comes through in the finish, with a tongue dabble of grenadine emitted as an extra sweet treat.
Golden color with thin yellow head. Aroma is sweet and skunky . Taste is malty with metalic notes. Low price , low quality... Baad ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottled - PET. Golden colour, small head. Sweet and fruity, medium bodied. Light plactic bitterness. An ultra-primitve industrial product vaguely resembling beer.

An orange beer with a bubbly white head. The aroma is sweet with notes of wet cardboard, straw, and malt, and a bit of skunkiness lingering in the background. The flavor is sweet malty with notes of straw and light notes of metal, leading to a dry cardboardy end. The body is thin.

Bottled. Golden colouored. Clear. Off white head. Light alcohol, grass and light sweetness in the aroma. Light skunked. Flavour is sweet wiht light fruitnotes. Has a grapish edge. Light bodied. Fruity sweet end with light alcholnotes, which surprises giving the low ABV.
Bottled. Dark golden coloured. Hay aroma. Sweet flavour of bread and toffee. Light bodied. Not very good.
500 ml bottle. White head; yellow body with strong ongoing carbonation. Faint sweetish grainy aroma. Taste is sweetish and grassy, with a bitter, grainy aftertaste. Alcoholic, raw finish.

Off white head, clear straw golden body, thick rocky lacing. Aroma of bread, dough, malts, grass, light fruity caramel. Tastes fruits, caramel, grains, bitter sticky malts - leading to a bitter-malty finish. Body ok. Better than expected, average brew. [50cl brown btl, abv6.8%, 15.5°, BB231015, B@Vopak/Pakko UA]
Bottled 500ml. -Clear golden coloured, small creamy white head, light vegetable (beet) nose. Sweet malty, light caramel, vegetables, touch of alcohol.....in short...crap.

Cask at Peterborough Beer Fest 2006. Cloudy yellow with a small white head. Smells like a lemonade. Taste is citrus/lemon in a very thin body. Some floral hops. Boring. I thought roosters were supposed to get us out of bed, this one is putting me to sleep.

Tasted by half-pint at the White Horse, Parson’s Green, W. London, during its Summer Pale Ale Festival in late July. Appearance: dark honeyish-yellow colour, to...tally cloudy, like scrumpy cider actually; no beer head, static body. Smell: very mild floral hops mixed with a slightly touch of phenol or more exactly, uh, liquidy cleaning agents... guess that’s wheat-malt or wheat? pear-ish (un-peeled) and coriander-ish notes at the back... too timid, but surely hints of wheats are there... Taste: very light-bodied grain-juice with a touch of peaches and citrus-rind, but overly restrained in flavour... turning cleaner in texture as it proceeds to the aftertaste, leaving a grist-like grainy flavour at the back. Not too bad. Palate: for a Witbier, which I suppose it’s brewed to be according to the nose, taste, and the name(!), the texture is quite clean and easily-managed, but overall the flavour is boring and lacking complex flavours. That medicinal note doesn’t add to its advantage, either.

From the barrel at GBBF, day 3 on 3 August. Cloudy straw colour. Light fruit. Quite dry with plenty of tannic grip. Mouthfeel was a bit thin. Not bad but seemed to lack a little depth. Perhaps an apple variety that works better in a blend (I’ve never seen it as a single varietal before)?

Barrel at GBBF 2006. An unclear yellow-green cider. The aroma is sweet apply with a light touch of acidty, while the flavor is apply with a light acidity, leading to a dry apply and woody end. The body is thin inspite of the 6% ABV.
Barrelat GBBF 06. Hazy yellow gold colour. Sour apple aroma. Fine if a little empty. Dullish
23-06-18 // 500ml bottle. Clear golden, white head. Quite sweet for a pils, sweet grainy with a mild bitterness.

Ein Pils, das mir wirklich zugesagt hat. Leicht würzig mit einer angenehmen Bodenständigkeit, wenig Getreide, dafür knackig und mild im Abgang. Sehr angenehm zu trinken und bisweilen sehr süffig. Gute Sache.
*Old rating. Best before 09.09.03. Nettes, trocken neutrales Pils. Schöne Herbe, süffig. Ein Hauch Getreide. Nett.
Weich herber Beginn. Kaum steigende Intensität, erst spät nimmt die zwar milde aber unpassende Süße ab, das Bier wird trockener und pilsiger. Naja... 8/7/9/8/8/8
Bottle from Maruhn. Clear golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty and moderate hoppy - grass. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 241114
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein goldgelbes Pils mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch hopfig, grasig. Geschmack herb, grasig, minimal würzig.
Draft at brewpub. Golden with medium white head. Aroma of grassy hops. Light body with a hint of honey and a nice hop bitterness.

50cl draught at the Brauerei. Clear yellow colour with a small and white head. Aroma is hoppy and malty. Medium carbonation and light body. Flavour is quite bitter but suave for a pilsener. Overall a very pleasant beer.
Bottle 50cl from kevnic2008. A clear yellow beer with good head. Nose is very hops on the grassy side. Aroma is very nice, malty, bitter, grassy hops, a well done pilsener, much better than expected.

bottle from kevnic2008 - danke! Clear pale yellow, large and creamy white head. Lovely hop aroma, very aromatic with fresh hay. Elegant malt base, fine carbonation that suports the flavours perfectly. Delicious aromatic hops, grassy and resiny with a touch of hay and citrus fruit. What a delicious beer, a truly superb example of the style. Anytime again - a pleasure!

All of the brews that I’ve had at this place are watery. This one is called a brown ale, which it is, but is described on the brewpub menu as a "medium bodied, sweet light amber ale." I.e., these folks are confused about beer. This one is a light brown, well carbonated concoction with an off-white head that nicely laces the Pilsener glass that it was served in. Not much aroma, some sweet, lightly roasted malts. The flavor is mostly suburban water with a bit of roasted malt flavoring. No hops that I could tell. The finish is wet. Millrose Restaurant and Brewing Company, South Barrington, IL

This draft brew from the brew pub poured a medium sized head of foamy finely sized light brown colored bubbles that were long lasting and left behind a semi-opaque dark red brown colored body and a good lacing. . The mouth feel was very tingly at the start and at the finish with a mellow vinous aftertaste. The flavor contained notes of hops sweet vinous dough and brown malt. Delicious and one I would certainly buy again.

On tap at Onion. Poured a clear deeper reddish-brown with a medium cap of well-retained creamy beige head. Aroma was of sweet, toasty caramel and darker malts, with mild herbal hop presence. Flavor had a heavy focus on dark and toasty caramel and brown sugary malts.. some woody bitterness gets swallowed up by the heavy sweetness.. finish was warm, sweet, and satisfying. Medium-bodied or a hair heavier on the palate.. quite sweet, but grew on me... just the right level of carbonation. Nice one.
appearance might have been better if it wasn’t served in the pilsener glass. had hardly any aroma. tasted sweet and decent.

Strange brewpub offering for the Summer, but, what the heck... The body is a clear golden brown and it’s capped with a creamy beige head. It smells of caramel with lightly roasted malts - all fairly faint. The flavor kicks up a notch, more roasted flavor, more malt sweetness, and a light earthy hopping to balance it out. I questioned the "doppel" part of it until the finish when a good nip of alcohol kicked in. I wish this joint would let us in on the ABVs for their brews. I might’ve had another. Onion Pub & Brewery, Lake Barrington, IL

Cask, Jan Primus. Aroma is spicy, floral-hoppy. Clear, golden coloured with a thin white head. Taste is moderate bitter, floral hoppy, slightly fruity and spicy (ginger probably). Slighly dry, watery and fresh. Quite a decent, well-balanced brew. The spicyness is a nice touch to the beer.

Cask, Jan Primus. Clear golden color, short head. Aroma is quite spicy of ginger and some nutmeg, furthermore some lemon and wheat, bit hop. Bitter taste, but also spicy, crisp, bit dry. Nice for 1 pint, but not more.

(Cask at Akkurat, Stockholm) Colour is golden yellow with little head. Nose is fruity with hints of lemon and a spicy wheat character. Taste is fruity with notes of orange and lemon, starts sweet but turns drier in a finish with a hint of spices (coriander?). Light body (on the thin side, actually) and gentle taste. Refreshing.

[Cask at Akkurat, Stockholm] Clear pale golden. Lightly citric nose. Sweet and soft with plenty of coriander and some vanilla. Fresh ans lightly lemony. Low bitterness. A well made English wheat ale with a lot of character of it’s own.
Cask (gravity) Worcester BF 2006. Smooth, smooth stuff; wheaty whiffs and licks of light spice, short finish, gentle beer.

Cak at Olicer Twist. Stockhol. Golden colour with a low white head. Light aroma of lemon, wheat and herbs. Light and a bit thin flavour of straw, lemon and wheat. Thin, almost bland body. Short watery aftertaste with an accent of lemon

Cask handpull at Wenlock Arms. Gold with thin white head. As Hophead is to JHB so this is to White Dwarf. Lovely hop aroma. US style hop plus bit of creamy grapefruit. Cereal in mouth. Citrus, cerealfinish. Lacks bite and sharpness and a bit flabby to be excellent.
A light hefeweizen. Similar in flavor but lighter with a watery texture. Nothing spectacular.

This pours a bright, clear yellow body with a sustained, creamy white head. The nose is slightly tart, wheat with a slice of unripe banana. Very soft mouthfeel. The flavor is more that of an American wheat ale, wheat with a slightly bitter graininess that lasts into the finish. I was told by the lady mixologist that this was basically their hefeweizen in a filtered version, but it seems pretty removed from that. Onion Pub & Brewery, Lake Barrington, IL
Bottle from tesco. Pale golden, head dissipates rapidly. Aroma is grainy, vegetal. Taste focuses more on the grains, but still retain some of the vegetal notes. Feel is oily and slick. Not great.
Cracking pint, smooth with soft peach and vanilla flavour and a decent dry hoppy finish. Pours hazy straw gold with a luxurious cream head. Lovely.
Bottle from Tesco, New Street, Birmingham. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are grain, malt, grass, straw and hops. Bitter and bready finish.

Bottle from Tesco, New Street, Birmingham. Clear yellow with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, light fruity and light citrus. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Sweet and moderate bitter finish. 280717
Bottle, golden with notes of white grapes and guava on the nose, sharply bitter with lightly sweet undertones.
Gold foamy head and lacing cream soda taste with a hint of orange decent sessionable stuff.

Butelka 500ml. Jasno-zlote z burza bialej piany ,ktora utrzymuje sie dlugo w szkle. W aromacie duzo cytrusow ,kwiatow i ziarna. W smaku dosc slodkawe ,oleiste z cytrusowym finiszem. Dominuja cytrusy ,zbozowe akcenty ( pszenica).
Bottle. Pours a light gold colour with a small but firm white head, light hop aroma with plenty of orange, taste is bitter and again hoppy with a dry bitter finish.
Bloody tasty in cask. Bottled version was disappointing. Seemed to lose its hops?! ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Cask at the Henry Addington canary wharf. Light hazed yellow straw coloured pour with a small loose white head. Aroma is damp hay, straw, rough grains. Flavour is composed of grain husks, spicy, hedgerow hop, straw! Wheat. Palate is light grainy with decent cask condition. Decent rustic golden.

This draft brew from the brew pub poured a small sized head of foamy white colored bubbles that were mostly diminishing and left behind a transparent softly carbonated straw yellow colored body. The weak aroma was malty. The mouth feel was tingly at the start and at the finish. The flavor contained notes of malt hops and astringent. Not one that I would buy again.

The brewmaster told me that this beer was replacing their regular wheat ale that wasn’t light enough for the brewpub’s BMC crowd. (?!) Not to be confused with their Lunker Lager, this one is admittedly adjunct laden - and it reeks of it. It’s got a strong corn aroma and a strong corn taste with a touch of generic hop bitterness. I’d complain more about the lowering of standards for the crowd that’d be just as happy with a Miller Light, but I got this one for free. Brass Restaurant & Brewery, South Barrington, IL

I was initially amused by the "German" in the name... until I remembered that I belong to a site that features German Hefeweizen and German Kristallweizen.This German ale is bright yellow with a fluffy white head. Nice lacing. The faint aroma has sweet malt, soft wheat, and a mild earthy bitterness. Same with the taste. decent enough on a warm Summer day.. Brass Restaurant & Brewery, South Barrington, IL

"Grohe Bock", vom Faß im Brauereiausschank in Darmstadt. - Dunkel kupferrotbraun, klar. - In der Nase dichtes dunkles Karamelmalz und dezente Hopfenherbe, bocktypisch schwer. - Antrunk satt toastmalzig und dunkelmalzig mit nussiger und feiner herbaler Herbe. Milder rezent, sämig, gut kaschierter Alkohol. Im Abgang frische hopfige Herbe. - Schön frischer, kernig malziger Bock, wie ein stärkeres Märzen. (7.10.2019.)
16-03-18 // taster at Grohe brewpub. Clear amber golden. Small white head. A solid bock with a mildnc sweet caramel aroma. Mild herbal bitter.
From bottle. Transfer of an earlier rating without text recorded, rating only.

Bottle. Clear, red brown color, small white head. Sweet caramel nose. Taste has a strong ethanolic touch, very sweet, medium bitter. Very sweet malty aftertaste, sweet caramel, cereals. Thin body, average carbonation.
Clear ruby color with some foam. Sugary sweet nose. The taste is sweet and ambery and it is dangerously easy to drink. Calm sweetish aftertaste.

Bottle @ THT December. Pours a clear reddish brown beer with a small off white head on top. Aroma of malts, caramel, nuts and earthy stuff. Flavor is rather sweet, malty and quite ok and full. Slightly boozy though, despite only being 6.2%. Still, a very decent bock.

Bottle at DOST. Clear copper pour with nice white head. Aroma is slightly toasty, malty, nice classic bock, light fruity notes, slightly worty. Taste is sweet, light boozy character, fruity notes. Palate is med bodied with good carbonation. Good bock.

Bottle at the Dirty Old Sock Tasting, Den Haag, December 2014. Poured a clear medium amber with a thin white head. The aroma is woody hop, resin. The flavour is moderate sweet, light bitter with a woody, sweet malt, light spice hop bitter palate. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.
33cl bottle sampled @ December THT courtesy of JulienHuxley No head. Clear light amber pour. Light sweetness. Easy drinking.
Bottle shared at the DOS tasting. Pours clear amber with a small white head. Aroma of malt, dough, toffee. Flavour is moderate sweet and light bitter. Light medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Rating from 2005. Fruchtig-bananiger Antrunk. Süßlich-hefig-mild, aber vom Körper her nicht zu voll. Im Nachgeschmack wird das Bier etwas herber, dabei verliert es deutlich an Fruchtigkeit und Fülle. Schade, aber dennoch lecker. --> 11
Cloudy orange colour with a white head. Yeast and some wheat banana in the aroma. Yeasty, light spicy, wheat and banana flavour. Fresh and nice weisse. [Bottle from a trade with Grima]

column1: Flossmoor Station Imperial Mocha Java Stout
column5: On tap at the brewpub, rating from memory, pours black with tan head. really intense coffee nose. a very nice and rich dark coffee flavor dominate the flavor and causes this to be delicious and way off balanced. very tasty.

column1: Flossmoor Station Imperial Mocha Java Stout
column5: Draft: Deep black. Burnt orange foam. Charcoal, burnt toffee, vibrant espresso, seared oak, and hints of campfire smoke fill the nostrils. Soft, fuzzy pricks of carbonation. Delightfully viscous, however. Decadent layers of bitter chocolate and espresso blanket the substantial hoppiness, initially. Espresso continues at full throttle, and expresses a vibrant yet meaty quality which pulls the palate downward with a tug of suppleness. Immense complexity here. Alcohol overexerts itself at the center, as does a subtle vegetal characteristic, but the alcohol is short lived. Dried plums provide a dab of acidity and complement the seemingly endless depth of richness. Molasses and port wine notes contribute more chewiness. Notes of char remain prominent, deepening the fruitiness with a burnt custard and ashen malt overlay. Finishes slightly chewy with yeast, but remarkably flavorsome and multilayered with burnt cookies and charred malts drizzled with melted fudge, dense espresso, and beefy molasses. Overall, the alcohol detracts from some of the more-polished elements of the flavor, and the fuzzy carbonation is the body’s only culprit, as the texture is slightly less than flawless. Still lots to love about this. Another commendable effort.

column1: Flossmoor Station Imperial Mocha Java Stout
column5: GABF 2006. Black body. Nose is pure coffee. Dark roasted malts and oily coffee beans. Taste is coffee - dark coffee with oily beans like a French Roast or Espresso. Dark roasted malts and hint of dark, bittersweet chocolate. Body is medium-full and vibrant. Ends with more coffee, roasted malts and a lingering bitterness.

column1: Flossmoor Station Imperial Mocha Java Stout
column5: Rating #900!!!! On tap at the brewery on 10/21/2006 at the 2nd monthly meeting of the Chicago Ratebeer group. Tan brown head, body is totally black. Nose is super huge and strong can be easily felt and smelled when you walk by someone with this beer. Full of coffee with just a hint of cream. Taste is full of coffee grounds then with more coffee beans. Very strong full malty backbone and the alcohol. Oh my friend, there is pleanty of that all over the place. Awesome.

column1: Flossmoor Station Imperial Mocha Java Stout
column5: Enjoyed at the monthly Chicagoland gathering and served in a snifter: Completely opaque with a small frothy tan head and shows excellent lace. The nose displays espresso, bittersweet chocolate, burnt and roasted malts, plum and earthy yeast esters. The taste comes forth with a big espresso characteristic that is very bitter and roasted with a minor background of acidic fruit twang and a sweeter chocolate finish. The finish is moderately smoky and ashy with some alcoholic bite. The mouth feel is oily and creamy as well with a smoothness that comforts and has a cleansing light alcohol nature, the aftertaste is ashy and has that espresso overtone lingering about. This is one solid Impy but could a hint of more body then it would truly rock. It once again it appears the coffee makes the body seem thinner. I can not wait to try this on wood next weekend at FoBAB!

column1: Flossmoor Station Imperial Mocha Java Stout
column5: GABF 2006: Opaque black with a nice briwn head. Aroma of spent coffee grains, big roast and chocolate underneath. Huge back coffee flavor. It had some of that tartness that black can sometimes have. Bitter tart finish. Silky and creamy mouthfeel.

column1: Flossmoor Station Imperial Mocha Java Stout
column5: Draught at brewpub; served in a snifter. Now that this brew has 10 ratings and is over 4.0, it will start getting some national attention. Doesn’t smell overly alcoholic. Rich aroma. Dark black body with a light brown head and some lace. Sweet, rich flavor with a strong alcohol profile. Really exceptional.

column1: Flossmoor Station Imperial Mocha Java Stout
column5: Draft... GABF ’06... This beer rocks!... Pitch black ale with a small, very creamy, light brown head. Espresso and chocolate nose. Well-balanced, rich and very flavorful. Sweet, chocolatey flavor up front, then bitter, burnt espresso grounds and charcoal. Full-bodied with a velvety mouthfeel and medium carbonation. Burnt, bittersweet finish. World class coffee stout!

column1: Flossmoor Station Imperial Mocha Java Stout
column5: Big black pour w/ a fluffy tan head and some nice lacing. Huge bittersweet chocolate chips and espresso aroma. Palate is well coated and full. flavor is light chocolates more espresso, some lactose notes, a bit of burnt grain. very nice.

column1: Flossmoor Station Imperial Mocha Java Stout
column5: Repeated sample at GABF. Massive chocolate/coffee aroma is narrow, but deep and lasting. Deep black body with a fluffed up creamy mocha head. Fore is black coffee, bitter burnt roast, dark milk chocolate notes with a touch of hot warming alcohol and a long espresso finish. Flavor range is also narrow, but concentrated, tasty and lingering.
6 oz draft pours golden with a white head. Aroma and taste much the same, malt and grains. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
From the Festival of Iowa Beers, very light color, hardly any aroma, very light flavor, not much taste but thirst quenching.
Draught at 2nd Annual Festival of Iowa Beers. Clear golden color with thin white head that left no lace. Not much aroma. Subdued hop and white bread flavors. I liked the blonde better.
Sampled at the Festival of Iowa Beers. Tasty and lightly refreshing. Slight hay like flavors. Very drinkable but not outstanding.

Sampled at the brewpub. Poured with a light yellow body. There was a hint of haze in the body while the head was snowy white. The aroma was a lot of bread with bell peppers, some Saaz hops and chewing gum. The taste was funky cheese with Saaz and some abc gum. There was also a hint of oatmeal. Yes, I know the style, that is what I tasted. Very smooth with the carbonation. Another solid lager from a solid brewpub.
6 oz draft pours golden with a white head. Aroma of grain and some roasted malt. Taste is the malt and a bit of sweetness. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Medium copper with a white head. Malty with a little bit of oranges. The taste is woody and nasty with some old watered down orange juice. There is a strange smoke note. I noticed this same strange smoky taste in their IPA. A little bizzarre. Earlier Rating: 8/15/2006 Total Score: 3.1 Sampled at the brewpub. The body was a fairly hazy medium gold. The aroma had oranges with some fresh ground wheat. There was also a hint of leather. The taste was bread crust withalmonds. There was also some decent toffee. The carbonation was a little sharp, but I thought it added to the nice mouthfeel. Decent.

When I was at the Duck, this was called Pintail Pale Ale, a new recipe. From the tap, sampled at the proper cooler cellar temperature in a pint glass. A new recipe APA from the Duck that I had to try. Poured a clear reddish orangey golden with a foamy white head that settled into a fine lacing. Aromas of citrus and dry leafs, sweet cereal grains and a hint of butter. Moderate carbonation overall and a softly crisp, dryish, watery, thin light bodied mouthfeel. Disappointing thin, watery taste, watery citrus rind, not very pleasing, earthy leafiness that provides only hop bite, but the bitterness is so soft and watery that if you were in the brewpub with a bunch of smokers, you would have a hard time finding it, thin, thin, sweet cereal grainy malts, a watery backing, and a finish that has some dryness to it, but the watery, washed out hop and malt flavors doesn’t utilize it. Washed out hops and thin malts leads to a APA I won’t be trying again.

Draught at the brewpub. Clear golden color with lasting white head that left some lace. Light citrusy hop and malty cereal grain aroma. Sweet maltiness on the tongue. The malt flavor is a bit overwhelming and unfortunately smothers the delicate hops that linger in the background. There is a touch of brown sugar flavor that lingers.
From the Jug at the GABF, Colorado Convention Center 12/10/2007 Floral aroma. Bronze coloured and a little rich on the palate. Fruity with some dryness in a pale malt finish.

On tap at the LO Ram. Pours dark red with a thin cream colored head. Toasty malt aroma with a light chocolate hint. Decent dunkel up front, malty and clean, but the finish was a mess, to bitter and a strong mineral taste. I really was looking for another beer quick after getting this one.
(Tap) Pours dark with small head. Malty and slightly bitter. Some kind of off flavor was also evident. Overall unimpressive.

listed as doppelstilskin at thje cb & potts location highlands ranch. a dark brown pour that was marroon on the edges with a lasting and lacing off white head. the aroma was caramel and metal with some maple. taste was more maple, and a lot of nut flavor. caramel flavor came out much better later in this. this had a metallic taste to it the whole time that destracted. but it was still drinkable. sweet lingering flavor.

Draught at 2006 Craft Lager Festival. Pours dark walnut brown with a patchy tan head. Aroma is sweet caramel and chocolate malt (cookie), yeast (dough) and flowers. Yeasty sweat, medium sweetness, malt and toast with buttery caramel notes, chocolate milk. Medium bodied and foamy palate.

(06.08.06) On tap at Rockbottom Chicago, Chicago, IL. Poured black brown opaque with tiny tan head. No discernable carobonation. Coffee chocolate flavor. Medium bodied porter that starts dry with intense roasted malt and coffee flavors. Finished with lingering roasted malt bitterness. Though watery and on the thin side, this is a decent drinkable beer tjat went well with food.

Dark orange with an aromatic, fruit aroma that has hints of caramel. The flavour is very fruity aromatic, slightly spicy citrus hints of caramel and a very long finish. The bitterness is nice, in my mouth it’s on the palate roof and the back of the tongue.. Charming indeed... 2415

Draught at the brewpub. Hazy roast brown, rich creamy head. Aroma of butter, peat and toffee. Sweet, soft and lightly woody. Medium bodied with some spun sugar and butterscotch, and lots of chocolate. Light flowery bitterness that grows with time. The brewer is constantly changing the recipe and altering the beer. I also got to try a newer batch, still not fully mature. This batch had a shorter time on oak barrels, clocking in at 5.8%. Being much younger it was more fruity and sparkling, and less malty and woody. Both of the beers were interesting and tasty, although a bit rustic. A visit to the brewery restaurant is highly recommended!

Pours red amber. Hoppy, light caramelly aroma with tones of nuts, resin, pine, and something a bit fruity and candy like. Hoppy, caramelly flavour with nutty, resiny, and piney tones. A bit fruity. Light syrupy mouthfeel with a medium body. Light bitter.
Dark amber with a small, bubbly head. Sourish and fruity with some toffee. Grassy bitterness in amedium body.
Bottled. Dark copper colour. Good fruity, caramelly aroma with notes of Zoo-pastilles. Solidly malty flavour with lots of fruits. Long finish with light bitterness.
Amber/orange color, almost no head. Fruity aroma, hoppy notes, oranges and apples. Fruity, hoppy flavor with a grassy and metallic bitterness.

Dark red hazy colour, with a flat head. Aroma of malts, citrus,flowers, and a nice hopy nose. Flavor is almost the same, but has a nice smouth mouth feeling. Thin to medium body, and a short to medium finish. Nice beer from this small brewery!
Hazy ruby red, no head. Fruity malt aroma, with some floral hops. Medium bodied, soft carbonation. Long and bitter finish, with a light acidity to it.
Klasyczny RIS. Bez udziwnieñ i dróg na skróty. Mocno palony, czekoladowy, wytrawny z delikatn¹ tylko slodycz¹. Oleisty i g³adki.

Wow, what a label, and then I saw Mikkeller and that it was a stout of some kind. Obtained at an upscale beer shop in Santa Fe in October, it is getting the try tonight. I selected my New Belgium tulip for the tasting. The lid comes off and I make the pour out of a 12.7 oz bottle. The body is coal black with a resolute light-to-medium tan skim of foam, The scent is strong licorice, sour dough bread and blackberry, all good. But I am here for the drink. Heavy on the malt, quickly a berry sweetness, oatmeal, cracker, light chocolate and firmly bitter at the end. Not as viscous as other imperial stouts but that is not a bother, just an observation. A very good effort, not a favorite.
This is a typical pilsner, goes good with a meal, or just with friends on a hot summer day. Another easy drinker from Norway.
0,5 litre Can from Coop Jessheim Storsenter. Clear Golden with white head. Malts, hops, sweetness, some bitterness.

(31-Dec-2006) Lovely luscious sweet apricot aroma. Cloudy orange-brown colour, ok head and good sheet lacing. Big sweet fruit hop flavour but some medicinal notes, Funny pungent aftertaste, can’t quite finger or tongue on it.

very idicative of beers from the region. light and dark fruit punch flavor leaning toward cherry with a foamy citrus tasting head. an appropriately malty balance with a hint of wood and a bit of floral. very nice vibrant carbonation yet smooth as well attributalble a bit to the taste. thank you Ned.
Pours golden color with medium white head. Aromas are malts, honey, fruits and caramel. Short bitter and sweet finish. I like the label with the frill-necked lizard better than the beer itself.

yelllowish colour, off aromas, tastes like something went wrong during fermentation. Very sour flavour. Not a good example of a pale ale. Had this one again 8/04/09, must have been a shonky bottle earlier. Earthy floral aromas, not over the top. Some malt on the palate. Good carbonation and mouthfeel. Would rate better as a golden ale I believe. Overall a decent session beer.

330ml bottle. Rich amber colour when poured and had a nice generpus head of white foam with large bubbles. Well carbonated with an aroma of floral hops and spices. Crisp and cleansing on the palate with alight dry finish and clean flavour.

...bottle. Poured a golden yellow with a small white head. Carbonation was low, and should have been higher. On the nose were floral hops, some fruity notes, and a hint of sweet malt. Flavors were too sweet, with a hint of apple, and some weird honey. Light bodied, watery and no carbonation. Finished sweet, with a weird fruity aftertaste. Not really a pale ale, but wasn’t that bad actually, but there was something not right. It was reduced to clear, so that might have something to do with it, otherwise it would have been way overpriced.
Not a good example of a Pale Ale. Insipid colour, thin, fermentation issues. disappointed.
Frothy head,nice gold colour,good carbonation.Aroma grassy,salty.Flavour metallic,blots out other flavours,gives the beer a sourness,thats as far as I need to go.

(Bottle 33 cl) Pours a slightly hazy golden with a small, rough, white head. Lightly sweetish aroma of fruit bubblegum. Medium-bodied with sweet malts, sweetish fruit and a cardboardish edge. The finish is dry. 030208
Light and slightly hazy body. White head of good size. Not much to say about the aroma - pretty neutral. Very light and fruity in the taste. Short aftertaste.

Draught at Space Craft in Krakow. Dark reddish brown with a tan head. Not much aroma and a taste of roasted malts, burnt toast and mild chocolate. Some light grassy bitterness. A little thin and watery, but not bad.
Good carbo mixed up with decent malt and coffee moments. Sweetish ending with some roasted malt.
Karmel, s³odkie, trochê kwaœne na finiszu, wodniste, dziwny niesmaczny chmiel, s³abe tmave. Jedynie wygl¹d na plus, reszta poni¿ej œredniej.
Lekkie, przyjemne, czuæ lekko ciemne s³ody, nie jest wodniste, ca³kiem fajne
Zapach wêglowy z wyczuwalny cukrem. Troszkê zbyt gazowane, trochê kwaœne, trochê slodkie... nie jest to zbyt dobry browarek.
Pours from the bottle dark clear black with sizable stable off white head, bready notes in the aroma, notes of chocolate and Carmel with hoppy herbal bitterness in the neck

15-07-2018; draft; somewhere in Sklarska Porêba, Poland (bought somewhere in Sklarska Porêba, Poland). The looks of the beer are very Good. The beer looks very dark. The color is a nice dark brown, with a lovely ruby red glow. Beautiful. On top there is a nice layer of soft creamy almonds foam. Nicely done. The smell of the beer is nice. Not very strong. There are some nice malty aromas, with a lovely touch of roast, toast and liquorice. Amazingly done. Not to strong. There are also some nice herbal hoppy notes. The taste is very good. Nice sweet malts with hints of caramel. There are also some nice bitter roast and hop flavours. It is well balanced. Amazing. The palate is good. Medium full body, smooth and medium carbonation. The finish has a very nice caramel flavour. Nicely done. Not to long, but quite smooth. Nice!!!
Pøíjemné,tmavé a husté pivo s typickými znaky dunkelu, velmi vyrovnané, plní, øízné s tóny praženého sladu a kávy.
caramel, bread, dark-brown color, rocky head, light sweetness, lightly bitter, light body, thin feel,

Ca³kiem ³adne, doœæ obfita piana, ale szybko siê dziurawi. Barwa coli, widoczne refleksy. Doœæ intensywny aromat, ale jakiœ taki nijaki, niby palone s³ody, ale nie porywa. Trochê wodniste, nijakie. œrednio wysycone. Spodziewa³em siê czegoœ wiêcej.

Cask at The Old Oak Inn, Horsley Woodhouse, Derbyshire 14-07-09 Pours dark brown with an off white head. There is a touch of smoke on the nose and some woodland aroma’s. The taste show’s some burnt woody touch’s, is really quite fruity and tasty. Nice stuff. A7 A3 F7 P4 Ov13 3.4
Cask-conditioned at the Bag O’Nails, Bristol 27/11/07. Near black with a slight tan head. Aroma of roasted malt with some toffee. Flavour of caramel, red fruit and a slightly roasted finish. Good.
Cask@Nottingham Beer Festival 2007. Blackish brown beer with a lightly roasted aroma and a roasted and lightly dry flavour. Overall an average beer.
Cask, Nottingham Fest 07. Dark brown with a small head. Aormas are caramel, mollasses and berries with roast malts. Flavours are earthy with light caramel and chocolate malts. Simple, but tasty.

Cask gravity at Nottingham BF 2007. Very dark brown. Decent mild. Very mild in fact. Nice malts, a little thin as you would expect. Good condition. Pretty good for the style. Bit of stilton cheese flavour.
Gravity at The Wellington, Birmingham. Black with no head. Chocolate and caramel scents with roasted coffee in the mouth. Thin and quite sweet.

Cask (handpull) Old Oak Inn, Horsley Woodhouse. Ah.... mild in May throws up a few pearls amongst some swine-ish bilge. This is a pearler. Attractive off-black body, subtle liquid berries and just the right side of charcoal. Makes the trip out to what is in effect the brewery tap for this beer such a rewarding experience.
Bottle @ Björn tasting. Pours a clear golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty grainy aroma. Fruity malty grainy grassy flavor. Has a fruity malty grainy grassy finish.
Rated 2005 as Wohn Nailaer Fichtenzäpfla. Ein goldenes, süffig-süßliches Bier, das für die Süße gerade im Nachgeschmack erstaunlich herb daher kommt. Nicht schlecht! --> 9

How: Bottle. Where: Tasting at Björn. Appearance: Golden colour with a small white head. Aroma: Malt, some fruit, overall weak. Body: Light to medium body, medium carbonation. Flavour: Weak, malt, grass.

Bottled@Björn tasting. Golden colour, small head. Aroma is mild fruity notes, nice herbal, bready and sweet malty notes. Flavour is very similar. Refreshing, but nothing out of the ordinary when it comes to a German pils.
Bottled. Clear pale golden, brief coarse head. Grasiny and grassy. Light-medium bodied with clean, crisp mouthfeel, Bread and grass. Really bitter finish. Harsh
Bottle at Björns. Golden color, small white head. Light malty aroma. Medium-bodied. Grassy a bit sweet malty flavor. Clean and balanced.
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein klares goldgelbes Bier mit geringer Schaumkrone. Geruch hopfig, grasig, leicht metallisch. Geschmack hopfig, grasig, würzig, im Hintergrund leicht metallisch.

It’s warm golden with a creamy, white head. The aroma has the same notes as the slightly sweet flavour: malt, fruit, light bread and straw w, and the finish is bittre, nice, straightforward and harmonic.

Sorry for the german rating, but this is a lousy rating from my "newbie" time (2007-2009), and it’s not worth of being translated. I just added it for the statistics, and to complete my backlog! Im Glas schauts gelb und sogar leicht rötlich aus, mit einer fein-mittelporigen, kleinen Krone. Es prickelt sehr schön und weiß zu gefallen. Beim Geruchstest kommen hauptsächlich Hopfenaromen durch. Der Antrunk ist zuerst dezent hopfig, sehr würzig und gut rezent. Im Nachgeschmack wird das Ganze dann doch sehr herb.

Ein seltsamer, wenn auch schwach ausgeprägter Geruch nach rohem Sauerkraut entsteigt dem eingeschüttetem Bier. Getreidig-sanfter Verlauf ohne Aromaspitzen mit leichten Andeutungen von Cornflakes. Erst spät im Abgang entwickelt sich die Herbe des Bieres. Etwas spät. So dümpelt das Bier eher im Flachwasser dahin. Tannenzäpfle, Eiszäpfle, jetzt Fichtenzäpfla. Ich bin in froher Erwartung eines Kiefernzapfens.Test vom 13.4.2008, Gebinde: Glasflasche

Cask (handpull) The Stables Bar, Denby. Turned out to be the last beer before the brewery refit. A solid bitter, ticks the usual boxes with deep malts and chewy sweetness. Last beer in a long and excellent session at the Leadmill tap. Hope the Stables re-opens soon.
Gelbes Export mit wenig grobporigem Schaum. Merkwürdiges Aroma nach Süßkartoffel. Dünner Antrunk. Etwas Malz im Geschmack und Bitterhopfen im Nachgeschmack, alles ziemlich dürftig. Nicht gut.
Bottle 50cl. Nice appearance, odd label. Flat, dull taste. Watery.Nothing to remember.
Deep golden color. Malty, but with a barnyard smell, almost like manure. Full bodied. Malty flavor, hay, hops. O.K
Bottle 50cl, a clear yellow beer with medium head. Nose is hopy. Aroma is malty, sweet grain, not bad export even if it is quite common, spicy hops at the finish.

Bottle 500ml. @ home. Clear medium yellow color with a average to large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white head. Aroma is light to moderate malty, grain, toasted, hay - gras, light hoppy, grass - hay. Flavor is moderate sweet and light bitter with a average duration. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20110205]

Bottle purchased from Toom Getranke. Pours a mild yellow color with almost no head and lacing. Aromas of grains and grass with a smattering of hop notes. Flavor is bland pale lager that everyone is used to and doesn’t know how to rate anymore.

Das Export strotzt nur so von Wössrigkeit, ein herb-blechernes Aroma ist darunter feststellbar. Dieses ist jedoch so schwach, dass die Vermutung nahe liegt, dass an der Menge der Zutaten gespart wurde. Das Aroma wird im Laufe des Mittelteil etwas stärker, jedoch nicht angenehmer, da der Ton weiterhin plörrig wirkt. Das Pils kann mich noch halbwegs überzeugen, bei dem Export sind Hopfen und Malz (sofern sie denn verwendet wurden) verloren.
Bottled. A yellow beer wih no head. The aroma is sweet malty with light acidic notes. The flavor is sweet malty, leading to a lightly bitter end. Boring.
Bottle. Pale golden colour with a small off-white head. Hay aroma and a light sweet malty taste. Medium body with a sweet finish.
Bottle, 5.3%. Clear yellow colour. Sewer aroma and flavour. Only the alcohol makes this better than their pils.

A Mes rate: Quick half from the Marble brew pub in Chorlton. Yuk yuk. Considering I have tried many Marble beers I feel safe to say this was not up to their usual standard. Malted water. A bit off in the aroma. Nasty hop finish. Had worse but it is far from great.
A Scotch ale. Red brown colour, fruit/malt/hop aroma, fruity malt flavour, medium sweet finish with a hint of hop.

Bottle from KWM Wine, as Hilden Headless Dog. Cloudy golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, light fruity and light hoppy - grass. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 131119
Bottle from random Tesco in Belfast. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are caramel, fruits, hops, flowers and has a nice bitter finish.
Clear amber with a thin white head that dilapidates quickly. Taste is predominantely grainy. OK
Copper colour with thin head. Aroma and flavour have some toasted malt. Decent body. Fine carbonation. Well balanced and sessionable.
Pours an amber colour. Taste is quite malty. Well balanced. Decent session ale

column1: Bell's Cherry Stout - Bourbon Barrel Aged
column5: Bourbon and nougat nose, faint cherry and even fainter charred oak. Black, thin tan head. Tart black currant and prune. Medium body, easy carbonation. Not nearly as good as the non-barrel aged version.

column1: Bell's Cherry Stout - Bourbon Barrel Aged
column5: Pours very dark with an insinuation of a thin foam ring. Aroma is far subtler than I expected. The notes I anticipated are there, coffee, bourbon, cherries ... but it’s so mild that I struggle to discern much. The barrel notes are there on the flavor, and some tart cherries. Plus there are mild herbal/licorice notes. But like the aroma, the aroma isn’t at all aggressive. On another day I might love this beer. Today I think it’s only OK.

column1: Bell's Cherry Stout - Bourbon Barrel Aged
column5: Good complexity - dark, wild cherry aromas, with bourbon, chocolate, coffee and dried fruit aromas. Alcohol is prominent but not overwhelming. Good balance, the bourbon does not overwhelm. One of the better bourbon barrel aged stouts.

column1: Bell's Cherry Stout - Bourbon Barrel Aged
column5: Cherry lead with oak finish. Cherry nose. Just all cherry. But well balanced. Sweet with tart flavor and a finish of A bit of oak/ cherry pit

column1: Bell's Cherry Stout - Bourbon Barrel Aged
column5: Excellent stout. Cherry is aggressive and accents the bold chocolate base really effectively. Barrel aging pushes this beer over the top. Excellent. Tried with Jess and dad at extreme in 2018.

column1: Bell's Cherry Stout - Bourbon Barrel Aged
column5: 12oz bottle from Steve's in Fitchburg, cellared 2 months and poured into the Civil Society snifter at cellar temperature. Almost black pour with a brown head that rapidly faded. Aroma has barrel, sweet malts and black cherries. Taste is of sweet malts, whiskey, tart cherries, other fruit and some roastiness. The taste is more dimensional than the barrel from the nose. Medium to full bodied, not falling into that "all barrel, no depth" trap. The blend is pretty good and there is a bit of an alcohol presence. Finishes sweetly, with a touch of tartness. This is a solid, tasty, sipper of a brew. 14.8

column1: Bell's Cherry Stout - Bourbon Barrel Aged
column5: Bottle from Beers of the World. Aroma of cherries, vanilla, caramel, and whiskey barrel.

column1: Bell's Cherry Stout - Bourbon Barrel Aged
column5: Pours a rich black with hints of red in the ring of head. Mild bourbon aroma with tart fruit. Lightly carbonated. Mild bourbon taste up front with tart cherry finish. Not as boozy as expected

column1: Bell's Cherry Stout - Bourbon Barrel Aged
column5: Bottled. Pours black, tan head. Aroma is lots of bourbon, oak, tart cherry, dark fruit. Flavor is super tart cherry, bourbon, oak. It’s like a sour stout. Interesting. Better than standard cherry for sure.

column1: Bell's Cherry Stout - Bourbon Barrel Aged
column5: BB backlog. Bottle from Capones, pours a black color with small to average sized foam. Smell is big on roasted malt, dark cherry, whiskey, and coffee. Flavor of chocolate, bourbon, fudge, malt, and raisins. Rich and complex mouthfeel that warmed us all up.

16-03-18 // 500ml bottle at City Braustübl Darmstadt. As Braustübl Kristallweizen. Clear golden. Big foamy white head. Quite high carbonation. Grainy body, not much in common with a Hefe. Dry body. Mild bitter. No more Yeast character. Not a great Kristallweizen.
Bottle in Heildelberg, germany. quite normal for the style, ok but not special
*Old rating, best before 27.11.04. Süßlich-fruchtiges Bier. Typische Kristallweizen-Aromen, frisch-fruchtig, mild, kaum Herbe spürbar. Lecker.

500 ml bottle. BB 20/07/14. Thanks to Erzengel! Clear golden colour with a small white head. Mild sweetness, banana, yeast and some wheat in the aroma. Sweet caramel, banana, mild wheat and yeast in the flavour. Very average. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Thanks to Erzengel for that one! Bottle looks really good. Beer in the glass zippy, small head. Starts fine malty-yeasty, light sweetish, fruity notes of apricot. Finish a bit drier, but still fine fruity on a malty base. Quite drinkable. Nice!
bottle, with thanks to kevnic2008! Clear golden colour, large and creamy white head. Fruity nose. Malty-wheaty flavours dominate, hints of lemon and banana. Nice.
Clear golden with medium off-white head. Aroma is wheat, banana, yeast and fruit. Flavour is wheat, yeast, banana, medium sweet and spices.

icht bananiger Geruch mit etwas beißendem Ton. Zurückhaltend fruchtiger Antrunk mit hopfiger Note, recht prickelnd. Im Mittelteil kommt ein leicht hefiges aber doch recht lasch wirkendes Aroma zum Vorschein. Ein säuerliches Aroma kündigt sich an, tritt aber dann doch nur sehr mild im Nachgeschmack an. Dieser ist allgemein sehr mild, ein würziger Ton ist irgendwie schon erkennbar, kommt aber leider asolut nicht zum Tragen. Weißbier Gold - unter dem Aspekt ein ordentliches Bier! Test vom 11.3.2007, Gebinde: Glasflasche Noten: 11,10,11,8,10,11 - 10,35

.5L bottle - Shared this one w/ SkyCop32. Picked up at Maruhn Getränke in Darmstadt. Pours a hazy golden yellow. Aromas of bread/grains/ and some fruit. Had a taste of yeasty grains with some spice and bananas.

Bottle 50cl. w. swing top @ home. Clear medium yellow orange color with a large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white to white head. Aroma is light malty, moderate yeasty, sweet, soft banana. Flavor is moderate to light heavy sweet with a average duration. Body is medium, texture is watery - creamy, carbonation is soft. [20090819]
Dark color with nice head. Malty, caramel, banana and apricot aroma. Intense flavor at low ABV. I like

the aroma is caramel and fruity with shades of toffee, citrus, candy and spicy herbs... the taste is caramel and fruity with notes of toffee, banana, brown sugar, plum and some spices... sweet and dry aftertaste...

Many thanks for this beer to kevnic2008. Piwo z niewielka pianka, ale za to ze spora dawka drozdzy. Metne, ciemnobrazowe piwo, pachnace rumianym chlebem pszennym oraz tarta. w smaku chlebowo zbozowe mus jablkowo brzoskwiniowy z lekka nuta kwaskowa. Przyjemne, lekkie i smaczne, dobry kompan do posilku.
*Old rating, best before 22.11.04. Schokoladig-dunkles, leicht röstmalziges Bier. Mild-weichm vollmundig, lecker.

500 ml bottle. BB 11/11/14. From a trade with Erzengel. Thanks Gabriel! Dark murky brown colour with a small off-white head. Sweet malt, mild sourness, chocolate, fudge and mild wheat in the aroma. The flavour is sweetness, dark fudge, caramel and mild sourness. A bit strange Dunkel Hefeweizen. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Thanks to Erzengel for that one! Bottle looks really good. Beer in the glass dark brown, nice head. Starts fine malty, not too yeasty, light earthy-rusty notes. Fruity hints of plum. Finish milder but not washy, dominated by malty-yeasty notes. Not bad!
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein trübes braunes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch hefig, röstmalzig, leicht fruchtig würzig. Geschmack hefig, leicht würzig, leicht fruchtig.
bottle, Dank an kevnic2008! Cloudy brownish colour, mid-sized off-white to beige head. Wheaty and yeasty with a fruity character (blackcurrant, blackberries) and a touch of chocolate.
Amber color with an good off-white head. Boring aroma for a wheat beer. Fine wheat and lemon taste.

Bottle from the Braustüb’l of the brewery Muddy brown color; generous head. The aroma is a bit breadish, and with some caramel. Correct body; there is a quite strong wheat and spicy character, like the regular Weizen, with some caramel; but the final is drier and rather weak; also, some bubblegum.

column1: Grizzly Paw Burrowing Badger Summer Ale
column5: I tried this as part of an 8 beer tasting tray at the pub. The tasting tray is an excellent value, featuring Big Head brown, Grumpy Bear Wheat, Powder Hound pilsener, Rutting Elk red, Beavertail Raspberry, Randy Goat pilsener, and two seasonal brews that are new: Bloody Hell Pale Ale and Burrowing Badger Summer Ale. This one was a light golden with a modest white head. Slightly fruity hop nose, with a palate of pale malt and modest hop character. This was not a standout among the beers I tried. As far as the two seasonals, I thought that the Bloody Hell was more interesting and I ended up ordering a full pint of it instead of the Badger.

column1: Grizzly Paw Bloody Hell Pale Ale
column5: On tap at the brewery, part of a sampler. This was a refreshing break from the fairly mediocre beers in the sampler, the best of the bunch, a moderately hopped pale ale, light and crisp

column1: Grizzly Paw Bloody Hell Pale Ale
column5: This may be the same beer that has recently been listed by "dkoonce", however I am certain that it is not characterized as an IPA, since I spoke at length with the bartender/assisstant brewmaster about this beer. It also is not a true English pale ale, nor a true American pale ale. It’s existence came about entirely by mistake when the brewmaster was making a batch of the Rutting Elk Red and accidently left out the crystal malt (this is why it is called "Bloody Hell!"-- get it?). The result is a pale malt ale with a moderately rich hop profile that doesn’t quite fall into any category. I tried this as part of an 8 beer tasting tray at the pub. The tasting tray is an excellent value, featuring Big Head brown, Grumpy Bear Wheat, Powder Hound pilsener, Rutting Elk red, Beavertail Raspberry, Randy Goat pilsener, and two seasonal brews that are new: Bloody Hell Pale Ale and Burrowing Badger Summer Ale. As far as the two seasonals, I thought that the Bloody Hell was more interesting and I ended up ordering a full pint of it instead of the Badger. A beguiling hop profile with moderately bitter finish, plays more towards the classic English-style pale ale than any other in my opinion.

12th December 2017 Bodney Towers bottle share. Thanks to Wingman. Light haze on this gold beer, big pale cream colour head. Light and semi dry palate, decent carbonation. Fluffy malts. Light floral mid. Mild and tangy citric peel on the back end. Light and easy going.

Bottle shared at Leighton's place at the Ktwse tasting, 12/12/2017. thanks ! a clear golden coloured pour with a loose frothy white head. Aroma i s semi sweet, honey, apple, corn. Flavour is composed of buble gum, tart, green apple, corn, stale grains, green hop. Palate si tart, semi sweet, moderate carbonation.

12Dec2017 Sweet grain and cereal, molasses, caramel. Clear gold, massive, creamy, white head. Light bitter. Citrus fruits, bittersweet malts, zesty lemon peel, grain malts, medium carbonation, medium bodied. Quite citrusy for a Pilsner. Bottle shared at Leighton's - thanks to WingmanWillis!

Bottl shared in Hackney - thanks to Davey. Pours clear, orange-gold with s frothy, white head. The nose has crispy cereal grains, vague lemon and hay. Light sweet flavour with a little tangy note, low bitterness. Light bodied with average carbonation. Finishes with a little more tangy citrus notes, simple cereal character, low bitterness. Maybe a little aged. So so.
Pours clear golden with low white head. Aroma of bread, malt, citrus. Taste is sweet, slightly bready and citrusy, malty finish. Light and smooth body with soft carbonation.
This beer has a nice creamy head, but the taste is disappointingly without much bitterness. Reminds me somewhat of the mainstream US beers. Very little aftertaste at all.
Herber, wenig getreidiger Antrunk. Spritzig, steigende, angenehm würzige Herbe. Vergleichsweise wenig bitter, erst zum Schluss nimmt sie deutlich zu. Typisches deutsches Pils. 9/9/9/9/8/9

50cl bottle bb01/2016, courtesy of Mister_Li I believe. - damp grass and dust in aroma, nomansland hayish mid, pronounced vegetable/flower stem bitterness lingers. Missing some elegance, although all elements are in place.

Im Geruch etwas muffig, hellgelbe Farbe. Der Antrunk ist süßlich-würzig. Zum Hauptteil wird das Bier vollmundiger, süffig-süßlich, angenehm geinherb. Im Nachgeschmack mittellang, vollmundig mit angenehmer süßlichen Honignote. 11/12/12/12
bottle from Bierzwerg. Clear pale yellow ith a creamy white head. Malty base with a nice sweetness, balancing the dry, grassy and resiny hop flavours very well.

Bottle 500ml. @ home. Clear medium grey yellow colour with a large, frothy to creamy, good lacing, mostly to fully lasting, white head. Aroma is moderate malty, hay, straw, keller, sweet malt, light caramel. Flavour is moderate sweet and light to moderate bitter with a average to long duration, caramel, keller, sweet malt, old malt. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20121118]
Clear yellow coloured with a small white head. Malty aroma of grass, grain and hops. Malty flavour of grass, cardboard and hops. Hoppy finish.

Bottle: Golden coloured, medium-sized white head, slowly diminishing; moderate sweetish-grainy nose with a tinge of honey and a distinctive hoppy touch; light to medium (malty) body, sweetish-bitter flavour; bitter-grainy-sweetish finish. A well rounded, malt-accented Export. Pleasant and tasty !

(bottle) Clear, pale golden colour with a firm foamy white medium-sized head. Slightly sweet and grainy malt aroma with a hoppy touch and faint grassy notes. Moderately sweet and slightly bitter flavour, light to medium bodied, crispy mouthfeel. Malt-accented, slightly grainy taste with herbal notes; moderately dry, soft malty and light bitter finish. Clean and pleasant Export.
On tap in Zum Deutsches Haus, Michelstadt. Served dark brown and clear, with a good head. Has a sweet nutty taste, with bread like hints, and finishes with a reasonable bitterness

Bottle:Reddish-amber coloured, big fluffy, lacing brownish head; clean caramelly, nutty and toasted aroma; light sweetish (malty) flavour; sweetish-toasted-malty finish with a touch of milk-coffee, shy bitterness in the aftertaste

(bottle) Clear, chestnut brown colour with a mid-sized foamy off-white head. Medium-sweet toasted malt aroma, slightly nutty with caramel and herbal hops. Moderately sweet flavour, medium to light body with a smooth carbonation. Balanced toast-malty taste with light notes of caramel and herbal hops; dryish, moderately bitter and nutty finish with a light hoppy note.

column1: Triple Rock Hop O the Rock
column5: IPAX on cask, drank a pint of this today on the day of this review. As IPAX is one of Triple Rock’s best brews, this is a great one to try on cask as well. As long as the cask hasn’t been sitting there oxidizing too long - unfortunately the cask brews at triple rock are sometimes hit and miss. Today it was pretty damn good. A low carbonation, 55F version of IPAX. Dangerously drinkable, and very enjoyable.

column1: Triple Rock Hop O the Rock
column5: Cask. Hazy amber beer with a nice whitish head. Grapefruit aroma. Grapefruit and pine flavor with some malt in the background - but hops stand out. Lingering grapefruit/pine resin. Nice mouthfeel. I’d bet on simcoe hops.

column1: La Caderie Cidre Bouche Fermier Doux
column5: Bottle brought from French market, Loughborough. Pale golden colour, highly carbonated. Restrained apple aroma with a touch of barnyard. Flavours are similar with a touch of caramel perhaps. Softly carbonated, very drinkable. Excellent.

Cask conditioned - handpump - Out Of The Vaults Leicester. A golden coloured beer with typical hoppy Roosters aroma. Mostly satsuma notes. The taste is also very hoppy with good bitterness levels. More excellent citrus fruits, and another winner from Roosters.
Fuerte aroma a café. Muy cremosa ligera. Rica malta, notas de chocolate. Muy agradable.
