On tap at source. Pours black with a small creamy tan head. Aroma of light burnt malts. Taste is light sweet, dark malty, perhaps a step up from my previous beers her.
On tap @ C.K. Browar, Kraków. Dark brown with a thin off-white head. Dark caramel aroma with some sweet coffee and a roasted malts finish. Not bad.

This beer was definitely about hops. Color was a murky straw yellow with a slim white head. The aroma was hoppy and fruity. The taste was excellent, extremely hoppy and slightly citrus with a clean after taste. The best beer I had in a sampler.

12 oz draught at the brewpub. "All about hops and malt"? Really? Never woulda guessed....anyway stupid description aside this carries a tiny white head atop a hazy dark gold body that laces a bit....the nose is spicy, piney and a bit peppery along with bitter orange and a bit of resinous oiliness.....body is thick, juicy and a touch syrupy, moderately bitter at the front edging to quite strong at the finish....smooth and slick, lightly ashy and smoky; fairly solid if unmemorable example.

column4: Société des Brasseries de l'Ouest Africain - SOBOA
column5: simple beer with nonstable and nonhigh foam. taste is with a bit of hop and bread, metallic something.

column4: Société des Brasseries de l'Ouest Africain - SOBOA
column5: Butelka 0,33l Kolor jasnoz³oty, piana znikoma. Aromat nik³y chmielowy, smak nijaki trochê kwasowoœci. Tylko na upa³y. Pite w Senegalu w 2014r

column4: Société des Brasseries de l'Ouest Africain - SOBOA
column5: Appearance: Yellow golden, clear, fizzy white head. Aroma: Cereal, that’s probably it... Taste: Cereal, some malt. Ok. Bought: Trade with Erzengel - thanks!, 330 ml Info: 7/12-2014, BB: 5/12-2014

column4: Société des Brasseries de l'Ouest Africain - SOBOA
column5: Wässriger, getreidig süßer Antrunk. Recht trocken, etwas herb, süffig. Sehr trockenes Finish. Trinkbar. 7/8/7/7/6/7

column4: Société des Brasseries de l'Ouest Africain - SOBOA
column5: Pours a clear, pale golden color with a small white head that immediately disappears. Typical grainy and malty aroma are picked up by the nose.

column4: Société des Brasseries de l'Ouest Africain - SOBOA
column5: Thanks to Mariusz for sharing! My country #115 Smooth, fresh, grainy. Lots of grain. Fresh, but grainy. Not too bad. Smooth and easy to drink. 10/12/10/10

column4: Société des Brasseries de l'Ouest Africain - SOBOA
column5: Goldgelbes Bier mit geringer Schaumkrone. Geruch süß malzig, getreidig, wässrig. Geschmack wässrig, malzig, getreidig, leicht süß.

column4: Société des Brasseries de l'Ouest Africain - SOBOA
column5: Bottle - 330ml. Boring pale blond body with good carbonation and a thin white foamy head. Light malty/hoppy aroma with herbal and bready hints. taste is thin and carries strange cabbage notes. Ends with a short malty/herbal finish. Useless.

column4: Société des Brasseries de l'Ouest Africain - SOBOA
column5: On tap at a hotel in Dakar, Senegal. Pours the normal African Pale Lager light yellew color with a soft white bubbley head. Aroma is stale malt and rubber. Taste is a raw mix of faint cardboard and chemicals. Palate is relitivley normal but the beer itself is of low quality.

column4: Société des Brasseries de l'Ouest Africain - SOBOA
column5: The word pale is appropriate here. The beer is pale in appearances. The flavor pales in comparison to most other beers. Counting the minutes you wasted tasting this beer when you could have been sampling others makes you go pale.

Bottle from Vine Ripe. 7%. Pours a clear deep amber color. Mildly roasted dark fruit nose. Dark fruit up front. A little bit of a roasted malty quality as well. A bit sweet. Fairly subdued flavor. Not aggressive, but has a decent flavor to it.
Botella 500ml Color cobrizo-rojizo,espuma de color beige,fina,sin resistencia.Aroma malta,frutas rojas.Sabor dulzor intenso,malta,cereales,frutas rojas

Das Avtorske ist ein Bockbier, das nichts anderes heißt als "Autorenbier", also sowas wie "nach Braumeisterart". Es ist dabei recht stark und der Alkohol kommt gemeinsam mit einer Zuckersäure, die aromatisch aber weniger hergibt. Es ist nicht ganz so übel wie mancher frühere, osteuropäische Bock, aber eine wirkliche Freude mag nicht aufkommen. Dafür fehlt es einfach an Fruchtigkeit und Aromentiefe.

Bottle. 7 %. Amber, translucent. Dirty white head, two fingers, poor retention. Medium carbonation visually. Watery texture with soft fizz. Aroma is cereal, grains, sweet corn, sweet caramel, hints of wet cardboard. Taste is the same. Disgustingly sweet. Fake caramel mixed with sweet corn, poor cereals and wet cardboard notes. Alcohol is well integrated, at least. This wants to be a serious beer but I'm laughing.
Ruby-colored beer Aroma: Weak, dried fruit and caramel Taste: malty sweetness, not a lot of hops. Pleasant body of beer.
0.5 l bottle. Dark copper color, transparent. The foam is small and unstable.The taste is very malty. Pretty good
Delikatnie s³odkawe. £adny ciemny kolor. Klarowne. Pianka ³adna. Fajny smak. Mi³e w piciu. Naprawdê fajne.
Ocena wystawiona na podstawie wspomnieñ z degustacji w ramach uzupe³nienia profilu.
25-01-19 // taster at Internationale Grüne Woche - Messe Berlin.Mild honey. Solid Bock.
Cask,The Beerhouse Winter Beer Festival 2014.Golden small head,aroma of biscuit yeast malt,taste is malt caramel light hops and dry.

Cask by hand-pump at Bon Accord, Glasgow - clear golden amber, thin creamy off-white head, weak malty aroma, irregular lacing, sweet toffee flavour with a bit of fruit and citrus, creamy texture, smooth, easy to drink
Bottles from Coppers, Newcastle and Open All Hours, Keswick. Golden coloured with a sweet toffee and caramel flavour, a creamy mouthfeel and a slight sugary fruity finish.

Cask (handpump) @ Market Porter, 9 Stoney Street, Southwark, London, Greater London, England SE1 9AA. Clear medium yellow orange color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, toasted - caramel, moderate hoppy, citrus, grass, fruity, orange - citrus. Flavor is moderate to light light heavy sweet and light moderate bitter with a long duration, fruity, hoppy, fruity hops. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft to flat. [20130327]
cask at market porter... golden amber ... thin white lacing ... soft dry lemon peel ... soft fruits ... little custardy ... light floral hop

First tasted this in the Three Judges, Glasgow in October 2003. Cask, handpump dispense. Clear pale garnet in colour with a thin creamy white head. Slight hint of roast grain in the short aroma. Thin but creamy mouthfeel and good lacing. Pale malts give a weak maltloaf base with raisin fruit and molasses. Slight spicy prickle of hop resins in the short aftertaste. A sweet winey overipe fruit finish with tart grape skins evident. An ok session bitter.

Cask-conditioned at the Cornubia, Bristol 25/05/2011. Pale amber with a slight, off-white head. Sherbet, yeasty aroma with some apricot and citrus hops. Sweetish malt flavour, with lots more fruit and a dryish finish. Good.
Cask Stillage from the Cellar at the Crescent, Salford 25/07/2003 Mid brown coloured slightly rich on the palate and fruity with a hint of bitterness in a dry roast finish.
Cask @ 3 Judges. Golden colour, white head. Aroma is soft malty, slightly hoppy. Flavour is malty, fruity. Smooth.
Cask in Blackfriars. Aroma is solid, bittering english grassy peppery hop, pale and richer biscuity hops. Taste is similar, well balanced and excellent.
Nothing to write about this. Standart pale lager and no more...drink and forget, dude!
Pyv u 2004 roci. Todi spodobalos, hoch karbonizacija bula zavysokoju - schipalo za jazyk.

Heller, honigartig süßlicher Antrunk. Geringfügiger, sich gut einbringender Hopfen. Deutlich steigende Würzigkeit, spritzig. Hell würziger und steigend hopfiger Nachhall, langer Nachhall. 10/11/12/11/9/11

Bottle from Coppers, Newcastle. Bright golden coloured with a thin, quickly disappearing white head. It has a warming grassy hop and toffee flavour with vanilla notes and a bitter earthy and biscuit finish.

Golden colour with a fine small white head. Noses of almonds, bready malts, bit fresh grass and herbs. Softly carbonated, slick texture with a medium body. Offers malt sweetness upfront lasting well with a light grass hoppyness developing. Medium finish - harmonic beer yet lacking a certain pronounced malt punch, still quaffable.
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein goldgelbes Bier mit geringer Schaumkrone. Geruch intensiv malzig, würzig, getreidig. Geschmack sehr malzig, leicht fruchtig süß, getreidig.

330ml bottle [6.5% abv]. Clear, orangey golden colour with average, frothy to creamy, half-way lasting, minimally lacing, white head. Grainy, minimally sweet-ish malty and strawy aroma. Taste is minimally sweet pale malty, flat bitter hoppy overtones, hints of alcohol; sticky palate.

(bottle; 6,5% abv) pours a clear deep golden colour with a frothy off-white head. aroma of pale malts, light sweet spices and banana, with a faint hint of butter, ripe plums, caramelized cereals and treebark. flavour is mostly pale malts, light green apple and herbal hops, with a hint of marzipan and some light notes of alcohol in the minerally finish. medium to heavy-bodied with average carbonation.
Amber with rapidly fading white head. Aroma of sweet malt. Flavor is sweet malt, somewhat bready.
Dark gold pour with little to no head. Abit of an alcohol flavor dominates on the first sip, followed by sweetness, and some citrus, not well balanced.

Bottle, thanks pivnizub. Amber, nice off-white foam, restrained carbonation. Honeyish sweet malt nose. Medium body, light ethanolic notes, some herbal light soapy counterplay. Might be this bottle, but I found it to be strangely unharmonic.

(bottle) Clear, amber colour with a fluffy, but non-persistent off-white foamy head. Moderately sweet, slightly fruity (lemon) malty aroma, minimal toasty with a light hoppy touch. Sweet flavour, malty, slightly toasted and fruity taste, medium bodied with a crispy carbonation on the palate; finishes malty, moderately bitter with a light metallic and herbal touch.

A dark copper schwarbier with a thin white head. In aroma, light chocolate and hickory smoke aroma. In mouth, a good light chocolate with smokey notes. A nice light smokey schwarzbier. Tasted at Mondiale 2007.
Thanks to Erzengel for that one! Bottle looks simple but good. Beer in the glass zippy, small head. Starts mild, quite malty, a bit moldy, some bready-wheaty notes. Not too intense. Okay.
Goldgelbes Bier mit ordentlicher Schaumkrone. Geruch malzig süß, getreidig. Geschmack sehr getreidig, malzig süß, typisches Alkoholfreies.
Bottle. Golden with small white head. Aroma of grains and malt sweetness. Light body with some mineral notes, the sweetness of unfermented wort, and a slight citrus finish.
Bottle 33cl from Kevnic2008, a clear yellow beer, nose is low, aroma is low just on light malt, almost no hops, very watery.
Pours golden with a white head. Aroma is malt, straw and hay. Flavour is malt, corn, straw and hay.

Dünner getreidiger Geruch. Getreidiger (wie von anderen Alkoholfreien gewöhnt), allerdings nicht penetrant. Im Mittelteil und Nachgeschmack ist dieser Geschmack zwar auch vorhanden, sie sind allerdings mild gestimmt und gefallen somit. Nun, zu alkoholfreien Bieren habe ich mist recht wenig zu sagen, daher hier der Abschlusssatz: Gutes, wenn auch etwas dünnes Bier mit holzigem Ton. Test vom 17.1.2007, Gebinde: Glasflasche Noten: 8,7,7,7,6,7 - 7,05

Bottled. A golden beer with a thin white head. The aroma has notes of cardboard, straw, and unfermented wort. The flavor is sweet with notes of straw and bread, leading to a dry metallic finish. Thanks MiP for sharing.
Clear golden with a medium white head. Metallic aroma with grainy notes. Grainy flavour with metallic and sulphur notes. Awfull.
Bottle. Clear yellow colour. No head. The flavour is slightly citric, not bready. Like many other Alkoholfreis.
It’s golden with a white head and the aroma has notes of malt, mash and light fruit. The flavor is sweet with light grainy notes and a dry, light bitterness with some citrus in the finish.
Hoppy initial aroma but not a great balance. Pours hazy orange. Green onion. Too much hop tang. Can.

01Nov2019 Juicy tropical fruits, ripe mango, papaya, pineapple, juicy tropical fruits smoothies. Hazy gold, medium, creamy, white head. Light bitter. More creamy tropical fruits, mango and papaya smoothie, pineapple, soft carbonation, medium bodied. Very nice. Can from St. Gambrinus Beer Shoppe.
light citrus aromas. gold and lightly hazy in color with great head. taste is of citrus especially grapefruit, light pine

Can. Amber beer with a cream head. Light grapefruit aroma. Grapefruit and orange flavor with light malt. Medium bodied. Good bitterness. Grapefruit and light orange linger with light malt and light wheat.

From a 12 fl oz can dated 07/23/19. Cloudy looking light amber gold appearance with modest foamy white head. Hoppy aromas of citrus, tropical fruit, and herb or more specifically white pepper. Also a sourdough note. Medium and smooth mouthfeel. Sweet at first and then the zestiness of the citrus, pineapple, and pepper come up behind with a clean but mild-moderate bitter ending.

Pours hazy gold with a moderate white foam. Aroma is light citrus and a touch of pine hop. Taste is a smooth citrus hop, moderate bitterness but so smooth. Bitterness is not over the top and you can crush the crap out of this.

440ml can at home. Pours a murky yellow gold with a thin white head. Aroma is tropical fruit and grapefruit. Flavour is the same but a little thin due to the wheat. Nice refresher but not a heavyweight IPA.
12oz can. Pours golden amber with a white head. Easy drinking IPA with notes of pine and lemon. Not bad.

Great NE IPA at an awesome pizza place - American Flatbread in Burlington, VT. Definitely worth a visit. Incredible sausage, onion, mushroom and sun dried tomato pizza that pairs well with this (and their many other) beers. Close to the lake, too.

4oz. sample at the brewery. Pours a big frothy off-white head, thick dirty lacing, has an orangey coloured appearance. Aromas of citrus, light tropical fruit notes. Flavours are mild fruity notes, citrus, a little bit wheaty and floral. Fairly mild overall. Slick and dry mouthfeel.
Thanks to Erzengel for that one! Bottle looks really good. Beer in the glass zippy, small head. Starts mild but not washy, modest fruity lilke lemon and apricot, mild sourish notes. Okay.
Smooth in the beginning, fresh, but with lots of sweetness. The mainpart is smooth-bitter, sweetish-lemonade. The aftertaste is bitter, lemonade, grain.
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein goldgelbes Bier mit geringer Schaumkrone. Geruch süß nach LImonade, Citrus. Geschmack fruchtig, Limo, Bier kann man aber leider nicht schmecken.
Bottle from Kevnic2008, a sweet and low malty beer, medium lemony, some malts at the finish with orange peer touch.

Sampled from bottle thanks to Dutchdrebus. Clear pale yellow golden color, medium sized white head. Aroma of artificial and a bit chemical sweetness. Taste is some sort of weird artificial sweetish fruit. Not even nice to drink as radlers sometimes are. No, don’t like this.
Gedronken met dutchdrebus, gele heldere kleur, geen schuimkraag, ruikt naar ijzer, limoen, mout, smaakt zoet, limoen, pils

Bottle @ home. Clear pale yellow colour with a medium sized, chunky white head. Smells iron, sweet, some malts, sprite, ’sneeuwwitje’. Tastes sweet, some lemon, malts. Has a very dry feel to it, which isn’t nice in a radler. Thin body, pretty normal carbo.
Bought by mistake in a supermarket in Germany. Although I thought it was worst before I opened and taste it. Not so bad bacause the lemon added is so suave.
50 cl flip top bottle, Darmstadt, Germany. Pale yellow, thick frothy head. Pine cleaner aroma, quite sweet with some hops battling the sugar. Lime on the finish.
Clear yellow golden colour, small and fast disappeating head. Artificial citrus flavour.
*Old rating, best before 21.04.03. Mild-weiches, etwas dünnes Bier. Sehr süffig, leicht getreidig mit feinherber Note. Gar nicht mal schlecht.

Flasche 0,5l: Goldgelb, klar, feinporiger fester Schaum; in der Nase leichte Süße, malzige Noten, Getreide, leicht gehopft; im Körper gleich schöne eher leichte Bitterkeit, cremig, kräftig Kohlensäure, nur sehr leichte Hopfennoten
Bottle from Maruhn. Clear yellow with a small white head. Aroma is sweet, light malty and corn. Flavor is light sweet. Dry finish. Watery. 271014
Goldgelbes Bier mit ordentlicher Schaumkrone. Geruch malzig süß, getreidig. Geschmack sehr getreidig, malzig süß, typisches Alkoholfreies.
Der Name ist Programm, denn dieses Gesöff ist weitestgehend "Frei" von Aromen und Geschmack: Säuerlich trockener Antrunk geht über in eine wässrige Bitterkeit mit Blechnote. Nie wieder.
Bottle 50cl from Kevnic2008, a pale yellow beer with low body, low malty, dry, astringent, relative high bitterness, less tasty, very poor.
Clear, light golden appearance with a small white head. Dull straw, hay, pale malty aroma. Grainy, straw, barn hay flavor
It’s light-golden with a white head. The aroma has notes of cabbage/DMS and malt. The moderately sweet flavor has notes of cabbage, malt and the finish is slightly citrussy and dry/bitter.

Bottle 33cl. Clear medium yellow color with a average to large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white to off-white head. Aroma is light to moderate malty, grain, cardboard, light hoppy, citrus. Flavor is light moderate sweet with a average duration. Body is light to medium, texture is watery, carbonation is soft. [20091003]
German Ulfborg tasting 09. Bottle. Pours clear pale piss yellow with a off white head. Skunk, grain, thin and watery. Bland
Pale yellow with a big white head. Sugary sweet aroma of wort. Dry thin and sour grainy flavour with a little sulphur
500ml bottle Light yellow with OK head. Wheaty/spicy aroma. Fruity/cloves taste. OK Hefe.
Massive unstable looking head bubbling in all directions. A tart under current. Big bubble gum phenyls with not so much banana. Maybe a liitle uncouth and unsophisticated.
Bottle from Plonk. Clear dark golden, Clove and wheat malt characters dominate, slight banana, some sourness. Best before Sep. 2012, so probably not a fair rating, tasted a bit stale.
Transfering data from other personal beer file. Will add a proper rating when i’ll drink it again

This rating is based on a past experience, serving this beer on tap a few years ago. It was an immediate favourite and remarkably easy to recommend. There were overt aromas and flavours of banana, clove and bubblegum and this was reflected in the flavours as well. It poured hazy yellow-straw colour and the head was short lived, but it was a deserved favourite with my customers. It sat nicely within the style guidelines. A simple, uncomplicated thirst quencher.
I like this beer. Simple, not too estery, just great for the end of a hard days work. A solid effort by the boys at Wigram.

500ml bottle pale straw hazy with small white foamy lasting head. Liked the banana, yeast, spice, wheat, combo with some lemon citrus aromas. Some tart sourness in a good way. For me the banana-iness made it yummy.

...bottle into weizen glass. Had a nice fluffy white head that lasted all the way down with lacing. On the nose was mainly wheat and yeast, with a touch of citrus. Smooth and yeasty, great sediment in the bottle, very hazy with chunks, which I like. Finished smooth, with mainly a wheat and yeast note, and slight citrus. Solid effort, worth a try.

Bottle. Very hazy, dirty yellow-brown with a brief small white head. By midway through, there was no head at all. Looks like an amateur home brew! Aroma is slightly sour, estery, with some banana fruit and faint spices. The palate is quite zesty, and despite the lack of a head, there is decent carbonation. The driving flavour is tart lemon with notes of banana, mild esters, and very mild spices. Finish is short and slightly tart. This played out more as an American style wheat in my mind. Not one I’d reach for again.
Draught. Pours hazy golden with small white head. Aroma and flavour of wheat, banana, butter and yeast. Low carbonation and average bitterness.
Bottle at the brewery in Pfungstadt, Germany, in 2005. From old notes. We use to do this mix as teenagers in Slovenia, we called it Diesel. Not good, better (if possible) homemade.
Dark brown, very small white head. aroma of cola and citrus, caramel flavor is bitter cola, citrus. worse tha plain cola.

Bottle 33cl. Clear dark red brown color with a average to large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, beige head. Aroma is moderate cola, cola sweet. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet with a average to long duration. Body is light medium, texture is watery to oily, carbonation is soft. [20091004]

Bottle 33 cl. Courtesy of fonefan. Pours a warm orangey brown with a firm beige head. Sweet cola aroma. Light body, sweet cola and burned caramel with an enticing spiciness. A little underlying malt bitterness in the finish. Not the worst mix. 041009

Sehr süßer Geruch, der Süßstoff zeigt sich schon im Geruch. Sehr süßer und künstlicher Antrunk, leicht herb im Mittelteil. Der Nachgeschmack ist wirklich schlimm, man hat eine Pappfresse aufgrund des Süßstoffes, ein chemisch wirkender herber Teil ist nun wirklich kein Bonuspunkt. Das schmeckt doch noch nicht mal Jugendlichen!
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein hellgelbes, leicht grünliches Bier mit wenig Schaum. Geruch süß nach Limonade. Geschmack nach Limonade, Bier kann man bei diesem Radler nicht heraus schmecken.

Die Farbe ist schon sehr hell-grünlich, aber das liegt wahrscheinlich auch an dem sehr hellen Pfungstädter Pils. Der Geruch ist leicht künstlich nach Limetten. Gut gekühlt ist der Antrunk leicht süßlich, aber für mich nicht so penetrant. Hauptteil wird etwas herber, sowohl von der Limette als auch vom Bier. Der Nachgeschmack schmeckt zwar eindeutig nach Chemie-Süßstoff + Chemie-Limetten, aber gut gekühlt ist das auch zu ertragen - und ein Biermischgetränk ohne Süßstoff findet man leider nicht so häufig - ich weiß nicht, was die Leute an diesen Chemie-Aromen schätzen... --> Ist gut gekühlt sehr gut, auch auf Grund von seiner Süffigkeit, trinkbar. Nicht gerade das non plus ultra, aber doch noch "im guten 3er Bereich"... (Test vom 8.5.2008) --> 9,7,12,6,12,9 - 8,85
Blonde pale, effervescent foam, average carbonation. Perfumed in the lemon, of course, sweetness and citric edge. Sugary lemonade, small back taste of beer.

Bottle 33cl. clear glass. Clear medium yellow green color with a large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white to light green head. Aroma is moderate lemon soap, lemon, detergent. Flavor is moderate sweet and light light lemon acidic with a average to long duration, cardboard. Body is light to medium, texture is watery, carbonation is soft. [20091004]
Bottle 33 cl. Courtesy of fonefan. Pours a clear pale green with a creamy and lacing white head. Sweet lime aroma. Thin body, astringent lime notes, sweet yet tart. 041009
The bottle (a Becks-bottle) looks good. The beer in the glass looks terrible. Toxic green, not much foam. Very dry aroma. Tastes chemical, modest fruity, dry finish. A terrible "beer".

Pervers sieht das Bier schon aus, fast wie ein atomverseuchtes Objekt in Zeichentrikfilmen. Wie kaum anders zu erwarten riecht das Bier süß, Süßstoff läst sich schon erschnüffeln. Übermäßig süß ist das Bier schon im Antrunk, im Nachgeschmack wird das Ganze noch gesteigert. Bier ist natürlich nicht zu erkennen. Dieses Zeug is ganz klar eine Katastrophe.
Relativ einfaches Hefe mit leichten Röstaromen, etwas an Malz und Hefe. Wenig Frucht, ordentlich Perlung. Ganz nett.
(ambre dark, nez levure, fruits blanc-red, généreuse, > fruitée, mais côté amérisant qui affadit)
Bottle at the breweryin Pfungstadt, Germany. dark color, roasted malt, grass hoppy and sweet wheat. Bready finish

aroma is very aley, malty, light chocolate. appearance is pale brown with a full beige head. body is fairly light for a weizen. taste contains a light yeasty bite, but is relatively hoppy and less phenolic than most weizens. mature and non-macro taste. very different and as i had an open mind before tasting it, it impressed me a lot as a nice brown ale.

(500ml can, Beijing) AROMA: light clove and herbs, some yeast, bread, leaves. APPEARANCE: medium, dirty brown. Tight foamy, beige head that sticks to the glass. good amount of initial visible carbonation. TASTE: yeast, cream, soft herbs, touch of grain/malt, not too hoppy, medium body (not as heavy as other dark wheats). PALATE: a bit light and watery, but with creaminess. a tad flat. OVERALL: Average dark wheat, at best. Nothing terrible about it, just leaves a bit to be desired in various ways.

Dark brown beer with a red tint. That red tint means it doesnt look good or taste good. The beige head lasts but the body is thin, the palate watery and the flavor watery amber malt. It’s a foul to call this beer a dunkel or even pretend it’s in the hefe class of beer. Shame on fungstaider!

500ml green bottle bought at Great Food Hall in Pacific Place, Admiralty. Cloudy hazy straw brown colour with a ring of yeast sediments; Explosive four finger head with crumpety off-white foam which lasts for 5 minutes; Very good sticky lacing with quite fizzy carbonation; Fragrant aroma of fair dark malt, with light roastyness, wheat, tartness, banana, dark fruits, light vanilla, cocoa powder , sugar, cloves, cinnamon, spices, marshmallows, strong yeast, light lemon and thin grass; Light sweet taste of light dark malt, with light roastyness, very light metallic, very light banana, wheat, light tartness, light vanilla, soda, strong molasses, earth, light cinnamon, soggy dark bread, strong yeast, light lemon, very light bitter hops and thin grass; Mid to light body. Quite slick and creamy palate; Mouth feel is good dark maltyness in a quite thick background. Wheatyness is fair with light tartness. Banana ester is very light, sweetness is quite strong in the middle. Quite spicy and earthy bready yeast. Moderate sweetness, clove and phenol iis moderate. Low lemon to round. Alright… Hoppiness is cinnamon, light lemon and light grass in nose and taste; Bitterness is low for an abrupt, very low-astringent sweet and dark malty finish; Quite dry after taste. Smooth and easy to mouth. Comments: Like its Hefe Hell brother, this Dunkelweiss has really impressive looks, creamy feel, and fun to sniff cocoa and marshmallows to hide its weak roastyness. Yet the rather brand taste renders it another “one of the crowds". Drinkable no doubt, but it’s all thunders with little rain.

On tap in Neckargemünd Clear dark brown with a small beige head, some lacing. Aroma of dark fruit, banana, caramel, toasted malts and chocolate. Taste of toasted malts, wheat, chocolate, dark fruit and nutty Ok

Bottle. Brown colour, a bit cloudy. Medium white head. Aroma of toast, citrus, slightly sour. Flavour is kinda sour. Some toast and citrus. Medium-creamy body. High carbo. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at home courtesy of McTapps, cheers Sabine! clear Deep chestnut red with beige lacing. Fruity sweet caramel and slight nutmeg spice on the nose. Sweet, light body, caramel, banana, lively carbonation, light body. Again more dunkel than dunkelweisse
Relativ simples und klassisches Kristall mit einer leichten Fruchtigkeit, dazu ordentlich Perlung und einer milden Süße. Nicht schlecht.
24-07-18 // 500ml bottle from Maruhn. Clear golden. White head. Crispy clean taste with mild wheaty notes, hints of banana. Solid Kristall for a day at the beach.
Green Bottle. Surprisingly lightstruck aroma. Golden, low offwhite cream. Light mealy wheat base, pilsnerisch hops, very light DMS, light candy finish.

Green bottle, many thanks Tim! Clear golden color with white head. Aroma is lightstruck, wheat, yeast, sugar icing. Taste is the same, a bit milky. Silky-mealy mouthfeel with medium carbonation. Surprisingly yeasty for a Kristallweizen.

Bottle 330ml. clear glass. Clear medium yellow color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white head. Aroma is moderate malty, bread, grain, toasted, cabbage water, cardboard. Flavor is moderate sweet with a average duration. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20101211]
Bottle @ Southern/Western Denmark Gathering , Ulfborg. Pours pale yellow with a small white head. Nose is bread and grain. Thin and watery flavor with lots of paper . .
Bottle 330ml @ fonefan Pours clear pale golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt and grain. Taste is light sweet with soft carbonation.
Bottle at fonefan tasting. Medium head with medium duration. Color is pale golden. Aroma and taste are bread, malt and hops.
Bottle @ FOneFan. CLear golden with small white head. Flavour is malt, bread, sweet and watery.
Bottle, 4.8%. Pale golden colour, small white head. Acidic aroma, not especially unpleasant. The flavour is skunky with a bit of plastic, quite unpleasant.
A light yellow beer with a white head. The aroma is sweet with notes of lemon and malt, and so is the flavor, while the body is thin.
(Bottle 33 cl) Clear, pale golden with a small, white head. Fresh, hoppy aroma. Medium-bodied and sweetish malty with a vague whiff of cardboard. Dry finish. 210906
Bottled. Pours very pale golden in colour with a very small fast disappearing head. Hard to rate - not much aroma or flavour. Slightly malty and metallic with a slighlty bitter finish.

330 ml bottle, poured into a tulip glass. Appearance is a clear amber gold hue, with one finger of white froth, which recedes to a thin ring. Aroma is surprisingly earthy, yeast, rather than malty, likely to be a result of the Manuka honey it is infused with. Taste is earthy, malts, and a distinct mild sweetness from the honey.
Brown color, aroma of tequila and caramel, taste like tequila with lemon horrible beer!

in nouse caramel 100%, the color is great, yhe head poor, in mouth feels dry acid and sweet, not to bad if u r thee guy that take corona with a chaiser of tekila in this beer you goona take moore flavor

Pours a crystal brown color,has an unmistakable tequila aroma with beer a very acid, and hard palate you cant quite taste both at the same time, so the tequila overwhelms the beer flavor, and yes theres a lime present too.Nice idea but this aint for me but more for people bored with plain beer and shifting to the Agave brew.
Bottle: Tequila with beer, nothing else. I only had only sip and all I got was alcohol and lemon. Different but not beer.

Bottle, July 07. Thanks Nekronos for the bottle!! Appareance is crysta clear copper color with a medium, creamy, beige head and efferevescent carbonatation. Aroma is strange, piney, lemony. Rahter artificial. Taste is very alcoholic, too rispid, cloyingly sweet, shocking. Mouthfeel is very astringent, almost harsh. Deffinetely a sipper, but not my cup of tea.

NOt very good, but keeping in mind it is a strange thing, like other tequila ones, this is dark, not pale like the othersbut the taste is more descent, it gives a big sensation of headache, but the colour is interesting as well as the foam and the aroma is something new.

Draft. Turbid copper dark straw pour with minimal off-white head. Aroma of big oaky bourbin, and a plethora of fruit, including peahces, pears, apple, apricot, and melon. The flavor was strongly oaky bourbony, with a great match of the fruit, which gave the overall palate a complex, fruity and bourbony flavor. This is one of the better beers I’ve ever had.

Draft at the brewery, August 2006. Dark orange rusty colored body, heavily murky with a small white/tan head. Nose is light dark burnt and caramelized oranges and plums, with a light bourbon butter note. Flavor is similar, sweet caramelized oranges, plums and cherries, with a very smooth bourbon nose, not buttery like some similar, but resiny, creamy, with a cannibus resin and light liquer flavor. Great stuff, with a buzzing, numbing long-lasting finish. Very similar to HOTD Fred from the Wood.

Draft at "The" Elevator. Poured light pale color with an average frothy white head that was mostly lasting with fair lacing. Moderate sour citrus, banana and clove aroma. Light to medium body with soft carbonation. Medium sour citrus flavor with a medium sweet finish of moderate duration. "THE" average beer.
Big banana and lemon nose. Clear gold, with a light haze. Tangy and biotic. Mostly dry. Better than the Wit and Hefe. Light body. Fizzy, bitter finish.

column1: Van Dyck I'll be Bock Doppelbock
column4: Van Dyck Fine Food and Brewery
column5: NIce beer. Poured very dark brown with no head. Aroma was faint, but roasty. Flavor is also very roasty, coffee, and caramel, some hops.

column1: Van Dyck I'll be Bock Doppelbock
column4: Van Dyck Fine Food and Brewery
column5: on tap-pours a light tan head with dark copper color. Aroma is dark fruit, sweet, dark malt, alcohol. Taste is a sharp, slight bitter tasate, not in standard doppelbocks. Syrupy, sweet, malt, very concentrated. The difference may be Mike’s German style signature, but I didn’t care for it.

I’ll have to agree that the presentation/appearance of this stout beer is lacking... though of course color is nice & dark there’s almost zero foam aka “cranium” (HHH) post-can pour into pint glass. Flavors are quite appropriate for the style, however, and I’ll add that lowish price & reliable availability contribute to my rating once again. Solid effort from NY state.

Can pour into tulip glass. Appearance is opaque black with no sparkle, finger-width fizzy light brown head with poor retention and no lacing. Aroma is mildly toasted malts, oats. Taste is moderate toasted malt--bordering on burnt, oats, musty bitterness. Palate is light-to-medium bodied with smooth, thin texture, average-to-lively carbonation and dry finish as taste. Overall, not very rich or sweet--very restrained. A bit thin and overcarbonated.
Has subtle chocolate aroma. Black body with a minimal head. Smooth chocolaty coffee taste. Friendly and drinkable.
Pours black with a tan head. Roasted malt and chocolate aroma. Flavor is roasted malt, chocolate, grain and a roasted finish.

Can. Pours murky brown with large foamy tan head, rich mocha aroma with alcohol undertones, medium carbonation, bitter mocha-dark chocolate taste, thin body, long bitter mocha finish. A bit thin, could be more robust.
330ml can. Dark brown with very little head. Aroma is fruit, coffee. Taste is similar. Thin body. Ok

12-ounce bottle pours nearly opaque brown with ruby highlights and a thick creamy tan ead. Aroma: prunes, vinegar, chocolate. Flavor: all of the above with some porridge. Mouthfeel: medium-bodied, somewhat creamy from oats. There’s an unpleasant lingering sourness that mixes with a pleasant lingering sweetness, with a dry bit at the end.
Draft. Hazy blackish pour with tan head. Nose was roasty dark malt, oats, cacao, hops. Smooth flavor, dark malt, dark choc, hops, complex and well balanced finish.
Nice job by Andy picking a few of these up on way to ADK. Rich and full body not super sweet so I like it. Had after a 2.5 mile hike around miss lake on a hot day.
Pours very dark, finger thick head. Aroma of cocoa, chocolate milk, intense roast barley. Smooth, sweet, chocolatey, a touch of oats.

On a nitro tap at the Golden Rail. Pours a clear blackish brown with ruby highlights and a medium tanned beige head. Smells of chocolate and roast. Thin body, and roasty. Roast bitter finish. This tasted like what I’d envision Guinness being if it had a little more substance. Decent session stout.

column1: Stone 20th Anniversary Encore Series: 10th Anniversary IPA
column5: 9/26/2016 -- from notes: 22oz bottle, from Dutch's. Bottled 8/18/16. Shared with Steph S. Clear darker orange color. Thin off-white head. Leaves some good bubbles and bits of lace. Kind of more of a carmelly malt, but has a nice big resiny piney hop burn to it all around. Moderate-plus sweet taste, moderate to bigger bitterness, with a nice hoppy alcohol warmth pushing the aftertaste in the back end. Bigger body, mild slick texture. Nice one to enjoy with my sandwich.

column1: Stone 20th Anniversary Encore Series: 10th Anniversary IPA
column5: From Sep 2006 Poured from 22oz bottle a clear reddish gold with a lot of bubbles and a huge head of foam that shrinks slowly until there's a solid layer with lots of lacing. Very attractive DIPA in my glass indeed! The smell is a big hit of hops and spices with a side of malt sweetness. It leaves me shaking my head and saying, inaudibly, that this is gonna be a very tasty brew... The taste is nothing short of BIG on super bitterness from the hops *and* BIG on super caramel sweetness from the malt. I *really* can't seperate the 2 and say that one is dominant over the other and...that makes for some really tasty goodness for my palate as I'm a big fan of both really hoppy and really malty beers. And the 10% abv is merely a statistic, imho. This one is *very* drinakable. Ahh...I think Stone has done themselves proud with this 10th Anniversary IPA. And I'm *so* glad that I made the effort to get some. Damn good stuff!! Bottom line: I'd have to rank *this* one amongst the best of the style I've tried to date. See some? Get some!

column1: Stone 20th Anniversary Encore Series: 10th Anniversary IPA
column5: Bottle 0.66l sample at Ratebeer Belgian Winter Gathering 2017 Antwerp, Belgium at Beerlovers Bar 25.02.2017. Thanks everybody for sharing great beers! Pour it clear golden color with small head. Aroma orange peel and pine. Taste pine, orange candy feel, good balanced hoppy bitter and fruity notes, medium to heavy cloying sweetness, medium bitterness, creamy, average carbonation, long finish. Nice!

column1: Stone 20th Anniversary Encore Series: 10th Anniversary IPA
column5: 25/II/17 - 1Pt. 6Fl. Oz. bottle @ RBBWG (Beerlovers Bar, Antwerpen) - BB: n/a (2017-204) Thanks to sebletitje for sharing the bottle! Clear orange beer, creamy off-white head, little stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: bit oxidized, malty, caramel, some honey, bit hoppy, tropical fruits. MF: soft carbon, medium body. Taste: sweet start, malty, lots of sweet tropical fruits, soft bitterness. Aftertaste: bit sweet, some honey.

column1: Stone 20th Anniversary Encore Series: 10th Anniversary IPA
column5: Bottle shared @ RBBWG 2017. Many thanks! Orange amber colour, clear. Nose of pineapple, lychee, mango. Sweet and malty IPA, light bitter finish.

column1: Stone 20th Anniversary Encore Series: 10th Anniversary IPA
column5: Geproefd @ RBBWG2017. Donker gele heldere kleur met kleine witte schuimkraag. Geur is floraal en bitter. Smaak is een en al bitter. Niet mijn ding.

column1: Stone 20th Anniversary Encore Series: 10th Anniversary IPA
column5: Sampled at the RBBWG2017 . Thnx for sharing, everyone ! Pours rather clear, amberblonde, small white head. Smell is pine, bitter. Very full. Taste is very full, intense bitter, pine. Very full.

column1: Stone 20th Anniversary Encore Series: 10th Anniversary IPA
column5: Fine transparant head over clear amber-golden beer. Citrussy New World hops, rosewater, malt and caramel too. Oxydized, rosewater, bit catty, caramelmalt, amandine. Very hopoilslick, not very carbonated feel. Right! the IPA’s of yesteryear: reconnaissance!

column1: Stone 20th Anniversary Encore Series: 10th Anniversary IPA
column5: As Stone 10th Anniversary IPA, bomber shared at RBBWG. Irregular, snow white, thinnish but stable head over an orangey blonde, clear beer with deep, warm ’old gold’ hue. Aroma of biscuit, dried grapefruit peel, bread crust, orange zest, bitter honey, parsley, soap, glue. Fruity flavor but clean and restrained, dried mango, green banana and starfruit, some ’dim’ sourishness underneath, medium carbo, supple and bit soapy mouthfeel. Cereally and mildly biscuity malt backbone, long aromatic finish, grapefruity and floral with minerally side notes, biscuity juiciness remains for a long time afterwards, as well as something glueishly resinous. Older bottle, but held up very well; has the class, personality and dignity of all Stone IPAs.

column1: Stone 20th Anniversary Encore Series: 10th Anniversary IPA
column5: Thank you Sebletitje! 650 ml. bottle sampled @ RBBWG VI (2017). Bottled 25 August 2016. It has some age on it. Nearly clear orange, small white head. Nose is mellow cat piss oil hops, mango, some lemon peel, fruity hops, far more mellow than expected (maybe the age). Taste is far more bitter than you would expect from the smell, bitter orange peel, lemon peel, cat piss, pine, lively body, nicely bitter. Pretty solid old school cat piss hops IPA.

Sampled from a 12 oz brown bottle this beer poured a caramel-bronze color with a huge foamy orange-tan head that lingered and left good lacing. The aroma was sweet toasted caramel, light fruits, bread and a bit of mustiness. The flavor was tangy and malty with notes of caramel, bread and a bit of tart citrus. Long finish. Medium body. Nice.
Horrid. Absolute Horrid beer. The worst thing I’ve ever had from DuClaw and I love their stuff generally. It tasted like I was drinking mud.

12 ounce bottle. Pours a orange copper color with a medium-sized foamy beige head. Sweet caramel malt nose. Flavor is more caramel malt and some notes of banana. Overly sweet with wheat-like tendencies.
Medium Banana hefeweizen smell ...taste is similar but less banana...nice boldness of flavor...medium alcohol burn that lingers..malty hefeweizen

Tap. Pours clear hazel, medium creamy tan head, great lacing and residual. Aroma is smoky first, hints of roast, faint banana. Flavor is medium sweet, light bitter, smoke and hints of banana and bubblegum. Not very weizen-y. Medium body, creamy mouthfeel. Meh.
Nice weizen that has some bready and bannana flavors. Good alcohol brings warmth to the beer.
Tap at Arundel Mills. Lost detailed tasting notes and was only able to recover numerical rating.

I'm not happy with sweet water overall, but this one is decent. Not the best Hefeweizen but it's got a nice finish. I would consider getting this again if nothing else on tap was appealing. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft at DuClaw Arundel Mills. Pours clear bright copper with a fizzy off white head. Tastes like dried fruits, boozy, and sweet roasted malt. Light/medium body and carbonation. Smells like dried fruits, roasted malt, and light booze.
This beer is a little thin with a poperri like flavor, finishes with a wild yeast taste

Flesje geprobeerd bij JoepvW. Het is een amberkleurig lichttroebel bier. Wild schuimend bij het openen. Het schuim in het glas is snel weg. Het aroma is kruidig en fruitig. De smaak is fruitig en licht bitter.
6/2/7/3/13=31. Goudgeel en helder bier met witte schuimkraag. Aroma van alcohol, appel, banaan, gist. Zoet en bitter. Zacht, medium body.

Drank it before, but never rated it. Deep golden pour with off-white head. Aroma is malty and fruity, yellow fruits, light honey. Taste accordingly, but also light citrus; medium sweet and light bitter. It’s a nice tripel, but quite standard (like a lot of Belgian beers); nothing surprising or special, just OK (and better than the blonde).

Flesje gedeeld door Joep. Licht amber kleurig, enigszins troebel bier. Wild schuimend bij opening. Schuim is snel weg. Aroma is kruidig. Smaak is fruitig en licht bitter. Bittere smaak blijft even hangen.

Kolor ciemnego bursztynu, piwo jest klarowne. Piana jest bia?a wysoka a w konsystencji bardzo kremowa. Aromat slodowy, korzenno owocowy, w tle nuty lukrecji i kandyzowanych owoców. Smak jest do?? wytrawny, ponownie korzenno owocowy i raczej nie jest jaki? bardzo nadzwyczajny. Goryczka t?pa, nieco alkoholowa. Wysycenie wysoki, sprawdza si? idealnie. Niestety, nieznacznie wychodzi alkohol.

On tap at West Brewery Tap, Sunday 11th February 2018 in the company of Nick and Anna. Pours dark brown with a slim white head. Soft in the mouth, a little chocolate, tangy and fruity. Good beer. A6 A4 T7 P4 Ov14 3.4
Keg at West... Hazy dark amber... Thin white lacing.. Soft sweet toffee fruit nose.. Soft sweet toffee fruit.. Sweet toffee fruit
[On tap at West] Aroma is pretty estery, rotten banana’s, some roast, caramel. Medium body, a little sweet, dry finish.
HA dit long aog but haven’t rated it. IT wa snice, good colour but something is missing for being a Hefe. Speaking of that, why is in the list a Hefe and a Weizen?.
Aroma is sweet wheaty and a little chocolate too. Taste is reasonably complex with clove, cinnamon, roasted malts, wheat and even macaroon. Medium body but quite complex.

20061007 Tap at Kennett 06. Liked this one quite a bit. Medium brown with much head, thick and tan. Smoky tobacco and distant forest fire. Full, sticky body, rich and savory. Complex and sweet with nice mingling of smoke and dark honey malts. Finishes with more nuttiness, sticky, dark toffee, lingering. Delicious - I’m a sucker for smoky doppelbocks.

Pour was a hazy copper/brown color with a clingy, off-white head. Aroma is dry smoke and a little roasted malts. Flavors are smoke, dry oak, toast, roasted malts, with subtle but sweet grapes in the finish.

KSBF 06. Pours a deep woody amber, slight haze, and an awesome sticky tight off white head. Aroma is campfire smoke, sweet and caramelly with some chocolate, smoked salted meats, and some light plasticy phenols. More meaty smoke and woody burnt malts in the flavor with a slight saltiness, sweet caramel malts. Full mouthfeel and sticky sweet. Good toasty smoky almond lingering finish. Real smooth.

Draught samples at Kennett Fest, 10/7/06 Very frothy, large, aerated head is a light cappucino color, providing excellent, sticky lace down the glass. Medium to medium-high retention. Tobacco/maple brown body shows low clarity and has some rust and beige tints. Dry smoke in the nose is not overly meaty (salt, bacon, sausage) relative to a Schlenkerla, but shows a more reserved woodsmoke/tobacco/char aroma. Medium dry chocolate malt notes are intersparsed, delightfully, with dry coffee-like roast and soft vanilla-toffee hints. A very faint note of yellow raisins can even be found on the finish. Medium to medium-high strength of aroma, with no alcohol apparency. Very dry for a doppelbock, with some hints of lager yeast on the finish. Clean and properly lagered. Dry chocolate and coffee bean crunchiness initially strips the palate, and only gradually is a light vanilla-cream and raisin-like sweetness added back. With warming, some base malts mix with the chocolate malts but also mingle with the oak-hickory-like smokiness and do not fully sweeten. Tobacco and some breadiness (perhaps paperiness) sit on the end, dryly, while light raisin and vanilla chewiness collects. A fair amount of acidity (smoked malt and/or dark malt phenol?) definitely builds up as well, unfortunately, and somewhat distracts from the drinkability (but does add an interesting dark berry-skin note). Carbonation is a bit loose and the beer has moments of wateriness on the finish. But even if the palate/mouthfeel are not quite up to par, the array of flavors and utter lack of any brewing flaws certainly wins back support. Yeast presence is low; some sparkle of lager yeast crispness is evident on the finish, but is minimal.

Poured a ruby-light brownish in color, decent head for the style, average lacing. The aroma was raisins, some dough, and roasted malts. The flavor was raisins first, as well as some American hoppiness (pineapples and grapefruits, interesting in this style). As temperature increased, some coffee notes came out. Mouthfeel was a bit thin and acidic, somewhat of an astringent note. An intersting take on the style, but not my cup of tea.

Draft @ KSBF:06 Poured a medium sized tan head, fair retention with some small spotty lace. Slightly Murky, brown colored brew. Aroma was light smoke, roast and a light, dark fruitiness. Body was medium, lightly oily on the palate. Flavors pretty much mirror the aromas with some yeasty, bready notes and some buttery flavors as well. Finish is lightly smokey and roasty, lightly sweet malts. Uneventful.

On tap at the KSBF ’06. This was my most anticipated beer of the festival. Hazy light brown color with a medium sized beige head. Mild smoke aroma with some caramel malt and doughy bread. Smoke came out a bit more in the flavor, but was still mild. Other flavors were brown sugar, whole grain bread and a bit of banana. Nice full, creamy mouthfeel.

KSBF 2006. Lightly hazy copper body with a frothy beige head. Peaty impression in the aroma, like an earthy, muddy campfire in the rain. Also has sweet toffee and cooked banana notes. Somewhat sticky with lingering smoke flavors that merge with a plastic phenolic quality and some woody hops. Good, not great.

On tap at KSBF ’06... Appears a hazed, amber toned brown with a small, bone colored tan head that slowly fades out and leaves hearty lacing around the glass. Smell is of caramel, smoked malt, cocoa, along with a meaty, and creamy vanilla aroma that is very nice. Taste is of the given aromas with a gentle smoked nuttiness that caresses the caramel flavors from the brewed grain. Mouthfeel is smooth, medium-full bodied, along with a caramel roastiness that does the brew justice.

On tap at Kennett. Dark reddish copper brown in color with a nice fluffy off white head. Malty caramel smokey aroma. Grainy. Toffee caramel smokey flavor. Roasty notes. Smokey and sweet tasting. Smooth. Finish is smokey. Full bodied. Very nice. Enjoyable.
2006 GTMW. Dark brownish black. Tan creamy ring. Licorice roasted malt, brown sugar chocolate, brownies. Okay, not exceptional.

750 ml bottle to snifter (shared with the Mrs.). Looks solid; a fairly cloudy burnt orange with off-white head. Smells like a witbier on steriod with ample notes of Belgian yeast, orange peel, and coriander alongside a notable oak and grape must presence. Tastes like it smells, but more orange peel and coriander-forward. Mouthfeel is medium full-bodied and mildly bitter. Underwhelming. I remember it being better fresh, but I also liked witbiers more back then.
light fruit and malt aromas. amber and clear in color with huge long lasting head. taste is lightly malty, light Belgian yeast notes, light wine notes

Tap at gravity. Golden orange with small head. Just a tad tart. Listed as a wit on the menu, definitely not that. Fruity grape and mild boozy hit. Wine barrel influence is mild. Interesting complexity and enjoyable, but not sure I’d seek this out again.

750mL bottle. Pours caramel with a medium off-white head. Aroma is wine, oak, orange, wheat, and yeast. Taste is wine, alcohol, orange, spice, caramel, and oak. A touch of yeast. Medium body. Soft carbonation. Smooth, slick, and slightly creamy mouthfeel. This really isn’t much like a witbier, but is very interesting. King of reminds me of Midas Touch.

Hazy , amber color. Big , white head. Caramel, honey, spices and moscato grape in aroma . Sweet, malty taste with flavors of yeasts and fruits. Unique and delicious. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From a bomber. Pours a dark, almost opaque orange and makes a thick off-white head. A bit of lacing follows the liquid down the glass. Aroma is of oak, Pinot Noir, and malted barley. Tastes of Belgian yeast, coriander, and malt. This is a great beer and a unique taste profile. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Really good beer. Super easy finish with nice present fruity flavors, the Pinot noir really comes through, but the corriander and oak keep things balanced. Good beer

2013 750 ml bottle Aroma: mostly fruity aroma with stale green apples (oxidation shows up here), vinousy notes, and lots of spices included the expected coriander. Appearance: pour a pale/medium amber with a thin off-white head that has decent retention. mostly clear as it warms but there is some visible sediment. no lacing observed. Flavor: a lot of caramelly sweetness, vinousy overtones and oak. earthy hop flavors are minimal but bitterness is significant to mostly balance. Palate: rich, creamy almost chewy texture, medium body, almost on the full side. carbonation is light and lacking a bit (shows age here as well). a mild astringency is present. Finishes sweetish, vinousy with a long lasting astringency and hints of alcohol. Overall: didn’t know what to expect here as far as cellaring. its an aged 10% abv beer. it was never a favorite of mine when fresh but its held out pretty well.
Fantastic. Perhaps the best I’ve ever had. This brewery did everything it set out to do with marrying the wit with the wine. A taste of balanced grape and honey and carbonation.

Half growler. Light haze on the orange-amber brew topped by a film of spit. Toasted wheat, rye, citrus, cocoa and bubblegum aroma. Tastes of bubblegum, spicy tripel yeast, earthy potato bread, cocoa and citrus. Medium-heavy body has a dry slant and low-medium carbonation.

column1: Breavoine Domaine du Lieu Gosset Poire de Normandie
column4: Domaine du lieu Gosset / Michel Breavoine
column5: 75cl bottle from Auchan. Pours pale greenish yellow. Aroma is tinned pear fruit syrup. Taste is quite rich for a French perry, lots of perry pear fruit, fairly syrupy sweet, oily and lightly sticky. Some pear skins. Not bad.

column1: Breavoine Domaine du Lieu Gosset Poire de Normandie
column4: Domaine du lieu Gosset / Michel Breavoine
column5: Bottle 750ml. @ [ First Official Randers Tasting ] by HenrikSoegaard, at HenrikSoegaard house, Randers, Denmark. [ As Breavoine Domaine du Lieu Gosset Poire de Normandie ]. ABV: 5.0%. Sparkling, clear light yellow color with a small, quick white head. Aroma is moderate pear, wood, celery, light horse blanket. Flavor is moderate sweet with a average to long duration, pear, tart, dry, celery notes. Body is medium, texture is watery, carbonation is soft to fizzy. [20150124]

column1: Breavoine Domaine du Lieu Gosset Poire de Normandie
column4: Domaine du lieu Gosset / Michel Breavoine
column5: Bottle from a French Supermarket. Very light yellow in colour, extremely fizzy, smells a bit musty champagne bubbles. Very fizzy in the mouth slight hint of pear a touch sweet but also quite sour. More of a sipper with so much fizz.

column1: Breavoine Domaine du Lieu Gosset Poire de Normandie
column4: Domaine du lieu Gosset / Michel Breavoine
column5: light sweet pear aroma,pale, clear, minimal head, light sweetness, lightly sour, light body, fizzy, long nice light sour finish.

column1: Breavoine Domaine du Lieu Gosset Poire de Normandie
column4: Domaine du lieu Gosset / Michel Breavoine
column5: Light yellow and almost clear. Has a white head. Heavy acidic, fruith aroma. Yeasty and faint solvents.

column1: Breavoine Domaine du Lieu Gosset Poire de Normandie
column4: Domaine du lieu Gosset / Michel Breavoine
column5: Bottle @ First Official Randers Tasting. Pours fizzy, clear very pale greenish with quickly disappearing white head. Slightly dusty aroma of matured pears with a faint sulphuric touch. Vinous flavour of pears with some rough notes. Vinous aftertaste. High carbonation. Drinkable, refreshing but nothing really impressive.

column1: Breavoine Domaine du Lieu Gosset Poire de Normandie
column4: Domaine du lieu Gosset / Michel Breavoine
column5: Bottle @ First Official Randers Tasting. No head. Color is water with a hint of yellow/green. Aroma and taste are perry, sugar, citrus acid, fruits and has a sour finish.

column1: Breavoine Domaine du Lieu Gosset Poire de Normandie
column4: Domaine du lieu Gosset / Michel Breavoine
column5: Bottle. Pale yellow colour. Powerfull Perry aroma. Dry nice Perry flavor. Average finish. Hint of sukfur at the end. Oily palate and a Little fizzy.

column1: Breavoine Domaine du Lieu Gosset Poire de Normandie
column4: Domaine du lieu Gosset / Michel Breavoine
column5: 75 cL bottle. Pours clear and golden greenish, quickly gone head. Aroma is dry sulphorish and perry. Citric, dry and sulphorish. Citric, fruity and dry finish.

column1: Breavoine Domaine du Lieu Gosset Poire de Normandie
column4: Domaine du lieu Gosset / Michel Breavoine
column5: Bottle from a French supermarket. Very pale. Clear with a yellow tint. Extremely sparkling with a champagne like fizz on the tongue. The taste is sharp and acidic. Lemony citrus flavour - more lemon than pear. The finish is clean and very refreshing. Good.

From notes: pours a dark hazy golden yellowish orange color with burnt orange hues when held to anlight and a frothy 1.5 finger white head that quickly fades into a lasting ring. Sporadic spots of lace left behind. Crisp golden fruit aroma with hints of apple, pear and grape balanced by earthy, floral hops, pale malt and champagne like yeast. Estery frui notes and sweet alcohol phenol dominate the nose. Fuller bodied than expected with surprisingly prominent malt backbone and subtle creamy presence. This helps balance out the sweet alcohol flavor and crisp light fruit notes. There is an unexpected earthy hop character that countered the sweet apple, pear and grape notes. Very well balanced with sweet alcohol flavor but not much heat at all. An interesting interpretation of the style.

Poured into a snifter from the big ass 33.8 oz bottle. 3.0 A: Opaque brownish orange color. One finger of soapy head with less poor retention and some lacing. 4.5 S: Smells more like a farmhouse ale than a tripel. Hay-like funk off the top. Not as hoppy as I would have expected, but there is a healthy hit of citrusy hops. Overripe peaches and spicy, peppery yeast. 4.5 T: Taste is also saison like. Overripe fruit such as peaches, pears, and funk. Belgian spicy yeastiness with pepper and clove. Hops aren’t present very much, but there is a healthy bitterness (much more so than a regular tripel). With every additional sip, I switch between thinking this is a tripel or a saison. 3.5 M: Medium body. A little under-carbonation (even for the style) and smooth. Slight alcoholic bite, which complements. 4.5 D: This is a shitty IPA, a good tripel, and a great saison mixed into one. Very drinkable if you’re down with funk, which I am. Serving type: bottle Reviewed on: 10-31-2009 01:58:32

Brewed a second time for election season! Batch #2 This is from the fresh 2008 batch just released on Saturday! Poured from the 1L bottle into my snifter. A-Body is a foggy orange/light amber hue that pours with a small (1/2 finger) foamy white head that quickly subsides to a thin collar. No lacing left behind in the glass. Brew is moderately uniformly cloudy with some sediment floating in the bottom. S-Perfect scent for a crazy collaboration of DIPA/Trippel. Belgian candy sugar and sweet, bready yeast come through first followed by a healthy offering of citrusy hops. T- Lots of citrusy juicy hop flavor upfront with a solid sweet, bready yeast and candy sugar backbone. The finish shows evidence of its freshness with a good dose of alcohol astringency and a bit of resiny hop bitterness...but these disappear quickly. All that lingers is a bit of alcohol warmth. P-Good...but could be better. Medium carbonation and a balanced body of alcohol astringency and smooth yeast. The third character is hop oils but not as strong as it could be (would be perfect if hop oils were most prominent instead of vaguely noticeable). O- Great, Unique beer. My dilemma was to age or not to age? If one ages the clear alcohol astringency of the beer is lowered and the yeast has a chance to thrive and effect the flavor and mouthfeel...but the wonderful hop flavors...are gone. I drank this one fresh. I really liked this collaboration of two of my favorite styles-who happen to be opposites. I will try to buy a few more bottles of this to experiment with. My only complaint is that it could be a bit more hoppy. Very well done though. Great beer! I was super-excited when I found out it was being re-released! Serving type: bottle Reviewed on: 10-17-2008 01:30:45

A: Pours a cloudy yellow with a puffy white head. Okay retention and a few spots of lace. S: Aroma of Belgian yeast, spice, and banana. Light citrus as well. T: Very much like the aroma. Lots of yeast and spice. The banana stands out as well along with some candy sugar. The citrus comes out mildly in the finish. It is more Belgian than IPA M: Medium in body, pretty smooth. D: An average american version of the style.

Bottle: &nbsp Dark straw, dull and hazy, large frothy white head, lots of sediment showing up on this one. &nbsp Heavy bready nose. &nbsp Felt a bit more Belgian but as it warmed it became much more American in its heaviness. &nbsp Seems somewhat bright. &nbsp Certainly more hoppy than your average Triple. &nbsp Body and mouthfeel are moderate. &nbsp Does seem a bit heavy tho. &nbsp Decent, but rather American like. &nbsp Wished it were more floral. &nbsp Just a heavy heavily hopped American Triple. &nbsp Not bad but, not as delicate as I would have wanted. &nbsp Thanks Trey!

Courtesy of tpd975. Pours cloudy copper with a bit of tiny floaties and nice white head. The modest aroma brings a few malty notes mixing with apricot, oxidized prunes, spice and a bit of grassy to piney hops. The taste starts with a pleasing mix of grapefruit, pine and then apricot fruitiness. Midway the malts show up just pushing aside the other flavors enough to get noticed. Nice brew.

Thanks tpd975 for the share. Pours hazy yellow with a white head. Nose is yeast, bitterness, banana, some malt, and some funk/ vinegar. Flavor is the same with some sugar and a fairly noticeable banana-ness. Medium-bodied and pretty nice.

@Tampa Wkly Gathering courtesy Greg/tpd975-1L bottle-pours a thin white head and cloudy yellow/gold color. Aroma is yeast, medium fruit-apricot, light malt. Taste is yeast, medium fruit-apricot, light malt, some tart lemon.
POurs a hazy yellow. Nose is candy sugar, sweet spices, floral hops. Flavor is crisp citrus and floral hops, sweet sugars, cane sugar, honey, belgian yeasts, cloves. awesome trippel.

This is from the fall 2008 batch, and as such, the hops have not mellowed much at all. This is a hoppy ass brew. Looks great, a nice golden color with a crown of head that releases scents of pine and sugar. On an aside, what a great label. Taste is very similar to the smell, though the hops are definitely the prevailing factor. With that said, it isn’t such a crazy amount of hops that it puts this brew off balance, but I wouldn’t recommend hop-averse or hop-newbies start here. Mouthfeel is strong with a medium body and carbonation. The flavor is enhanced rather than overshadowed here. Drinkability is good but a fair warning: this one will sneak up on you. A very good brew.
Draft. Wow, awful. Smelled and tasted like a badly executed rauchbier gone terribly wrong.

on tap-pours a thin foamy light tan head and brown color. Aroma is mild medium/dark malt-some sweet. Taste is medium/dark malt-toffee, nutty, hint of/slight hops to balance this beer out nicely. OK carbonation.

Tap and Spuyten Duyvil - I wasn’t going to rate this beer, but I just have to because I thought it tasted so damn wierd! - it sure looked nice, with a deep amber color and a compact, lasting white head - smelled very earthy and vegetable-like, with aromas of fruit-flavored yogurt and freshly-baked bread - earthy, plant-like flavor, with bread yeast, melon rinds, yogurt - my tongue didn’t know what to do with this stuff - I’m still trying to figure it out, and I had it about 24 hours ago - it won’t leave my brain alone!

My Bottom Line: This balanced Altbier presents leafy, earthy hops joyously walking alongside the malt’s nutty caramel. A competent recreation of this flavorful session style. Further Personal Perceptions: -A creamy head decorates the hazy caramel-tinged copper. -The aroma does not necessarily announce the high flavor content, especially its length. -This finish is well balanced, offering as much caramel maltiness as wooden, earthy, and grassy hop bitterness. -Carbonation suits the flavor profile and body quite well. -I would not have expected less from High Point. On tap at Tap NY.

Pours an nice shade of brown (yeah, I know, whatever that is?) with the obligatory tan-ish head. Flavor is traditional for an Alt, yet it somehow finished bitter than expected, even though there wasn’t much in the way of hops with the initial. Decent brew.

Brewtopia NYC (2006). Pours an amber/light brown with a tan decent head. Malty aroma. The flavor suggests a slight roastyness in the malt, bread-like. Rounded earthy pepperyness and a prolonged bitter finish. Not bad.

On tap at Brewtopia. Deep copper in color with a nice off white head. Malty grainy and fruity aroma. Caramel toffee notes. Malty dark fruity and hoppy flavor. Nice bready and chocolatey notes. Sweet tasting. Finish is light and hoppy. Dry. Medium bodied. Enjoyable. Nice beer.
brewtopia 10/21/06 Aroma is fruity, sweet malts. Taste was the same, lightly hoppy finish.

Bottle courtesy of Luiss. Thank you, sir. very light grassy hop aroma with notes of lemon peper and sweet bread. Body is ruddy brown and holds a tight, pinky thickness, tan head that dimishes slowly. Fore is a kind of a hearty plain bread and cotton cloth flavor with sweeter maltiness throught he middle and hints of brown ale like nuttiness in the finish. finish is vaugely dusty, but satisfying too. Presentsas a dry, less fruity, brown ale with a slight dusty funkiness that gives it some depth.

Thanks to dickinsonbeer for this... Appears a dark, transparent mahogany with a small off white head that quickly fades out. Tiny speckles of lacing is left around the glass. Smell is of toffee, doughy malt, chocolate, green hops, dark fruit, nuts, and caramel. Taste is of the same aromas. There is almost a prune presence found in the flavors as well that is typical of a Belgian Dubbel but not necessarily an altbier. Mouthfeel is medium bodied, sugary, with raisins, and cocoa mixed with sugar lingering along the palate.

Curiously named, I suppose to dumb it down for the uneducated, this actually is a fairly respectable Belgian Wit. It poured a hazy, light straw color with a modest head that did some decent lacing. The aroma is a tart wheat with orange peel, coriander, and orange pulp quite evident. Thick for the style, it has a refreshing wit taste, soft wheat with coriander and orange zest and a lightly tart finish. A pleasant surprise. Prairie Rock Brewing Company, Elgin, IL

column1: Rock Bottom South Denver Oak Aged Abbey
column5: tap at the brewpub on the beer engine. i did not know this was not on the site, i will return to get more info, and another pint. poured a hazed orange yellow with a white head. smelled like a 7&7. fruity flavor with a nice whiskey edge. some strawberry started to emerge in this late. alcohol really showed in the finish. a bit too sweet, but not bad.

column1: Davids Ale Works Sprocket Blonde Ale
column5: A fairly weak attempt at a blonde ale here. There was corn in the nose, a sweetness that was also very prominent and not much else going on. Appearance was a light yellow in color, minimal haed. Mouthfeel was light and crisp. Flavor was really off with a strong buttery/diacytl very prominent. I could get notes of hops too but they were very faint. Best I could say about this beer is it was wet. Not much else.

column1: Davids Ale Works Sprocket Pale Ale
column5: Surely, I’ve had worse beers out of a can than this. But those are usually the mass produced, lager stuff we all know and love. But this is probably the worst pale ale out of a can I’ve come across. This is a very unbalanced beer in both the nose and palate. Aroma was slightly peppery and vegetable. Appearance was a very dark copper color. Mouthfeel was medium bodied and unremarkable. Flavor was peppery, sweetly malted and very little hops to taste. Way to malty for a pale ale and not enough hops.
Bottle from friar tucks, pours clear dark red, aroma of brown sugar and malts. Flavor is roasted nuts and some caramel, asweet, but a litle bitter on the end.

Enjoyed on tap in a shaker glass. The beer poured a medium copper color, with a low off-white head. The nose showed pleasant caramel and toffee notes, with perhaps a very low level of yeast-derived esters in the background, if they existed at all. The palate was pleasantly malty, lacking the semi-astringent roasted character and thin mouthfeel that accompanies many variants of the style. Again, caramel, honey, toffee, and perhaps a touch of date come through. Extremely enjoyable. Overall, a very good example of an oft-poorly brewed style. It’s difficult to see where many other raters found so much fault.

I poured the bottle into a small snifter and it produced a small cream colored head that faded fast with no lace after it left. The body of the brew was a nice shade of orange. The beer started to fall apart from here. The aroma was more roast than malty not what I expect at all, and I got no peat note from this at all. The flavors were more roasted malts than sweet caramel. It was more bitter than earthy as well so the bittering just didn’t work. The feel was ok for the style with good carbonation for your tongue. I finished the bottle but it was nothing close to what I wanted to see for the style.

Bottle sample at the Hill Distributing tasting at Blacklick Wine & Spirits on 5/13/10. Beer labeled simply as "Scottish Ale" because someone thought they needed to sue CBC over the name "90 Shilling". I didn’t realize you could sue someone over a style name, but I digress. Clear copper pour with a huge beige head. Metallic nose that’s a bit peaty with some hop character. Caramel flavor with some peat and a bit of hop. Thin finish. Meh.
Hazy red brown color/ rocky beige head. Nutty, toasted caramel aromas. Dry cardboard, spicy caramel, metallic, plastic flavors; drain pour.
On tap at the brewery/restaurant. Pours a deep red/amber color with an off-white head. Grainy aroma with caramel notes. Medium/light bodied. It was okay.
Aroma toasted grain and slightly charred brown sugar,maybe a hint of smoke,taste is burnt caramel, toasty malt, peat ,and maybe a little teacle. Fine as an American version

On tap at the CBC. Deep amber color with a foamy beige head. Nose of lightly toasted grains with some campfire. Medium body. Tea, burnt toast, smoked grains, brown sugar, and an almost berry sweetness. Long toasted grain finish. Enjoyable beer for a style that I usually don’t prefer.

12oz from BeerVirgin72 - thanks, Dawn! Bright amber pour with a moderate head. Very intense caramel notes in the nose, which tapers off to be a bit one-dimensional (even if that single dimension is enticing). Slightly thin mouthfeel and lively carbonation, but the flavor is really quite nice. Soft and bready, with a hint of smoke to balance the sweet flavors.
On tap at the Columbus Brewing Company Restaurant. Beautiful dark red color, Wonderful malty flavor, tasty smoky and lightly bitter finish.

5 oz draught sample at the Gaylord, MI location, July 2006. Very dark amber with quite a bit of lace as the small creamy head recedes quite slowly....faintly spicy with cacao and a trace of cinnamon, lots of toasted grains, some corn perhaps in the mix....the body is lovely, smoky toasty malts making for a rich mouthfeel, moderately sweet at the front and creamy-smooth but heading towards spicy territory at the finish with a bit of pepper and again, cinnamon....coffee notes start to show up with warmth; moderate to low carbonation. This was really interesting, just could have been a bit more forceful and it might have touched greatness, but as is a very nice surprise.

10-year aged bottle from Beer Bistro in Toronto. Wow, what a fantastic concoction. Aromas of oak, olive brine, cognac, and wine. Tasting notes of oak, olive brine, cognac, roasted nuts with a wine-like dry finish. Colour was a very deep amber, reminiscent of cognac. No head. Hands down one of the best aged beers I've had.

750 ml bottle, v2009, at Gueuze tasting 2016, Ulfborg. Clear amber copper color with off white head. Malty and yeasty aroma, floral and herbal notes, fruity, cherries, spicy, peanuts, wood, vinous. Sweet and acidic taste like aroma. Light to medium oily body with soft carbonation.

From Bottle @fonefan gueuze tasting Ulfborg, thanks to Nightfall - june 24th 2016. Vintage 2009-ish. Pours a reddish, clear brown with a small off white head. Aroma has earthy, wet wood, mulch, peanut butter, PJ without sweetness, tart, slight balsamic. Taste has surprisingly much caramel, tart, fruity, vinous, slight toasty finish. Medium high carbonation and a medium oily body.

A deep dark brown ale with a thick big bubbled mocha head. In aroma, a nice herbal chocolate, Brett, coffee, lactic points, very nice. In mouth, a smooth chocolate with ground cherries, Brett, Orval notes, ligther bodied, but overall, very nice. Tasted Dec. 25 2011. Bieropholie Imports, BB May 2009....based on 2009 ratings, this benefited from aging.
moutig biertje met caramel toetsen - thuis gedronken - goudgelige kleur met mooie schuimkruig. Vlot binnenlopend biertje

9/VII/2012 - 33cl bottle from De Zytholoog / Bierloods (Adegem) @ home - BB: 9/II/11 (2012-706) Clear dark blond to orange beer, big creamy head, very stable, little adhesive. Aroma: sweet malts, lots of spices, bit sugary, dried orange peel, bit fruity. MF: soft carbon, medium to full body. Taste: bit of a dusty start, citrus fruits, oranges, dried orange peel, lots of spices, bit peppery, star anise, cloves, lots of alcohol noticeable. Aftertaste: citrus and oranges, sweet malts, candi sugar, more spices, nice bitter ending, some alcohol burning the throat. Good stuff, even when 1,5 year past BB date. (or maybe because of that)
Bottle from Bier Temple Brussels. Bold gold body with huge soapy head. Nose of citrus, chalky. Taste fruits, oranges, malts, caramel. Quite nice. Nice warming Tripel finish going on. Enjoyable.

Bottle 330ml. @ home. ABV. 7.0%. Clear medium to dark yellow color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white to white head. Aroma is moderate malty, grain, toasted, fruity, moderate yeasty, belgium yeast, light alcohol. Flavor is moderate to light heavy sweet and moderate bitter with a average to long duration, alcohol, peppery. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20101008]
33cl, exclusive brew, from De Bierloods Adegem, complex brew, not balanced, hazy, rocky head, nice brew
Bottle, 7%. Cloudy orange colour. Big semi-stable white head. The flavour starts spicy, then turns a little sour. Very high carbonation. Ends on a clean finish in between dry and sweet.
On bottle. Noce and good tasting beer. A rather bitter aftertaste and some sweetness, makes this beer a good and nice beer

Pale amber-orange ale; small yellowish head. Wet dog, rotting wood, moulded malts. Again something rotten in the taste, as well as sweet malts superimposed by a rather harsh bitterness, not really hoppy. Drier finish. Slick, but rather thin. Ugh. Retrial with new batch. The rotting wood from above has been replaced by burnt plastic, very present in the taste. Not really an improvement. At least the thinness seems to be remedied, making it even more slick. Would fetch a couple of points, indeed, so: was: 3/4/5/3/9 = 2.4/5
Bottle, 33 cl. Delirium Café Brussels. Dark golden color, good white head. Aroma sweetness, hops, light fruity. Medium body. Taste = bitterness, malts, a bit sweet. Dry aftertaste. Not bad at all.

Tap, Café De Gouden Leeuw, St Lievens Houtem. Golden color, light and undescript fruity aroma. Thiinish mouthfeel. Alcoholic. Malty, slightly citric flavor with not very much else. I can’t taste much hops. Rather empty abbey tripel type.
Clear golden, decent white head. Citrus aroma. Taste is a little more grainy, a bit too mild for my liking. Drinkable though.
0,5lFlasche. Strohgelb, klar. Weisser hoher Schaum. Etwas muffiger Strohduft. Antrunk besser und frisch. Gras, Hopfen. Sanft herb.
Fles 50cl thuis. Fris bitter, würzig, zoetje. (8-2014).---------------------.
Poors light yellow, white big white lacing foam. Typical aroma and taste, barley all over. (Velp 201804)
Lekker, makkelijk drinkbaar bier, matig koolzuurhoudend met helaas een lichte naar-bittere afdronk.

L: -pours a clear straw golden with a small to medium,foamy,white head -medium carbonation visible S: -lemon,pears,floral,wet paper,tea T: -grainy,honey,lemon,pears,chalky -low to medium bitterniss for the style F: -medium carbonation -light body O: Rather mediocre Helles.

Bottle from Trinkgut. The beer is golden colored and has an unstable white head, with average carbonation. The aroma is malty, with tones of citrus, grass, grains and some hops. But further it’s a little weak. The taste is malty, light sweet and has a light structure which is also a little watery. The finish is a little dry and light bitter, with subtle hop notes.

Flasche 0,5l (Alc: 4,7%): Helles Gold, klar, etwas fester feinporiger Schaum; angenehme, recht süße Nase, malzige Noten, sehr leicht und mild; im Körper frisch, leichte Süße, malzig, Getreidenoten, cremig, deutliche Kohlensäure, sehr mild; angenehm milder Nachgang
50 cl. bottle. Clear golden colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of malt, hops, straw and with a bitter finish.
Goldenen colour with white head. Sweet maltiness, hay, refreshing finish. When you drink "helles" you don’t expect hop bombs and this seems to be a good example of the style
Naso che esprime ben poco, note di cereali maltati e lievito. Al gusto ha struttura media, carbonazione adeguata alla tipologia, retrogusto poco piacevole. Un prodotto di buon livello industriale

column2: Frankfurt an der Oder, Brandenburg, Germany
column5: Clear pale yellow color, average sized white head that quickly disappears. Some lacing. Light body, average carbonation. Aroma of malt, apple, hops, little bit soapy. Not bad for 50 cents. Light and watery but surprisingly tasty. Not offensive.

column2: Frankfurt an der Oder, Brandenburg, Germany
column5: Can. Clear liquid, big white head. Light body. Medium carbonation. Watery. Metal aroma.

column2: Frankfurt an der Oder, Brandenburg, Germany
column5: 50cl 4,5% marine-blue alu-can imported fr Suomi. Produced in France for co. Kepro in Kesko.fi. "Premium III" it says. Pours straw golden body, tall head, lively carbonation. Scents of yellow apple, very mild hops, elderflower. Rounded gentle taste of hops, malts, bread. Comfortable mouthfeel. Aftertaste loafs of bread, doesn’t last long, but this is overall a nice beer.

column2: Frankfurt an der Oder, Brandenburg, Germany
column5: Can 0.5l from local market. Originally rated 26062012. Colour is clear golden with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Grain, malts and something horrible.

column2: Frankfurt an der Oder, Brandenburg, Germany
column5: Weird artificial taste, even sweetener and colour are used. Nothing quite pleasant there.

column2: Frankfurt an der Oder, Brandenburg, Germany
column5: Canned, 0.50l, brewed in France. Clear pale golden color with frothy white head and average visible carbonation. Aroma of corn malt, vegetables, grassy hops and a bit papery, stale on the nose. Taste starts malty, more on sweetish side, while followed chalky, papery and finished relatively bitter Light body, thin texture and soft carbonation in palate. Not good...

column2: Frankfurt an der Oder, Brandenburg, Germany
column5: 50 cl can. Pours clear golden color with small head. Aroma of malts, grain, artificial sweeteners and grass. Flavour of sweet malts, hay and some metallic notes. 3412

column2: Frankfurt an der Oder, Brandenburg, Germany
column5: mild aroma has some flower notes and toffee caramel. Clear straw yellow. Short head. Taste is bit fruity with light hoppiness. Medium bodied, standard carbonation. Easy to drink but bit plain.

column2: Frankfurt an der Oder, Brandenburg, Germany
