Backlog rating. Tap at JDW WIQ Cider Fest 2015, London. It pours a hazed light golden color with no head. Aroma is musty and dry, lightly sweet with baked apples and starch. Taste has more apple juice, light plastic, dust and must. Dry tart lemony finish. Light bodied with no carbonation. Overall, decent

At the Monk’s Retreat, Reading. Cloudy gold in hue. Still. Drying and a little sour in the mouth. A bit watery. Definite bitter apple skins here with not enough flesh to compensate. Always find it difficult to rate ciders but this is not one of my favourites.
Box @ Saxon Crown, Corby. Paler yellow colour. Good apple nose, with a slightly lesser taste due to its extremely dry nature.
Cask at the Alexander Graham bell. Pours hazy golden, nose is tart apple, taste is very dry, apple.
Poly pin at AGBELL... Hazy yellow amber... Soft sweet apple.. Light tannins nose... Soft sweet tannin apple
Bag in box@gatehouse, lichfield. Slightly hazy yellow orange cider. Aroma of barnyard and apples. Taste is some barnyard, sweetish apple juice and a touch of dry apple skin. Decent.
Cask at the white lady. Pours hazy pale gold with no head. Aromas of sweet apples, a but watery upfront. Taste is watery apple juice. Lacks bite. Lacks most things, actually.

Appearance Clear(1)->Murky(5) : 2 &nbsp Pale(1)->Dark(5) : 1 &nbsp Still(1)->Sparkling(5) : 1 Aroma Intensity : 2 &nbsp Yeast : 2 &nbsp Bread : 2 &nbsp Hay: XX &nbsp Brett : XX &nbsp Floral: 2 &nbsp Wood: 3 &nbsp Leather: XX &nbsp Barnyard : XX &nbsp Medicine : 1 &nbsp Phenols: 2 &nbsp Cheese : XX &nbsp Vinous: 2 &nbsp Notes: Caramel : XX &nbsp Honey : XX &nbsp Applesauce: XX &nbsp Appleskin : 3 Pear : XX &nbsp Tropical FruitsXX &nbsp Flavor Initial Flavor : Dry(1)->Sweet(5) : 2 &nbsp Finish Dry(1)->Sweet(5) : 2 Juicy: 3 &nbsp Sourness : 3 &nbsp Bitterness: XX &nbsp Farmy : XX &nbsp Complex: XX &nbsp Length : XX Palate Light(1)->Full(5) : 1 &nbsp Flat(1)->Fizzy(5) : 1 Chewy: XX &nbsp Sharp: 1 &nbsp Chalk : XX &nbsp Astringence : 3 &nbsp Tea tannins : 3 &nbsp Alcohol : XX Comments: One of those dry ciders that focus on astringency instead of flavours and the aroma remains timid.
Brown-orange with thin beige head. Aroma of chocolate and vanilla. Flavour of chocolate and vanilla. No bitterness.

Draft. A brown beer with a thick brown head. The aroma is sweet with strong notes of caramel. The flavor is sweet malty with strong notes of caramel, but also quite strong notes of nuts, leading to a dry and bitter end. OK, but nothing special. The body is thin.
On tap at Pannrummet. Pours dark brown with hints of red. Deep roasted malt aroma with rasins and notes of coffee. A bit thin and watery and plain. Dry finish that leaves little impression.
rbesg06, on tap at the brewpub. deep brown colour. aroma of chocolate cake with a lot of icing, pretty drinkable, lightly sweet, hints of burnt hay and toffee
On tap at the brewpub. Red brown/black colour with a beige head. Aroma is light roasted, fruit. Flavour is fruit, malt, fruit, caramel, hop.

Draught@Panrummet. A decent dunkel. dark brown colour. Lightly toasty/caramelly aroma. palate is smooth, soft and quite clean. Toasty malt characters, which are also slightly roasty. Some lightly sweet buttery caramel characters aswell. Sweetish, and perhaps a touch thin.

On tap at the brewpub. Served clear, dark brown with some reddish notes, and a with a small, beige head. Lightly roasted aroma with some fruityness. The flavor is much the same, but with some caramel as well. Thin to medium body, and some hops in the finish. A bit boring. (060825)

(Draught at Pannrummet on August 25) Clear dark brown color, tan head. Malty a bit chocolate scent. A bit spritzy mouth feel. Fruity after taste. Fresh a bit sweet but mostly fruity taste. Low bitterness.

(Draught at the brewpub) Pours dark, dark red. Small nougat coloured head. Aroma of chocolate. Sweet and smooth. Tastes cocolate, malty sweetnes. Round, silky and mild. A bit nutty. Minerals. Light carbonation.
Mahogany brown, tan head. Malty, sugary nose with some salty hints. Sugary flavour with small hints of red berries. Somewhat malty. Low bitterness.

[cask] Pours a cloudy, golden yellow color. Aroma is very full, and really fresh-smelling. Very sweet flavors initially, mellowing out to some pleasantly tart flavors. A solid take on the Apricot fruit beer.

Hazy orange/amber color. Aroma of apricots, hops, some candy-like sweetness, some hint of malt. Super smooth mouthfeel, barely any carbonation (probably due to the cask), slightly syrupy (in a good way). Flavors were predominantly of apricot, malt, and hops. Undertones of caramelized sugar, yeast, and spices. Pretty unique, pretty good.

Ein helles Bier, das angeblich zurzeit (2019) in Novi Sad gebraut wird. Es hat einen recht flachen Körper, der hinten raus etwas interessanter wird, da erst jetzt die Hopfenbittere einsetzt. Angenhem ist, dass es nicht den gleichen Einheits-Balkan-Geschmack hat, aber ein Spitzenbier ist es deshalb noch lange nicht.

Pours a clear golden, topped with frothy white head, poor retention. Typical smell grainy aroma, malty. Taste sweet and watery, no real bitterness. A very poor attempt, but you get what you pay (cheap).
Bottle 0.5l from Roda supermarket Belgrade Serbia.Pour it golden color with medium white head.On the nose feet.Taste and aroma awful, skunky, corn, sweet, annoying flavour.Man someone drink this...
Hvala vedranu na ovoj pivi...plasticna boca od 2 litre vrlo groznog okusa..vocni okus ali i miris...ruzno,vrlo ruzno. ...kao da je neko oprao noge u pivo..
0,5l bottle. Golden color. Malty aroma and taste. Some bitterness. It’s nice and refreshing lager.
0.5l bottle from Belgrade. Clear golden color with small head. It’s grassy and watery. Low end beer.
Dull straw. Has some light bitterness, hop extract. So some dryness and balance to an otherwise bland beer.
Bottle. Gold and fizzy; smells sweet but not grainy with some plastic. The palate is thin and too flat but the hop extract adds balance to what would otherwise be bland. Finishes dry

500ml bottle purchased at a Maxi store in Belgrade. Dotted spots at the glass from a low, white head. Clear, pale golden body. Grassy hints to the nose. Semi-tart grassy taste alongside notes of cardboard. Papery dry ending. Just about drinkable (last one at the Danube river cruise, Cabin, MS Rügen 04.08.2012).

Bottled. A light golden beer with a thin white head. The aroma has notes of brewing cereal and honey. The flavor is sweet with notes of cardboard, honey, and a bit of brewing cereal, leading to a dry finish. Thanks yespr for sharing.
330ml Flasche. Klar und dunkelgolden mit minimaler Schaumkrone. Leicht getreidig. Sonst kaum Aroma und Geschmack. Sehr wässrig.
Clear golden beer with very small white head vanished quickly. Aroma is weak bread and malts. Taste is very light sweet malts, almost like water. Refreshing light beer.

330ml canned from ICA. Clear golden, small white head that disappears almost completely, weak lacing. Sweet bread aroma. Thin and watery mouthfeel. Does not taste very much, slightly grassy and sweet bread. Lacks bitterness.
Can from ICA Barkarbystaden. Golden with a small white head. Light with some bread, metallic notes and some grass. Thin and boring.

column1: Sonny Barger Sonnys Lean & Mean Lager
column5: Pours a transparent pale golden with a thin-lacing wispy white head. Aroma of lightly sweet sugary pale malt and a touch of noble hops. Body starts with a thin, sugary grainy maltiness with a touch of fruity esters before a mildly bitter finish. Pretty sweet for a pale lager, but uninteresting and sorta thin.

column1: Sonny Barger Sonnys Lean & Mean Lager
column5: A very light lager with nothing special going for it. However, there’s nothing bad about it either. No weird flavors or skunky smell, just a decent light lager.

column1: Sonny Barger Sonnys Lean & Mean Lager
column5: Bottle from bockyhorsey, a very generous rb’ian. The pour was, well, pale lager-like. Need I say more? The aroma was corny with some off-notes of something or other. Grains very subdued. Skunk was tame, maybe some slight grass. The flavor followed, some sort of an astringent off-ness to it all, but heck, this was a pale lager, what more could I have hoped for? Mouthfeel was pale lager-like. Thanks, Bill, always fun to try a new one!

column1: Sonny Barger Sonnys Lean & Mean Lager
column5: Pours a clear straw color with slight white head that goes quickly. No aroma that I can notice. Flavor is I guess okay for style since that is what I am trying to rate to. But it just has a bit of straw malt flavor. No hop presence at all. I guess not too bad for a light/pale lager. But a little more flavor that the big 3, I guess. Thanks bockyhorsey.

column1: Sonny Barger Sonnys Lean & Mean Lager
column5: Pale gold color with a bit of fizzy head. Basic sweet grain aroma, a little grain silo-like. Clean, grain taste. There really isn’t much to write. No off flavors, just simple grain. It’s like if MGD or Bud were decent beers.

column1: Sonny Barger Sonnys Lean & Mean Lager
column5: 12 oz Bottle. Aroma was matalic and corn and a lemon note as well. Yellow body with white head that disipated rather quickly. Starts out cool and crisp and of normal swill beer. But by the finish the malt thicken up and it was to the point you had a stale metal vat taste on the palate. Not the best beer in the world but cool label. 4/2/3/2/5=1.6 Thought I hadn’t had this one and picked one up on a beer run. Aroma was like passing by the malt house on I-94 in Milwaukee. Yellow body with white head. Flavor didn’t have that metalic taste but just a good refreshing swill with moderate bitterness.

column1: Sonny Barger Sonnys Lean & Mean Lager
column5: Bottle poured a clear yellow with a quickly disapating white head. Aromas of lemon, straw and corn. Palate was light bodied and crisp. Flavors of straw, light lemon and a hint of corn with a crisp clean finish. Label says Sonny Barger Brewing Co. but since Sonny light is under Huber I guess this is where it goes. I knew it would be another boring pale lager but being a motorcyclist and having met Sonny I was curious what kinda swill he put his name on. It was’nt quite as bad as I expected.

column1: Sonny Barger Sonnys Lean & Mean Lager
column5: Bottle reads "Sonny’s lean & mean Premium beer" under the moniker "Sonny Barger Brewing Company, Monroe, WI", so I assume the actual brewer is indeed Huber Brewing. Well, this isn’t that bad for a light beer but for the most part it still seems like a cheap macro. Seems to have some raunchy machine oil elements, though it’s not a drainpour. Try it if you can find it, but mainly for novelty.

At the 2007 Big Beer, Belgians, & Barleywines Festival in Vail. Great CO barleywine! Pours dark brown to ruby black in color with a thin off white head. Fruity caramel aroma with raisins and dates. Candy apple fruity malty sweetness has a near perfect balance of hop bitterness. This is remarkable smooth for the stated alcohol. You’d think it was alcohol-free! Thick mouthfeel, but not saturating. Just a very technically well-made BW.

tap at the brewery. dark copper orange body. aroma is peaches, plums, alcohol, and syrup. this is hot. alcohol really bites at first, this fades as it warms and some other flavors emerge. supersweet, some bitterness in the finish, but the fruit comes through on top of everything. peach syrup, it really reminds me of the syrup from canned peaches. cherry lingers with a note of alcohol.

Segfault bottled this one at the brewery for me. What a guy. What a birtday present! It pours dark reddish brown with a skim of white bubbles. Looks thick and mighty! Aroma is extremely malty. Lots of caramel and dried fruit. Hints of spicy hops. Taste is marvelous. Tons of malty goodness. Great balance, though not as hoppy as I’d prefer. Still, a really interesting maltiness. Some toastiness toward the back of my tongue which is made more interesting by the hops back there too. Lots of caramel and fruit toward the center and tip of my tongue. Man, this is interesting. The alcohol is really well cloaked by the malts, and the thickness and sweetness of the malts is really well cloaked by the hops. It’s a rather deceptive combination. It lends to a really smooth beer. I’ve never had a barleywine as clean and smooth as this. If I were to offer any criticism, I’d say I kinda wish it were a little less reserved. Give me more of something - hit me with some more malts or surprise me with some more hop character. Still, all in all, an impressive barleywine. I can’t wait to see what Dry Dock comes up with next!

Objectively speaking: A brown lager that lacks the usual house confidence. I like: Not very tasty at all, rather pale coloured. Very light bodied. limited roastiness. Clean, but mostly dull. I dislike: Mostly sweet palate, but never really choosing a direction, avoiding fruitiness and wandering into the cerealic side of things. Not much lager character, no crispiness.

Draft... DLD’08... Very dark (almost black), clear ruby red with a large, frothy, white head. Creamy, tight retention. A merger of cocoa, vanilla and cinnamon comprise the aroma. Medium-bodied with a skim-milk mouthfeel and bristly carbonation. Well-balanced, nicely roasted and very drinkable. Good bitterness prevents overwhelming sweetness. Roasty, nutty finish.

On tap at the brewpub with a dark brown body and light tan head. The aroma was sweet pancakes with some coffee. The taste was coffee with some cola. There was also some fresh bitter green beans. A decent Schwarzbier.

Pours a light black to dark brown and is transluscent. No real lasting head. Smell is dry roasty dark malt. Taste is same but thinner than the smell. Light bodied and drinkable, but just average flavorwise. No real flaws however.

Sampled from the full sampler at Flossmoor Station. Poured a dark syrupy brown with a prominent off white head that stuck around. Faint malty aromas that leave little intimidation. Flavors are of nice toasted darker malts with some sweet undertones. A very pleasant and refreshing brew with a smooth finish. It’s all about the taste.
Pour is ruby amber/brown with a thin tan head...toasty sweet caramel aroma...some chocolatey molasses flavor things going on...nice malty toasty flavos throughout...

Draft at Radio Maria in Champaign, IL. Pours black with a nice thick tan head. Faint aroma of dry roast and lager yeast. Initial flavor of dark caramel that transitions to dry roasty middle, with some accents of chocolate and nuts. This an interesting take on a Schwarzbier. Sort of like brown lager/ dry stout blend.
On Tap at Radio Maria. Jet black body under a small, frothy tan head. Smoke, caramel malt, roasted nuts, chocolate aroma. Medium body, watery. Flavor was slightly sweet but otherwise unremarkable.

On tap, 9/22 at the brewery. Very dark color with some short lived tan foam, no lacing. Lots of dark malt in the aroma, very sweet smelling. A bit too thick in the mouthfeel for a Schwarz IMHO, almost resembles a hefty brown ale, lots of esters, not very lager like to me.

On tap at Flossmoor Station, and served in a shaker. This beer poured a dark black with a thin, quickly fading, light grayish/tan head. Very little lace was left behind. The aroma of the beer was made up of cocoa, light roasted malts, and also some light yeast. The flavor was mainly light roasted malts, with some caramel and chocolate at the finish. The mouthfeel was medium-bodied with minimal carbonation. Another winner from Flossmoor.
Tap at CooperSmiths. The look is clear, no legs, light yellow in color. The taste is honey, sweet, fruit, and sugar. The taste is sticky, alcohol, fruit, and honey. Just ok.
Tap. Clear dark yellow, mild carbonation. Aroma is honey, feet, some chemicals. Taste is dominated by astringency, although some honey creeps through. Light hoppiness. Finish is astringent, metallic.
Keg at La Lanterne Brasserie, Strasbourg, France. Clouded blonde with white head. Sweet banana liqueur flavour with the ubiquitous pear drop note. Thin and rather unremarkable. Not great.

Draught, 6%. Weak wet rag smell with a faint sweetness. Very muddy light brown colour. Small and creamy, semi-stable white head. The flavour is a little sweet and very slightly sour. Supposedly plum flavour, it reminds me more of some sort of candy. Not a gueuze, but tastes OK.
Straw colour, very short foam head. Grassy, malty scent. Slightly perfumed in the mouth at first and then a big bitterness hits you. Very, very bitter and very, very dry. Lovely stuff!
W aromacie soja, przyprawy w stylu Vegety, kawa rozpuszczalna, likier wiœniowy. W smaku alkohol, czekolada, s³ody palone, karmel. W posmaku goryczka alkoholowa. Taki przeciêtny porter.

Light yellow colored, little white head. Pretty mild aroma with fruits, honey, some esters and citrus. Thin to medium bodied. Flavor is also fruity with lemon and hops, aftertaste lasts with dryness and citrus. Some unclean tones also in aftertaste.
Deep red colour with spicy aroma. Sickly start with spicy middle and boring end. Very average.

Bottle. Deep gold with a large off white foam. Aromas are malty with caramel and biscuit. Some citrus with hints of berry. Flavours are biscuit and toffee malts with citrus. Clean on the palate and fairly tasty. Not bad.

Amber colored, little white head. Chocolate in aroma with some sweet caramel, hops and mild alcohol. Thin to medium bodied. Flavor has also some chocolate, roastiness and caramel, aftertaste has some nuts, dryness, slight hops and alcohol. Nice surprise this brew to have some character, bottle looked like a normal-East-European-lager.

Clear yellow golden colour. Aroma of apple, apple skin, light yeasty notes. Light sweet apple flavour, light sour green apple notes, sulfite notes. Fizzy. Finish apple, apple skin, green apple. Quite good at quenching thirst, not the most complex of ciders though. (from 1L bottle @ home)
Bottled (RBESG Gothenburg). Golden colour, small white head. Aroma is apple and a bit of alcohol. Flavour is very much acidic apple juice mixed with white whine.

Bottled. A light orange cider with no head. The aroma is sweet with strong notes of apples, and only hints of acidity. The flavor is quite acidic with notes of primarily green apples. The acidity makes it very dry.
rbesg06gt, bottled. clear golden, light texture, not much fizz. freshly sliced apple aroma, light sourness with a crisp finish. a good palate cleanser
Bottle. Clean, fresh and quite dry in the finish. Some appleskin acidity, apple juice. Quite clean/refreshing.
[Sampled at RBESG 2006] Pale golden. No head. Sourish and dry. Apple aroma and flavour.
(Bottle 100 cl) Pours clear and golden, completely lacking head. Very fresh apple aroma. Rather light-bodied with tart apple notes and a dry, slightly acidic finish. Very fresh. 260806
Von Fass at the Frankfurt Apfelwein Festival 2018. Dry, austere nose, lightly acidic. Deep gold, hazy, flat. Very dry, a bit of tartness, light apple flavors. Crisp and dry.
Apples, cheese, vegetables on the nose. Light sour taste. Standard stuff, not bad.

Bottle (1000ml): Golden, clear, slightly sparkling; ripe apples, unripe apples, malic acid and some subdued cellary nose in the almost moderate sourish-sweetish nose; mild to moderate - as well - sourish-sweetish flavour, light bodied, not really dry, not really tart; slightly lingering fruity (apples, lemons)-sourish finish, subdued tartness and very delicate mouldy/cellary notes in the aftertaste. No reason to get excited, but still a well drinkable, tame Ebbelwoi...
Intensiv apfeliger Antrunk. Geringe Säure, mit der Zeit süßer werdend. Spritzig, zum Ende etwas trocken. Nett. 9/8/10/8//8
100cl bottle. Pours clear deep golden colour, no head. Aroma of medium sweet apples, dry mild tart apples. Taste of sweet apples, some riped medium tart apples, okay!
Ganz ok, wenn auch die Säure recht heftig reinhaut. Unreife bis reife Äpfel, ein bisschen an Zitrusfrüchten und etwas Kohl. Ganz ok, aber kein großer Apfelweinklassiker.

Sample from Erzengel - many thanks! The Apfelwein has got a clear golden colour with a smooth body. Aroma of sweet, red apples. Taste of ripe apples, ripe fruits, sweetness, red aroma apples, fields and light woods. Easy drinkable with a smooth finish. Enjoyed it.

Thanks to erzengel for sharing!! Pours a clear yellow gold without head. The smell is earthy, astringent apples. The taste is earthy, dull apple, some tartness on the end. Light in body with a tickle on the tongue.

Fruity nose of very ripe apples. A bit sugary. The cider has not much carbonation, starts fresh and fruity with a nice Speierling tartness. Nice tannins, fresh and sour apples. Fruity body with not much water there. Fruity ripe apples in the aftertaste, the Speierling with its sour- and tartness is fully there. Nice and round with hints of a fruity rest-sweetness.
Golden yellow. Aroma of apples and sulphur. Acidic. Appleflavour. Dry and acidic.
Bottled (RBESG2006). Golden/orange colour, no head. Aroma is sour apples and some mild vanilla. Flavour is sour apples with some slight sweetish hints in it. OK cider...

column1: Höhl Der alte Hochstädter Speyerling Apfelwein
column5: “Der alte Hochstädter Speyerling Apfelwein“, Flasche von REWE, Bürgstadt. - Tief goldgelb, klar. - In der Nase klare, natürlich saure Äpfel, leichte kellerige und schwach muffige Noten. - Im Geschmack reintönig säuerliche Klaräpfel, zart holzig- kellerig. Wenig rezent, schlank. - Ein wenig einspurig aber sehr sauber, gut herb und gradlinig. Angenehm.

column1: Höhl Der alte Hochstädter Speyerling Apfelwein
column5: 330 ml bottle from a night market in Frankfurt. Acidic nose, almost somewhat acetic, mineral, dry, a bit dusty. Pale golde, almost flat. Lightly tart, almost lactic, almost acetic, somewhat insipid, apples, acid, minerals. Oily, funky body, rather big barnyard all around. Interesting but not lovely. Scrumpy like, on the f7nky side.

column1: Höhl Der alte Hochstädter Speyerling Apfelwein
column5: Trocken säuerlicher Antrunk mit runden aber eher milden Apfelnoten. Süffiger, milder werdender Mittelteil. Im Nachhall wieder etwas stärker, deutlich trockener. 8/9/10/8/10/8

column1: Höhl Der alte Hochstädter Speyerling Apfelwein
column5: Bottle, 5.5%. Clear golden colour. Citric apple aroma. The flavour is nicely sour with a touch of vinegar. Also has a good apple flavour. Not sweet, and quite nice.

column1: Höhl Der alte Hochstädter Speyerling Apfelwein
column5: Bottle. Pours clear straw with very small and short-lived white head. Clear aroma of apples, with some hints of fermentation. Dry and sourish flavour of apples, albeit a weak one, with notes of metal and hints of spices. Low carbonation. Mild,mslightly vinous aftertaste. Refreshing but nothing special.

column1: Höhl Der alte Hochstädter Speyerling Apfelwein
column5: Thanks to erzengel for sharing!! Pours a clear medium yellow color. The smell is musty, earthy, apple skin. The taste is nicely tart apple, skin, ending dry and a touch musty. nice light carbonation and light body.

column1: Höhl Der alte Hochstädter Speyerling Apfelwein
column5: Fruity and a bit mouldy nose. The cider starts fresh and smooth, soft carbonation. Nice tart with a nice tannin body. Fresh and fruity. The astringent Speierling is present, fresh and fruity, smooth and easy to drink with still a bit of a light body. The aftertaste is dry, fruity, light and nice sourish-tart. Nice.

column1: Höhl Der alte Hochstädter Speyerling Apfelwein
column5: Ein feiner, aber bisweilen etwas dumpfer Apfelwein, der weniger spritzig, aber dafür umso kerniger daherkommt. Trinkbar, nicht süffig, aber mit Charakter. Würde ich auch ein zweites Mal antesten.

column1: Höhl Der alte Hochstädter Speyerling Apfelwein
column5: Pours out of the 1 l bottle in a clear golden colour with medium body. Nice aroma of apples and leaves. Taste of mild but ripe red apples combinedwith some sour greenv/ unripe ones and leaves. Light sugary finish. Very easy and nice to drink - enjoyed it a lot.

column1: Höhl Der alte Hochstädter Speyerling Apfelwein
column5: Bottle 1L, a clear yellow cider without carbonation. Nose is like a old wood kettle with vine fermenting in it ! What an horrible stuff, very dry, acid, less fruity, just water and acidity.

Ich habe es mir bei Lidl gekauft. 6er Pack 1,79 Euro plus 1,50 Euro Pfand, macht 3,29 Euro. Der Geruch ist eher einfach und dezent gehalten. Der Geschmack ist pilstypisch. Kein Highlight aber auch nicht schlecht. Mein Fazit Ein einfaches Pils zum Essen oder für zwischendurch. Trinken kann man es. Es gibt mit Sicherheit besseres Pils, allerdings nicht zu diesem Preis. Kann man durchaus mal Probieren. Soll sogar nach dem deutschen Reinheitsgebot gebraut sein. Zum Wohl. Volker.

500 ml can purchased in Germany. Aroma is of a fresh pilsener beer. No hops noted. Pour is light yellow with a thick white head. Almost zero carbonation. Flavor is well balanced with the hops, but not a lot of flavor to the beer. Refreshing lawn mower type of beer

Bottle @home (Euro-vision 2016 tasting.) Pours yellow, white head which dissipates very quickly. Nose is hay, grass and rotten vegetables. Taste is bland at first than a artificial bitterness kicks in.
# 518; 11/2016. Slabší, prázdnìjší a kyselejší prazdroj bez výraznìjší hoøkosti. Obilný, maltózový. Odvar. Dárek ze Švédska.
Can from supermarket somewhere in Uppsala. This is like they stopped somewhere on a half way towards desired beer. C'mon, why are you guys doing this to your beer.
Es ist ein ganz passables Bier... Für kleine Brauerei ganz ok! Eine 4.5 verdient ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

0.33l bottle from coop in bern, 1.85 fr. pours a hazy amber with a dense white head. aroma of hay, some sulphuric hops. flavour of hay, caramel, vegetables, bread. very much like a cheap lager, boring.
Bottle at home. Copper clear, minimal cream white head. Cellar, vegetable, some caramel, but very light and anonymous. Watery, brown sugar, cereal notes and light herbaceous finish.

(bottle) slightly hazy deep amber colour with a frothy light-beige head. aroma of raisins, earth and cherry stones, slightly peppery, with a hint of caramel and grass. flavour is mostly roasted malts, more earth and caramel, with some light popcorn, hazelnuts and a semi-dry finish. medium-bodied wit soft carbonation.
W aromacie lekki skunksik ale te¿ lekkie zio³owo - chmielowe nuty. W smaku niezbyt fajne, nuty piwniczne, zbutwia³e drewno i nieco karmelu, chlebowoœæ. S³abe.

Aroma: brad malts. Appearance: clear amber, medium white head. Taste: light sweet. Palate: bitters coming up quite quickly, short finish. Overall: unremarkable Amber beer, quite boring in aroma and palate. Bottle at Brasserie Federal, Zurich.
Bernsteinfarbig, weisser schaum, schnell verflüchtigt, kaum aroma, wässrig, fad ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Perfectly evening beer to drink with friends. But nothing really, really special.

Draught December 2012 as Oberlanderbier Amber. Clear amber with a big frothy white head. Bubbles and lace. Limestone, some malt, a little sugar aroma, bitter, malt, a little caramel taste. Light body, soft fizz, malt finish. Nice.

Wenig würziger Antrunk, schnell wird das Bier auch wässrig. Die vorhandenen Aromen sind modrig, darunter fallen auch die Getreidenoten, die eigentlich Frische vermitteln sollen. Wenig würzig, etwas hefig, einfach unspektakulär. Wässriger Nachgeschmack, etwas hefig und bitter. 11/4/5/4/7/4

3Nov2018 Dusty straw, grain and cereal malts, wet cardboard. Hazy gold, medium, frothy, white head. Light bitter. More cardboard, grain and cereal malts, medium carbonation, medium bodied. Not great. Bottle shared at Marco’s - cheers!

Das Zugpferd der mittelständischen Brauerei in Uster (ich habe es als "Usterbräu Original" getrunken) am Greifensee. Interessanterweise wird damit geworben, dass es kein Industriebier ist und sich deshalb positiv von diesen abhebt...das witzige daran ist, dass die Brauerei am hiesigen Industrielehrpfad liegt und die alte Brauanlage als Industriedenkmal geschützt ist. Vom Geschmack her sehr fein und schweiztypisch mit biologischen Zutaten gebraut und nicht pasteurisiert und gefiltert.

bottiglia 33 cl, bel cappello di schiuma fine bianca persistente, colore giallo torbido, al naso leggero malto e scorza di limone, in bocca uguale, carbonatazione moderata, corpo leggero, lieve acidula, leggero. 02.02.18
Pale golden color and nice white head. Light malty aroma.... Taste well balanced, noticeable hops... overall a nice helles

Liechts süffigs Bier! Für mi no völlig unbekannt gsie, aber bin definitiv begeistert. Note:5 passt sehr guet für en gsellige obig!! ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone Earlier Rating: 12/2/2017 Total Score: 3.7 Gutes Bier für Apero! Es glustet nur eis zha 4.75 hät i geh! Alles in allem es guets Naturtrüebs Bier! ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Getreidiger Antrunk. Mild hefig und hellmalzig, feine Karbonisierung. Wässrig herb, ab dem Mittelteil pappige Beinoten. Geringe Bitterkeit, mittellanger Nachhall. 9/8/9/8/8/9/8 Earlier Rating: 6/3/2011 Total Score: 2.5 Süffig getreidig-würziger Antrunk mit unterschwelliger Bitterkeit, die ihren Status lange Zeit behält. Der zu milde Hopfen ist währendessen führend, was zeigt, wie mild das Bier im Gesamten ist. Das Bier bleibt oberflächlich, entsprechend schnell ist der Nachgeschmack – und das Bier aus meinem Gedächnis – verschwunden. 10/8/9/7/7/7
Das Usterbräu ist wirklich nicht mein Geschmack. Riecht nach vergärtem Hopfen. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
By taste/palate, this is very close to the classic lager. While very light on the tongue, it has a distinct bitter finish. Texture is thin and makes it a very easy beer to drink.

Appearance: Pale yellow golden, clear. Fizzy. Slight white head. Aroma: Slight hops, slight malt. Grass. Taste: Light hops, light malt. Slight grains. Very refreshing. Didn’t expect to like it so much. Bought: Drinks of the World (Online), 330 ml, CHF 3.50 Info: 1/7-2017, BB: 6/7-2017 Earlier Rating: 4/10/2010 Total Score: 3.5 Appearance: Golden yellow. Slightly hazy. Some white head. Aroma: Hops and fruit. Nectar? Taste: Fruit and hops. Nicely balanced. Quite sweet. Info: 500ml bottle, 9/4-2010

0.33l bottle from coop in bern, 1.85 fr (03.09.2017). also from kalea adventskalender (23.02.2018). pours a hazy pale golden with a frothy white head. aroma of chewed pencil, jasmine tea, spicy malts. flavour of almonds, biscuit, mint. mild, but interesting. Earlier Rating: 12/18/2016 Total Score: 3 0.33l bottle from coop in zurich, 2.10 fr. pours a hazy pale golden with a medium white head. aroma of grass, hay, yeast, dough, wet grains, grape skins. flavour of grass and crackers/hardtack. this is actually a zwickl, but whatever.

hazy golden colour, moderate sized yellowish off-white head; aroma of coriander, some clove, slight banana and lemony-lemongrass notes; taste of breadcrust, caramel, biscuity and banana notes, some clove and slight lemony sourness; not bad

bottiglia 33 cl, schiuma bianca fine media persistenza, colore giallo/arancio torbido, al naso intenso banana e cereali, in bocca ancora banana ma predomina i chiodi di garofano e le spezie, carbonazione moderata, corpo rotondo, lieve acidula, amaro leggero. Una birra dall’aroma e dal gusto intenso. Molto buona 01.03.19
Dark amber colored with little yellow head. Well, not as its best since mostly glue here with some berries, slight hops too. Flavor is same with biting berries and hops, glue dominates so gone bad.

This beer has appareantly replaced the dark wheat in the menu if my favourite brewery restaurant. However, it doesn’t pull the longest straw here. It has a weak smell, but quite good flowers in it. It looks like a lager (according to a friend it is a lager, but I’m not completely convinced). It is far too bitter for my taste.
Pours an orange golden color with a small lacy head. Notes of banana, brown sugar, milk chocolate, and orange citrus. Semi sweet mouthfeel and medium length finish.

Cloudy golden with a white head. Nice spicy citurus aroma. The flavor is nice, not nearly as funky as some but very flavorful and well put together. Very quaffable. I really wish I had not forgotten my growler.

On tap at Dominion. Pours slightly cloudy golden with a white head. Nice fruity, estery nose with spiciness and banana. Flavor has notes of sweet pale malt, noble hops, banana and herbal fruityness. Some peppery, spicy hops show up in the finish. Has that proper, effervescent/spritzy carbonation and a medium body. Overall, enjoyable and well-made.
Draught. Medium white head, very hazy, and yellow appearance. Aroma is yeasty, with some fruit aroma. Flavor is quite multidimensional, fruit and alcohol, with candy sugar and some hops.

(draft) Pillowy white head, havy lemon yellow body. Aroma is medium sweet, lemon, floral, some duskiness. Taste is medium sweet, lemon, some orange, yeasty, earthy. Dusky dry finish with light alcohol. Medium body, light sticky, acidity.

Growler... Hazy, golden ale with a mid-sized, creamy, white head. Good retention. The nose is fruity and spicy with esters of pear, apple, peach and must along with clove phenols. The fruity flavor is tangy and citric; sweet and spicy. Medium-bodied with a milky mouthfeel and modest carbonation. Sweet, then moderately tart finish. Thanks to growler for sharing his... umm... growler!

Looks like I’m the first. I had this at the brewpub today (Oct 3, 2006) -- waiter said it was just available starting today. Nice golden color, very cloudy, dense but short-lived head. Very complex, lots of different flavors -- fruit and citrus, maybe a hint of corriander. Wonderful stuff.
clear and bright golden colour, big creamy head; light aromatic hoppiness and some corny notes; tasteless and light-bodied; no bitterness; short watery finish - very close to water

Draft... Mostly clear, yellow lager with a small, fizzy, white head. The nose is very grainy and herbal with lots of spent mash and German(?) hops. Malty, grainy flavor with a spicy hop kick. Medium-bodied and creamy with lively carbonation. Crisp, grainy finish.

Cask Conditioned at Charlie’s Pub, Copenhagen Hazy dark amber color. Quite nice aroma; the flavor is better, malty, fruity (apples), caramel, a bit woody. The final is well bitter, with a lot of caramel and light fruitness. A fruity Bitter.
Cask conditioned at Charlies. Dark amber coloured. Fruity and hoppy aroma. Sweetish fruity flavour with a very bitter finish. Nice.

[Cask at Charlie’s Bar, Copenhagen] A hazy dark orange beer with a bubbly orange head. The aroma is sweet with light notes of hops and fruit. The flavor is very fruity and rather hoppy, as well as lightly grassy, leading to a dry and very bitter end, where the hops makes them self known with flowery notes. But the body is a bit thin.

Pint/Draft: Pours a light caramel color, pellucid with some nice head and lacing. The nose is light, some faint hops and malt shine through, but it’s clean. The flavor is balanced, almost pilsnerish with a nice body and some light doughy malts. Strong carbonation that’s typical with all Tablerock beers. Decent clean neutral finish. Pretty middle of the road with a bit of maltiness, no potato tast of course.

Reviewed from notes. This was on tap at the brewpub. This was poured into a pint glass. The appearance was a light golden yellow color with a quarter finger of white foamy head that dissipated within less than thirty seconds. There was barely any lacing. The smell had some light sweet bread. The taste sweet and lightly bready with a light aftertaste and watery finish. On the palate, this one sat pretty light. Overall, not a bad beer, just nothing over the top.

On tap at the brewpub. Pour of clear deep golden. Coarse carbonation clings to the walls. Light aroma of sweet pizza sauce sugars. This beer has carbonation! Hooray! A first for this brewery. Flavor is quite palatable. There’s a sweet clean sugar of grain edges and thick wheat. It’s smoothes out with some brandied pear hops in the end. A touch thin, but right on for the style. Some diacetyls on the smack bring it down. Otherwise, certainly the best offering by this brewery.
On tap at the brewpub. Black pour with a tan head. Aroma and taste of dark roasted malt, chocolate and coffee.

Draught at the Tahquamenon Falls Brewery, Tahquamenon Falls, MI. Hazy dark reddish brown color with a tiny tan head. Sweet roasted malt, licorice and mild bitterness in the aroma. Roasted malt, ash, mild sourness and dryness in the flavor. No carbonation. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a dark brown with a thin white head. Aroma is roast, coffee, and chocolate. Flavor is sweet chocolate and roast. Has a soft, light body. Solid stout, or maybe it is only solid because what I had to compare it with at the brewery was unremarkable beer.
Draft. Brown pour fruity aroma just a very pedestrian if sub par dry stout. Not great.

Comparatively speaking, this could be their best one. Here’s why. At the brewpub, this was poured into a pint glass. The appearance was a dark brown to black color with a quarter finger white to off white foamy head that dissipated within about a minute. The lacing was there but didn’t show much of anything to stick as it slid for the most part. The smell had a fairly decent dried and roasted coffee bean to light chocolate. The taste was mainly the same thing with a really dry aftertaste and finish. On the palate, this one sat about a medium on the body. The carbonation was really subdued as it let the beer have a decent drying effect to cover my mouth and tongue. Overall, this was a nice interpretation of an Irish dry stout.

Draft at state park location. Deep black, medium body, light head. Enjoyable stout, not too complex, worked well on a warm day to enjoy with some good food. Alcohol seemed moderate, easy to drink... I enjoyed this.

tap at the brewpub - It’s been nearly three years since the last rating for this beer. Maybe it’s improved? We’ll see. It pours very dark brown with a creamy, lasting, light tan head. It has a decent roasted malt aroma and the flavor of roast mocha. It’s light and a bit watery with fine carbonation and a light, roasty finish. It’s alright but could use more intense flavor and more body.

On tap at the brewery. Poured black with a bubbly light brown head. Aroma was full of coffee notes and a bit of chocolate. Taste much more like a stout than a dry stout with coffee notes. A really acidic after taste really put me off.

On tap...First thing that I notice is the complete lack of carbonation. Very watery and boring taste for a stout. Not enough roast or dark malt flavor here. Simply put, this is the lamest stout I’ve ever had.
On tap at the brewpub. I found this beer to be quite drinkable. I also find water to be quite drinkable. Very thin and watered down.
Bottle - dark golden color, white head. low carbonation. malty, very rich in taste. good body. floral hops. very nice. it was worth the detour.
0,5 l Flasche aus einem lokalen Getränkemarkt. Orangebraun, klar mit cremigem Schaum und leichtem Lacing. In der Nase malzig, im Geschmack Karamell, Brot, malzig-süß
50cl bottle. Pours clear deep golden colour with a mid-sized most good lasting white head. Aroma of toasted malt, spicy hops, grains. Taste of bitter hops, toasted malt, grains, some sweet malt.

0.5l bottle. Dark golden to amber color, white head. Aroma of malt, pale malt, grain, herbal hop notes, some metallic notes. Taste starts sweet, medium carbonation, medium bitterness. Malt notes dominate, some caramel and hop notes. Very refreshing, though!

Bottle. Head is initially average sized, frothy, white, mostly diminishing. Body is medium yellow. Aroma is lightly to moderately malty (toasted grain), lightly hoppy (flowers, herbs). Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly bitter. Finish is lightly to moderately sweet, lightly to moderately bitter. Medium body, watery/syrupy texture, lively carbonation. Very plain, but clean. Just the basics in the nose, and a somewhat sweet (and even slightly syrupy) mouth experience. No complaints, really, just really ordinary and forgettable.

Bottle 500ml. @ home on the terrace. Clear medium to light amber yellow colour with a large, frothy, good lacing, mostly to fully lasting, off-white to white head. Aroma is moderate malty, grain, malt malt. Flavour is moderate sweet and bitter with a average to long duration, grainy, hay, malt, warm sweetness - maybe honey sweet, dry, initial light metalic bitter. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20120528]
Bottle. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are grass, malt, straw and hops.

It’s dark golden with a creamy, white head. The aroma is mild and malty with light notes of fruit and flower. The flavour is moderately sweet with notes of malt, caramel, dark syrup and light citrus. The finish is dry.

(bottle) Clear, golden colour with a thick and slowly lacing foamy white head. Light-sweet malty aroma with honey and a touch of hay and herbal hops. Light-sweet flavour, medium to light bodied with a lively carbonated mouthfeel. Malt-accented, honey-ish fruity taste; moderately dry, light-bitter, slightly herbal finish. Not overwhelming but pleasant to drink.

Bottle: Clear, deep golden coloured, thick and creamy white head; honeyish, sweet-malty nose with a delicate hoppy bitterness, mild to moderate sweet-bitter flavour, light to medium-bodied; mild but spicy bitter-sweet finish. Mediocre by franconian , but great by international standards.............
50cl bottle. A clear golden beer with a mid-sized good lasting white head. Aroma of dry grainy malt, grains, cereals. Taste of dry grainy malt, straw, cereals, mild bitterness.

500ml bottle from Beers of Europe; BB 24th Jun 18. Poured into an old vase shaped 0.2 litre glass from Watzdorfer Brauerei (three times). Very pale golden body, snow white head. Light malty nose with a perfumed, floral note or two. Semi-bitter taste, again with a malty feel like the aroma which give a subtle sweetness, the hops blending nicely to produce a balanced, easy drinking beer. Nothing is going to send your senses racing, but this is a decent beer all round.
5.3% bottle from Rehills, Newcastle. Golden coloured with a sweet toffee, malt and butterscotch flavour with a gentle grassy and sweet fruity finish.

(500ml) .In a Jug pint. This is a fine lager but just look at the people who score this delicate Helles poorly , the same guys who rate 3000 beers a week from thimble sized pours . A flowery spicy hop accent , with expressive musty dry woody floral bitterness is nice and lively ..This being a Helles its a pretty bready beer in character ,and i fucken love that texture in lagers .. slightly toasted . hay,grain and honey covered prunes pop out . A dry finish . I like this kinda beer , subtle, but awesome .
50 cl bottle. Pale copper colour with average head. Malt taste . Another export
Crisp clean flavor. Nice clear color. Seemingly true to the style worth a subtle sweetness.

Bottle marked 08.10.12. Cheap sweet malty nose. Dull, pale golden with a quickly-gone head. Crisp light body with floral and perfumed hops. Barely dries out but the bitterness does evtl make an appearance.

Clear pale yellow, fizzy. Big white head and a little bit of lacing. A pissy, lemony aroma with some hints of malt and yeast. Malty flavor with a slight bitterness. Sweet and a little dry. Not bad. Not bad.

It’s golden with a creamy, white head. The aroma has notes of malt, bread, light flower and hints of cellulose. The flavour has a light sweetness and notes of malt, straw, grain, light flower, and the finish is dry.

Bottle 50cl. @ home. Clear medium yellow orange color with a large, frothy, good lacing, fully lasting, off-white to white head. Aroma is moderate malty, grain, hay, toasted, sweet malt notes, light to moderate hoppy, grass. Flavor is moderate sweet and bitter with a average to long duration. Body is medium, texture is watery to oily, carbonation is soft. [20090726]
Backlog rating. Hazy golden brown, offwhite creamy head. Light metallic, papery aroma. Ok roast & sugar. Medium body. Light sugar aftertaste.
From the notes: pale lager with coloring. Nothing special. Did not enjoy it so much to buy again.
Can. Pours dark red in color with a small head. A bit of nuttyness in aroma, some sweeter notes as in toffee too. Flavor similar, a bit nutty and sweet. Quite soft.
Can 0.5l from local market. Colour is brown with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Grain, caramel and malts.

Can from super market. Brown color, beige head. Sweet malty taste with bread, a hint of caramel, toast and nuts. Very thin body. Overly sweet finish some bitterness. Not one of my favorites, but not too bad either.
Can. Pours a brown color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty caramel aroma. Fruity malty grainy caramel flavor. Has a fruity malty caramel finish.
Color is dark amber, reddish. Aroma is sweet. Malts and burned suger. Some hops. Flavor is sweet burned malts, burned sugar and malts. Caramel. Sweet palate and taste.

500 ml can. Pours a copper amber colour with an off-white head. Aroma of light caramel, malts and some hay. Flavour of caramel, malts, hay, nuts and weak old hops. Light bodied, slick mouthfeel and a light malty finish with some sweetness. Could pair nicely with meat, but still a boring beer.
Can. Dark red colour with off-white head. Weak malt aroma. Moderately sweet and bitter taste.

Dark amber body, white head. Aroma of cardboard box, grassy hops. Flavour is same plus grainy malt. Bulk. Earlier Rating: 1/16/2012 Total Score: 2 Dark brown body. Some sugar, malt and flat aroma of wort. No hops, just Quite bad. Bready aftertaste.

On tap at Ram in downtown Indianapolis (served ice cold in a frozen glass :( ). Poured a clear medium golden with a short layer of white head.. some lacing. Spicy yeast focus in the nose when it finally warmed up... white pepper provided a kick and some light fruits attempted to push through as well (apple and pear)... too much spice focus, though. Coriander, cloves, and bananas make the first impression on the tastebuds... lots of spicy yeast... sweet lighter fruits, white pepper, and alcohol drive through the finish (more spices, too). This never really established an identity on the palate... heavy spicage on the front and back with an almost empty middle.
bottle from brewery. Pale golden with small head. Light body with some mild grain/cereal. Very light hops. Like the amber, this has no flaws other than just being bland.
On tap at Walldorff brewpub. Hazy amber with a very thin head. Aroma is faint and pale with a bit of malt and honey. Taste is mild and pale as well with some honey and corn plus a dry finish.
Snoozefest here. A totally useless beer, slight buttery character, otherwise limp and tasteless.

Served on draft at the brewpub. Pours a clear yellow color with a large creamy white head. Good head retention and lacing. Aroma of honey and citrus. The taste is bread, caramel, citrus and a leafy hop finish. Medium bodied.

Draft sample. Poured clear amber with an average frothy white head that mostly lasted with good lacing. Moderate sweet malt aroma. Light to medium body with a smooth texture and soft carbonation. Medium sweet malt flavor with a medium sweet finish of short to moderate duration. Soft session beer.
Pretty weak beer. Almost like a macro light beer. Drinkable, but I expect more from a brew pub.

On tap at Walldorff. Hazy straw-yellow body, thick off-white head. Light herbal hops nose. Herbal body with corn and other off-flavors, light metallic cereals. This beer wasn’t brewed for me, but that doesn’t mean I don’t like it.
had this opening night in four pack sampler. not a bad blonde but not a memorable one eaither. golden color and a wheat taste peeking through the cream flavor.
a sub-par red with little to speak of flavor wise. aroma turns one off, color warns, then flavor disappoints.

rotten apricot hue with no head..aroma of sulfur, farts, and rotten hops...flavor is lightly floral with a massive infected bacteria backbone..disasterous palate...im rating this only because they offer on tap and shouldnt if it is infected
my favorite walldorff beer. grapefruit colored body and great malt flavor with an excellent hop balance to compliment it.

my favorite at the Walldorff..light amber body with samll head...citrus fruit with light floral/piney hops in the nose...flavor is a nice malt--hop complex...caramel, earthy grains with floral hops..bitter finish

On tap at Walldorff. Hazy yellow-brown body, medium buff head. Peppery, spicy hops aroma with slight tartness. Bready, caramely body with abundant medicinal hops. Slight tartness. The bitter hops overwhelm the malts after a few sips.
A good oatmeal stout.....smooth.....on tap.....great place.....good food and good people

On tap at Walldorff brewpub. Dark brown to black with a creamy beige topper that hangs around to protect its contents long into the sampler. Aroma of dark roasted malts, roasted barley and light chocolate. Taste is chalky with chocolate, dark roasted malts and some bitterness on the finish.
I believe it was on nitro. Smooth, creay, chocolate, roasted malt, coffee, and a touch of hop bitterness.

On tap: The aroma consists of roast, chocolate, and light smoke. It’s a dark brown with a large creamy khaki head with excellent retention and decent lacing. The flavor starts with chocolate and light vanilla. The finish is lightly roasty with just a hint of smoke. Medium bodied with moderate carbonation.

A nitro pour at the brewpub. Disclaimer: In my opinion, nitro has a shitty mouthfeel to it, so this wasn’t the greatest stout experience for me. Plus, I thought the beer tasted a little watery and bland. I enjoyed the coffee brown better.

Served on nitro at the brewpub. Pours a dark color appearing black in the glass. Everlasting tan head. Aroma of chocolate, nutty notes and a roasty finish. The taste is chocolate and roasted malts. Medium bodied. Pretty simple, but good.

Draft sample. Poured black color with an average fizzy brown head that mostly lasted with good lacing. Aroma was toasted dark chocolate malt. Medium to full body with a creamy smooth texture and flat carbonation. Flavor was medium to heavy toasted sweet with a medium to heavy chocolate sweet finish of moderate to long duration. Solid drinkable brew.
a pretty average stout with nice dark color and pleasant aroma. easy to drink, goes great with their food selection.
nitro body with roasted malt nose..nice toasted/roasted malt flavor with bitter, dark chocolate..average palate

On nitro tap at Walldorff. Deep brown-black body, thick creamy tan head. Light soapy, roasted malt aroma. Round roasted malt body with some creaminess, chocolate. Slightly astringent and woody. Bitter finish. For the Guinness fans, dry stouts tend to be pretty dull.

Warning! My bottle was a sample from the second trial brew. If the commercialized product proves different, I’ll try a new rating. Fully hazy brown with red-amber highlights; small yellowish, very fine head as whipped cream, leaving rings of lace. First impression is leafy/earthy, then an overwhelming onslaught of chocolate, dark chocolate powder and cacao booms. Quite bitter taste, chocolate, but also quite some hops. Malty, nowhere sweet, until after some serious warming up. Dry beer, a bit fizzy. In the aftertaste, warming up, some mild melassy sweetness. The chocolate reigns in the aroma, but is very meek in the flavour. Whatever, nice beer.

Poured a clear lighter amber with a well-retained cap of off-white head. Nose was of sweet hone and caramel malts... kind of airy... with citrus, pine, and some English floral bitterness behind it. Sweet and creamy caramel and English toffee malts upfront with bitter pine and citrus bitterness around the tongue and through the finish. Light-bodied with well-placed bitterness.

On tap at Jasper Brewing, pours a clear golden with a nitro beige head. Nose and flavour reveal light English hops, crackery malt, and nitro notes (metallic notes). Not too bad for what is really an ESB, but pretty banale. Meh.

Pours a clear golden yellow with a thick frothy head as it was in Nitro at the brewery. Aroma of toast, cereal and fruity hop esters. Taste is biscuit, cereal and toasty malts with a nice crisp hop flavor. Well balanced and easy to drink... Crisp and clean.
Aroma is nutty with some cereal grains and pleasant hops. Taste is light malty sweetness with a bit of nuts and a mild hoppy bitter finish. Light bodied with mild carbonation.
Draft to pint glass Aroma of perfume, orange, and wheat. Hazy amber with an long lasting creamy head. Taste is as expected, creamy and bitter.
On tap at Jasper Brew Pub. Quite a bad bitter... It was really hard to finish... Never again...
Clear pour with creamy head from nitrogen. Taste is a creamy, with a nice hop presence.

Pint on tap at the brewery pours a slightly cloudy pale golden color with a 2 finger white creamy head that retains well and leaves some soapy lacing on the glass. Aroma is nutty with some cereal grains and pleasant hops. Taste is light malty sweetness with a bit of nuts and a mild hoppy bitter finish. Light bodied with mild carbonation. A nicely done bitter that is certainly better than a Boddington’s.
Nitro. Pint on 6/13/11 at the Jasper Alberta brewpub for around $7.00 CAD Very good.
Had a taster of 6 at the Jasper Brewing Co. Not much taste so not a good score.

On tap at Jasper Brewing Company. Poured a clear, very pale golden with just a ring of white head. There really wasn’t much going on in the nose... some vegetal notes, light pale malts, and honey showed up with coaxing. Pale malts and veggies again in the flavor.. and they left their impression on the finish. Light-bodied with a mild bitterness... left tacky, sweet vegetal notes at the finish. Not so good.

On tap at Jasper Brewing Company. This was significantly better than the Union Blonde Ale. Poured a hazy pale golden with a short cap of whitish head. Nose took a while to develop, but was nice... ginger, citrus, light smoke, and a bit of mango rest on top of sweet pale malt and vegetal notes. Lightly-smoked pale and other sweet malts form the flavor base with ginger, mango, and citrus surrounding. Light-bodied and somewhat grainy on the palate... herbal and light spicy bitterness hit the right places. Good stuff.
Growler, brought back from the brewery by Parksy and shared with the brewery crew. Pale crackery malt and light florals, appropriate bitterness. Not bad.
Nice aroma of citrus sweetness with some malt. Nice foam and vaguely foggy body. Smooth lemon and malt flavour with vague nut hints. Quite nice, drinkable by the gallon.

Pours a light hazy golden yellow with a frothy white head that leaves good lacing. Aroma of pil malts, yeast and some floral hops. Taste is sweet pil malts, floral hops, some spicy nobel hops and pilsner yeast. Crisp finish that’s a bit too sweet but overall a nice drinking German pilsner.
On draft at the Jasper Brewing Company, Jasper. Sweet aroma, some grass, citrus. Taste had grain, pils. Watery finish. Thirst quencher, refreshing beer, but nothing special.
Slightly cloudy yellow body with a light white head. Slight aroma of grains and grass. Taste matches aroma. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Jasper Brewing, pours a clear pale golden with a small white head. Aroma brings out lightly grassy hops and very subtle spicy hops. Flavour is very lightly grassy and hoppy, with a dry body. Refreshing and drinkable, yet nothing special. Decent pils.
Grainy dryish malt nose. Flavour of moderately crisp and grainy malt, light grassy hops. Body was light as was the mouthfeel. a pretty good pilsner.

Draft - Sweet perfumy grains. Gold with a rich white head. This is not like any pilsner I have ever had. So much perfumy grains, sweet with little bitterness and not as crisp or refreshing as I would like.
Quick review! Pale gold, limited cap. Muted aroma cereal and pennies. Taste is better, smooth easy drinking, crisp, clean. Corn, grass, metalic hops. Not one bad thing to say but very forgetable.
Poured a clear golden with a well-retained cap of creamy white head. Nose was of sweet pils and pale malts, and lemon...simple, soft, and pleasant. Very nice initial flavor.

On tap @ Earl’s, St Vital. Pours a very dark chestnut brown with a patchy off-white head. Aromas are chocolate-like, like a malteaser mixed with some berry. Tastes are nuts and some subtle raspberry. Medium body, moderate carbonation, medium gritty finish. ---Rated via Beer Buddy

16 oz draft poured at earls in west Ed. Pours dark brown to black with a minimal white head. Smells like chocolate and a touch of coffee. Taste is quite sweet. Chocolate and coffee flavors. I really enjoyed this beer. Was a bit surprised at how good it was.
Tap, Earl’s St. Vital, Winnipeg, MB. Deep brown. Chocolate and spicey hops aroma. Medium body. More chocolate and slight vegetable. Strange aftertaste.

On tap at Earl’s, rating this from memory as it’s been a while. This was surprisingly decent - light, but fruity and flavourful, with a decent balance and an interesting flavour. I would not call this a porter, but as a brown ale or even a mild, which would make more sense, it was pretty good. Some nice dark fruits and a balanced bitterness. Would try it again if I found myself at an Earls.

Medium body ale on tap at Earl’s, served as a seasonal beer. Had 12oz sleeve in a lager glass. Served cool, but not chilled. Nutty aroma with a malty taste. Finish is slightly astringent, but not overdone. Looked very dark brown with a slight haze to it.
Brown pour with a thin but dense white head. Aroma and taste are heavy on the malt with light sweetness. Not bad at all!

Pours a dark amber with a light brown head. Aroma of toffee, caramel and chocolate. Taste is chocolate and caramel sweetness. Not sure either this is all malts or artificial but it tastes malty and pleasant. Either way decent beer for their house draft.

Draft sample. Redish brown in colour with medium carbonation. Aromas are a blend of floral and toasted nut elements. Flavors are of milk chocolate, flowers, nuts, and a bit of chalk. Light bodied, but has an odd residual sweetness on the back end. A strange beast.

A dark rediish amber ale with a thin light mocha head. In aroma, roasted malt with weird mineral notes, sweet chalk. In mouth, sweet malt with weird funky esters, oxidized, so-so. On tap at Winnipeg location, Nov. 2 2012.

(First Taste, Earls South Edmonton Common, Draught Pint, Unknown ABV, Cellar Temp, 24/03/12 #22.) Appearance (3/5): Dark cola color in the glass, with a small, quickly diminishing, off white head with good lacing. Aroma (4/5): Dominant burnt grains and lemon, with notes of orange, cardboard, and perfume. Taste (4/10): Moderately sour and lightly bitter, with a short, bitter finish. Tastes very watered down. Palate (1/5): Medium/light body, lively carbonation, extremely watery texture. Honestly feels like carbonated water. Overall (7/20): Honestly I was surprised at how bad this was. Tasted extremely watered down and was very flavorless. Looking at the other reviews, I can’t help but wonder if I got a bad batch or something. If you think that is the case, drop me a line. Drinkability: 4/5. Character: 2/5. Buy Again: Definitely No.

On draft when visiting the brewery before Noogfest High Five. Clear, slightly darker yellowish hue than the welterweight. Defintely more bitter, and fruity. Certainly has that piney weird ’gin’ flavor. I can’t stand gin, so I really didn’t care for this too much

Brewpub sample. Poured cloudy gold with a lacing white head. Aroma is sweet, floral, and pine. Taste is a little hoppy, with plenty of pine and floral notes, as with the aroma. Another unique brew from Moccasin. Body is middle of the road, with average carbonation. Finish is sweet and a little bitter.

Draft sample at brewery. Slight hazed golden with a white head that settled to a ring and left light lace. Floral aroma with light pine. The flavor found more floral and pine with a light backing of citrus and malt. Light to medium body and light bitterness.
on tap-pours a rich white head and hazy pale yellow color. Aroma is floral/spice hops, secondary light malt. Taste is floral/spice hops-some bite, secondary sweet light malt. Easy.
Pale golden yellow with a substantial white head. Aroma is light veggies, juniper, pine, sweet malts. Taste is more balanced juniper on top of the light malt fruitiness. I like this.

Source:22 oz bottle for my birthday from my brother. Glass:Shaker. Appearance:Hazy yellow pour with a thin white head. Aroma:Slightly vegetal, with some juniper and a hint of citrus. Flavor:Malty, with citrus and juniper in the finish. Palate:Medium body with solid carbonation. Overall:Not very good, but worth the tick.

Bomber split with NachlamSie. Pours yellow with whitish head. The aroma is steamed carrots, juniper, some pretty unpleasant veggies, orange peel, and some cucumber. The flavor is better, with notes of light malt, some fruity hops, and noticeable juniper. There is some organic plantiness to the finish. Questionable beer.

Bomber shared by Tronraner. Pours a light gold, just barely hazy. Smells bad. Smells like boiled carrots, eggs, hay, vegetation, and there is finally a dry juniper note. I’m really dreading the flavor, but I find it to be forgiving. It is vegetal and spiced, but reasonable. Hints of yams, mild bitterness, accessible esters, and a finish of weak gin. This is fair, though smells awful. [January 16, 2010] On tap at the brewery. man, this is so much better this time around. The glass I had today is nothing at all like the bottle we drank awhile back. This doesn’t even look the same. It is very light yellow with a small white head. This is probably the lightest in color pale ale I’ve ever seen. The brewer informed me that during different seasons he uses different malts. This batch apparently has Pilsen malt. The palate is quite light with just a crisp malty flavor which really lets the hop and juniper flavor out. Overall, this is a clean drinking ale with adequate citrusy hops. For such a light bodied ale, I really liked the flavor on this one. I adjusted my score from 2.6 to 3.2.

Tap at the brewery. My favorite from these guys. The body was deep gold to amber. The aroma was berries with some grapefruit. The taste was bitter grapefruit with a little bit of blueberry. A sweet finish.
Pours with a heavy haze. Bubblegum esters are evident in the aroma. Very much like a hefeweizen, but several of the brewery’s beers were showing some noticeable yeasty esters.

column1: Moccasin Bend Pumpkin Seed Pale Ale
column5: Pours clearish copper with white head, lots of lace. Aroma of spice, roast pumpkin seeds, citrus hops. Taste is pretty interesting, with the pumpkin seeds strangely complimenting the citrus hop flavors. Spice is relatively subdued, with light sweet backbone. Finish is nutty and bitter. Overall, an interesting take on APA. A beer I would try again.

column1: Moccasin Bend Pumpkin Seed Pale Ale
column5: From a batch with homegrown hops. Hazy brown-orange, whitish head. Aroma is caramel, light toasted pumpkin seeds, citrusy hops. Taste is again citrusy, spicy, light toast and caramel. I think I like these after they sit on the pumpkin seeds for a lot longer.

column1: Moccasin Bend Pumpkin Seed Pale Ale
column5: Source:22 oz bottle from Greenlife in Chattanooga. Glass:Shaker. Appearance:Clear amber pour with a thin white head. Aroma:Sweet malt and grass with a faint hint of pumpkin seeds. Flavor:Sweet malt with a mild bitter finish. Not bad, but not very exciting. Palate:Medium body with solid carbonation. Overall:Better than the Juniper Pale, but still just ok.

column1: Moccasin Bend Pumpkin Seed Pale Ale
column5: On tap at the brewery 5/31/08: Pours a transparent bronze with a stringy-lacing white head. Aroma of toasty grainy pumpkin seeds and lightly sweet malts. Body starts semi-sweet toasty and grainy with some earthy bitterness. A smooth, unique and enjoyable brew.

column1: Moccasin Bend Pumpkin Seed Pale Ale
column5: 2008 Southern Brewers Fest . Cask. Amber pour. Creamy light tan head. Bitter, nutty aroma. Smells like "green", untoasted malt. Flavor of bitter hops, bold malt. Slight notes of spearmint in the distance. (Having to search for tasting notes for this beer). Kinda forgettable. Finishes with a deep tannin bitterness, too much for an American Pale Ale.

column1: Moccasin Bend Pumpkin Seed Pale Ale
column5: Tap at the brewery. Apparently the end of a batch. The body was dark amber. The pumpkin seed dominated the aroma was some roast and nuttiness. The taste was pumpkin seeds with some light grapefruit. An interesting brew, especially surprising is now little pumpkin seed it takes to add that character.

column1: Moccasin Bend Pumpkin Seed Pale Ale
column5: Pours an orange copper color with a white head. Aroma is caramel, nutty, toasty, roast, and some floral notes. Flavor is malty, caramel, nutty, toasty, roast, and a nice floral finish.

column1: Moccasin Bend Pumpkin Seed Pale Ale
column5: on tap. Pours a cloudy copper with a nice white head. The aroma is quite strong with definite nutmeg, subtle pumpkin, some citrusy/lemony hops. The mouth is slightly sticky with a nice clean caramel backbone. The nutmeg comes out in the finish and light lemony hops ring throughout the drink. This is surprisingly good for the style. It cuts the difference between being overly spiced or bland. And thanks to the hoppy character, this still tastes like real beer.

column1: Moccasin Bend Pumpkin Seed Pale Ale
column5: Date: 11/04/2006 Mode: Firkin Source: Brewery opaque orange, thin fine beige head, lots of nice lace, lightly sweet malt aroma, rich body, dry malt flavor, lots of nice hop flavor, nice long bitterness, -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Date: 11/04/2006 Mode: draft the keg version has a sweeter malt flavor, nice nutty character, slight hint of astrengent bitterness Aroma: 5/10; Appearance: 7/10; Flavor: 6/10; Palate: 7/10; Overall: 12/20 Rating: 3.1/5.0 Drinkability: 7/10 Score: **/4

column1: Moccasin Bend Pumpkin Seed Pale Ale
column5: Cask. Very hazy dark amber color with a thin off-white head. Some grapefruit hop aroma mixed with malt and mild pumpkin in the aroma. the flavor had a light maltiness with citrus grapefruit flavors that went to the finish. Light bitterness and semi-dry finish.

column1: Bethlehem Brew Works Minglers English Ale
column5: On tap at the BBW Brew Pub. On Nitro. Poured a medium orange/amber color with a smaller sized off white head. Aromas of caramel with light hops. Tastes of pretty much the same with the hops a little more pronounced in the tastes. The Nitro seemed to have killed the majority of the flavors. Smooth but thin body.

column1: Bethlehem Brew Works Minglers English Ale
column5: On tap at the brewpub. Pours a translucent golden amber with a creamy off white sustaining and lacing head (thanks to the Nitro pour). Aroma of caramel, light hop presence, slightly metallic. Flavor of caramel, toffee, light hop, biscuit, cereal and grains. A bit watery.

column1: Dark Star Greenwich Ivebin Piloct Ale
column5: Tasted at the Evening Star, Brighton, East Sussex. A mix of Dark Star’s Hophead and Sunburst, it’s even a brighter brew than the parents. Appearance: pale golden in colour, the clarity is as great as a true believer’s conscience; a monk’s rimmed beer head sits on top of a pool of still nectar. Smell: sweet, ripe white-grapefruits and plenty of flowery & lychee-fruity American-hoppyness... Not terribly complex, but really like Hophead with added fruity edges and sugary malts. Taste: an initially bitter-sweet edge of grapefruit zest gradually gives way to an intensifying bitter and dryish edge of raw, flaky hops... the considerable bitterness expands on the palate knowing no limits, almost like the aftertaste and after-mouthfeel of Chinese dried-herbal medicine soup--no offence though, instead the vertical yet clean bitter palate is one of the most lively and impressive I’ve encountered in the world of Bitter; simultaneously lots of hops lend an overwhelming aroma lingering in the mouth... Utterly enjoyable from the first second of tasting to the very last. Palate: extremely light-bodied, very much like Hophead in a sense, and lively textured with a healthy dose of fine fizziness on the palate... I can’t believe a mix could be this good and tasty, even better than its parent-brews in terms depth as well as freshness... Absolutely a brilliant beer in its own right.

Cask handpump at The Maypole, Cambridge. Dark gold in colour with a short head. Nosy of honey and sugar with some citrus in there. Very well balanced with a dry end but consequently not hugely bitter. Honey and citrus in the mouth. Nice but not what I was expecting from a bitter.
Cask Stillage at the Memorial Hall, Northwich 22/09/2001 Golden coloured and bitter on the palate with a dry hop finish.
Cask at Wellington Arms, Bedford. Mid to dark gold with a small head. Sweet, floral hoppy aroma and a sweet caramel malt taste. A good bitter finish.

Tasted at the Black Bull, a freehouse nr. Whitechapel, East London, dedicated to Nethergate’s beers. Presentation: pale amber hue, great clarity; a thin white head settles to a rimmed foam and low in carbonation. Smell: faintly sour-sweet peary fruits, a focused yet understated flowery scent of hops, accompanied by a very softly sweet nougat and caramel note of malts. Simple. Taste: very light grapefruity and slightly peary hops on top of floral flavour and mildly savoury maltiness; a more subtle nutty malt flavour at the back gradually turns dryish, tea-leafy, leaving a bitter-sweet and soothing finish. Palate: great carbonation, soft and light-bodied Best Bitter. Worth a try when one sees it, otherwise not so special to seek out.

column4: Old Capitol Brew Works and Public House
column5: Notes from Iowa City Brewfest 2006. Hazy golden with a small white head, low retention. Lemons and a bit of wheat make up the aroma. Flavor is the same with less lemons and a clean wheaty--and lightly biscuity--finish. Light to moderate carbonation, light body. Not too bad for such a bland style.

column4: Old Capitol Brew Works and Public House
column5: Draught at the brewpub. Hazy yellow color with thin bubbly white head. No lace. Light citrusy aroma with a hint of bread dough. Nice grainy flavor with a hint of yeast. Subdued grainy bitterness at the end. Pretty good.

column4: Old Capitol Brew Works and Public House
column5: The body poured with a cloudy medium gold color. The head was white colored and a little frothy. The aroma was fairly neutral with some lemons, flowers and soap. The taste had some soap with a hint of lemons. There was also a touch of banana peels with some bland bread. This is relatively clean and easy to drink.
gouden, clean witte kraag, ok co2, aroma van mout, gist, lichte banaan, biscuit, smaken evenzo, zacht, licht, maar erg smaakvolle weizen, prima te doen
Bottle from Duisburg. Hazy yellow with a medium head. Aroma of banana wheat. Flavour is grainy wheat, watered fruit, banana base.

Sampled from 0.5 l bottle from local 'trinkgut', best before May 2018. Hazy, amber with a medium large, frothy, almost stable, white head. Sweetish, rather yeasty-spicy and a bit fruity aroma of banana, cloves and some straw. Moderately sweet, quite yeasty-spicy and a bit fruity taste of banana, cloves, some wheat and a touch of straw, followed by a short, moderately bitter, rather yeasty-spicy and a bit watery finish. Medium body, smooth and quite effervescent mouthfeel, average carbonation. Not bad, quite drinkable, not that great either.
50 cl. bottle @ home, bought @ Trinkgut Emmerich. Hazy dark golden with a big white head. Very typical and decent weizen.

(Oscar Maxxum Weizen) Bottle 500ml at home, served into a big weizen glass, ABV 4.9% Pale orange coloured body, hazy, with a huge and thick white head on top, very good retention. Aroma of wheat, kind of dusty, with nice fruity notes though, ripe bananas. Taste also of wheat, more fresh now, lots of bananas, some bubblegum of course on the finish, ripe pears, forest berries. Medium body, good carbonation. Pretty good.
Bottle @ home shared with dad. Hazy pale yellow color, average sized white head. Smell and taste wheat, yeast, slightly floral, slightly sweet. Decent body and carbonation. Decent beer.

Bottled (backlog). Orangeish amber colour, big creamy head that leaves good lace. Aroma is citrus, spices, wheat, some caramel and mild yeast. Flavour is banana, sweet malts, wheat, herbs and some earthy notes. No aftertaste to speak about.
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein trübes orangegoldenes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch hefig, fruchtig, leicht würzig. Geschmack hefig, fruchtig, leicht bananig, etwas würzig.

Slightly orange, half-cloudy wheatbeer. A somewhat malty-flour like aroma, so quite unusual. It has a dry, somewhat bitter taste, and not much of an aftertaste. Not really special. Licht oranje, half troebel witbier. Licht tarwe / meel-achtig aroma, dus wel vrij apart. Droge, licht bittere smaak, en verder ook weinig nasmaak. Niet echt bijzonder.
Gelb-bräunliches HW mit guter Schaumbildung. Leicht weiziges Aroma mit Banane. Im Geschmack sehr mild geraten mit säuerlicher Grundnote. Insgesamt ein Durchschnittsbier ohne Wiedererkennungsfaktor.

Draught. Weak sweetish aroma, not too appleish, but a little citric. Clear shiny yellow colour, sparkling. The flavour is mostly citric with some apple peal notes to it. The flavour is more rounded than in cheap cider, but IMO it could use more apple flavour. Medium carbonation.

Bottle, 660 cl, bought in Italy. Into a lager glass. ABV 4.7% Pours bright golden yellow, with good activity in it. Tall white head, thin in texture, average retention. No lacing left on the glass. Aroma of hay, grass, with a tiny hint of fruit smell on the back. Taste is sweet and very malty. Again a hint of fruits on the aftertaste, apple to be more specific. Thin body, low carbonation. Overall a below the average lager, but I am drinking it in Greece now and it’s ideal for the high temperatures here.

Bottled. A light golden beer with a white head. The aroma is sweet malty with notes of caramel and light notes of brewing cereal. The flavor is sweet malty with light notes of citrus. The body is thin.
Canned. Pale golden in color. A maltyfaint note, the xcent that is. The flavor is watery and metallic There is a dry aftertaste in this one. Thanx to Dorqui for this one.
(Bottle 33 cl) Courtesy of yespr. Clear, pale golden with a white head. Very discreet aroma of nothing much. Medium body, dominated by cardboard and a light acidity. Dry finish. 040408
Clear golden with with tiny white head. Sweet fruity aroma with grainy notes. Sweet flavor with cardboard notes.
33 cL can. Pours clear yellow with a white head. Light cornish aroma. Flavour is light citric and cornish. Ends medium dry bitter. Bland yet not bad.
Can (BB 10/2007) Pale yellow color, small white head. Metallic, vegetably nose. Tasteless, watery, metallic, lightly sweet corn-malty flavor. Harmless and useless. No hops found.
Canned (thanks mabjork!). Yellow colour, not much head. Aroma is malts, some metal and cerals. Flavour is the same, but is very watery.
Bottle. Tasted side by side with the 3.5 and noticed no perceptible difference. Flavorless and boring/unenjoyable.

Can from the kiosk in the arrival hall, Malpensa airport, Milan. Very pale, lively carbonation. Almost tasteless, if you don’t really like beer, this may be the one for you. A hit of malt, but the stronges taste is of cardboard.

Can: Bought in San José Costa Rica. Radler or Alsterwasser is a mixture of half beer and have lemon soda (Sprite / 7 Up), this is already mixed in the can. The original is much more refreshing and tasty, this one is flat and too sweet.

Canned 0,50L. Frothy and adherent head, good resistance. Yellow clearly color, lightly hazy, light fizz. Top heavy and inconsistent lemon aroma, citruses candy and sugar. Little pungent, much soft and intangible taste. Bitter and alcohol practically absent. Too much sugary and sweetish.

column1: Royal Dutch Post Horn Green 8.5% Extra Strong
column5: Bier met veel alcohol, 8,5%, weinig schuim, beetje zoetig. Ze noemen dit ook wel alcoholistenbier. Geen duidelijke smaak helaas.

column1: Royal Dutch Post Horn Green 8.5% Extra Strong
column5: A: Clear gold with a small white head. N: Sweet T: Sweet malts again with good bitterness and a bit boozy. P: Medium O: Not great but not bad either. Drinks a lot easier than the ABV would suggest, so beware.

column1: Royal Dutch Post Horn Green 8.5% Extra Strong
column5: Hiermee hebben we denk ik wel onderhand de bodem van de onderkant van het supermarktschap bereikt. Alcoholistenbier wat zelfs een alcoholist niet lekker kan vinden. Het is gewoon een smakeloos biertje gemengd met een hoop alcohol wat in halve liter blikken wordt verkocht. Kunstmatig zoet, licht moutig, heeft een licht bittertje maar bovenal is het een doods bier met nauwelijks mondgevoel. Uiterlijk is nog zijn sterkste punt met zijn heldere gele kleur met kleine witte schuimkraag die vrij snel verdwenen is. Lichte zoete mout geur die eigenlijk al een waarschuwing is op wat er gaat komen. Proefglas

column1: Royal Dutch Post Horn Green 8.5% Extra Strong
column5: Can @ tasting shared by Inoven. Clear yellow golden color, medium sized white head. Smell and taste malts, a bit sweet. Hmm quite ok actually, not what the usual malt liquor brings: sweet malty alcoholic. This is quite ok. Doesn't taste like 8.5% ABV either.

column1: Royal Dutch Post Horn Green 8.5% Extra Strong
column5: Blik 50cl thuis. Krachtig, wat vlak, wat zoetig. (6-2011).-----------------.

column1: Royal Dutch Post Horn Green 8.5% Extra Strong
column5: Blik gedeelt door Inoven, geprobeerd met Benzai. Het is een donker goudgeel bier met weinig schuim. Het heeft een moutige geur. De smaak is moutig en wat metaalachtig.

column1: Royal Dutch Post Horn Green 8.5% Extra Strong
column5: Blik gedeeld met Tomhendriksen en Benzai. Goudgeel helder bier met weinig schuim. Geur van metaal. Smaak is zoetig, fruitig en hoppig. Nasmaak is iets bitter. Geen overdadig alcoholisch smaak.

column1: Royal Dutch Post Horn Green 8.5% Extra Strong
column5: Prakticky tady pøidávám tento komentáø, jen aby tady nìco bylo, protože zpìtnì dopisuji 900 piv z mého seznamu a asi bych se musel u toho zbláznit.

column1: Royal Dutch Post Horn Green 8.5% Extra Strong
column5: 4 3 3 2 6 Can shared at THT June ’17. Clear golden with a small white head. Aroma of malt, metal, light caramel and grain. Flavour is moderate sweet and light bitter. Light bodied with soft carbonation. [16/06/2017]

column1: Royal Dutch Post Horn Green 8.5% Extra Strong
column5: Sampled from bottle at THT June at kwartje. Clear pale golden with thin white head. Sweet plastic malts, terrible headaches, cardboard juice. Moderate sweet and light bitter. Medium body, malty slick and low carbonation. Feel the immediate alcoholic burn!
Leicht trübes Goldgelb mit reichlich Schaum. Malzig, hefig, reichlich Banane, etwas Nelke, sehr süffig.

Bottle from my secret summer santa-17. Pours almost clear golden with a small creamy white head, short lived. Sweet malty aroma, ripe banana, flowery and herbal hops. Taste is sweet malty with a bold bitterness, herbal and flowery, lively and fizzy mothfeel, clean dry mouthfeel.Nice
Tap. Hazy golden body with white head. Aroma is yeast banana malts. Taste is nearly the same but with some sourness. Aftertaste is sweet and yeasty.
