Hell herb hefiger Beginn bei geringer Süße. Trocken würzig, rund, nett. 10/9/8/8//9
Golden with medium white head. Aroma is green stuff, slime, cheesecake. Taste is sour green stuff. Medium drinkable. Hm.
Klares, sehr helles Goldgelb mit durchschnittlicher Schaumkrone. Malzig, blumig, leicht fruchtig, grasig, leider nicht allzu spritzig.
Süßlich getreidig-herber Beginn. Die Süße steigt noch an, wenig grasig-hopfig. Konstante Herbe, vollmundig, eher Richtung Helles als Pils gehend. Sehr süffig, nett. 9/10/9/8/8/9

Bottled, from Biershop Bayern. Clear golden, rocky head. Distinct floral grassy hops up front. Mid sweet with medium body and soft mouthfeel. Sweat bread, summer flowers, grass and herbal spices. Long salty bitterness. Very sweet for a pilsener, but well made.
Bottle Oro buona schiuma persistente nasoerbaceo buona secchezza discreta nota amara erbacea
* Old rating, 0,5l, best before 01.12.10 IV. Grasig-bitteres, sehr trockenes Pils. Leicht getreidig mit einer ganz leichten Grundsüße. Nett.

0,5 l bottle Golden color, clear and with a creamy / frothy white foam head. bread, hay, cereal, citrus, herbs, light sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, oily and slick feel, average carbonation,
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein goldgelbes Pils mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch herb, grasig, leicht getreidig. Geschmack startet bitter hopfig, grasig.
It’s golden with a white head. The aroma has notes of malt, hay and flower. The flavor has a light sweetness and notes of flower, hay, malt and straw.
Pale gold color with a fine white head. Aroma of spicy noble hop. Near medium body with moderate carbonation

(draught) pours a very pale yellow colour with a frothy white head. aroma of floral hops, radish and light treebark, slightly spicy and earthy. flavour is straw, floral hops and light corn, with a hint of cinnamon and a minerally finish. medium-bodied with average carbonation.
Klares Bernstein mit durchschnittlicher Schaumkrone. Malzig, etwas Karamell, würzig, leicht herb.
500 ml bottle served in mug. Dark amber colour, medium head. Malt, caramelized sugar. Nicely balanced, light malty sweetness and slightly bitter. Soft carbonated, medium body. Not bad.
Dunkler, sehr trockener Antrunk. Leicht bitter, dunkles Malz. Mir etwas zu trocken. 11/9/8/8//8

At BKL16. Not sure yet if this was a re-release or a new recipe... Nice amber color with big beige head, good lacing. Aroma is malty, caramel, a bit piney hops. Taste is malts, caramel, fresh feeling, although it has some rusty nail feeling, it fits. Silky mouthfeel, a bit high and fine-bubbled carbonation. Not bad.
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein dunkelbraunes Bier mit geringer aber schönen Schaumkrone. Geruch leicht röstmalzig, Karamell, minimal würzig. Geschmack angenehm röstmalzig, würzig, gering schokoladig.

It’s dark brown with a creamy head. The aroma has notes of caramel, roasted malt, a little fruit and a touch of straw.The flavor is moderately sweet with note of loads of caramel, roasted malt, and a little fruit, it’s so soft and pleasant, and the finish is slightly dry.
Clear amber/brown beer with a nice white head. Aroma has some malty and caramel hints. Flavour is quite sweet and malty.

Die Schaumkrone hält leider nicht so lange. Gechmacklich schön röstmalzig, leicht klebrig, süß und ein bisschen herb. Fazit: Voll ok! Test vom 22.5.2009, Gebinde: Glasflasche Noten: 8,9,9,9,8,9 - 8,85
Bottle. Chestnut - offwhite head. Light molasis nose. Medium body, somewhat flat mouthfeel. . Slightly neutral malt mase, light roasted sugar. Quick finish.

Bottle: ruby-amber coloured, pretty stable off-white head, mild to moderate nutty and dark-malty nose; moderate sweet-bitter flavour, medium bodied, relatively soft; shorter nutty-malty finish, followed by a delicate bitterness in the aftertaste. Good Dunkel.....

500 ml bottle. Clear golden with average head. Grain, corn, some lemon, some metallic notes. Mild bitterness. Watery texture, very light bodied, dry finish, average carbonated. Very refeshing. High speed of drinking. Not bad for an alcohol reduced beer.

In-between-the-acts bottle pour@BKL 2016 - FR. "Bestes Leichtbier von ...". Smell of protein-rich grains, barley shed. Quality grains in taste, dry and astringent with a distinct isotonic protein feel. Pleasant hoppiness peeking through for a refreshing finish, enough to dispel the impression of cooked grain lemonade. Well done for a low ABV beer.

Many thanks to kevnic2008. The beer starts fresh and smooth. A bit grainy, but fresh and easy to drink. Slightly bitter in the mainpart, fresh but not too deep. Easy to drink, fresh and smooth. Slightly grainy-sweetish aftertaste, slightly bitter and not too bad!
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein goldgelbes Bier mit ordentlicher Schaumkrone. Geruch leicht malzig, getreidig. Geschmack leicht malzig, getreidig, leichte Bitterkeit.
50 cl bottle @ Timo A, BBE 01.05.2013 Aroma is rather light with cardboard, grainy notes and hints of grass. Flavour has butter, some wet paper, grass and herbal notes. Better than I expected.

50 cl bottle @ Timo A. Pours clear pale golden color with a minimal head. Aroma of clove, pale malts, floral notes and some fruits. Flavor of butter, hay, pale malts and apple juice. Slick palate, watery. A palate cleanser. 3313

500 ml bottle. Thanks Timo A. Pours a clear yellow colour without a head. Aroma of green apples, citrus and grains. Flavour of grainy malts, apples, marshmellow, toothpaste and grass. Light bodied, watery mouthfeel and high carbonation. Palate cleanser yes, other than that a no-no.

Wässrig herb zu Beginn. Wenig malzig, dies aber konstant bis in den Nachgeschmack. Die Herbe steigt, mild, etwas getreidig. Das Bier ist zwar dünn aber nie wässrig. Für ein Leichtbier gut. 9/7/8/7/8/7
0,5 l bottle. BB 01. May 13 bread, cereal, citrus, herbs, golden, clear, minimal head, white foam, medium sweetness, lightly sour, light - Medium Body, average carbonation, thin feel,
Pours a slightly hazy yellow color with a white head. Has a fruity grassy aroma. Fruity malty grassy flavor slightly watery.
Bottle - low carbonation, but very large frothy head. Darkish amber. Good strong aroma, not bad tasting but something missing? No depth. Ok palate - taste maybe due to end of date bottle?
Dunkel hefiger, deutlich bananiger Antrunk. Wässrig bitter, süffig, noch okay. 10/8/9/8//8
Hazy golden colour, medium white head. Aroma is light malted, bit of banana. Flavour is light malted, yeasty, little spicy and banana.

It’s unclear golden with a white head. The aroma has notes of metal, fruit and wheat. The flavor is sweet and of course rather watery with notes of yeast, fruit, light banana and wheat, and the finish is slightly spicy.

Bottle 500ml. Hazy medium yellow color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white head. Aroma is light malty, light to moderate yeasty, paper, fruity, yeast. Flavor is light moderate sweet and light light bitter with a average duration. Body is light to medium, texture is watery, carbonation is soft. [20101017]

Bottle 50 cl. Courtesy of fonefan. Pours a cloudy and opaque golden with a thick white head. The nose has a litle citrus and yeast. Light body, yeasty and very dry with a vague touch of citrus. Absolutely no banana. Ends very dry also - and dusty. 171010

(bottle) Cloudy, pale golden colour with a big and fluffy white foam. Yeasty, banana-fruity and wheaty aroma with a tinge of citrus and cloves. Slightly sweet and sour flavour, light bodied with a lively carbonation. Wheaty and moderately fruity (banana, citrus) taste; slim but not watery wheaty and slightly fruity finish with a whiff of cloves and vanilla. A decent Weizen light. 15.X.10

The bottle looks simple, but good, as well as the beer in the glass. Starts mild, but not washy. Modest yeasty, fruity like apple, well balanced. Finish still mild, very drinkable. Good leichtes Weizen!

Bottle, 3.1% as Weissbier Leicht. Cloudy dark yellow colour. Big stable white head. The flavour is subtle, as expected. Weak fruity flavour with enough citrus and sweetness to balance. Good mouthfeel for ABV, again to be expected from the style.
Bottle. Cloudy orange yellow, white creamy head. Clove nose. Good strong flavor - banana and clove, light vanilla. Surprisingly full bodied. Nice actually Light metallic aftertaste.

column1: Ottos Bourbon-Barrel Aged Jolly Roger Imperial Stout
column5: Easily my favorite Otto’s offering so far. Rich and bold with complex characteristics in the aroma, flavor, and finish. Surprisingly drinkable for a beer this bold and rich. Lovely stuff.

column1: Ottos Bourbon-Barrel Aged Jolly Roger Imperial Stout
column5: 12 oz On-tap in a tulip shaped glass My first review although a long time experimenter/taster. Appearance- a nice brown deep brown color. The beer clung to the side of the glass while swirled. Smell- delicious Bourbon barrel aged aroma. A little bit of fruitiness (although can’t pinpoint exact fruit) and a sweet aroma of chocolate. Taste- A bit lighter then would be expected for a 10 % abv, but very flavorful none the less. The barrel flavor is overwhelming, but welcoming, with a nice afterglow of other more standard stout flavor. Mouthfeel- good but a bit lighter then would be expected/anticipated. Overall - This was was very enjoyable brew to drink. Would recommend to anyone who likes a good imperial stout and will definitely experience again.

column1: Ottos Bourbon-Barrel Aged Jolly Roger Imperial Stout
column5: On tap at brewpub. Black with thick dark tan head that retains for a long while. Aroma is bourbon, chocolate, oak and vanilla. Flavor is a slight letdown compared to the aroma but still nice: bourbon, chocolate and oak, but a simultaneous barrage rather than a nice progression. Finish is long and a little too boozy. Very nice overall.

column1: Ottos Bourbon-Barrel Aged Jolly Roger Imperial Stout
column5: Tap @Otto’s: Pours a rocky, brown head that exhibits good lacing atop a black body. Aroma of pine, milky taste and mouthfeel, medium body with a smooth taste profile. Very excellent.

column1: Ottos Bourbon-Barrel Aged Jolly Roger Imperial Stout
column5: An extravagant thanks goes out to Nate for this special brew! Had the pleasure of sampling this at the 7/9/2009 Pittsburgh RB tasting extravaganza (PGHRBEXT) at the Sharp Edge Creekhouse. It will be a long time, if ever I see a spread of bottles like I did there. I am not good enough for the beers that were that we served! For example, how about this beer: a hand bottled ottos B A jolly roger! Dark black glass staining oily appearance. Dark roasty aromas. Surprisingly there is some carbonation in this brew. Sweet initially then goes impy strong. Typical strong impy stout on style characters thru the rest of the session. Way too much personality for this lager lover. Almost rude tripel or barleywine in its nature. What else can be said about this brew but ON STYLE!

column1: Ottos Bourbon-Barrel Aged Jolly Roger Imperial Stout
column5: Had this one at the RB Pittsburgh tasting. This one was hand bottled from a hand pumped growler, so I curved quite a bit on the final impression. This one is a lot better than it’s individual character scores would show. The mouth is where I want every stout to be. Lots of roasty bitterness here in scent and taste. Bourbon is at a good level. Let me clarify since re reading the above could be misconstrued; I only mention the less than ideal bottling situation to illustrate how well it held up. That was also taken into account when giving numerical scores. It should be noted and quite obvious that what I had was not what was intended, but it works.

column1: Ottos Bourbon-Barrel Aged Jolly Roger Imperial Stout
column5: This poured a very dark brown pretty much black with a small tan head. Aroma was licorice, smokey, and roasted grains. Flavor was very very roasted, some smoke notes, and a long lingering bitterness. Bourbon notes were there, but not overwhelming at all and fit very well. Damn good beer.

column1: Ottos Bourbon-Barrel Aged Jolly Roger Imperial Stout
column5: [On cask at Ottos] Appears black with a small brown head. Aroma is pretty nice--chocolate and anise mainly, with a touch of coconut, and a little roasted malt that came out as it warmed. The taste has a lot of anise again, some acrid roasted malt, cookie dough, and some chocolate, but not as much as in the aroma. Wow, this is only 10%? I love high alcohol beer, but this thing did the worst job of hiding it that I have ever seen. Palate is tough for me to judge, as I don’t really know how being on cask is supposed to change them. It had extremely low carbonation, bordering on being completely flat, medium-thin mouthfeel, and a long finish. It was very smooth. Perhaps it is because of my lack of experience with cask ales, but from a purely hedonistic perspective I was quite underwhelmed by this beer. The taste did sort of grow on me a little the longer I drank it, but it was hard to get past the over-the-top alcohol burn that came with it.

column1: Ottos Bourbon-Barrel Aged Jolly Roger Imperial Stout
column5: Pours a dark cola colour with frothy light brown head which leaves a nice lacing on the glass. Aroma of chocolate, vanilla, malts, coffee and bourbon. Tastes of chocolate, malts, coffee and bourbon. Has a slightly bitter taste that improves as it sits.

column1: Ottos Bourbon-Barrel Aged Jolly Roger Imperial Stout
column5: Pre-DLD tasting: Opaque and oily in appearance. The aroma has notes of bourbon (vanilla, oak, booze), chocolate, ashy smoke, green tea, molasses, and a hint of lactic sourness. The taste starts with the expected sweet malt character of chocolate and roasted malt, hints of vanilla bean, dark fruity (fig and prune),herbal hop, pepper, and a hint of peat smoke. The mouth feel is oily, heavy and lush. A solid brew all told but not quite the level of the top level BA Impy’s IMO.
Bottle. Clear pale yellow colour with a medium frothy head. malty aorma and taste with grassy notes. Nice beer. Easy drinkable, but watery. Triple?

Food white head, fast disappearing over clear gold, big bubbled beer. Very malty nose with greenmalt and a bit grassy. And very dull. Watered down pale malts, retronasal warm summer grain. And sparkling water. Very thinnish. Aftertaste has a very slight hoppy bitterness. This might sound all very bad. Put to put this into perspective, I’ve had some (quite some) foreign lagers that weren’t any better...
Keg @ Pumproom, Halifax. Hazed golden-amber. Very vinegary but not off (although I was told it had not been pulled through the lines for a while). Some tangy apple evident.
Gravity at Huntsman, Cheadle. Pours murky orange. Smells of sweaty pants. Decent cider though, plenty of dry apple, balanced sweetness. Enjoyable except for the look and smell!

A deep golden yellow coloured still cider. A sour aroma of artificial fruit, appley with a hint of lemon. The taste is syrupy sweet, again, the artificial fruit comes through, giving the flavour a sour, vinegary finish. (Cask - The Fox & Hounds, Heacham, Norfolk.
Polypin at The Fox & Hounds, Heacham, Norfolk. Gold with white head. Perfumed peachy cider with a sharp peely quality. Overwhelming Pear drops.

Personal Milestone 100th Illinois Rating. Pours a clear a gold with with a thin white head. Nose is light. Very grainy with a hint of malt and noble hops. Lightly sweet malt grain flavor touch of noble hops around the edges and slightly bitter. Decent.

Gold with solid beading but a slender white head. The light aroma has some sweet, almost bready malts with a faint herbal bitterness. The flavor is a grainy, sweet malt finishing on a grassy hop bite. Had the mixologist not been insistant, I should perhaps have called this a premium lager. Brickstone Restaurant & Brewery, Bourbonnais, IL

column1: Au Maître Brasseur La Belle Brune (Pomdher Hütt)
column5: pours dark opaque brown with a 3-finger beige head. nutty, malty, roasted malts, oatmeal, floral and herbal hops. wee-heavy body - saweet. good drinkability. very low carbonation, actually really smooth, silky. good brew.

column1: Au Maître Brasseur La Belle Brune (Pomdher Hütt)
column5: 341 ml bottle from Trappe a Fromage, served at cellar temperature in a tulip glass. App.: Deep brown with a huge tan froth. Aroma: Lots of lovely crunchy malts, caramel, toffee, brown sugar, lighter molasses, a little nutty, minty herbals, quite fruity, like an Abbey Dubbel or even an Abt, woody and vinous. Palate: Medium body and carbonation. Flav.: The flavour follows the nose well, tons of rich, crunchy malts, dark and milk chocolates, plenty fruity, less of the minty herbals, still nutty, very nice; dry with fair bitterness and a lingering malty/earthy finish. Quite nice. Quite belle.

Original review date 8/16/2008...on tap at Stone Bistro... Pours a very clean honey color with decent head-looks almost Pilsenerish Faint yeast/malt electricity with slight horse blanket notes-nice but subtle Very crisp orange yeast and honey with slight spice notes too. Finish is extra clean from front to back-mild wood/pine feel Definitely bright and sessionable. Maybe not a brutally profound or complex saision but extremely drinkable and enjoyable

On tap at Stone. Pours with a small, off-white head covering a clear yellow body. Aroma of candy, light spices and fruits. Taste is dry and sicey with apple and pepper. Creamy mouthfeel, light carbonation.

I’d have to say that this is probably my least favorite beers from the VBC line-up. Saison’s can be so hard to make, and I applaud these guys for trying. However, comparitively speaking to their other beers it has a way to go before it catches up. Aroma was a bit spicy, slightly peppery with hints of the coriander they used in brewing. Appearance was a medium/dark orange. Mouthfeel was satisfyingly light, not harsh in any way and nothing offensive like. Flavor was a bit vegetative for me, but I could also detect some white pepper, bitter oranges and grain. A decent attempt and I’m sure they will work out the kinks and get this beer working soon.
Extremely delicate and soft on the palate. Has notes reminiscent of a good Viognier. Floral and fruit forward wth an effervescent mouthfeel. Wonderful session beer that demands to be quaffed.

column4: Ross On Wye Cider & Perry (Broome Farm)
column5: Cask. Pours clear golden with no head. Aroma is super moody, dusty and super oaky and dry. There is red apples, juice, green apples and leafs. Taste is juicy, then turns really complex and dry. Earthy, apples, apple skin, mushrooms, sour apples, lactic, flat. Spicy mouth drying finish with dusty notes and oaky tannins. Light vanilla and light sweet. This i complex!

column4: Ross On Wye Cider & Perry (Broome Farm)
column5: On hand pump at the Southampton Arms, London 25/03/10. Golden in colour with slight carbonation. Sweet rum aroma with some tart apple juice. Rum was less evident in the flavour, which was medium dry with a touch oif apple skin. Good.

column4: Ross On Wye Cider & Perry (Broome Farm)
column5: Aroma is sour tart dry apple skins, some spice comes through also. Taste is similar good dry tartness in the finish, this vertion was 6.5%.

column4: Ross On Wye Cider & Perry (Broome Farm)
column5: Bottle picked up from mum at Worcester Beer Festival Aug 06. Pours a pale golden in fact more pale yellow than golden. The nose is very rummy owing to the barrels that it is aged in, and yet this didn’t overun the taste which was still fresh and relatively crisp and with the apples still shining through. Really enjoyed this cider.

Cask handpull at Shakespeare Head, JDW, London. Gold with thin white head. It’s a gold/blonde beer, ok in mouth, some citrus dusty hop on end. Handfull of cascade hops are nice. Like a 100 other blond beers, but doesn’t stop it being drinkable though.
Cask @ Willow Walk, JDW, Victoria. Pours a clear golden color with a small white head. Fruity malty and slightly hoppy aroma. Sweet fruity hoppy flavor. Has a long fruity hoppy finish.

Cask conditioned at a Wetherspoons. Gold with white head. Light and eminently drinkable bitter, biscuity malts, quite crisp and lightly roasted followed by zesty, grassy hops, a full mouthfull, I would go for cascade. Long bitter finish, pretty decent.
A Mes rate: Cask at Baker Street ’Sporks. Dark golden with no head. Slight malt and fruit. Standard stuff with some clear cardboard notes. Dull finish. Standard and bland.
Cask at the Hopwood House Inn, Hopwood, Worcestershire. Mid amber with a citric aroma. Refreshing, zesty ale with a little biscuit in the taste. Medium bitter finish.

Bomber poured a hazy amber with a lingering ring of amber foam. Aromas of toffee, dried fruit and light tobacco. Palate was medium bodied and smooth. Flavors 8f toffee, fruitiness and light tobacco with a smooth dry lingering fruity toffee finish.

(bottle) hazy ruby colour with a frothy light-beige head. aroma of bread dough and brown sugar, with lots of vanilla, cherry syrup and chocolate fudge. flavour is mostly the same, lots of fudge, more bread dough and raisins, quite alcoholic, with some dark bread crusts, herbal hops, grape skins and sugar icing in the slightly starchy finish. heavy-bodied with average carbonation.

Bottled: Beautiful brew with ruby accented mahogany hues topped by a fluffy head and very good lacework upon the thistle. Big arse toffee and caramel tones along with brushes of fig, prune, candy apple, and roasted nuts. Some toasted marshmallow, smoked meat, and herbal tea notes moved about by firm but not overly aggressive alcohol. The finish is long and earthy, a touch of iodine too. Very lovely brew, Mikey Likey.

Pours a clear amber with a small lasting off-white head that leaves good lacing. Fruity aroma with notes of caramel, sweet malt, earthy hops, and a touch of toasted malt. Taste is the same as aroma but more prominent. medium mouthfeel with a mild amount of bitterness and smooth alcohol.
"Very very malty brew...big toffee, caramel, light peat and fruit. Definitely hits the spot when in the mood for the style. Shows all of its 8-8.5% alcohol, but it’s warming and pleasant."

Bottle: (22oz $8 total wine): Pours a dark dark red with a tan head. Taste cocoa. Medium plus body with lots of malt. A little sweet but very nice. Update 9/26/2014):was4.0. This continues to impress me.

22 ounce bottle into snifter, bottled on 12/31/2012. Pours hazy deep ruby red color with a 1 finger fairly dense light khaki head with decent retention, that reduces to a spotty lace cap that lingers. Light spotty soapy lacing clings on the glass, with a moderate amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of big caramel, toast, toffee, biscuit, brown sugar, nuttiness, raisin, plum, fig, apple, herbal, light smoke, light leather, and yeast earthiness. Damn nice aromas with good balance and complexity of dark/bready malt and moderate fruity yeast ester notes; with great strength. Taste of big caramel, toast, toffee, biscuit, brown sugar, nuttiness, raisin, plum, fig, apple, herbal, light pepper, light smoke, light leather, and yeast earthiness. Lingering notes of caramel, toast, toffee, biscuit, brown sugar, raisin, plum, fig, apple, light smoke, herbal, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Dame nice robustness and complexity of dark/bready malt and fruity yeast ester flavors; with zero cloying sweetness after the finish. Medium carbonation and body; with a very smooth and fairly slick/bready mouthfeel that is nice. Alcohol is very well hidden with only a light warming present after the finish. Overall this is an excellent scotch ale. All around great balance and complexity of dark/bready malt and moderate fruity/earthy yeast ester flavors; and very smooth to sip on for the ABV. A very enjoyable offering.

pours a clear dark copper with a small tan head that goes away quickly, and a little lacing. smell is of malt, toffee, and a roastiness comes through. taste is thick, malty, and burnt toffee. ends creamy with lots of malt.

Poured at a good temperature with a smallish, tan, fizzy head that soon settled and no lace. Color is a clear deep mahogany. Aroma is heavy malt and dark ripe fruit. Flavor’s a lot like nose, lots of tang, bittersweet, hint of brandy. Body is huge, carbonation a bit sharp, and is very warming. Finish is like flavor, alcohol warmth lasts a long time. Not my fav wee heavy.

Bomber from some online place I’m forgetting the name of right now. Pours a hazy dark red color with a thin fizzy tan head. Fair head retention. Aroma of toffee and dark fruits. The taste is toffee, caramel, dark fruits, anise. Medium bodied. I thought based on the aroma this was going to be awful, but thankfully it tastes very nice. This will be a very bi-polar score.

column2: Watkins Glen, New York, United States
column5: 750 ml beautiful cobalt blue bottle. Pours a clear pale gold, more straw colored than yellow, with no head. This is a still mead. Faint aroma of honey. Not a bad smell, just extremely light. Thankfully more flavorful than the aroma would indicate with honey being the main flavor. Not really that sweet. Light, almost delicate on the palate.

column2: Watkins Glen, New York, United States
column5: This mead seems to have some sweet honey apricot flavors with a medium finish. The sweetness is somewhat balanced and the texture reminds me of a glaze. This is made for the Ethiopian royal family from what I’m told and has to fulfill certain requirements.

column1: Moccasin Bend Edward T Bass IPA
column5: On draft when visiting the brewery before Noogfest High Five. Hazy mustard pour. i found this to be extremely bitter. Some celery notes. Overly lingering bitterness. Not a big fan of this one.

column1: Moccasin Bend Edward T Bass IPA
column5: Appearance: Very lightly hazed, dark gold body with a smallish, white head. Smell: Smells of extra pale malts with a teensy hint of honey, some strong, wafting florals, as well as touches of grapefruit pith and resin. Taste: Mild taste of modestly sweet light pale malts. Boldly floral, along with sharp tastes of citric grapefruit and pine resin. Assertively bitter. Finishes drying and longly bitter. Mouthfeel: Medium-bodied. Medium-light carbonation. Drinkability: No more than an acceptable, decent India Pale Ale.

column1: Moccasin Bend Edward T Bass IPA
column5: Date: November 01, 2009 Mode: Draft Source: Brewery Appearance: hazy orange, frothy beige head Aroma: sweet and fruity aroma, light floral hops Flavor: sweet malt flavor, nice fruityness, balancing bitterness, light citrus, nice bitter finish Date: January 23, 2010 Mode: draft Source: brewery Aroma: sweet crystal malt aroma, nice fruity sweetness, nice citrus hops Flavor: sweet malt flavor, butterscotch sweetness, nice balancing hops, light lingering bitterness Aroma: 6/10; Appearance: 6/10; Flavor: 6/10; Palate: 6/10; Overall: 12/20 Rating: 3/5.0 Drinkability: 7/10 Score: ** /4

column1: Moccasin Bend Edward T Bass IPA
column5: Sample at brewpub. Poured a redish orange color wih an off-white head, lots of lace. Aromas of pine, citrus, sweet malt. Taste is similar, with a bit more malt than in the aroma. Mouth is full and the finish is bitter. Overall, a decent IPA.

column1: Moccasin Bend Edward T Bass IPA
column5: Hazed light brown pour with clinging thick head and lace. Aroma is bread and evergreen. A pretty hard bitter lacking a little in malt. Thin, watery, light bodied. A bit out of balance.

column1: Moccasin Bend Edward T Bass IPA
column5: Draft sample at brewery. Hazy amber with a creamy off-white head that settles to a ring and had thick lace. Aromas of pine and caramel. The flavor found that same nice blend of caramel and pine. Medium body, medium bitterness, and slightly dry.

column1: Moccasin Bend Edward T Bass IPA
column5: on tap-pours a foamy off white head and cloudy orange/brown color. Aroma is citrus/pine, some medium malt. Taste is pine/earthy dry hops (English) bite, some medium malt.

column1: Moccasin Bend Edward T Bass IPA
column5: Hazy golden orange with a thin white cover. Nice falling lacing. Aroma is piney hopes a bit of celery over the caramel malt. Taste is pale malt, pine hops mixed with a vegetal celery grassy note.
Hazy yellow, creamy white foam. Watermelon aroma. Taste is sweet watermelon juice, fresh jolly rancher.

2008 Southern Brewers Fest . Tap. Fitted with a slice of Watermelon on the rim of the glass. It quickly got tossed. As Burt Reynolds has quoted, "don’t fruit the beer". Poured a cloudy yellow. Funky, rotted fruit aroma. Flavor of malted wheat. Tart. after a big gulp from the mug, there is a slight essence of melon. Besides that... No fruit. Stale finish of watermelon rind bitterness. Not desirable, even on a summer day.

I dont know what this beer was supposed to be but by the time i got it, whatever it was it wasn’t good!!!! hazy golden color, nasty acidic funky smell, flavor is a little more normal but no watermelon that i can find and just not enjoyable. kinda cool idea to make a watermelon beer but just not well executed.

A yeasty, even funky yeasty wheat beer. We notice the inclusion, the infusion of white yeast there. On a light yellow body. A medium mouthfeel with this mellon-gourd flavouring. So-so, to drink but once. Not overcarbonated, a tad astringent. Not very drinkable but not a complete waste.

Date: 11/04/2006 Mode: Draft Source: Brewery light yellow, dense white head, drippy lace, nice light watermelon aroma, light body, slightly tart raspy wheat character, hint of sweetness, light bitter finish -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Date: 11/08/2006 Mode: can Source: tasting light sweet fruity aroma, thin body, light sweet fruit flavor, hint of green rind character, Aroma: 6/10; Appearance: 5/10; Flavor: 4/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 9/20 Rating: 2.5/5.0 Drinkability: 7/10 Score: **/4

Can sampled on 11/8/06: Pours a clear, nearly still pale golden. Aroma of watermelon fruitiness and mildly malted wheat. Body starts with a subtly tart watermelon flavor thinning toward a bland finish. An interesting concept, but needs more body.
Draft. Hazy golden color with a mild aroma of watermellon. Light malt character but it didn’t see, very wheaty to me. Light bodied.

From a keg at the unfinished brewery thanks to Chris. Poured a slightly hazy medium orange with a rather long-lasting whitish head. Aroma had a fresh watermelon seed character on top of a pleasant lemony wheat base. Flavor found about the same stuff.. the watermelon was fresh and the base moderately tart. Crisp and refreshing finish. Note: per Chris, the canning machine went nuts and a whole bunch of the cans out there are more water than beer. This was really a solid effort.

Unlabled can from decturstevo. Pale slighty hazy yellow. Smells like nothing. Taste just like the smell, with the exception of the lemon fresh joy dish detergent aftertaste. I don’t have anymore to say about this beer...Oh yeah, it was watery. Thanks, Stevo

From a can, courtesy of Springslicker. Slightly cloudy yellow, no head. Faint, sweet candyish watermelon aroma. Way too thin bodied. Hint of watermelon flavor, maybe a touch of wheat character. But really just too watery.

A touch of straw color, balsa wood and yes, good call Jordan...dried fruit as well as almonds. Yep, very clean, this dryness and flavor pattern seem to be the norm for Niigata region sake, Hyogo is similar. I’m partial to the fruitier flavors from the far north. This is still good, and I will save half the bottle to have heated later. Glad you enjoyed it & thanks for adding it to the DB!

300mL Bottle: Faint egg shell white with spotty legs, not full enough. The nose is clean and chalky with some light dried fruit; apricot, koji, gruel, light grain and dry dessert flowers. The flavor is a bit dry with a moisture sucking finish. A nice clean body and tail, but it’s just a bit too dry to be enjoyable. I really want to love it though! Decent sake though, some umami as it warms. Thanks IslandHaole!

Bottle. Quite a spicey beer. menthol (quite mentholy actually- like toothpaste) and pepper. Yeasty, citric, with warming alcohol. It fits into the style of a tripel i think, but its not a tripel i’m too fond of.
A Mes rate: Bottle at Chris O’s extravaganza. Spice, wheat, lots and lots of chunky plankton-like floaters, thick with little bits. Sweet, hoppy and spicy. Crisp finish.
ChrisFest. Light and fruity with a pleasant effervescent carbonation. Perfumed. Weak grapefruit. Refreshing. Exciting. Wonderful.

Bottled at Chris_O Fest March 2007. A hazy yellowy gold coloured beer with a whitish head which gushed big time on opening. The aroma is peppery and spicy with sweet malts also. The taste is peppery and very lemony. Over carbonated in the extreme. Yeasty, and not over enjoyable.

Bottle at Dickies, Bruges, Belgium Blond, hazy body. Creamy, white head. Excellent lace. Aroma of anice and tonic. Dito flavour (bitter). Therefor the flavour is quite weird. Off course very innovating and well done. It sure is a convincing beer. Just like it’s a style that I’ve never had before and I discover right now.

Bottle, 33 cl. Blond- almost amber color. White head. Very special beer. Aroma is not bad, koriander, and other spicy. Medium body. Taste is a little too much spicy, the boss thold me it’s "komijn". Like the other Alvinne beers more.

Rocky head, foamy, filling the Alvinne Glass. Sitting here witha a daft dash sniffing my leg, I realised that this is the dog on the bottle. Perhaps there is a dog in the bottle, considering the aroma. Spicy, rather than hoppy. The flavour continues the spicy theme, not asian, just odd, curious rather than appealing. Found myself drinking this to finish it.... Not great.

Huge, fluffy head, yellowish over fully hazy orange-ochre beer. Pungent spicey nose - lavender? Like a desinfectant, but with a natural herb. Lavender again, going over in an outspoken bitter almond flavour. The spices & almond completely overwhelm anything else. Some sweetness; retronasal citrus, soapy. Good point: somehow it’s refreshing. Medium bodied. There’s just too much of this lavender thingy. Pity, because a bit more balance might have yielded a much better beer.

After drinking several of the Niigata/Hyogo style drier sakes, it is nice to have another of my "hometown" sakes. Well, actually, Momokawa and Oroshi are much closer to my former home but this is still Aomori-Ken. These are usually a lighter, fruitier sake than their southern counterparts. I’m not nearly as good at describing all of the subtle flavors as Jordan but he pretty much hit the nail on the head with this one. Aroma wise, not much to write home about. I pick up the fruit and what I’d have called some cheesey scents (lactic sounds so much more palatable) but the rich lightly sweet, doughy flavors more than make up for the mild bouquet. Nutty follow, but I didn’t get the whole breakfast buffet! :-) Nice feel, smooth and easy going down, no rough rubbing alcohol taste here!

300mL Bottle: Pretty tough to find this one online, but there were several references, something about a special release. It pours a clear color with light beige legs and a nice spritsy character. The nose is minerally with some peach and anise, some lactic notes and a light koji grain note along with a decent amount of alcohol. The flavor is rich with umami, nice body and a light sweet candyish flavor, even though it’s only +1, which is just one single point into the sweetness side of the road, it’s very subtle and nice. The rest of the sake is really fresh and tasty but not much in the nose or floral department. Whoa, after I drank about half of this, it started tasting like walnut banana pancakes smothered in butter and maple syrup, it was delicious! Thanks Dan, you rock!

Cleaning out my fridge and what do I find? This little gem that I picked up in Gifu Prefecture on my last trip through mainland Japan before I moved here to Okinawa. As Jordan said, an off yellow, like a mild Jasmin Tea. Light alcohol and the buttery quality he described. Slick feel, thick & chewy, I want to use a spoon! Very rich and creamy, peach yogurt comes to mind. This makes me realize how much I’ve missed drinking good sake.

300mL Bottle: Pours a light yellow color as you can tell from the picture. Some people say clear is the way to go, and clear is pretty, but some good color shows that the sake wasn’t filtered heavily (physical or chemical). Some spotty legs and light creamy swirls. The nose is full of floral buttery nama with some light melon and pancake. The flavor is sweet, balanced, light alcohol, lots of umami and sweet maple banana notes. Mmmmm, nama. A light alcohol pinch in the tail with a more creamy mouthfeel. Finishes balanced, brief tail. Surprising for the low seimaibuai on this sake. Thanks Dan!

DATE: September 14, 2017... OCCASION: Thursday night relaxation... GLASSWARE: Ayinger willibecker... what is immediately noticeable immediately is its thick, pillowed white head that holds a three-finger stance until it laces with robust thickness... reasonable effervescence makes its way through a dark red body--fitting for a fest... the aroma is dank with caramel, dough malts, with some noble hops suggesting spiciness (licorice? pepper?)... some pine too, with vegetable also present... a thin, oily feel with some flourish at the throat... swift in its passage, with little texture to speak of... light bodied, with an apologetic softness that tingles--odd mouthfeel that causes one to wonder why... the caramel is not so heavy as it is lithesome and sweet... the flavor profile is much like its aroma, with the caramel sweetly piquing the taste buds... iced tea, mint (?), grainy woods, and apple/pear sweetness... overall, a flat, sweet approximation of what an Oktoberfest should be... a borderline rinser... serviceable, but not worth seeking out this season...

Pours hazy amber with a very quick head. Nose is a little boozy with a good bit of fall spice. Flavor is similar and shallow with a very strong alcohol profile considering it’s relatively low content. Finish is cloves and a little spice. Very unbalanced and heavy for the style.

Transfer from BA review on 9-5-13- Poured from bottle into a pint glass Appearance – The beer pours a nice copper/deep amber color with a one finger fizzy just off white head. The head fades quite quickly leaving only a very light foam on the top of the brew and a light persistent foam floating atop the brew. Smell – The smell is of a roasted malt with a good dose of caramel sweetness. Other sweeter aromas of some apple and a bit of cherry as well as some aromas of a more spicy nature with notes of cinnamon and nutmeg round out the smell. Taste – The taste begins with a bit of a roasted malt and a rather strong caramel sweetness. These flavors create a base for the beer lasting, throughout the entire taste. As the flavor advances from the beginning to the end, light flavors of apple and some spice comes to the tongue. In the end, a little bit of a citrus and herbal hop taste comes to the tongue with a slight intensification in the roasted malt flavors, leaving a somewhat sweet but lightly roasted and spiced flavor on the tongue. Mouthfeel –The body of the beer is on the slightly thinner to average side with a carbonation level that is a bit on the higher side. A little thicker of a body and a slightly lower carbonation may have been better for the roasted malt flavors of the beer, but the combination of the two (thickness and carbonation) did do a nice job for the sweet and fruity flavors of the brew, so overall it was quite acceptable. Overall – A rather enjoyable and quite easy drinking oktoberfest that comes at a great price. Rather nice overall.
Definitely better Oktoberfests out there in the world. Drank out of a bottle so couldn’t tell you the appearance. Hope to have it at the Brewery sometime in the near future.
NOt very good at all. Light caramel colored. Some malt, and very thin overall. This one was dialed in and lacks the palate and full bodied malt of a higher-quality oktoberfest.

THOUGHTS: Not bad, but not great either. Nice and sweet but not enough hops to balance all the malt. TECHNICAL: Bottle. Poured a medium amber with a small, off-white head that mostly diminished. The aroma had lots of different malts. There was heavy, dark bread, cookie, toasted, caramel, sugar water, honey, cake, and graham cracker like malts. There was also light grassy hops and slight cardboard. The initial flavor was moderately sweet and slightly bitter; while the finish was heavily sweet and lightly bitter with an average duration. The medium body was syrupy and lightly fizzy with a dry and slightly astringent finish.

12 ounce bottle from Total Wine Virginia Beach. Pours a clear copper color with a foamy tan head. Good head retention. Aroma of caramel malts, candied citrus, toasted malts. The taste is toasted caramel malts, anise, faint fruits, mild hops. Medium bodied. Generic, but solid.

Rich amber color with a quickly dissipating white head. Nose is malty with a little banana and some disruption by something else (almost agave or smokiness). Somewhat thin bodied and quick finishing, it has tastes of dry grain and corn with a little booziness coming through even though it’s not a particularly high abv. Less expensive than some Oktoberfests on the shelf next to it, but tastes it.

Bottle from b3shine. Poured clear brown color with a minimal frothy off-white head that was mostly diminished with fair lacing. Moderate toasted sweet malt aroma. Light to medium body with a smooth texture and soft carbonation. Light to medium sweet flavor with a light to medium sweet finish of short to moderate duration. My expectations where met.
12oz. Bottle from b3shine. Pours clear amber with small white head. Sweetish grainy malts, light fruity, mild toasted. It is what it is. On my phone so this is short.

Really nice, caramel-imbued, medium roasty aroma with a narrow swath of tidy hops (lightly floral). Lightly sour, finely burled maltiness. Round, ebullient grainy finish, light bitterness. Good stuff.
Very soft nose with a nice mild noble hop note and some lingering caramel and a slight touch of sulfur. Clean and inviting mouthfeel that begs to be quaffed.

Pours amber with a thin white head. Citrus and pine hop aroma. The hops are floral with a strong bitter finish. Crisp and dry with lingering grapefruit aftertaste. Very nice hop profile without being painfully bitter. Slight excess yeast flavor in the finish.

Tap at Uber Tavern. Pours a very nice clear orange-amber with a lovely white head and good lacing. When we were kids, we’d stick a hollow peppermint stick into an orange and suck all the juice out; that’s how this one smells and I rather like it. The flavor is rich with a strong and long-lived bitterness, mouthfeel is slightly hot and oily. I’d enjoy trying it again.

Amber with a small head and great lacing. Very fruity nose with pine notes and lots of caramel. Almost a note of bubblegum with citrus. Bitter and piney flavor. Strong caramel and toasted malts. Some yeast, but overall not a lot more I want to say about this one.

Golden amber colour. Woody-mouldy-mossy...a really strange aroma. Quite bitter, mossy, woody and very toasty. A light alcohol back note. Rather strange, to say the least. Certainly not the citrus bomb you’d expect, and I don’t like that it almost feels like it’s got a stale cigarette smoke note to it.

Very dark pour with a white head. Sweet malts, dark ripe fruit, candied sugars, and light peach. I didn’t pick up much of the peel or spices they say are here. The booze is well hidden. A good winter warmer.

I thought this was one of the best (porters?) I’ve had in a while. Sweet, rich, chocolate, and fullness to the mouth. I’ve been meaning to talke to the brewmaster to brew this again. The one I had was 2006.

I bought this bottle several weeks ago at Uber and drank it at home last night. Aroma is toasty, nutty (toasted pecan), and malty sweet with hints of chocolate and dark cherry. Also has a spiciness to it, like a root beer, with licorice and anise aromas. Appearance is rich red mahogany, clear, with a medium off-white head that tries to lace. Flavor is malty, sweet, rich, and spicy like a cross between a Belgian dubbel and an Aventinus. Has a Belgian candi sugar sweetness and some slight dark fruit notes. Mouth feel is medium-bodied, with medium high carbonation, giving it a little crispness. Some alcohol warming. Malty sweetness lingers in the finish. Overall a well-made Belgian style dubbel that is slightly light in the body.

Bottle shared with Oakes, glkaiser, and Sham at Uber Tavern in Seattle. Pour a deep brown and provides a sweet nutella aroma. The beer is far too sweet in flavor, think Thai iced coffee, with few other redeeming characteristics -- a bit of nuttiness, smoky/salty hints, rather sticky mouthfeel. I won’t be a repeat visitor.
Dark brown. Chocolatey aroma, nice light toffeeish note. Hints of coffee, light chocolate. Subtle maltines but bland.
Cask at SRAF. Pours hazy pink, nose is tart raspberry, wheaty, taste is juicy, fruity, dry.

Tasted this in The Esquire House, Glasgow (JDW) in June 2007. Cask, handpump dispense. Cracking colour with russet and goldne ruby depth tones like Arran sunset. Thin white head. Slight hint of ripe rasberry in the short aroma. Thin but refreshing mouthfeel and poor lacing. Pale malt gives a strong fruit base of rasberry flavour and very much like a flat Frambosen. Hops are in scant evidence in the short aftertaste. Sweetness continues into the malty finish. A pleasant summer session fruit beer.
Cask @ The Sir John Moore JDW. Rich golden amber colour. Mild dry raspberry aroma & flavour. Bitter aftertaste. Not very fruity.

A Mes rate: Cask at some random JDW in Glasgow. Unattractive red amber colour with a crappy white head. Egg and sulphur nose with very slight raspberry. Flavour is that of a lifeless ale with some very faint unidentifyable fruit. Yes ok of course it’s raspberry but I would never have guessed if I didn’t know. Sticky palate, especially in the finish. Gotta love the Cask Marque assured quality beer at JDW...
Cask @ Crystal Palace, Glasgow. Soft beer with a fine berry flavour, sweet, while not cloyingly so. I rather liked this, but it was more interesting than great, perhaps. One glass is enough.

Cask conditioned at Merton Beer festival ’07. Pinkish brown with slight head. I do struggle with fruit beers, my wife loved this but I find them a little challenging. Yes, the Raspberries were very evident and fresh tasting and the Witbier background was also evident, but I cannot overcome my, probably prejudice against them.

STBF07. Aroma hits you with tart rasberry, excellent xactly what i want, then the rubbish beer cuts throguh it and distroys what could have been great. Taste is tart real rasberry juice, then again a terrible overly malty backing offends me. Could have been a great, but loses it due to the terrible beer base.
Edinburgh Beer festival 2007 ... Light orangy pink colour ... fruity fresh raspberry nose ... light fresh raspberry juice with a light touch of hop.

Cask, Dick Whittington pub, Gloucester, 02-09-06. Loz (partner) had this first and I was that impressed I had to have one. Poured a very red/brown colour and with a noticeably fruity berry nose this beer was a real turn up as I’m not usually that struck by fruit beers. The label described it as a wheat beer with the addition of locally grown raspberries, the raspberries were very evident and really added and improved but in no way did they ever overpower, we both agreed that this was very, very refreshing and really different but both felt that a half or pint would probably be enough. Wonderfully different beer.

Bottle from Sainsbury's, from old notes. Poured pale gold with an average sized just off-white head. Aroma of citrus hops, malt, lightly floral and grassy. Medium plus sweetness, moderate bitterness. Moderate body, slight watery texture, soft carbonation.

Goldgelbes Bier mit feinporigem Schaum. Citrus-Biscuit Aroma. Dünner Antrunk. Leicht säuerlicher Geschmack nach Korn, Getreide, ungemälzter Gerste. Wird gegen Ende ziemlich trocken und verhalten bitter. Insgesamt aromenarm und einseitig.
More like a brunette than a blonde, but the ale does have a decent kick in the palate.
5.5% gold colour with a thin head, fruity aroma, hop and fruit taste, good beer.
16th August 2007 Warning! Early amateur rating! Crisp dry beer with subtle hints of citrus. Refreshing and moorish but lacks complexity.
Yellow with a lasting white head. Aroma of citrus with a hint of butter. Dry butterscotch and caramel flavour with a hint of citrus hops. Boring

Bottle. Pours a slightly hazy golden color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty caramel aroma. Fruity malty caramel flavor with some hoppy hints. Has a fruity malty caramel finish with some bitterness in the aftertaste.

Bottle 50cl. Clear medium yellow color with a average, fizzy, good lacing, mostly diminishing, white to off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, toasted, shoeshinne cream, malt, citrus notes. Flavor is moderate to light heavy sweet and light bitter with a average duration. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. (030808)

500 ml brown bottle, thanks to oh6gdx and chris_o. ABV is 5.5%. Clear golden to amber colour, decent head. Fairly nice aroma, floral and fruity with notes of honey. The flavour is zesty and fruity, there is a noticeable sweetness, again with notes of honey and also marmalade, acceptable hops in the finish. Not bad.
Bottle, 5.5%. Weak yeasty and grainy aroma. Clear golden colour, small white head. The flavour is distinct, slightly sweet and yeasty, OK maltiness. Peachy aftertaste.

Draught at the Plevna, Tampere, Finland. According to the waitress this is the non-organic version. Clear golden colour with a small white head. The aroma is apple cider, sweetness and malt. Strange. The flavour is dry grainy malt, nutty dryness and sweet alcohol. Not my favourite.
Yellow, cloudy, persistent head. Malty breadiness dominates. Medium sweetness. Pretty decent.

Tap@villiwäinö. Golden yellow, clear. Rich, slight sweet, malty lager nose. Full, soft body. Lush rich sweetish golden malts. Hints of greeny hops. Very festbier- ish. Robust, almost thick, lager. Does get a little boozy after a while. -- bb/wp8

Ulkonäöltään kullankeltainen ja hieman samea olut on tiivisvaahtoinen. Haju on maltainen, hieman makea ja hedelmäinen. Maku on raikkaan kukkainen ja sitrushedelmäinen sekä hunajaisen makea. Suutuntuma on ohut, mutta hiilihappoinen. Kokonaisuutena raikas ja helposti juotava olut sopi hyvin saksalaisten makkaroiden seuraksi, muttei tämä itsessään mikään makuelämys ole.
Aroma has lots of hay. Clear golden, short head ok. Light and soft with low cabonation, sweet. Ok sweet lager.
220912. Tap at oluthuone tampere. Pours clear golden with a small head. Aroma hops, butter, bread. Slightly sweet. Medium low palate.

Copper colour, somewhat creamy head. Herbal and grassy nose, some citrus. Medium tuo heavy maltiness, sweet grains, honey. Bitterish herbal finish somehow challenges maltiness. Not very well balanced. Medium body, oily and low carnonated palate.

Tap @ Plevna. Poured a clear copper colour with a small white head. Aroma of grainy malts caramel and vegetables. Flavour of malts, caramel, vegetables and honey. Medium bodied with a thin mouthfeel. Classic Oktoberfest-style.

&#40Draught at Pikkulintu, Helsinki, on 2009-09-24&#41 Golden and clear. Medium sized white head. Grass and grain in aroma. Medium bodied palate with medium carbonation. Malts, grain, grass, some molasses and bitterness in taste. Grassy and bitter aftertaste.
Draught@Pikkulintu Copper brown color, small white head. Fresh cut grass aroma. Hayish hops dominate malty body. Quite hayish for being an oktoberfestbier. Different.
Clear golden body with a thin white head. No lacing. Aroma of biscuits and malts. Taste was simple. Very basic beer but not bad.

# 3499 ersma: testlieferung der brauerei. kräftig pilsfarben mit mittelviel, mittelstabilem schaum. der geruch ist sehr dezent  süßlich mit leicht metallischem einschlag. der antrunk  ist malzig-süßlich. nach wenigen sekunden kommt eine metallische note hinzu sowie hopfenherbe. diese bestimmt auch die mitte, aber nicht auf die angenehmste art. der abgang ist hopfenbetont, herb, aber ohne bitter zu sein. dahinter malzig-getreideige süße. die flasche hat etiketten, die sowas von austauschbar sind. gut, dass der name der brauerei draufsteht. fazit: tut nicht not. wobei man sich generell die frage stellen muss, wozu es überhaupt noch export gibt. 10,8,7,7,7,7 - 7,45

(bottle, from pivnizub) Slightly hazy yellow colour with a medium-sized foamy white head. Dusty, slightly citrousy, grainy and grassy hoppy nose. Bitter flavour, light to medium bodied, soft carbonation. Moderately malt-based taste with herbal hops from the beginning. Moderately dry, slightly bitter, herbal hoppy finish with a grassy touch.

Bottle: Pale golden coloured, big fluffy white head, slowly diminishing; delicate sweet-malty nose with a tinge of metallic (iron ?) hoppiness; light swee-bitter flavour; ends in a delicate bitter-sweet finish. Quite well drinkable stuff, just a bit more aromatic and tasty than a bland beer..............

"Marke Alt Waldecker Dunkel", 5 %, Fläschchen von Edeka, Volkmarsen. - Kastanienrotbraun, blank; dürftiger Schaum. - In der Nase mild röstiges dunkles Malz, leichte Kirsche, schwache Hopfenherbe. - Antrunk leicht säuerlich dunkelmalzig mit matter Kirschsüße und matter, dumpf-ranziger Herbe. Gut rezent, limonadig dünn. Im Abgang deutlich ranzig. Leerer Nachtrunk. - Dünnes Dunkles mit deutlichen aromatischen Defiziten. Mit Röstmalzbier und Hopfenextrakt gelingt nur selten ein gescheites Dunkles.

33cl bottle from trade with Erzengel, many thanks! Pours clear dark amber colour with a mid-sized good lasting off-white head. Aroma of spicy hops, toasted malt, caramel. Taste of toasted malt, caramel, some nuts, spicy hops, mild metallic hops.
Many thanks for this beer to Erzengel. Pours a dark amber-brown with a thin head. Has a lager malt nose, although its taste includes darker, smoother malts.

Bottle from brewer. Clear dark copper, white lasting foam head. Light roasty aroma, some cereal tones. Light sweet taste, little roasty, some grass tones. Never been too enthousiastic about these German Alt beers. (Velp 201509)
33cl bottle traded with VIPinVelp. Thick creamy white head. Clear light amber pour. An ok brew.
*Old rating, best before 03.06. Malzig-frisches, mildes und leicht röstiges Bier. Trocken mit leichter süffiger Restsüße, die durch eine minimale Säure das Bier Sehr süffig macht. Lecker!

Malziger, etwas saurer Antrunk. Die Malzigkeit setzt sich im Mittelteil fort, der etwas saure Ton weicht teilweise, um einer herben Note Platz zu machen, die auch im Nachgeschmack noch zu erkennen ist. Weiterhin ist das Bier hier leicht bitter. Test vom 2.7.2007, Gebinde: Glasflasche Noten: 7,8,8,10,8,8 - 8,20

Das Alt Waldecker Dunkel aus Bad Arolsen steckt in einer Flasche mit schönem Etikett (Jugendstil?). Dunkel und kupferfarben zeigt es sich im Glas, dem malzig-herbe Gerüche entsteigen. Der Geschmack ist malzig mit rauchigem Beiwerk. Sehr vollmundig.

330ml bottle! The best before date has expired for over 2 months. The beer in glass is dark reddish brown with a bright beginning pompous crown, but then disappears here soon. The smell is malty and indefinable, something I’ve never smelled, and it is difficult to describe this smell but I like it! The Dunkel starts very malty and roasty well, with a subtle aftertaste of sweet malts. The finish is strong malty spicy. To finish it’s even a trace of more sweet malts, but the roasted note determined by the end of this beer. Delicious thing!

[bottle] Toasty toffee raisin brown sugar and nuts aroma. Clear dark chestnut appearance with a nice, lacy cover. Sweet, nutty brown sugar flavour that kind of drops off to a dry bitterness, leaving you hanging, unfortunately. Light body, low carbonation, nutty finish.
* Old rating, 0,33l swing-top bottle, best before 07.05.03. Leicht süßlich-süffiges und recht deutlich herbes Pils. Die Herbe überwiegt.

Heller, sehr trocken herber Beginn. Geringer Aromahopfen, deutlich stärkere Bitterkeit. Trocken bleibend, die Bitterkeit zieht an. Knackig bitterer und angenehm grasiger Abgang. Zu trocken. 8/9/8/10/11/10

Flip-top bottle (33cl): Pale golden coloured, small foamy layer; slightly sweetish-grainy, a bit hoppy nose; mild bitter flavour, quite light bodied; short, bitter and grainy finish. A quite bland, average Pils............

(33cl swing top bottle, a present from pivnizub) Clear, pale golden colour with a mid-sized quickly diminishing foamy white head. Sweet grainy aroma with a touch of herbal hops. Bittersweet flavour, light bodied with a soft carbonation. Malty taste, slightly grainy and papery; almost medium-dry, dense fruity and moderately bitter finish. Okay, nothing more.
Uninteresting smell as of a standard lager beer (grassy hops). Malt-dominated taste. Mostly sweet caramell-like and few darker notes. Quite good balance of sweet and bitter tastes.
Black transparent bier with ruby highlights and a weak head. Smell is malty caramel. Some coffee and liquorice. Taste is nicely balanced. Malty, sublte and smooth.
Das Bier hat eine klare orangebraune Farbe und eine ordentliche große leicht beige Schaumkrone. Geruch leicht karamellig, gering Kaffee. Geschmack angenehm röstmalzig, Kaffee, Karamell, gut!
Bottle. Dark brown color. Roasted and caramel malt aroma. Taste of roasted malt, a little sweet and hops.
Brownish black with a tan head. Aroma is sweet roast malty. Flavour is roast, cream on a dry roast finish.

Dunkelbraun mit rötlichem Einschlag, wenig Schaum. Verhalten toastiges Aroma. Dünn-malziger Antrunk. Die Würze hat ihre Betonung auf bitter-süß a la Pumpernickel. Mir liegt dieses Brotige jedoch nicht sonderlich.
Trocken brotiger Antrunk. Röstige Noten, laff, geringfügig bitter. Bleibend, monoton. 9/7/7/7/7/7
Draught: Poured a dark brown almost black with an off white cream head. The aroma was sweet roasted malt. Taste seemed roasted malt, but also a rusty metallic was present.

Bottle: Reddish-amber coloured, mid-sized lacing off-white head; malty, caramelly nose with hoppy traces and a tinge of roasted malt; moderate sweetish-bitter flavour, light to medium bodied; drier malty - a bit roast-malty too - finish with a harmonic hoppy touch in the very end. A pleasant, well rounded Schwarzbier......

(bottle, from pivnizub) Clear, dark brown colour with a reddish shine and a small beige foam. Shy toast-malty, slightly roasty and mouldy aroma. Light-bitter flavour, soft roast-malty taste with shy hints of coffee, light bodied, fizzy mouthfeel; dry, moderately bitter and light hoppy finish with notes of coffee in the aftertaste.
*Old rating, best before 03.05.06. Nettes Kristallweizen, weich, aber nicht zu tief. Frisch, leicht süßlich.
A very fruity flavor with a slight bitterness. Very clear yellow in color with a lasting white head.

(bottle) Clear, golden colour with a big and blond foamy head. Wheat-malty and banana-fruity aroma with shy grainy hints. Moderately sweet flavour with a light level of sourness, almost medium bodied with a spritzy carbonation. Wheaty, slightly chalky and shy banana-fruity taste; mildly sweet and slightly citrus-fruity finish. Style-wise a decent one. 28.VIII.11

Bottle: Golden coloured, huge white rocky head, slowly collapsing and lacing; distinctive wheaty-fruity (oranges, lemons) nose with a tinge of bananas; light to medium bodied, moderate sweetish flavour; mild finish with wheat and citrus-fruit. A better example of this really not necessary style.......

column1: Alt Platz Blind Dog Grog Pale Ale
column5: Nice aroma. Poured a clear amber a little dark for a pale ale. Nice malt and hop taste. An enjoyable beer.

column1: Alt Platz Blind Dog Grog Pale Ale
column5: Draft: Light opaque copper, disappearing head. Quite tangy lemon and grapefruit taste. Well timed orange peel finish. Very slight hop aroma. Judged solely on taste it is fantastic.By now, my opinion of the brewer is hit or miss, but mainly hit, and this is one of the good ones.

column1: Alt Platz Blind Dog Grog Pale Ale
column5: On tap at the brewery. Dark brown/orange pour with no head. Light floral/citrus nose, malt and liquorish. Flavor follows. Light overall.

column1: Alt Platz Blind Dog Grog Pale Ale
column5: On tap at the brewpub. Dark for the style - hazy caramel color, thin ring for a head. Weak nose, anise, caramel, some nutty notes. Seems under-hopped for an IPA. Light citrus flavors, some anise notes. Strange, but enjoyable.
No aroma to speak of. Opaque dingy copper pour. Dirty copper taste, but high quality hops. A bit yeasty. with a metallic finish. Alt platz’s other wheat beer, the Hefenweasel is much, much better.
On tap at the brewery. Pours a hazy orange with fluffy tan head. Huge banana/clove nose with something really sweet, like Equal. Flavor is crisp, light wheat. Nice drinker.

On tap at the brewpub. Hazy amber with a nice rocky white head. Nice spiderweb white lace. Nose is bannanna and clove. An odd sweetness, like powdered sugar, is detectable. Finish is similar to the taste. Light and refreshing hefe.
Hopfig herber, süß trockener Beginn. Steigende Bitterkeit, leider trocken bleibend, der geringe Hopfen wirkt sich kaum aus. Zunehmend bitterer Nachhall mit brotigem Charakter. 9/7/7/8/8/7
Klare goldene Farbe, fingerbreite weiße Schaumkrone. Geruch nach Getreide, Malz, Heu, grasig hopfig. Geschmack dezent hopfig bitter, würzig, leicht grasig, getreidig malzig.

0.5 l bottle from the brewpub in Malsfeld. Clear golden color, good stable head. Nice natural hop aroma, little bit metallic. Mild Pilsener taste with some interesting hop aftertaste. Metallic ending.
Many thanks for this bottle to Kappldav123. Pours golden with a decent head, aroma of grain and herbal tones, flavor is sweet with some herbs and floral notes.

0,33 l bottle. And again from kappldav123. Big thank you! Golden clear in the glass, small head. Grassy herb nose. Tastes grainy with a significant dry Pilsener bitterness. Scratchy citrus hints in the background. Not bad.

bottle, kindly donated by kappldav123! Clear yellow, small white head. Bitter-sweet nose. Light-bodied, grainy sweet touch with some not very aromatic, but dry and bitter hops. Bitter-sweet, quite ok.

Thanks to kappldav123 for this beer! The beer starts pushy-bitter. Typical pale Pils-taste, but very pushy bitter. Not nice and round. The aftertaste is very unround-bitter, sharp and not so nice. 8/10/7/7
Bottle looks simple but good. Beer in the glass zippy, nice head. Starts mild, malty, modest hoppy-dry. A bit metallically. Light sourish notes. Finish still mild, but not washy. Average.

It’s warm golden with a creamy, white head. The aroma has notes of malt, straw, slightly herbal, and the flavor has a light sweetness and again slightly herbal notes of malt and straw. The finish is dry.
Bottle. Grassy nose. Golden, fine carbonation, lacing creamy head. Light straw malt, lightish body, metallic grassy hops which stick to the palate. Leafy aftertaste. Seems unbalanced.
Bottle. Clear golden colour with a medium german style mostly lasting white head. Rich malty arom and taste with a semi dry finish. Good helles.
Bottle, thanks Pivnizub. Light straw malt and edgy herbal aroma. Green golden, creamy head. Aromatic flowery hop flavor on a somewhat papery malt body. Lightbodied. Herbal aftertaste.

Bottle: Golden coloured, visible carbonation, quite firm mid-sized white head; clear sweet-malty and grainy (barley) nose with a faint bitter touch; delicate sweet-bitter flavour, light bodied; light but distinctive grainy-bitter finish. Light, but tasty and fairly well drinkable Helles.......................

(bottle) Clear, golden colour with a rather small but stable foamy white head. Sweet and slightly buttery grainy malt aroma with spicy hops in the background. Sweetbitter flavour, medium to light body with a smooth mouthfeel. Soft and dry-ish (“hochvergoren”) malty, slightly grainy taste; dry and moderately bitter malty finish with spicy, herbal hops. Not an overwhelming brew, but clean and well-balanced.
Many thanks for this beer to Erzengel. Pours yellow white head. Nose/taste of banana, clove and wheat malt. Medium body.

Very yeasty nose. The beer starts yeasty fresh, nice banana and clove. Very round and fresh, lots of banana, a slightly grainy body that fits in well. The aftertaste is moderate dry-bitter, nice fresh clove, the ripe banana is there together with lots of yeast. Interesting, highly drinkable nice.
Hefig herber Beginn, geringe Bananigkeit. Erhöhte Karbonisierung, laff bitter. Kurzer Nachhall. 10/7/7/7/9/7
Sehr trübe orangegelbe Farbe, mittelgroße weiße Schaumkrone. Geruch fruchtig, hefig, leicht bananig, Nelke. Geschmack hefig, Gewürznelke, leicht fruchtig, lecker!

It’s unclear orange-golden with a huge, white, lasting head. The aroma has notes of yeast, fruit and wheat, when it gets warmer also a little hint of butter. The sweet flavor has notes of yeast, fruit, light banana, wheat, and the finish is slightly spicy. Quite pleasant....

0.5 l bottle, thanks Timo A! Hazy yellow brown color. Sweet hefty clove and pepper aroma with banana and tart fruitiness. The flavor is also very spicy and banana with some grainy straw notes. Full bodied and highly carbonated. Strong spice and banana character but unfortunately very filling and less drinkable.
Hazy orange with a large off white head. Sweet and yeasty aroma with yeast and wheat. Sweet and yeasty flavour with wheat and banana.
Bottle, 5.2%. Banana aroma, rough hops. Cloudy orange colour, big off-white head. The flavour has some banana, but the bitterness is not as rough as in the aroma.

18-Aug-08 (500-ml bottle, Best by 19-Nov-08: Free sample bottle for stewarding the 2008 World Beer Cup in San Diego, CA) Cloudy pour of bright golden-yellow body, but the streams of large carbonation bubbles move incredibly swiftly up the tapered weiss bier glass. Ugly forced carbonation, but this improves over time as the carbonation settles down and the bubbles become smaller and more leisurely. The voluminous whitish head is over an inch in thickness and shows solid retention, though the bubbles aren’t especially tightly knit. Simple, mildly aromatic nose of lemony citrus, black pepper and doughy bread, but also a touch of cheesiness and a hint of plastic phenolics. Light and mildly flavorful on the palate, the entry is tart, lemony and peppery, the finish is heavy, bready and gently tart, with some sweet banana and a touch of clove in the aftertaste. The beer lacks complexity or depth, and the flavors are generally light and uninteresting, though balance is reasonable. Light-medium body, trending toward medium, with medium-strong carbonation. The citrusy acidity keeps the breadiness at bay into the evolution, but once the acids fade off the palate, the beer starts to feel a bit flabby. A fat ring of lace remains at the top of the glass with sporadic strands below. Not bad, not good, just there, bland and innocuous on the palate. Probably best served cold as a summer quaffer, it certainly won’t distract you from your conversation.

(bottle) Cloudy, deep orange colour with a fluffy white foamy head. Dusty, mouldy, slightly sweet wheat-malty nose with a touch of citrus. Medium-sweet and sour flavour, light to medium body, fizzy carbonation. Malty, sour-fruity taste, tart and sourish finish. Less than decent Hefeweizen.
Malts, some roasted aroma, well estabilished but a bit watery with a metallic tinge and a hoppy aftertaste. Yeasty, breadlike taste but mainly malts.

Bottle: Clear, deep amber coloured, medium-sized off-white head, that lasts long and sticks to the glass; sweetmalt, caramel, toasted malt in the nose; light bodied, light sweet-bitter flavour; toasted malt and caramel again in the finish, balanced by some mild, but distinctive bitterness. Pleasant, well made..........

(bottle, with thanks to pivnizub) Clear, reddish brown colour with a medium-sized, slowly lacing beige foamy head. Sweet and slightly toasty malt aroma with bread dough, chocolate and hints of caramel and herbal hops. Moderately sweet and slightly bitter flavour, light bodied with a fresh, well-carbonated mouthfeel. Soft and slightly toasted malty taste with light notes of caramel; dense hoppy and a bit slim finish with a touch of chocolate. A light one, but well-balanced and pleasant to drink.

(bottle) Clear, pale golden colour with a mid-sized foamy white head. Aromatic, slightly sweet strawy grainy aroma, citrousy with a hoppy blend. Light-sweet flavour, light bodied with a refreshing sparkling mouthfeel. Initially malty, slightly grainy taste with balanced herbal hops towards the finish. Slim but refreshing and well-rounded.

Bottle: Pale golden, medium-sized fluffy, lacing head; sweet grainy to malty aroma with a "sweet" floral hoppy, a bit resinous touch; soloid sweet-bitter flavour, soft MF, light bodied; mild sweetish finish with a distinctive aromatic hoppiness. A pleasant and tasty Helles !

“Schwalm Bräu Pilsener“, Flasche (50 cl) von Rewe, Treysa. - Goldgelb, blank; schöner Schaum. - In der Nase recht schmalspuriger, schwach grasiger Hopfen und die leicht ruppige Schärfe, die den Hopfenextrakt verrät. - Antrunk sehr schlank, beinahe dünn mit Zitronenschalenherbe, schwach plastikartiger Note und leichter hellmalziger Restsüße. Gut rezent. Abgang schön trocken hopfenherb aber ohne distinkte Hopfenaromen außer etwas scharfer Zitronenschale mit Anklängen an Scheuerpulver. - Aromatisch eher schmalspurig aber schön schlank und trocken hopfenherb, einen Tick besser als das übliche Fernseh-Bier.

Bottle 50cl. @ home.
Clear medium yellow color with a average to large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white head. Aroma is moderate malty, hay, toasted, moderate hoppy, grass. Flavor is moderate sweet and bitter with a average to long duration. Body is light to medium, texture is watery, carbonation is soft. [20081014]

Bottle: Fresh hayish-resinous hoppy nose, some sweet malt in the wings; pale golden coloured with a medium-sized fluffy white head; moderate bitter-sweet flavour, light bodied, soft MF; bitter-sweet finish with a distinctive aromatic tinge. Very well made Pilsener !

Bottle, thanks pivnizub. Pale hazy golden, white creamy head. Nice aromatic hop aroma, on the sweeter side - elderflower with a sharp bitter grass edge. Hops dominate the flavor immediately, grassy and mossy notes overlay light fermenting hay. Light body, yet solid, smooth mouthfeel. Green tea aftertaste.

(bottle, excavated by pivnizub in the Hessian badlands) Slightly hazy yellow colour with small yeast floaties swimming around and a big but unstable white foamy head. Very unusual but also aromatic flowery hoppy nose with a distinctive fruitiness of mandarins and lemon zest. Light-sweet flavour, light to medium bodied with a crispy carbonation. Malty and fruity taste with light herbal hoppy background; dry and slightly bitter finish with a delicate hoppy touch. An uncommon but tasty and refreshing Pilsener.

Bottle: Pale golden, slightly hazy, small foamy layer, quickly diminishing; clovey, wheaty, dusty nose with a faint fruity touch; sweet flavour, light bodied; short sweet finish. A rather poor weizen.......

(bottle, with thanks to pivnizub !) Cloudy orange-golden coloured effervescent hue with a mid-sized foamy white head. Light-sweet and slightly sour wheaty, banana-fruity aroma with a touch of clovy spice. Light-sweet flavour, wheat-malty and yeasty taste with notes of banana and citrus; fruity, slightly acidic and clovy finish with dense traces of bitterness. Absolutely average Hefeweizen.

Bottled. Banana aroma with hints of citrus and caramel. Murkey, greyish brown color, ow tiny irregular head, no lace. Sweet, caramel malts, light bitter, toffee/butterscotch, some kind of coffee liquor in the background, flat. The brewer told me it was brewed elsewhere but I forgot where.

Bottle: Rather dark amber coloured, mid-sized "dirty" white head, quickly collapsing to a small foamy layer; faint dark-malty, almost chocolatey notes in the - in common - moderate fruity (bananas, traces of citrus-fruit) aroma; mild sweetish (fruity-)sourish flavour, light bodied; very light finish, presenting traces of bananas and wheat. O.K., not so bad......

(bottle, a present from pivnizub - thanks !) Hazy, murky brown colour with a mid-sized off-white foamy head. Sweet and yeasty toast-malty aroma, slightly wheaty with strong notes of clovy phenols, also a bit soapy. Moderately sweet flavour, light to medium bodied with a soft carbonation for a Hefeweizen. Slim and slightly toasty malty taste with hints of caramel, very restrained fruit character, but quite heavy clove phenols; short malty and clovy finish. All in all not bad.

(bottle) Slightly hazy, pale yellow colour with a big but also non-persistent white foam. Sweet and slightly dusty wheat aroma with nutmeg and loads of cloves. Sweet flavour, wheat-malty and strong clovy taste with light fruity notes; light to medium body, fizzy carbonation even for a wheat beer; medium-dry, sweet and slightly acidic clovy finish. Hardly drinkable.

Bottle: Golden coloured, bigger fluffy, slowly diminishing head; citrus-fruity and clovey aroma; light bodied, delicate sweetish and a bit sourish flavour; short fruity, clovey, sourish finish. Drinkable, but really no pleasure..............

On tap @ the brewery’s taproom on 11/12/10. Poured out a yellowish gold with an ever so slight green tint. Small creamy white head with loads of lacing. Smells of crisp fresh green hops. Tastes like a Belgian; yeast, apricot, apple, and bright citrus. Has a very slight spice bitterness on the end. Kinda odd for me.

Quaffed over the summer repeatedly as i stopped in Dry Dock’s tasting room, this is an excellent example of a Saison... happens to be in the real farmhouse style, meant for the ’worker in the field’ -- meaning the 4.7% (if I recall correctly) alcohol is intentionally low so one may enjoy a lot of it. Nice aroma of spices, malt and ’saison-ness’, wonderful appearance. I enjoyed it a great deal. Most other Saisons I have had have been abnormally high in alcohol for the style (not that that is a bad thing, just out of style). Color is actually only a little lighter than Saison duPont, although both are much lighter than the crazy-big saison by New Belgium. With a little more spice note on the tongue and just a touch more body on the palate I would have rated it even higher.

At the 2007 Big Beer, Belgians, & Barleywines Festival in Vail. I’m not sure who let this dog into the Big Beer festival. It by no means has the muscle. Fairly clear pale yellow with a white head. Some spicy coriander aroma, but body and flavor is rather mild. A very slight peppery tingle to the tongue and otherwise drying finish. Ho-hum.

Draught at brewery. Pours very pale yellow with a large frothy white head, mostly diminishing, excellent lacing, clear and sparkling body. Aroma is heavy malt (grain, hay), light hops (flowers, grass), light yeast (sweat, leaves) with notes of banana. Light bodied, slick texture, soft carbonation and a bitter finish. Long duration, light sweetness and acidity, moderate bitterness and salty. This is likely the worst interpretation of a saison I have ever had.

On tap at the Dry Dock Brewery Tasting Room. Poured a very light and clear straw color wtih a smaller sized white head (doesn’t look like saisons that I’m used to). Aromas of lemons, citrus, and peppers. Tastes of lemons, fruity, citrus and peppers. All around on the thinner and weaker side.

Slightly different experience on this beer as the only other rating. Light malt, of course, and moderately hoppy with herbs and citrus filling my nose. Slight toffee and maybe cola as well, but a clear aroma of bubble gum enticing me to drink. Brilliant clear body of light yellow hues, average head for this beer of a white color dispersers almost all together. A closer look shows small particles suspended in this thin-bodied saison. A moderately acidic and lightly bitter flavor on my tongue, the lively carbonation is satisfying. The medium body give way to a dry and slightly watery texture. As it slides down the back of my throat, I feel a light astringent taste and the hops intensify making this a very enjoyable and refreshing beer. I think I will get a growler next time I’m in.

Draught at the brewery. Body is very light yellow (not far from colorless). Aroma is lightly malty (toasted grain), with light notes of clove, lemon, and green apple. Flavor is lightly to moderately sweet, lightly bitter. Finish is lightly sweet, lightly acidic, lightly to moderately bitter. Light body, watery texture, soft carbonation. A very light, watery, and rather bland rendition.

Draught at the Brauhaus: Yeasty, faint smoked aroma, sweetish-caramelly too; deep amber coloured, hazy; sweetish flavour, medium bodied; mild, but distinctive smoked aromas in the coffeeish-bitter finish. A very pleasant smoked (good for beginners...) !

(draught at the brewpub) Hazy and very dark brown colour with a mid-sized firm and stable off-white foam. Aromatic and distinctive smoked malt aroma with caramel and a shy but present hoppy background. Bitter flavour, light to medium body, smooth carbonated mouthfeel. Well-rounded smoke-malty taste with herbal hops right from the beginning; moderately dry and aromatic malty and smoked finish with hints of coffee and a bitter hoppy blend. Surely the best Rütershoff brew I had so far.

Hazy pale golden color with a fine white head. Nice lacing. Ok intensity in the aroma. Medium body and fine carbonation level. Better than normal for a cask ale. Ok balanced sweetness versus bitterness. Malty, herbal and mild citric flavor. Nice refreshing cask ale. Very session able. [Cask at Belvedre Arms in Liverpool, England] Brewery #1783
Tried at the Three Horseshoes, Waddington. Light golden colour with a white head. Aroma is sharp citrus and light caramel. Taste mid bitter. Medium body.
Sample at GBBF 2016, Wednesday. Clear golden beer with a small offwhite head. Malty fruity aroma, citrus, grapes, some caramel. Fruity citrus aroma, grapes, hay, floral notes. Sweetish but ok.
Sampled @ GBBF Day 2. Clear golden color, small white head. Smell and taste malts, quite buttery, some bitter. Meh, not very good.
Gbbf. Fast klare dunkel goldene Farbe. Geruch karamellig malzig, dezent süß. Geschmack karamellig süß malzig, leicht hopfig.

500ml bottle from the Inn Beer shop, Southport. Pours clear straw gold with a thick white head. Aromas of cooked lemon and that stressed-yeast woody thing. Taste is sweet, woody. Thin finish. Not great.
Cask in Pivni, York. A golden ale with a white head. Fairly decent with biscuit and a citrus finish. A touch of marmalade too.
Quite a pleasant sessionable bitter with a nice malt character, I had a few of these
(Cask): Golden colour, white head. Aroma of fruity hops, not much else. Big peppery hop taste, slight fruit and malt in the background but the overpowered hops make for tough drinking.
Bottle from Cheers Liquor Store, Todmorden. Golden ale with a fruity hopped aroma, but also a well balanced character.

November 29th, 2014 - Lightning Brewery’s Kolsch is a cup of little crisp, dry joy. Straw colored and light, it gives off the slightest smell of cereals and grains, though it is almost invisible, thanks in part to the tiny sampling cup I am making do with. The flavor is slightly bitter, but features a very long aftertaste, which is both clean and crisp.
