Many thanks to Erzengel for this Vintage Bottle! Pours murky orange brown colour with a small off-white head. Aroma of caramel, spices, yeast, dark fruits. Taste of dark riped fruits, caramel, spices, interesting!
Mudy , brown color ; medium-sized , off-white head. Aroma of yeast , fruits and wheat. Sweet , malty taste with yeasty and bread notes . It reminded me kvas somehow ...
Bottle at International Great Beer Expo (Meadowlands). Hazy light amber color with light beige spongy head, honey aroma, sweetish taste, high carbonation, abrupt finish. A bit too sweet for my taste.

33 cl bottle at Kulminator, Antwerp. One of the few low-alcohol beers they serve. This one is very much like the Leroy Bock, but sweeter. Pours dark amber, almost no head. Aroma is honey, oat, porridge, breakfast cereal. Taste is sweetish, mild but nutritious. So-so.

Thnx to biersmurfke. Pours clear caramelly brown. Small white head. Smell is sweet. Taste is cola-like spices, some sugar. Bit caramel and earhty brown malts. Very sweet ( stuff that reminds of aspartaan or stevia or something) . Very lasting sweetness, but unfortunately, not the good kind...

Leroy’s dark table beer and like most of the beers under this brand, delightfully but hopelessly old-fashioned. Yellowish white, moussy head, clear bronze colour. Light nutty and chocolatey, but primarily caramelly malts in the nose, some artificial sweetness as indicated, reminiscent of blonde sugar of even a hint of cocoa powder, the obvious thin mouthfeel, grassy hop bitterishness in the finish. This brewery seems to specialize in obsolete beer styles and they do a damn good job at it: though very stereotypical, this is one of the most well-balanced brown table beers I tasted so far, only surpassed by some of the blonde or ’triple’ ones from Gigi and Slaghmuylder.
Geruch flach und süß. Geschmack wiederlich süß, keine weiteren Aromen. Das könnte auch Zuckerwasser sein. Fies!

Served to me in Jan Yperman Hospital, Ieper. Clearly sweetened and light caramel back taste, but a beery balance is present and the artificials do not spoil this good tafelbier. Clear brown, persistent head. Lovely pre-war style label.

Bottle 33 cl (as Leroy Mild Bruin) A hazy red brown colour with a medium high beige head. An aroma of fruit and caramel. The taste is heavy sweet and light bitter. A light body, thin texture and a short duration.

Bottled, as Leroy Mild Bruin. Hazy copper colour, mid sized firm head. Saccharine aroma. Very sweet with light body and clean mouthfeel. Dominated by artificial sweetener. Strange how much less apetizing this is, compared to the blond one.
Sample at SBWF 2012. It had a smell of earth cellar among other things. Sweet taste with honey and sugar. Almost like drinking wort. Nice taste, but worse smell.
Sample at SBWF 2012. Clear medium brown with a small head. Very sweet with toffee, syrup and notes of saccrine. Reminded of Swedish "Svagdricka".
Bottle. Pours a brown color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity sweetish caramel aroma. Sweetish very sweet caramel flavor. Has a sweetish weak malty caramel finish.

On tap at Moxie’s Kitchener - I was told it’s contract brewed by Sleeman in this region - taps a clear amber-gold ...small white cap reduces quickly... aroma is much like most commercial premium LME brews - frail aromas of grains, maltose/dextrose sweetness, some mustiness...light watery body... flavor is malt forward, sweet, little hop balance....fast liquid finish...nothing really outstanding here a forgettable brew.
Happy to try a restaurant-special beer. Good beer, slightly above average. Worth it with a good meal.

[6351-20140529] Tap. Malty bread aroma. Clear, red brown body with a long-lasting foamy off-white head. Sweet yeasty malt continues in the flavour with a lingering aftertaste. Medium body. Average. (6/3/7/3/13) 3.2 (@ Moxies, Fairview Mall, Toronto, ON)

On tap at Moxie's (shudder). Slightly better than expected though. Pretty classic amber with caramel malt notes and some light citrus hops. Mostly average mouthfeel with a little too much carbonation. Very drinkable and tastes fine. Just a boring amber.

Pours a clear amber color with a decent white head and some lacing. Aroma of caramel, some nuttiness and grain. Taste was caramel, nut, moderate amount of malts with some light hopping on the finish. Nice easy drinking beer.
draught. Amber colour, little foamy head. Aroma of caramel malts, orange. Taste is thin, light, overly sweet. Not very good.

Draft sample at the MTS Centre before a Jets game. Pale amber in colour with strong carbonation. Muted aroma of pale malt, caramel, and wet stones. Bland but fairly clean flavors of butter caramel and minerals dominate. Thin bodied. Barely better than your typical Canadian macro.

14oz draft at Moxies. Clear filtered, moderate head, good amber colour. Weak aroma, but nice. Taste was sweet malts. Body a bit thin. Overall, fairly generic and inoffensive. I liked the Big Life Euro Lager more. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This is an outstanding session ale from an outstanding small brewery. The good folks at Legend have done an excellent job of recreating a classic English style with this one. Understatement, balance, and harmony are apt descriptors. Unfortunately, it’s a seasonal offering and (at the moment) a limited release -- from a brewery with limited distribution. A visit to the brewpub on the James River will not be a waste of time, though, rest assured.

On tap at the brewpub. Clear, dark gold with a small white head. Light, sweet malt nose, weak caramel and a hint of grass. Flavor is more of the same, a light breadiness is added. Finishes with light grass and floral. Yup, it’s a mild.

(draft) Crystal clear apple juice body with white head. Aroma is medium sweet, grassy/earthy, some caramel, light apple. Taste is medium sweet, caramel, grassy, some earthy, light apple, mint. Light body, crisp.

Draft at Legend. Amber bodied. Small white head. Nose is light malts, faint caramel, and flowery hops. I also picked up some metal in the aroma, maybe iron. That happened towards the end of the pint, though. Taste is creamy malts, light fruit, soft yeast, and some buttery notes. There’s also more light floral hops. Body is light, but chewy. I mild carbonation throughout. Finishes with caramel, buttery malts and more floral hops.

Draft at pub, glad they decided to throw out a mild! Copper appearance, little head. Very, very faint caramel aroma. Light bodied, flavor was of light caramel and decent hop bitterness on the finish, leaning towards spicy. Nice session beer, which is what it was supposed to be. Perhaps a tad more carbonation than needed, but enjoyable.

On tap at the brewery. Copper pour with thin white head. Nose was barely perceptible, even after it warmed, with a hint of sour malt. Flavor has more of the sour malt with a bit of fruitiness. On the thin side, but pretty sure that the point.

It pours an amber color with a thin white head. Strawberry and banana scents are evident in the aroma. This is a very smooth, slightly creamy, and lightly bitter ale. It has a fruity flavor and a slightly nutty after-taste.

Tap at Legend Brewing -- A nice ruby-orange body with a thin white head. Good aroma, light caramel, honey, fruit and some malts. Great taste for the style, light hops, some wheat and a light fruit presence. Pleasent ending. If one wants to try a Mild Ale, this is a perfect example of what the style is suppose to be.
Clear light amber body with a small creamy white head. Faint malty aroma. Light malty flavor, a hint of dark malt. Very smooth and easy to drink.
Brown amber body, lasting small white head. Gentle malt aroma, malt flavour with banana. Refreshing palate— clean and spicy.

On tap at Pacific Coast poured a clear gold with a lingering ring of white foam. Aromas of bread, honey and light fruittiness. Palate was light bodied and crisp. Flavors of bread, honey and light fruittiness with a crisp finish.

On tap at the brewpub (I think this was listed as a blond?). Pours with a lightly hazed golden hued body with a small white head that clings to the glass. Aromas are bready, honey, floral aromas. Estery, and some very light phenols (clove). Flavors are bready, grainy, honey, and dry. A hint of sweetness in the mid palate. Some minerallity. Very lightly bitter, lively bubbles. A bit dry, not astringencies, light body.
Sample at the brewpub on 8/8/10. Clear yellow pour with a thin white head. Creamy malt nose with not much else going on. Flavor is corn, honey and water.

Draft @ the brewpub. Pours a pale yellow color with a small white head. Has a sweetish malty weak hoppy aroma with some hints of citrus. Sweetish fruity malty caramel flavor with some hoppy hints. Has a sweetish malty finish with some hints of citrus in the aftertaste.
Draft. Golden amber beer with a whitish head. Slight citrusy aroma. Fruity orange, honey, grainy flavor. Lingering lemony citrus. Medium-light bodied.

Sampled at GABF 2015. In the tasting glass was hazy yellow with white foam. Nose of tropical fruit, citrus, and maybe some pine. Medium body. Flavor brings mango, citrus, and the finish is bitter. Quite nice.
Draft to half pint at brew pub Spruce and pine, grapefruit, a bit of caramel. Amber, thin creamy off white head. Taste is pine, pepper, spruce, grapefruit.

Reddish orange in color... Aroma of caramel, toffee malts, light citrus hops... Flavor is a blend of caramel malts initially, gives way to intense citrus and piney hop bitterness... Deceivingly hoppy, nice ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I am guessing I had this in October of 09. Just found the ratings in some shorts pockets. On tap at the brewpub. "A souped up amber ale with a hodge-podge of leftover hops and malts. Recipe changes from year to year". Aroma is pretty sweet with some soapiness and mild pine hop aromas. Some caramel malts are barely detectable. Moderately hazy orange-amber body with an off-white head. Starts a little caramelly and sweet with good maltiness. Finishes with sharp, biting, hop bitterness. Dry finish. Grapefruit bitterness and spiciness. Very harshly hopped brew.

Tap at the brewpub. Pours hazy amber with a beige head. Smells malty and quite hoppy. Near full body. Losts of floral, but more grapefruit, hop. Seems a hint of mango. Finishes bitter. Hoppy amber? Malty IPA? Pretty good.

Tap. Wow, very hoppy! Smell was rather floral and rich. Body was has a cloudy copper color, and came to the table with a nice off-white head. Very bitter and dry finish, much more bitter than I expected. I don’t know how popular this beer is, but I think the menu needs to compliment something this heavily hopped.
amber pour thick tan head w/ nice lace. Odd aroma lightly spiced some fuggle notes. Palate is dry and oily. Flavor is a very resinous dry pine. Not very good.

Draft. Rich amber beer with an off-white head. Slight grapefruit/grass/earth hop aroma. Muddled hop flavor - grapefruit, pine, grass, earthiness. Fairly dry with lingering piney/earthy bitterness. Lots of hop flavor, just muddled with a combination of PNW and British hops.
Murky brown large creamy tan head good retention. Aroma of strong banana, caramel, leaves. Taste is banana, clove, caramel, spice. Thin, lingering spice.
Cloudy dark brown body. Banana/berry and dark chocolate wheat in teh aroma. Tart berry, banana, clove and lightly chocolatey wheat in the flavor. Nice yeasty highlights in the end - a solid dunkel.

Milwaukee. Semi-hazed and mahogany-caramel-brown in color with a frothy, grayish tan head. Aroma’s rocking: bananas beaucoup with some cocoa and prunes marinating in plum sauce. Hazelnuts and nutella provide aromatic substance as well. Flavor comes in lightly with stinging cloves and steel. Light, tragic lemons. Vanilla and almond butter make a little fuss, followed by fluffy fudge brownie mix. Warms up a bit better, butting down with mild milk chocolate fudge and aluminum canned cream soda. Light-bodied and quite a bit of palate reprehension, sliding into grape jam, whole wheat and chocolate bran in the end.

column1: Rock Bottom Milwaukee Black Sheep Chocolate Stout
column5: At the brewpub in Milwaukee. Almost porter like. Smooth and a little sugary. Sweet rather than bitter chocolate. Easy drinking. Serving: Tap

column1: Rock Bottom Milwaukee Black Sheep Chocolate Stout
column5: On tap at Rock Bottom Milwaukee. Poured deep brown with a short, well-retained beige head. The aroma picked up a blend of sweet and slightly darker chocolates joined by lactic character.. some coffee and vanilla too.. cake-like as it warmed. The flavor found mostly moderately-roasted darker chocolates laced with milky sourness.. molasses and coffee bitterness surrounded.. spicy and bitter on the finish over a nice bed of chocolate. Medium-bodied and surprisingly bitter on the palate.. the milky sourness worked.. grainy on the finish, with a lot of residual sugars. Solid drink.

column1: Rock Bottom Milwaukee Black Sheep Chocolate Stout
column5: On Tap in Milwaukee- Drank while splitting a huge ass chocolate fudge brownie with vanilla icecream ontop and it was a hell of a combo. Pours a pitch black color, tan head. The aroma is feint chocolate, and astringent roasted. Though by my own admittance I was smoking, the person I was with was smoking, and we were sitting in the smoking section. You get the point. The flavor was good delicious chocolate mixed with a good roast charachter as well as some hops tossed in for good measure. Not bad, though if given the chance I’d take the brownie over the brew.

column1: Rock Bottom Milwaukee Black Sheep Chocolate Stout
column5: Was listed as Black Sheep Stout, but I ’m fairly certain it’s the same beer. Pours to a dark black body with a lasting brown head. Decent lacing. The flavor is chocolatey and roasty with lots of black patent. Bitter cocoa. Hints of plums hide in the finish. The aroma is lacking. Light black patent. The palate is sweet, medium-full bodied, dry on the tip of the tongue. Seems to be more of an Irish non-nitro stout. I also had their cask version. It seemed to be much smoother in flavor and palate. More milk chocolate aroma.

column1: Rock Bottom Milwaukee Black Sheep Chocolate Stout
column5: Milwaukee. Muddy and light midnight brown in color, with opacity that’s shielded by the plastic patio cup, though a dark tan head perseveres. Dark chocolate and black patent nail the nose along with deep roasted espresso and mocha beans. Caramel truffles add their own sense of aromatic vibrancy. Pacific Northwest hops surround the flavor, making up for its lack of palate density, imparting a touch of mango to the chocolate covered espresso bean flavor. Caramel weaves through unsweetened bakers chocolate bricks. Bitterness sidesteps carbonation to amplify the tingly mouthfeel. Medium-bodied format hits the espresso baked brownie substance right on the head, grainily disintegrating in the finish with a hint of coffee flavor additive to a lactic café concoction of some sort or another. Decent.
355ml can. 5.60 for a 12 pack. PAle pour, not as offensive as it could be. Mild and as an ice beer tends to be a stronger version of a light beer.
Wow, i actually enjoyed this ice beer because i was on a boat drinking 4% beers for a week and this at least tasted like alcohol...not really like beer though.

Let’s just say for the price of the beer its worth it. Nice thick head sweet apple taste almost could be a lager. This is a case I could grab and bring out to the fish house and everyone will enjoy ! Cheers!

Pours a clear, deep golden color with a modest white head. Nose is very grainy, sweet apple, light corn note with some finishing alcohol. Flavor is very sweet and reminds me of apple juice. Light grainy middle, light spicy hops kiss toward the end. Pretty one dimensional, sweet. Typical crummy beer feeling - very light with lots of fizz. Overall not as bad as I thought it would be. Actually a drinkable cheap beer for camping/lawn mowing without being that harsh super cheap flavor.

wow, thanks for this addition to the tasting Stuart .. . dirt yellow colour . . white wine .. . horrid . . some low lacing . . metal, poo, evil flavours .. . drain pour!!!! ahhhh!! belittling to my person..

This was pitted head-to-head against Keystone Ice in the Great American Shite Beer Taste-Off. Colorado vs Wisconsin. Ice vs Ice. This poured a darker straw colour than Keystone with the same brief white foamy cap. Aroma of corn syrup and apples. Flavour is sweet bland grain with a harsh slightly chemical aftertaste. This brings to mind an interesting question. Does one desire more flavour in ones beer even if said beer is a can of shit? Hmmmm...

Can, but it says 5.6% abv. Pours a golden color with a decent white head that slowly fades. Taste is of corn, sugar and is really sweet. The sweetness reminds me of fruit beers and malt liquors. Aroma is the same, but alcohol is present. Not as watery as what I was expecting. For the price ($5 a 12 pack) this is a decent beer. Goes down easy and doesn’t taste that bad. A good beer to get drunk on. Also the label is kind of neat.
(Can) Pours a clear yellow body with a small quickly dissipating white head. Aroma of lemon, corn, and some floral. Flavor of cardboard, grain, metallic, and stale water.

can from lumpy(and yes i will add a trade to your profile soon) all i can think to say is, fuck you lump. i could end the rating there, but i won’t. pale yellow, active loud white head that did not last. smelled of honeysuckle that grew by the rows of corn out where i grew up, well if there was also an overturned garbage truck nearby that is. oh and metal. taste: well, lets go back to this line: fuck you lumpy. overly sweet corn juice, tastes like all the other crappy pale lagers but with extra creamed corn. my taste buds are pissed, they thought the days of swilling were over except for the occasional camo black ice, because damnit, it is a usefull beer. this was a bad beer, i hope lumpy enjoys the malt liquor i sent him half as much. 2 3 2 1 5

Can. Looks like a macro-gold with a foamy white head. Nose-smells like a macro-very corny, straw, pungent, perfumey, sweet, not good. Taste-tastes like a very fruity overly sweet macro, berry, apple, corny, WAY too sweet, foul, a lot worse than I thought it was going to be. An overly sweet macro mess. Just foul. Burns going down, which is a bad way to finish a bad beer. Bitter and sticky mouthfeel. Hands down one of the worst beers I have ever had.

My first tasting of the Illinois Craft Brewers Guild 2006 ReplicAles, this year a Saison.Mike rose to the challenge and produced a tasty brew. It pours a bright yellow body, slightly golden, very slightly hazed, with a bubbly white head. It has a warm aroma, yeast, soft malts, recently cut grasses, a peppery spiciness. Light bodied, it has a refreshing blending of said malts & spices with the addition of apples and unripened pears. Finishing on an herbal bitter note, this is one that I hope America’s Brewpub keeps in the rotation. America’s Brewpub, Aurora, IL
Pours off white with a white head. Smells of light hops but little in the way of malt is present. Taste is very watery with some light hoppiness.

column1: Americas Why Dont We Get Drunk And Brew... Scotch Ale
column5: Sampled from tap on 11/10/2006 at Walter Payton’s Roundhouse in Aurora, IL... Let me start by saying that this is a solid Scoth Ale. I really enjoyed it and was quite impressed with it overall. This is the THE beer to try if you ever make it to Walter Payton’s Roundhouse in Aurora, Illinois! Served in a brandy sniffer. Color is a dark amber with an orangy hue. Nice creamy, orange-colored head. Aroma is caramel malt, and a hint of peat and smoke. The flavor has a complex maltiness to it with a very nice peat and smokiness in the finish. The alcohol is nicely tucked beneath the maltiness and is only evident later in the finish. Slightly heavy on the palate, but just about right. Very smooth and full of flavor (although I would have liked just a touch more smoke!). Very balanced and highly recommended!

column1: Americas Why Dont We Get Drunk And Brew... Scotch Ale
column5: I love a good Scotch Ale...and there aren’t that many around! This one looks great...dark mahogany pour with thick, rocky head. The aroma is a wonderfull blend of peat, smoke, scotch whiskey, and caramel. My first impression upon tasting is a big smoky peatiness that really makes this non-smoker want to light up a great cigar while I sip this libation. Big sweet caramel malt bottom is the bass line, while the melody is layered on top of that, featuring a harmonious interplay between the smoke, the scotch, and the hints of toffee and hazelenuts. Or perhaps I just enjoyed getting kicked in the nuts by the alcohol...hard to say, really!

column1: Americas Why Dont We Get Drunk And Brew... Scotch Ale
column5: Had this on draught at the brewery in Aurora, Illinois. Served in a brandy glass due to the extraordinary high alcohol content. Deep reddish pour with a thin, lacy head, nose of whisky and sweet chocolate. The flavor is malty and smoky, reminiscent of scotch whisky, but only once the alcohol really roars into the finish. I didn’t like this at all.

column1: Americas Why Dont We Get Drunk And Brew... Scotch Ale
column5: My first visit to the pub, and this brew amazed me. Serious malt aroma mixed with alcohol emanated from this caramel colored, tan headed brew. It was warming just to smell it. It was like drinking flaming malts, sweet caramel burning on the tongue as smoky alcohol fumes filled my mouth, nose and sinuses. Nice light hopping to balance the sweetness. Sticky warm finish. It reminded me of Orkney Skullsplitter. America’s Brewpub, Aurora, IL
Aroma: none; Appearance: clear golden pour with little head; Taste: more funky than expected with some cereal, yeast, and a little spice; Palate: light bodied; Overall: interesting for a lager.

From Sept 2008 I got this bottle in a trade with Wasatch. Thanks John! This pours a hazy yellow gold with another fine 2 finger head of foam. The smell is malty with some fruitiness and just a touch of hop bitterness. Nice nose and good for the style. The taste has good caramel maltiness and some light grain, a little fruit, and just a wee bit of citrus hop bitterness just to keep the sweetness in check. Nice taster here and very easy to drink. Light mouthfeel and lightish carbonation, it finishes with a slight bitterness. Good stuff. Btw, the foam does a very good job of sticking around and the lacing is pretty good. Bottom line: Another good brew from Zion. What more can I say? ;^)

column1: Zion Canyon Hop Valley India Pale Ale
column5: From Sept 2008 I got this bottle in a trade with Wasatch. Thanks John! It's a twist off cap but I had to resort to a bottle opener... This pours a slightly hazy gold colour with a good 1 finger head of foam. The smell has notes of earthy malt and light notes of citrus and some pine. The taste is on the light side but pretty substantial for a 4.0%abv brew. Good hoppinesss with nice tasty grapefruit and piney hops, good earthy and caramel malt flavours that bring some balance. Hmmm. there's more going on here than I figured there would be. In fact, this is lick ass for a brew this low in alcohol. Hell, even if it wasn't this low in alcohol, I'd say this is a damn good drop. Hell of a session brew, me thinks. It's light bodied, the carbonation is light, and it finishes with a nice pleasing bitter bite. Dang, I can't remember when I finished a glass of IPA quicker than this one. Well done!! And..the head retention was quite good as was the lacing. Bottom line: Don't let the abv scare you away from this one as it is packed with flavour. I'm always impressed with how flavourful, despite the cap limits the state is strapped down with, the brews of Utah *can* be if done right. This one is an excellent example.

column1: Zion Canyon Hop Valley India Pale Ale
column5: 12 FL oz bottle from the shop at the Cable Mountain Lodge in Zion US. Fruity citrus hop aroma and a little of malts. Hazy light orange body with small white head. Soft bitter, easy drinkable beer.

column1: Zion Canyon Hop Valley India Pale Ale
column5: From bottle. First taste and aroma of grassy bops, not much in the aftertaste. Dors not taste much like an IPA. More a pilsener with some extra hops.

column1: Zion Canyon Hop Valley India Pale Ale
column5: 12oz bottle, thanks to my parents for picking this up for me during a road trip. Shared with the local group. Mostly hazy amber - orange color. Some particles visible floating in the body. Thin white head. Some loose splotches of lace. Medium body, not as light as the ABV would suggest. Smooth, lightly soft carbonation. Nice grassy hop. Some citrusy hop. Nice citrus zest. Impressive, satisfying IPA, despite being so light. Good flavor overall. THey could easily call this a "session IPA" outside and UT and get a little more attention.. Would be a satisfying fix in Utah if I wasn’t able to find anything else of normal strength

column1: Zion Canyon Hop Valley India Pale Ale
column5: Bottle to snifter (thanks DrSilverworm). Looks good; a fairly transparent orange with thin white head head that dissipates into lacing. Smells of bitter hops. Tastes like it smells with an average mouthfeel. Alright, but a little thin and unbalanced.

column1: Zion Canyon Hop Valley India Pale Ale
column5: On tap at the brewpub. Amber pour with almost no head. Nose is hops, spicy. Flavor is fruity and bitter. Hard to even call this a real IPA, didn’t taste like one.

column1: Zion Canyon Hop Valley India Pale Ale
column5: Bottle: &nbsp Amberish, soft cloudiness, super strong carbonation, even stronger head, super large and fizzy, a few clumps of lacing. &nbsp Almost seems infected... well maybe at least. &nbsp Citrus powder like nose, hoppy yet very sweet. &nbsp Spritzy sweet citrus rind with soft hops that arent too bitter. &nbsp Doesn’t seem infected, or if it is then it is in its early stages. &nbsp Body and mouthfeel are moderate, oh, and spritzy. &nbsp Hop oil lingers, like a sweet hop oil. &nbsp Not terribly complex. &nbsp Comes across as a homebrew, but one that isn’t too bad. &nbsp Thanks for the freebie Dallas!

column1: Zion Canyon Hop Valley India Pale Ale
column5: I found this bottle at Ruby’s after the Zion area. It went down fast after a hike. An amber beer with a huge orangey head. The aroma has notes of citrusy hops, some spices, and malt. The flavor is sweet with notes of elderflowers, hops, malt, lemon peal, and caramel, leading to a very bitter finish. The body is a bit light.

column1: Zion Canyon Hop Valley India Pale Ale
column5: Tap - fair sized foamy head, medium copper color, strong piney hop aroma and flavor, decent malt backbone - better than expected

column1: Zion Canyon Hop Valley India Pale Ale
column5: amber coloured body with a off white head a spicy hoppy malty aroma a spicy hoppy fruity bitter taste with a bitter finish

"You don’t want that wedge," said braumeister Mike as he observed me sitting at the bar with my freshly served brew, thus illustrating the gap between brewpub owner and brewpub brewer. Chucking the lemon slice into my ice water, I looked at a caramel colored ale with a thick & creamy off-white head. The aroma was of overly ripe bananas, clove, and a soft blending of wheat & barley malts. Light in the mouth, the old banana dominated the flavor, smoothly blended with a light spiciness. Very refreshing at the end of a warm seaon. America’s Brewpub, Aurora, IL

Slightly thin, but an attractive pour, a clear dark, dark brown with a slender, bubbly brown head. The aroma is of freshly brewed coffee laced with creamy milk chocolate. Very smooth to drink, the coffee and chocolate blend nicely with lightly roasted barley and a mild nutty bitterness. Good sessionable stout. America’s Brewpub, Aurora, IL

column1: Americas Three Threads Bourbon Barrel Porter
column5: What I enjoy about this barrel aged Porter is that the Bourbon influence never dominates, but blends smoothly into the rich malt flavors. It pours a very dark brown with a slender tan head. The aroma is of rich, sweet malts, lightly roasted, with Bourbon and a dollop of chocolate. All are reflected in the taste. The Bourbon gains some strength in the finish, making the drink seem deceptively stronger than it is. Nice. America’s Brewpub, Aurora, IL

&#40draft&#41 Small brown head with black body. Aroma is medium sweet, cocoa, coffee/roast, light floral, smoked cheese. Taste is medium sweet, milk chocolate, coffee/roast, light smoke. Light-medium body, low carbonation, some creaminess.

On cask Feb 2008: Pours an opaque black with a pillowy well-lacing froth of tan head. Aroma of sweet dark malts and some good smoky notes and roasty dark chocolate. Body starts fairly full and dark malty sweet with some dark fruity notes and good salty smoky balance. A well-made and enjoyable smoked stout.

Draft at the brewpub - Poured a very dark black/brown in color with a creamy tan head that stuck around and provided some nice lacing on the glass. Aroma is strong of dark roasted malts, chocolate and much less of coffee/espresso with the smokiness present, but not overpowering. Flavor is roasty and bitter with a quite delicious smokiness that reminded me of smoked cheddar or Gouda. An excellent stout and the smoke only adds to it.

Sampled at brewpub. Pours black with a small tan head and has nice lacing. Aroma is rich and malty with liquid hickory smoke and a hint of chocolate. Flavor is creamy and smooth with smoked roasted malts, coffee and some notes of dark chocolate with a medium body and a dry finish. Decent brew

20080730 Tap at brewpub. Maybe it was the day because I did not really taste much smoke in the cheddar, either. Anyway, it was a good enough stout with nice dry palate and chicory aromas. This is the beer I got a pint of after the sampler was done.

A deep dark stout with a thick moka head. A lightly smoked aroma, a bit of bacon, and light chocolate fudge. In mouth, alight powdery chocolate wiht light peaty notes. A very decent smoked stout. On tap at brewpub, July 20, 2008.
A dark dark brown with a creamy brown head. Roasted malts on the aroma with a decidedly dry finish. roasted malt character, with the faintest, ever so faintest hint of pitted fruits.

This was a decent dry stout. Aroma was weak but could pick up roasted malt. Pour was a deep dark brown with a two finger tan head. Taste was typical nitrogenated draft. Very thin mouthfeel...no carbonation and an almost chalky roasted malt character. Some coffee comes out as it warms. Not bad for the style.

On nitro draught at the Wausau brewpub location, pours an opaque dark reddish brown brew with a creamy beige head that has some excellent lacing and retention from the nitro charge. Aroma of toasted dark malt, a touch of coffee, and smoked wood. Taste is full bodied, smooth, creamy with flavors of toasted dark malt, a touch of coffee, vanilla, flowery hops and even some lactose. Finish is smooth and creamy as its flavor with a semi-sweet toasted malt aftertaste. Looks like the Wausau brewed stout has more flavor than the Cranberry, PA location.

12/27/07 - Winter Road Trip ’07 - Draft sample at brewpub. Dar black with amber hues. Coffee colored head, foamy and long lasting. Good lacing. Roasted coffee nose, a bit sweet. Big roast character, little bitterness. Run-of-said-mill, but not bad. Drinkable, sessionable, pretty watery. Eh.

On tap. Rich coffee chocolate nose, with smoky bitterness, sesame seed bitterness, and dusty grain. Dark black clear with creamy tan lacing head. Medium-heavy watery body with smooth carbonation. Starts dry with carbonic tang and watery coffee notes. Not a huge taste profile, subdued and dry. Light chalky bitter finish and after.

Pours black with a long-lasting thick tan head. An aroma of black coffee and bitter chocolate. Not really any sort of hops detected. Tasted a lot like a smoked coffee with a bitter dry finish. There were some notes of chocolate and roasted malts as well.

On tap at the Wausau brewpub on 6/24/07: Pours an opaque black with a dense, creamy dark tan head. Aroma of lightly sweet and very roasty dark malts. Body starts fairly full with nice dark earthy roasted malty sweetness and some good bitter dark chocolate flavors lingering in the finish. A nice dry stout.

Name: Cashel Bay Dry Stout Date: 06/24/2007 Mode: Draft, Nitro Source: Brewpub black, lasting tan head, spidery lace, light dry roasted aroma, lots of dry roast flavor, touch of dark chocolate in the background, Aroma: 6/10; Appearance: 7/10; Flavor: 6/10; Palate: 6/10; Overall: 12/20 Rating: 3.1/5.0 Drinkability: 7/10 Score: **/4

On tap at the H&H in cranberry township PA near Pittsburgh. Nice place. Very dark opaque pour. Good aroma of roasty coffee, very interesting. Very nice creamy brown beige head, I want to touch it and then feel it between my fingers. Mild coffee and roasted flavors but it is not overwhelmingly bitter. OK flavor, no hop aroma. Moastly roastyness and possibly some malt flavors too. VEry little if any carbonation. There is a slight bitter linger but it is not hops bitterness....more roasty malts. Label says it has a low hop flavor. Pretty good example of an enjoyable dark beer. Better than guinness.

Sampled on draft at the Cranberry Twp PA location this beer poured a black color with light ruby highlights and a a medium sized creamy tan head. The aroma is a wonderful mix of strong roasty malts and coffee. The flavor is simply awful. Very very bitter and acidic coffee with sour malts and a gritty finish. The beer tastes like old cold McDonalds coffee. Uck!

column1: Rock Bottom Yorktown Bottoms Up Pilsner
column5: Tasty, refreshing Pilsener that I would place in the northern German style. It pours a bright yellow body with lots of beading and a frothy white head. Good lacing. The aroma has a light biscuity smell covered by a solid herbal/floral hopping. Good malt flavors balance out nicely with a sturdy floral bitterness. Nice and crisp, dry, bitter finish. Good. Rock Bottom Yorktown, Lombard, IL

column1: Rock Bottom Yorktown Bottoms Up Pilsner
column5: RB Mug Club draft. Yay! I get to pop the cap on this new place. Golden yellow pils color in this big glass mug. Tends toward a brassy yellow. A thin head coats the sides of the glass as it goes down. Pretty standard pilsener smell, but that’s what you expect from this style. Taste is pretty decent, crisp malts and a Boho hop profile that’s pretty sharp, and leaves a nice bitter aftertaste. Substantial mouthfeel.

Trübe, dunkel-orange Farbe mit einer ansehnlichen, weißen Schaumkrone. Ausbalancierter malziger und hopfiger Geruch mit leichter Getreidigkeit und floralen Noten. Getreidiger, malziger Geschmack mit umsichtig agierender Süße und floralem Hopfen. Leichter Körper mit vorsichtiger Kohlensäure, erfrischend und leicht zu trinken.

Draught at the brewpub. Orange, hazy body, with a big, cramy, lacing, off-white head. Aroma of honey, flowers, grass, grains, some fruits. Taste follows this, with some herbs. Medium, slick mouthfeel, with a soft carbonation. Finishes soft, moderate bitter, floral, grassy, slightly herbal. Good. Very easy, quaffable and quite clean, with nice floral and honey notes. One of the better beers of this style I’ve had.

Draught: Sweet grainy, malty nose. Some yeast. Low creamy head, hazy yellow color and a very fine carbonation. Smooth flavor, grainy, malty and and light sweet. Light astringent finish, few hop bitterness, Easy drinkable brew with a nice maltiness.

Considering the style, Scores ranging from 1 to 5, 5 being the most intense Appearance: Body: &nbsp Clear(1)->Murky(5) : 3 &nbsp &nbsp Pale Yellow(1)->Copper(5) : 2 &nbsp &nbsp Still(1)->Volcanic Sparkling(5) : 2 Head: &nbsp None(1)->Large(5) : 4 &nbsp &nbsp Lasting: 4 &nbsp &nbsp Lacing : 3 Aroma: Intensity : 3 &nbsp Yeast : 3 &nbsp Bread : 2 &nbsp Dough : XX &nbsp Esters : 2 &nbsp Phenols : XX &nbsp Dusty : XX &nbsp Spicy : 1 &nbsp Apple : XX &nbsp Banana : XX &nbsp Tropical Fruits : 2 &nbsp Brett : XX &nbsp Barnyard : XX &nbsp Leather : XX &nbsp Wood : XX &nbsp Vinous : XX &nbsp Cheese : XX &nbsp DMS : XX &nbsp Diacetyl : XX Sulfur : XX Malt : 3 &nbsp Pilsner : 4 &nbsp Pale : XX &nbsp Vienna : XX &nbsp Biscuity : XX &nbsp Toasty : XX &nbsp Hay : 2 &nbsp Caramel : XX &nbsp Honey : XX &nbsp Cereals : XX &nbsp Grainy : 3 &nbsp Wheat : 2 Hops : 2 &nbsp Noble(1)->American(5) : 1 &nbsp Leafy : XX &nbsp Perfume : XX &nbsp Orange : XX &nbsp Floral : 2 &nbsp Lemon/Lime : XX &nbsp Herbal : 2 &nbsp Grassy : 1 &nbsp Piney : XX Notes : Pepper : XX &nbsp Cloves : XX &nbsp Coriander : XX &nbsp Ginger : XX &nbsp Orange : XX &nbsp Earth : XX &nbsp Vanilla : XX &nbsp Oxidation : XX &nbsp Bubblegum : XX Flavor: Initial Flavor : Dry(1)->Sweet(5) : 3 &nbsp Finish Dry(1)->Sweet(5) : 3 &nbsp Sourness : 1 &nbsp Acetic : XX &nbsp Lactic : XX &nbsp Bitterness : 2 &nbsp Farmy : XX &nbsp Complex : XX &nbsp Length : XX Palate: Light(1)->Full(5) : 3 &nbsp Flat(1)->Fizzy(5) : 3 &nbsp Clean : XX &nbsp Sharp : XX &nbsp Watery : XX &nbsp Oily : XX &nbsp Chalk : XX &nbsp Astringent : XX &nbsp Alcohol : XX &nbsp Mineral : XX Comments: An unfiltered, yeasty, but fresh example with a certain wheaty zing, but above all, a quaffer of high quality.

Draught: Very yeasty aroma. notes of baker’s yeast. Dark brown color, off-white, creamy head. Flavor is malty, smooth and rich on roasted malt. Fruitiness, hints of coffee and a very roasty end with notes of coffee beans and burnt malt.

Considering the style, Scores ranging from 1 to 5, 5 being the most intense Appearance: Body: &nbsp Clear(1)->Murky(5) : 4 &nbsp &nbsp Pale Yellow(1)->Copper(5) : 5 &nbsp &nbsp Still(1)->Sparkling(5) : 2 Head: &nbsp None(1)->Large(5) : 3 &nbsp &nbsp Lasting: 3 &nbsp &nbsp Lacing : 3 Aroma: Intensity : 3 &nbsp Yeast : 3 &nbsp Bread : 3 &nbsp Apple : XX &nbsp Tropical Fruits : XX &nbsp DMS : XX &nbsp Diacetyl : XX Sulphur : XX &nbsp Malt : 4 &nbsp Pilsner : XX &nbsp Pale : XX &nbsp Vienna : 3 &nbsp Biscuity : XX &nbsp Hay : XX &nbsp Toasty : 3 &nbsp Caramel : 2 &nbsp Honey : XX &nbsp Cereals : 2 &nbsp Grainy : 2 Hops : 3 &nbsp Noble(1)->American(5) : 1 &nbsp Leafy : XX &nbsp Floral : 3 &nbsp Lemon/Lime : XX &nbsp Herbal : XX &nbsp Grassy : 1 &nbsp Flavor: Initial Flavor : Dry(1)->Sweet(5) : 3 &nbsp Finish Dry(1)->Sweet(5) : 3 &nbsp Sourness : 1 &nbsp Bitterness : 2 &nbsp Farmy : XX &nbsp Complex : XX &nbsp Length : XX Palate: Light(1)->Full(5) : 4 &nbsp Flat(1)->Fizzy(5) : 2 &nbsp Clean : 3 &nbsp Crisp : XX &nbsp Sharp : XX &nbsp Watery : XX &nbsp Oily : 2 &nbsp Chalk : XX &nbsp Astringent : XX &nbsp Alcohol : XX &nbsp Mineral : XX &nbsp Oxidation : XX Comments: Juicy, fresh, round and elegant dunkel with a fresh flowery hop note that balances its toasty, pruney malts nicely.
Draught (years ago): Grainy and malty aroma. Light yellow color, hazy. Frothy head. Pithy grainy and malty flavor. Remarkable hop notes, light flowerly end. Dry, quite bitter finish.
Draught at the brewery. Long lasting white head. Big hop aroma. Opaque golden color. Fruity hop taste. Medium bitterness.
Draught at the brewpub: Hazy yellow color, white foamy head. Malty aroma. Flavor ios pithy grainy and well hopped. Notes of grassy and light herbal hops. Medium bitter, dry finish.
Draught at the brewery. Fluffy white head. Clowdy golden color. Nice banans aroma. Big banans taste. Very det finish.

Draught at the brewpub: Yellow to golden color, creamy head. Fruity aroma, notes of oranges and citrus. Flavor is fruity, notes of oranges and cloves. Light astringent finish, light bitterness. A bit light bodied.

Beer No. 3 on my tour through Austria, Germany and Denmark. Draught at the brewpub. Quite difficult to find this brewpub. Slight cloudy darker golden coloured, medium sized white head, mild acidic nose with hint of cinnamon. Bitter hoppy herbal taste with hint of spices. Also some grassy notes in the bitter finish and long-lasting bitter aftertaste. One-dimensional. Not worth the effort of finding this place.
Heller, stark getreidiger Beginn. Weich bitter, angenehm hopfig, hohe Süffigkeit. Langer Abgang. Gut. 10/9/10/10//10
On tap at the Brewpub. Leicht trübes goldgelbes Bier mit schönem Schaum. Geruch malzig, getreidig, mild. Geschmack erfrischend malzig getreidig mit leichter Bittere im Abgang.
Dunkler, moderat röstiger Beginn. Herb-malziger Mittelteil, trocken, rund. Malziger, wenig röstiger und konstant herber Abgang. 10/8/8/9//8
On tap at the Brewpub. Klares braunes Bier mit geringer Schaumkrone. Geruch röstmalzig, würzig. Geschmack röstmalzig, würzig, leicht bitter.
Süffiger, hefig-herber Beginn. Mild bananig, leicht herb, süffig. Deutlich hefiger Mittelteil, süffig bleibend, rund. Gelungen, Standard. 10/8/7/9//8
On tap at the Brewpub. Trübes leuchtend oranges Weizen mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch hefig, malzig würzig. Geschmack hefig, leicht würzig bitter.

Considering the style, Scores ranging from 1 to 5, 5 being the most intense Appearance: Body: &nbsp Clear(1)->Murky(5) : 2 &nbsp &nbsp Pale Yellow(1)->Copper(5) : 2 &nbsp &nbsp Still(1)->Volcanic Sparkling(5) : 3 Head: &nbsp None(1)->Large(5) : 3 &nbsp &nbsp Lasting: 4 &nbsp &nbsp Lacing : 3 Aroma: Intensity : 3 &nbsp Yeast : 1 &nbsp Bread : XX &nbsp Dough : XX &nbsp Esters : XX &nbsp Phenols : XX &nbsp Dusty : XX &nbsp Spicy : XX &nbsp Apple : XX &nbsp Banana : XX &nbsp Tropical Fruits : XX &nbsp Brett : XX &nbsp Barnyard : XX &nbsp Leather : XX &nbsp Wood : XX &nbsp Vinous : XX &nbsp Cheese : XX &nbsp DMS : XX &nbsp Diacetyl : XX Sulfur : XX Malt : 3 &nbsp Pilsner : 3 &nbsp Pale : XX &nbsp Vienna : XX &nbsp Biscuity : 1 &nbsp Toasty : 2 &nbsp Hay : XX &nbsp Caramel : XX &nbsp Honey : XX &nbsp Cereals : 3 &nbsp Grainy : 2 &nbsp Wheat : 1 Hops : 3 &nbsp Noble(1)->American(5) : 1 &nbsp Leafy : 1 &nbsp Perfume : XX &nbsp Orange : XX &nbsp Floral : XX &nbsp Lemon/Lime : XX &nbsp Herbal : XX &nbsp Grassy : 3 &nbsp Piney : XX Notes : Pepper : XX &nbsp Cloves : XX &nbsp Coriander : XX &nbsp Ginger : XX &nbsp Orange : XX &nbsp Earth : XX &nbsp Vanilla : XX &nbsp Oxidation : XX &nbsp Bubblegum : XX Flavor: Initial Flavor : Dry(1)->Sweet(5) : 3 &nbsp Finish Dry(1)->Sweet(5) : 2 &nbsp Sourness : XX &nbsp Acetic : XX &nbsp Lactic : XX &nbsp Bitterness : 3 &nbsp Farmy : XX &nbsp Complex : XX &nbsp Length : XX Palate: Light(1)->Full(5) : 3 &nbsp Flat(1)->Fizzy(5) : 3 &nbsp Clean : 3 &nbsp Sharp : XX &nbsp Watery : XX &nbsp Oily : XX &nbsp Chalk : XX &nbsp Astringent : XX &nbsp Alcohol : XX &nbsp Mineral : XX Comments: A clean and fresh pilsner with a finely extracted bready base and crisp, grassy hops.
A hidden gem of a beer, from the Gerstl microbrewery and traditional restaurant in Wels, Upper Austria. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Considering the style, Scores ranging from 1 to 5, 5 being the most intense Appearance: Body: &nbsp Clear(1)->Murky(5) : 4 &nbsp &nbsp Pale Yellow(1)->Copper(5) : 1 &nbsp &nbsp Still(1)->Volcanic Sparkling(5) : 3 Head: &nbsp None(1)->Large(5) : 3 &nbsp &nbsp Lasting: 3 &nbsp &nbsp Lacing : 2 Aroma: Intensity : 3 &nbsp Yeast : 3 &nbsp Bread : XX &nbsp Dough : XX &nbsp Esters : 2 &nbsp Phenols : 3 &nbsp Dusty : XX &nbsp Spicy : 1 &nbsp Apple : 1 &nbsp Banana : 3 &nbsp Tropical Fruits : 1 &nbsp Brett : XX &nbsp Barnyard : XX &nbsp Leather : XX &nbsp Wood : XX &nbsp Vinous : XX &nbsp Cheese : 1 &nbsp DMS : XX &nbsp Diacetyl : XX Sulfur : XX Malt : 3 &nbsp Pilsner : XX &nbsp Pale : XX &nbsp Vienna : XX &nbsp Biscuity : XX &nbsp Toasty : XX &nbsp Hay : XX &nbsp Caramel : XX &nbsp Honey : XX &nbsp Cereals : XX &nbsp Grainy : 1 &nbsp Wheat : 3 Hops : 1 &nbsp Noble(1)->American(5) : 1 &nbsp Leafy : XX &nbsp Perfume : XX &nbsp Orange : XX &nbsp Floral : XX &nbsp Lemon/Lime : XX &nbsp Herbal : XX &nbsp Grassy : XX &nbsp Piney : XX Notes : Pepper : XX &nbsp Cloves : 1 &nbsp Coriander : XX &nbsp Ginger : XX &nbsp Orange : XX &nbsp Earth : XX &nbsp Vanilla : XX &nbsp Oxidation : XX &nbsp Bubblegum : 1 Flavor: Initial Flavor : Dry(1)->Sweet(5) : 3 &nbsp Finish Dry(1)->Sweet(5) : 3 &nbsp Sourness : 4 &nbsp Acetic : XX &nbsp Lactic : XX &nbsp Bitterness : XX &nbsp Farmy : 2 &nbsp Complex : XX &nbsp Length : XX Palate: Light(1)->Full(5) : 3 &nbsp Flat(1)->Fizzy(5) : 3 &nbsp Clean : 3 &nbsp Sharp : XX &nbsp Watery : 1 &nbsp Oily : XX &nbsp Chalk : XX &nbsp Astringent : XX &nbsp Alcohol : XX &nbsp Mineral : XX Comments: A rather acidic weizen that does not feel as fresh as most Austrian examples.

Bottled: Malty, grainy and sweetis aroma, notes of fresh worth. Light amber color, low head. Flavor is sweetish, grainy and malty. Remarkable hopped with herbal notes. Quite dry and biter, long finish.

Color was a clear dull gold with an off white head; I can’t remember if this was bottled or on tap. Aroma of bread and earthy hops. Flavor was the same. Quite bland with a bit of hops. Generic, but not bad.

Tap. Medium white head on a slightly unclear, golden body. Yeasty, floral, some biscuit/toast, spruce, dough. Light sweetness, a bit tart, medium bitterness. Good balance. Round medium body with fitting, very natural carbonation. Very pleasant, with good carbonation. Somewhere in between Pils and Zwickl.

Bottled: Yellow, cloudy color, small creamy head. Intensive herbal hop aroma, a bit flowerly and yeasty. Light grainy flavor, grassy, herbal hops and a dry, herbal bitter finish. Medium ton intensive bitter, long end. Nice, herbalpils.
From the bottle. Nutty, roasty, some dark chocolate. Light sweetness, turns more dry and softly bitter. Slick medium body with natural, pearly carbonation. Nice one.

Bottled 330ml. -Courtesy of and shared with Marko (thanks!). Murky brown coloured, small creamy off-white head, dry light nutty nose. Slight roasted malt, coffee and hint of spices with grassy notes near the end. Bit watery but all in all nice one.

Bottle from their stall at the Advent festival on the Graz main square. Poured a slightly amberish opaque brown body. TIny off white head. Sweetish nougat-dust nose, some rum? Hmm... Light sweetish nice dark malts/noughat taste, very light coffee. Some bitternessUnfortunately it’s way too light and subdued. If it was more pronounced it would’ve been lovely, and like this... just not that exciting. Still, they’re on the right way with this one.

Had this one some time ago. Poured a golden color, topped with an average white head. Malty aroma with quite obvious herbal and grassy notes. Taste is sweet, with lot’s oh herbal/grassy presence. Not that nice to be honest.

On tap at the brewpub. Almost clear deep golden beer with a mid-sized most good lasting off-white head. Aroma of caramelish malt, hay, mild spicy hops. Taste of caramelish malt, spicy hops, straw, sessionable

Karamellmalziger, recht hopfiger Geruch. Der erschnüffelte Hopfen gibt sich im Antrunk süßlich, das Bier überaus süffig. Grasig hopfig im Mittelteil, eine Getreidenote ist deutlich karamellig und wird dadurch süß, danach bleiben aber viele Aromen aus. Weing süßer, dafür getreidiger Abgang, bodenständig, süffig, minimal säuerlich. 10/10/12/9//11

Considering the style, Scores ranging from 1 to 5, 5 being the most intense Appearance: Body: &nbsp Clear(1)->Murky(5) : 4 &nbsp &nbsp Pale Yellow(1)->Copper(5) : 3 &nbsp &nbsp Still(1)->Sparkling(5) : 3 Head: &nbsp None(1)->Large(5) : 4 &nbsp &nbsp Lasting: 3 &nbsp &nbsp Lacing : 3 Aroma: Intensity : 3 &nbsp Yeast : 2 &nbsp Bread : 3 &nbsp Apple : XX &nbsp Tropical Fruits : 1 &nbsp DMS : XX &nbsp Diacetyl : XX Sulphur : XX &nbsp Malt : 2 &nbsp Pilsner : 3 &nbsp Pale : XX &nbsp Vienna : XX &nbsp Biscuity : XX &nbsp Hay : XX &nbsp Toasty : XX &nbsp Caramel : XX &nbsp Honey : 1 &nbsp Cereals : 2 &nbsp Grainy : 2 Hops : 4 &nbsp Noble(1)->American(5) : 1 &nbsp Leafy : 2 &nbsp Floral : 3 &nbsp Lemon/Lime : XX &nbsp Herbal : 2 &nbsp Grassy : 3 &nbsp Flavor: Initial Flavor : Dry(1)->Sweet(5) : 3 &nbsp Finish Dry(1)->Sweet(5) : 2 &nbsp Sourness : XX &nbsp Bitterness : 4 &nbsp Farmy : XX &nbsp Complex : 1 &nbsp Length : XX Palate: Light(1)->Full(5) : 2 &nbsp Flat(1)->Fizzy(5) : 3 &nbsp Clean : 3 &nbsp Crisp : 3 &nbsp Sharp : 3 &nbsp Watery : XX &nbsp Oily : XX &nbsp Chalk : XX &nbsp Astringent : 1 &nbsp Alcohol : XX &nbsp Mineral : XX &nbsp Oxidation : XX Comments: A strongly floral, herbal, leafy, bitter unfiltered lager whose malt appears a bit frail in comparison with its soft grainy notes, but gently bready from the yeast.

Draught at the brewpub: Fresh, light yeasty and grainy/malty aroma, light sweet and notes of honey. Big foamy head, honey color. Flavor is pithy, grainy and malty, light honey sweetness and a hop bitter finish. Dry, quite bitter and astringent finish. Quite tasty brew but a bit unbalanced. Massive, rough hop finish.
On tap at the brewpub. A clear pale golden beer with a mid-sized most good lasting white head. Aroma of phenolic esters, yeast. Taste of mid sweet banana, phenols, hints of clove, nothing special.

Considering the style, Scores ranging from 1 to 5, 5 being the most intense Appearance: Body: &nbsp Clear(1)->Murky(5) : 4 &nbsp &nbsp Pale Yellow(1)->Copper(5) : 1 &nbsp &nbsp Still(1)->Volcanic Sparkling(5) : 3 Head: &nbsp None(1)->Large(5) : 4 &nbsp &nbsp Lasting: 4 &nbsp &nbsp Lacing : 4 Aroma: Intensity : 3 &nbsp Yeast : 3 &nbsp Bread : XX &nbsp Dough : 3 &nbsp Esters : 3 &nbsp Phenols : 2 &nbsp Dusty : XX &nbsp Spicy : XX &nbsp Apple : XX &nbsp Banana : 2 &nbsp Tropical Fruits : 1 &nbsp Brett : XX &nbsp Barnyard : XX &nbsp Leather : XX &nbsp Wood : XX &nbsp Vinous : XX &nbsp Cheese : XX &nbsp DMS : XX &nbsp Diacetyl : XX Sulfur : XX Malt : 3 &nbsp Pilsner : XX &nbsp Pale : XX &nbsp Vienna : XX &nbsp Biscuity : XX &nbsp Toasty : XX &nbsp Hay : XX &nbsp Caramel : XX &nbsp Honey : 1 &nbsp Cereals : 3 &nbsp Grainy : 3 &nbsp Wheat : 3 Hops : 1 &nbsp Noble(1)->American(5) : 1 &nbsp Leafy : XX &nbsp Perfume : XX &nbsp Orange : XX &nbsp Floral : 1 &nbsp Lemon/Lime : XX &nbsp Herbal : XX &nbsp Grassy : XX &nbsp Piney : XX Notes : Pepper : XX &nbsp Cloves : 2 &nbsp Coriander : XX &nbsp Ginger : XX &nbsp Orange : XX &nbsp Earth : XX &nbsp Vanilla : XX &nbsp Oxidation : XX &nbsp Bubblegum : 3 Flavor: Initial Flavor : Dry(1)->Sweet(5) : 4 &nbsp Finish Dry(1)->Sweet(5) : 3 &nbsp Sourness : 2 &nbsp Acetic : XX &nbsp Lactic : XX &nbsp Bitterness : 1 &nbsp Farmy : XX &nbsp Complex : XX &nbsp Length : XX Palate: Light(1)->Full(5) : 4 &nbsp Flat(1)->Fizzy(5) : 4 &nbsp Clean : 2 &nbsp Sharp : XX &nbsp Watery : XX &nbsp Oily : XX &nbsp Chalk : XX &nbsp Astringent : XX &nbsp Alcohol : XX &nbsp Mineral : XX Comments: A tasty weizen with a delicious meringue-like expanding mouthfeel. Sweet, but polished and delicately grainy. Fresh stuff!

Drauth at Kemmet Bräu: Aroma is fruity and flowerly, light malty. Pale golden colr, light hazy, fizzy carbonation, creamy off-white h ead. Flavor is malty, light sweet, light grainy, fruity and hoppy. Not bad but a bit unharmonic.
Draught at Kemmet Bräu: Fresh malty aroma, caramel and light fruitiness. Chestnut brown color, off-white head. Flavor is malty, light roasty, notes of dark chocolate, cacao, only light sweetness.

Draught at Kemmet Bräu: Aroma is wheaty flowerly and light fruity. Yellow to orange color, light hazy, off-white creamy head. Flavor is wheaty, light yeasty and a bit spicy. Bit light bodied. Unharmonic and a bit thin.
On Tap at the Brewpub: Dunkles Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch leicht röstmalzig, Hefe. Geschmack leicht röstmalzig, etwas herb. Gut trinkbares Dunkles!
Draught at the brewpub: Malty aroma. Small head, off-white head, quicky diminishing. Flavor is malty, hints of berries and chocolate. Light roasty in the end but a bit light bodied.
On Tap at the Brewpub: Leicht trübes goldgelbes Bier mit schönem Schaum. Geruch leicht malzig, hopfig, hefig. Geschmack leicht malzig hefig und dann auch etwas herb.

Draught at the brewpub: Aroma is fresh, light yeasty, hints of malt. Small foamy head, yellow to pale golden color. Flavor is malty, light grainy and distinct hopped. Dry, light bitter finish. Solid Helles.

Considering the style, Scores ranging from 1 to 5, 5 being the most intense Appearance: Body: &nbsp Clear(1)->Murky(5) : 4 &nbsp &nbsp Pale Yellow(1)->Copper(5) : 5 &nbsp &nbsp Still(1)->Sparkling(5) : 2 Head: &nbsp None(1)->Large(5) : 3 &nbsp &nbsp Lasting: 2 &nbsp &nbsp Lacing : 2 Aroma: Intensity : 3 &nbsp Yeast : 3 &nbsp Bread : 3 &nbsp Apple : 2 &nbsp Tropical Fruits : XX &nbsp DMS : XX &nbsp Diacetyl : XX Sulphur : XX &nbsp Malt : 3 &nbsp Pilsner : XX &nbsp Pale : XX &nbsp Vienna : 3 &nbsp Biscuity : XX &nbsp Hay : XX &nbsp Toasty : 2 &nbsp Caramel : 1 &nbsp Honey : XX &nbsp Cereals : 2 &nbsp Grainy : XX Hops : 2 &nbsp Noble(1)->American(5) : 1 &nbsp Leafy : 2 &nbsp Floral : XX &nbsp Lemon/Lime : XX &nbsp Herbal : XX &nbsp Grassy : 1 &nbsp Flavor: Initial Flavor : Dry(1)->Sweet(5) : 4 &nbsp Finish Dry(1)->Sweet(5) : 4 &nbsp Sourness : 1 &nbsp Bitterness : 1 &nbsp Farmy : XX &nbsp Complex : XX &nbsp Length : XX Palate: Light(1)->Full(5) : 3 &nbsp Flat(1)->Fizzy(5) : 2 &nbsp Clean : XX &nbsp Crisp : XX &nbsp Sharp : XX &nbsp Watery : 2 &nbsp Oily : XX &nbsp Chalk : XX &nbsp Astringent : XX &nbsp Alcohol : XX &nbsp Mineral : XX &nbsp Oxidation : XX Comments: A fruity and perhaps overly sweet, highly juicy, plumy, blueberry-like dunkel with a certain metallic edge in the finish.

Draught at the brewpub. Hazy golden coloured, medium sized white head that went away slowly. Yeasty, hoppy and light herbal with notes of grain and fruits. Mild bitter finish. Very pleasant beer but Dunkles is better.

Draught at the brewpub. Cloudy dark brown coloured, pale brown head, extremely lively carbonation, light roasted nose. Roasted malt, caramel and light vinous taste with notes of bitter coffee in the finish.
Pours a copper color with a white foam head. Aroma is bread and spicy yeast. Flavor is bread, butter. Good carbonation. Doesn’t have much of the advertised flavors. Okay.
Draft - Wheat and light citrus. Hazy pale gold with a decent white head. Light soured wheat and citrus with a bit of spice in the finish. Not particularly well done.

Tap: Super hazed, pear colored body with barely any head... only outlined by a bone-white, thin collar. Aroma has notes of musty grains, dry wheat, creamy orange & lemon zest, & a touch of biscuits & yeast. Perhaps just a faint hint of coriander/clove?? Taste is fairly cereal grain heavy with some more must, lemon zest, citrus spritz, light orange, pale malt, & a finish filled with wheat & slight metallic notes. Easy drinker, but relatively boring & lifeless. Not bad, but not much going on, either.
On tap at Sherwood. Poured an amber color with a small sized head. Citrus, spices with some wheat in the tastes. Thinner all the way around.

On tap at the brewpub. Hazy yellow-brown body, thin off-white head. Citrusy, almost lemony nose, with orange peel and hints of pepper. Wheaty, grassy body with hints of coriander; also wet hay. Sugary and prickly and overall atypical for a wit. Long, tangy finish. Marginal.

Drank this in Bayern and didn’t like it one bit. It has a draining heavy grey taste and it is the kind of Hefeweizen which tastes like it’s got sucked all the life out of it. It’s like liquid stones were mixed with weissbeer...

had this opening night served by Ray. poured a cloudy pink grapefruit color with small off white head. aroma fruity, got thoses peaches and apricots some citrus. flavor, the peaches stand right out there and you get that nice smoothness from the apricots hints of yeast. good hot day after mowing the lawn beer.
This is a different take on IPA. Ray, the brewer is bucking the trend. Nice Colombus nose. Let it warm up a bit and taste the Carafa Malt. Not your everyday IPA

had this opening night severed by Ray. poured a nice dark golden color with off white head. aroma the malt came out first for me than the hops, some brown sugar and citrus. flavor for a hop head the hops where not as strong as I would of like them but this was very good the malts came out with some citrus at th finish. this kinda of reminded me of GI IPA and I like that beer.
Draft - Light roast. Deep brown black with a small beige head. Molasses, roast and a long roast and light bitter finish. Very dry.

MiBGWF 2009: Deep brown nearly opaque with ruby highlights, lasting tan head. The aroma has notes of roasted and charred malts, bakers chocolate, walnut, hint of coffee and plum, and an earthy yeast ester. The taste is rather straight forward sweet and black malts with a fruity layer. Some very light hop and coffee bitterness as well. Finished with a smack of smoky character. The mouth feel is very good for the genre, oily and lush. All told a darn good beer, another solid stout from this brewery.

Draft at brewery. Dark brown to black in color with a dark tan head. Mostly dark chocolate on the nose but I can pick up some roasted malt and smokiness. The chocolate and smokiness are also the dominant flavors with just a faint hint of coffee beans. Definitely full bodied but not excessively heavy, there is a slight creaminess to the mouthfeel. Very enjoyable brew that I regularly order whenever I’m there.

In short: A very solid roasted stout. Nothing new but very solid. How: Tap at brewpub The look: Black body with a beige ring of foam In long: Plenty of roasted malts with a light roasted coffee bean flavour and a some prunes in the finish. Full bodied, Medium carbonation. Big body but just dry enough to make it highly drinkable. What I really liked about this beer is how much it was roasted and dry yet still felt somewhat juicy and creamy. The Irish part of the name is probably inspired by how tempting it is to get drunk on this highly drinkable beer.

Sample@ WBE: Tasty, but not what you would expect from an Irish Stout. Pours a mahogany color, with amber highlights. Has a sweet, chocolate malt aroma with a bit of a smoked character to it. Very interesting, and it makes me want to try more from this brewery.

I am not an Irish stout kind of guy. Excellent beer, wish I would have made this post sooner rather than later to give more detail. Excellent color and roastiness. Not as dry as I would have expected. I will be returning to this brewery and post some better reviews.

had this opening night. served by Ray. poured black with a small tan head because the glass was full of beer which was a good thing. aroma wow all that roastyness coming out of the glass , dark chocolate, coffee, malts and barley. flavor no disappointment here, the taste buds were happy getting that nice smooth chocolate with a touch of coffee and malts, brown sugar,cherries has it warmed. nice thin mouth feel to this very easy to drink.had a couple of these good beer congrats Ray

Tap at brew pub: Was an oily black with a nice sized tan head that dissipated rather quickly. Aroma was malty, some chocolate, and a coffee scent too. Taste was nicely malty, chocolate, a slight coffee tinge, and some caramel notes throughout. Palate was rather thin, not really watery, but some nice malty bitterness on the back end. Overall, It was a decent Irish Stout, and had some nice flavors and aroma throughout. I will go back to sample the rest of their beers.

had this opening night severed by Ray. poured a nice amber with a off white to light tan to head. aroma malts and hopps with some caramel. flavor gotta love those malts with a nice hops finish with a touch of caramel at the finish. another good one.

Draught at the brewpub. After two unsuccessful attempts (closed roads and closed pub) I finally managed to get here. Pale golden coloured, small to medium white head that went away slowly, yoghurty grainy nose. Weak hoppy, butterscotch and cereals with short bitterish finish. Quite letdown after great Forstner beers. Too much effort for the few that I got.

Draught at the brewpub, the only one they seemed to have at the moment. Poured a golden body with a thick white head that stayed for a while. Lively carbonation, bordering with fizzy. A light nose, grainy and oily, the taste not being far off... grainy and yoghurty, a light herbal hop presence going into the aftertaste. Biting carbonation. An ordinary lager... one could suspect industrial presence, but not even nearly like with Kugel Bräu.

Bottle: Golden color, low head. Caramelic, buttery nose, malty. Malty flavor, fruity. OK.

Draught at the Sajacher. Slight hazy yellow coloured, small white head, odd nose; something between meat and sausages. The kitchen was closed at the time but the taps were near. Nice malty and weak hoppy aroma with some herbal grassy notes. So-so beer.
Bottle at Braukunst Live 2014, pours black with a wine and treacle nose, touches of burnt caramel and red fruit on the palate, the finish is dry-bitter and slightly watery.

2l growler from the brewpub - many thx Adrian shared 2014-07-29 Göteborg AR: caramel, wee bready AP: hazy amber, frothy white steady head F: fizzy bready, citrus, syrup, caramel, honeycake - feels more like a bock then a weissen...
On tap at the Brewpub. Trübes braunes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch hefig, würzig, fruchtig. Geschmack hefig fruchtig, würzig, Röstmalz.

getrunken am Krampustag 2017 Der schwarze Rabe ist ein Wiener Wirtshaus im bierigen 16. Bezirk. Die kleine hauseigene Brauanlage wird aber nur selten angeworfen. Das ausgeschenkte Hausbier kommt von der Villacher Brauerei. Es ist bernsteinfarben und hat einen interessanten Geschmack: Ganz am Anfang haut einen fast die Kohlensäure um und dann schlägt die süße Malzigkeit zu, die aber schnell nachlässt. Hinten raus, nach einem kurzen hopfigen Höhepunkt wird es dann sehr wässrig. Ein wahrer Regenbogen an Aromen, die aber nicht ganz ausgewogen sind und auch besser harmonieren könnten. Das eigentlich schöne, rustikale Lokal kriegt außerdem Abzüge, weil es noch immer ein reines Raucherlokal ist, was aber offenbar der Ottakringer Unterschicht und den Senioren geschuldet sind, die die meisten Gäste stellen.

0,3l from tap at the brew pub. Amber clear colour, small off white head. Smells malty sweet, caramel, lightly fruity, plums, Ok smell. Light to medium body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. Tastes malty sweet, caramel, plums. Finishes lightly sweet and with notes of plums and sweetness. Okish, not very special though..

On tap at Schwarzer Rabe. Aroma hints at a straightforward malty caramelly beer. Clear amber colour. Stable white head. Taste thin bodied, empty. Lightly metallic, dull caramel. After all remains somewhat drinkable. Not entirely bad.
Tap at pub. Dark golden color with thick white head. Malt, caramel in aroma. Taste, caramel, light hops, diacetyl, wet mop.

Draught at the brewpub. Dark amber, clear body, with a medium, creamy, lacing, off-white head. Moderate, sweet aroma of berries, bread, smooth malts. Tastes of sweet berries, honey, bread, grains, subtle bitter hops. Medium, oily mouthfeel, with a lively carbonation. Finishes quite light, sweet, bready, a bit hoppy. OK. Clean, easy, but overall too sweet for my liking. Lacks more hops in my opinion.
Imported from old beer-rating-app. I had this beer draught at Schwarzer Rabe pub in Ottakring last summer. I remember it as an extremely drinkable and mild beer. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft @ the brewpub. Pours a dark golden pale amber color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty grainy caramel aroma. Fruity malty caramel flavor with weak yeasty hints and also weak grassy hints. Has a fruity malty grainy caramel finish.

From tap at the brewpub. Pours clear and golden orange with a huge white head. Aroma is toasted malt, light grassy. Medium sweet, toasted and light grassy hoppy flavoured. Mixed bitter and slight sweet finish.
Draught at Schwarzer Rabe. Clear golden coloured with a small off-white head. Malty aroma of fruits, hay and hops. Malty flavour of hay, grass and hops. Dry hoppy finish.

Draught at Schwarzer Rabe (5.0%, brewed at Villacher). Clear deep golden, small creamy head. Buttery and mild. An unassuming sweet and maklty beer with low hpo rate. Good amounts of soft, sweet buttery malt is what chracaterizes this beer.

This was an apricot beer, but I was not sure of the base. I suspect that some wheat is used. The body was cloudy light orange. The aroma was apricots with basil and other herbs. The taste was dried apricots with some very mild bubblegum. There was also some strawberry character. This had little carbonation and was very smooth.
On tap at the Brewpub. trübes goldgelbes Bier mit geringer Schaumkrone. Geruch malzig herb, grasig. Geschmack herb, malzig, grasig.

On tap at the Brewpub. Trübes goldenes Weizen mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch hefig, fruchtig bananig, Geschmack hefig fruchtig, reife Bananen, leicht würzig.

On tap at the brewpub. A slightly hazy dark golden beer with a mid-sized most good lasting white head. Aroma of phenols, mild banana. Taste of phenolic yeast, esters, mild spicy banana. Nothing special.

Draught at s’ Kloane Brauhaus. Orange-amber, hazy body, with a big, stable, fluffy, lacing, white head. Quite light aroma of banana, vanilla, sweet bread, some spices. Tastes of ripe banana, vanilla, spices, bread, some orange, some dried fruits Medium, a bit oily mouthfeel, with a quite fizzy carbonation. Finishes sweet, spicy, yeasty, with vanilla, banana, some bread. Good. Quite light, especially the nose, but still quaffable and fresh. More on the sweet side, with banana and vanilla dominating. Overall nothing special and not as good as their Kellerbier, but solid enough.

On tap at the brewery. Dark orange to amber color big white head. Aroma is fruity, banana and light spice, yeast. Aftertaste is short with amaretto/almond. Taste is sweet sticky. Medium to full body, heavy carbonation, dusty texture, smooth finish.
On tap at the brewery: Pours hazy orange with a foamy white head. Aroma of banana, coriander, lemon. Taste is pretty sweet, lots of lemon and banana at the end. Light body, little thin. Decent beer.
Drunk in draught in the brewpub in Salzburg. Lovely dark hoppy weizen beer. Amongst the best drunk of this style. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tap @ Kloane , Salzburg. Pours hazy dark orange with a small stable head. Overwhelmingly sweet and estery. Lots of wheat and sweet overripe banana.

On draught at the Kloane brewery in Salzburg. Orange gold colour mid hazy lasting off white head. Good solid weisse, a little empty on the ripe banana orange and lemon aroma. Soft citrus version. OK. Decent. Holds up.

Sehr milder Antrunk von leichter, kaum vorhandener Hefigkeit. Muffig wässrig im Mittelteil,es geschieht keine Aromenentfaltung. So gleitet das Bier trocken hefig au. Unscheinbares und monotones Weizen. 9/7/6/6//6

Draught at the brewpub (about two years ago): Orange, light brown color. Sourly nose, lemon, bit milk sour. Flavor has notes lemons, sourly and a bit sweet. Wheat, oranges, spices and peppery. Quite pleasant wheat.

Draught at the brewpub. Muddy brown coloured, small to medium sized off-white head that went away fast, fruity caramel nose. Moderate malty, yeasty and fruity with notes of caramel and spices. Touch of juniper in the finish. Good weizen.
On tap at the Brewpub. Trübes dunkel orangegelbes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch hefig, malzig fruchtig. Geschmack hefig, fruchtig, leicht bananig, etwas würzig.
Tap @ Stöfflhütte. Copper color. Wheaty aroma with peach. Hint of firewood in the flavor. Pear in the aftertaste. Interesting weizen.
Draught in the Omni Hotel tap room Pittsburgh. Bright to deep orange color with bitterness and hops and citrus.
Bottle. Clear gold in color. It has a white head and nice thin lacing. The hoppy aroma is citrus with notes of mango, orange and light grapefruit. The taste is slightly bitter. Very good.
Orange pour with a white head. Good lacing throughout. Hints of lemon and grass in the aroma. Taste has hints of lemon in front end with a good bitter hop finish.
On tap at the brew pub in Pittsburgh. Well balanced IPA, not over the top- I think the bitterness is controlled. Very light gold color.

Slightly cloudy, dark yellow pour with a beige, lasting foam. Strong resinous nose that is much more fruity on the tongue. A little malt sweetness, but very much a west coast IPA with a lingering pepper touch.
Clear gold pour white head. Big resin smell. Mellow flavor to start bitter end.

bottle @ House of 1000 Beers / New Kensington PA --- Cloudy dark amber, off-white head that sinks to a bubbly rim, sheets of lace. Taste is malt that begins to sweeten through the swallow before being snuffed out by citrus hops. The hops add unsweetened tea during a long finish. Not sure this one is fresh.

Pittsburgh, PA - on tap at Church Brew Works. Slight haze to the medium copper pour, light bone colored head that clings to the edge of the glass. Heavy spruce aroma, some papaya fruitiness, maple syrup sweetness. Flavor has some citrus accents, a bit of pineapple fruitiness, some caramel sweetness, Kind of a throwback to old-timey West Coast IPA. Thickish mouthfeel.
Tap. Clear light golden. Mild citrus pine aroma. Taste is harsh herbal hops, very slight caramel, unbalanced.
Draft - pours orange white head -nose/taste of orange peel, citrus peel and caramel - medium body

Eine Brauerei mit nur einem Bier: Einem Kristallweizen. Zudem auch mein erstes Kristallweizen vom Fass. Mild zitrusartiger Antrunk auf mildem Level mit minimalen Malz-und Getreidetönen. Etwas trocken, zum Ende herber und spritziger. Nicht sehr aromenstark, wenig würzig-malzig. Für ein Kristallweizen aromatisch und gelungen! 12/8/9/9//9

Draught at the brewery: Aroma is lemonlike, notes of cidre and yeast. Light remembrance of lambic. Flavor has light notes of fruits, hints of roasted malt and some citrus flavor with orange notes. Good wheat with nice burnt malt components. Quite dry finish.

getrunken im Frühling 2013 Irgendwie habe ich mir von diesem Bier etwas mehr erwartet, immerhin rühmt sich das Braugasthaus in der Innsbrucker Innenstadt, der ehemalige k.u.k.-Bierlieferant gewesen zu sein. Ich habe mein Theresienbräu leider nicht im Lokal selbst genossen, möglicherweise muss der Flair des Gasthauses wirken, um einen besseren Geschmack und eine bessere Bewertung zu erzielen. Sollte man in Innsbruck sein, so sollte man schon vorbeikommen, aber eine Flasche (gibts nur als 1l mit Pfand, den man aber nur dort einlösen kann) extra importieren, sollte man nicht.
On tap at the brewpub. Creamy thick head, aroma, resin, floral, bread..Pleasently malty-caramelish mouthfeel, slightly oily, diacetil in limits, bready, bitter caramel after taste.

(draught) murky amber colour with a frothy off-white head. aroma of candle wax and earthy malts, with some notes of bran flakes, herbal hops and yeast. flavour is mostly grainy malts and yeast, slightly chalky, with a light touch of sugar icing and a semi-dry husky finish. medium-bodied with average carbonation.

On tap at the brewpub. Bright cloudy orange color, coarse bubbly white head, funky smell kinda sulphur, fizzy. Aroma is grass, hay, leaves, earth, boiled vegetables. Some bread and cookies on the malt aide but very thin together with dougy yeast. Taste flattish, mild bitter. Extreme carbonation, raw, light body, watery texture dry finish mild bitter.

On tap at the Brew Pub. Pours out a copper color top with a cream white head. Nose is bread malts some tartness popcorn butter. Taste is more of the bready malts some buttery popcorn again and a little floral hop.

Tap @ The brewpub, Innsbruck. Pours hazy orange color with a large head. Sweet hay-toffee aroma, stuffy, diacetyl is strong on this one, grain. Flavor is buttery, grainy and a bit hay dry, some malts. Not very pleasant. 4323

Draught @ the brewpub, Innsbruck. Aroma has strong diacetyl tones and it feels musty - and even a bit contaminated. Flavour has cereal-like malt, diacetyl, some tartness and mild floury tones. Not good, feels slightly contaminated and there’s too much diacetyl too. Closer to a zwickel than märzen by looks and taste.

Tap at the brewpub. Hazy amber-orange color with white head. Aroma is bready, malty, fruchtgummi, juicy malts, a bit buttery. Taste is bready, again juicy malts, caramel, buttery, and a little tart touch, a bit nutty. Bready-grainy aftertaste. Natural but high carbonation. More moreish than expected for sub5 ABV, but does not completely work out.

draught@brewpub - hazy light amber-orange beer with a moderate head retention; gently spicy and herbal hoppiness; moderate malt backbone; crisp and bitter, quite dry spicy and flowery hoppy finish - well-made but deeply boring
Golden to amber colour, medium sized dense off-white head; aroma of grains, hay, grass and some barnyard; taste of a malt-dominant lager with some herbal and grassy hops; correct and refreshing beer

In Tirol wird relativ viel Weißbier gebraut, da Bayern nicht weit ist. Darum hat dieser Braustil hier auch eine gewisse Tradition. Dies ist jetzt nicht das große aromenreiche Weizenbier, aber es ist durchaus gut trinkbar und erfrischend. Ein bisschen mehr Fruchtigkeit würde nicht schaden.

(draught) hazy golden colour with a frothy white head. aroma of canned peaches and yeast, slightly perfumed, with some notes of watermelon and pine syrup. flavour is mostly powdered sugar and grainy wheat, with a very faint hint of butterscotch, some caramel and a soft brown sugar finish. medium-bodied with soft carbonation.

On tap at the Brew Pub. Pours out a hazy muddy orangish golden color topped with a white head. Nose is spice floral belg yeast some fruit notes and banana. Taste is more of the banana bread note spice and a little citrus.
Draught @ the brewpub, Innsbruck. Aroma has sweet banana tones and hints of flour. Flavour has some tartness, mild banana tones, bubblegum and some lemon. Foamy palate. A weisse on the tart side.

Tap @ The brewpub, Innsbruck. Pours hazy golden color with a large white head. Sweet banana on the nose, orange, wheat, spice. Flavor is wheaty with apricot notes, carbonation its a bit strong, yeasty spiciness, faint banana esters. Harsh sharpness on the aftertaste. 4333

draught@brewpub - cloudy golden-blond beer; aroma of ripe banana dominates, hints of cumin and cloves; fairly sweet, medium-bodied, solid but not excessive carbonation; very ripe fruity finish (banana, grapefruit) where the spicy tones stay behind

0,33l from tap. Orange hazy colour, small white head. served rather cold. smells of spices, flowery, belgian yeasty, some peach. nice smell. medium body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes of belgian yeast, spices, peppery, peach, light banana, some tobacco. finishes lightly dry with notes of spices, some yeast and peach. quite good one, refreshing. beer was served rather cold, not sure if a warmer beer would improve the beer, but overall good one.
Draught at the brauhaus Cloudy greenish gold color with compact head. Lightly spicy and estery, rather dry, but overall it’s too watery. No bitterness. Mediocre.
Hefetrübes orangegolden mit durchschnittlicher Schaumkrone. Hefig, leicht fruchtig, Banane, süßlich.
On tap at the brewpub. Trübes goldenes Bier mit einer geringen weißen schaumkrone. Geruch sehr bananig, hefig, gering zitronig. Geschmack trocken hefig, bananig, wenig citrusfrüchte.

Draught at Falstaff Bierfestival 2008 (Vienna): Sourly aroma, intensive notes of wet, unaerated cellar and carbonic acid. Hazy, light yellow color and a creamy head. Sourly, grainy flavor with cellar and unclean components. Dry, bitter finish. Unclean brewed beer.
Dezent herber Antrunk mit wenig Süße. Im Mittelteil etwas getreidig, süffig, dann wieder herber, dafür nimmt dann aber die Würzigkeit ab. Naja... 10/8/10/8/12/8

Swing-top bottle (courtesy of Koelschtrinker - danke - labelled Wipptaler Tennengold Naturtrueb). Sweet barley malt, cherry and grass aroma. Hazy golden yellow color with giant head and moderate effervescence. Lightly sweet barley malt and moderately bitter herbal hops flavor. Nice hoppy Helles.

Bottle. Aroma sweet, honeyish, light diacetyl. Clear golden colour. Taste is assertively hoppy, high bitterness, quite some astringency of unidentified origin, hops flavour seems stale. Rather below average beer, unbalanced.
Bottle kindly shared by Werckmeister, many thanks. Golden color with medium white head. Sweet malty aroma with diacetyl. Malty taste with butterscotch, caramel.
Bottle. Pours golden color, white head. Aroma is malty, bit fruity. Taste is medium sweet, lightly bitter, malty, caramel, bit hoppy.
330ml bottle at home. golden, shiny, clear color. white head. smells grainy. light bord, light carbonation, taste of grains. light bubbly, light dry bitter finish. decent but not very interesting.

330ml bottle. Not absolutely clear, orangey golden colour with average, frothy, half-way lasting, minimally lacing, white head. Cautious grainy and minimally strawy aroma, very light hints of floral hop. Taste is bitter hoppy, chalky, mineral, grassy, subtle pale malt sweetness.

getrunken vor Ort auf der Terasse an einem heißen Sommertag Ein wunderbar malzbetonetes Bier, das aber auch nicht auf die Würze vergisst. Es lässt sich wunderbar trinken und erfreut Stil- und Vieltrinker gleichermaßen. Gut zum Wirtshausessen und auch als Erfrischung.
Draught at the brew gasthof. Lasting beige head. Opaque dark golden color. Not clear aroma with a bit of butter. Firm bitterness and good body.

Leicht eingetrübte, goldene Farbe mit weißer Schaumkrone. Malziger, getreidiger, leicht hopfiger Geruch. Geschmacklich malzig, getreidig, leicht würzig, leicht hopfig. Mittlere Süße mit leichter Bitterkeit, mittlerer Körper mit spürbarer Kohlensäure.

Draught at Melker Stiftskeller, Vienna as "Haselböck Zwickel". Dark golden, hazy body, with a big, creamy, lacing, white head. Aroma of grains, bread, honey, flowers, grass. Tastes quite similar, but sweeter and with some soapy notes. Medium, oily mouthfeel, with a lively carbonation. Finishes grainy, bready, moderate bitter, a bit sweet, floral, grassy. Good. Quite rich, with nice grainy, bready notes and sweet honey. Tastes a bit unclean though, with some soapy notes. Overall solid enough, but nothing special.
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein goldgelbes Bier mit ordentlicher Schaumkrone. Geruch malzig, würzig. Geschmack würzig malzig, leicht fruchtig, minimale Bitterkeit.

330ml bottle. Clear golden colour with average, frothy, half-way lasting, minimally lacing, white head. Cautious grainy and minimally strawy aroma, a cautious touch of floral hop. Taste is moderately bitter hoppy, cautious fruity hints of green apple and apple parings, pale malty basis with very subtle sweetness; fairly lasting bitter hoppy finish. Simple, precise, accurately crafted.

bottle at home. light amber color, off white head. smell of malty sweetness, grains, light flowery, grass notes. full body, nice mouthfeel, bubbly, tastes grainy, light sweetness, grass notes, honey, light flowery, dry hoppy finish. I like it. Quite sweet, but has a certain hop punch to it.

330ml bottle [as FestBock]. Clear, orangey, deep golden to amber colour with small to average, frothy to creamy, half-way lasting, moderately lacing, white head. Rather expressionless malty aroma, cautious fruity hoppy overtones, banana, pear. Taste is minimally sweet malty, hints of banana, honey, baked banana, dry hoppy overtones, hints of nut parings. Light, clean, soft.

330ml bottle. Nice, almost clear, reddish, copper colour with average, creamy, fairly lasting, minimally lacing, off-white head. Malty aroma, dry hoppy overtones with a touch of red berries and their parings. Taste is toasty malty, slightly fruity, hints of red fruit, a nuttily touch, subtle sweetness; super-soft palate. An unexpected, tiny nugget.
