column5: Clear dark brown with a small off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, lots of coffee and light buttery. Flavor is medium sweet and light bitter. Sweet finish. 290814

column1: Rock Bottom King of Prussia Nevermore Lager
column2: King of Prussia, Pennsylvania, United States
column5: Nice head with good duration. Color is dark brown. Aroma and taste are caramel, toffee, butter, malt, coffee and hops.

column1: Rock Bottom King of Prussia Keller Marzen
column2: King of Prussia, Pennsylvania, United States
column5: Cask-poured. Nice orange-brown color with a sweet aroma. Taste was malty-sweet & very grainy. Tasty, very sweet brew that probably tasted much better from a cask. Better than most beers in this style.

column1: Rock Bottom King of Prussia Keller Marzen
column2: King of Prussia, Pennsylvania, United States
column5: On tap at the KoP location [10oz]. On cask. Even though this one was a cask pour, it was ice cold. Poured a deep and hazy amber color with an averaged sized off white head. Aromas of bread, oranges (citrus), caramel and I was getting some pine. Tastes of oranges, caramel, and citrus.

column1: Rock Bottom King of Prussia Keller Marzen
column2: King of Prussia, Pennsylvania, United States
column5: On cask...pours a hazy deep orange amber with a foamy lacing and sustaining off white head that left lots of lacing. Aroma of grainy malt and some floral. Flaovr of citrus hop, very smooth, cereal, grains, malty, grapefruit and light bitterness.
Draught: Poured a hazy orange with a creamy white head. Aroma is fruity. Taste is fruit and hops, its smooth overall. Although has just enough hops bitterness to liven up the finish.

Draught at IBF 2009, Milan Blond color;creamy head. Simple Pils, more creamy than crispy, with good bitterness, but difficult to find the Nelson Sauvin. Extremely light fruity aroma. The final is well balanced and interesting.
Draught: Poured a reddish orange amber with a creamy off white head. Aroma was very light. The flavor was mix of caramel and malt, finish was sweet.
Draught at IBF 2009, Milan Hazy red amber color; creamy head. Light caramel aroma. Medium bodied, caramel flavor, medium-low sweetness, correct bitterness. Ordinary.
note leggermente tostate non molto corpo lieve luppolo leggero tostato abbastanza secca ma poco intensa
A little sweet. Lager. Clear golden. Moderate carbonation. Smooth finish. Bland but easy. Good summer session

Draught at Torri Beer Fest. Hazy deep golden color with thick creamy tan head and soft carbonation. Aroma of grassy hops, malt and some citrus or orange peel. Taste starts sweet malty and is followed yeasty sourness and refreshing fruitiness. Mouthfeel is more on a blander side, aftertaste is relatively bitter. Medium body, slick texture and soft carbonation in palate. Better than industrial lagers, but still nothing special...
From tap. Pours hazy yellow. White head. Estery. Slight sourish. Fruity. Milky. Fruity and slight spurish finish.

01/08 Draught at the brewpub. It poured murky golden to orange body with medium sized head. Sourish aroma, but much less hops this time with banana, fruity bubblegum and some cabbage. Flavor was quite simple, some sourish lemon and some cabbage. I really expected something better, other beers from the brewpub are really decent. Unfortunately this is too thin, with some bad flavors anyway.

Draught at the brewpub. -Hazy yellow coloured, small white head, wheaty nose. Not so good as I’ve expected. Strong and artificial sweet corn and cooked potato aroma with just weak wheaty notes. Slight acidic lemon finish.

On tap @ the brewery. 4,8% version. Clear golden body with a tall, frothy and persistent white head. Aroma of fresh herb, a bit grainy and in background some notes of boiled vegetables. Taste is crispy, slightly hoppy and malty sweet. Mild grassy finish. Medium body, lively carbonation, watery texture

On tap. Slightly hazy, yellow body with average, frothy, white head, mosly lasting with some lacing. Moderate malty (grains) and hoppy (herbal) aroma. Moderate bitter and light-to-moderate sweet flavour with a dry and bitter finish. Medium body with oily texture; soft carbonation.

50cl bottle bought at the brewery. Clear amber body with a moderate, vanishing, foamy white head. Aroma is moderate malty (caramel and dried fruits) and grassy. Taste is grassy again, slightly malty and metallic. Finish is surprisingly yeasty: nice notes of bread crust, then comes the hoppy (grassy) part. Low bodied, soft carbonation, slighlty watery texture.

On tap. Clear, amber body with small, frothy, white head, mosly diminishing with virtually no lacing. Moderate malty (caramel) and light hoppy (flowers) aroma; some unpleasanr feeling of medicine. Moderate sweet and light-to-moderate bitter flavour with a kind of light acidic note. Light-to-medium body with watery texture; average carbonation.
From tap. Pours hazy dark brown. Small tan head. Roasted malty. Breadish and caramelish. Breadish and roasted dark malty. Bitter and roasted finish.
draught @ gusti di frontiera 2012. pours hazy reddish, medium brownish head. Skunk water aroma, smoke and yeast. Smokey taste, acid and salty. pasty mouthfeel. really horrible

Draught at Torri Beer Fest. Hazy deep golden color with mid-sized creamy white head. Aroma of spicy hops, malt, fruits with light honey note. Taste starts sweet malty with light vanilla notes and followed sour fruity and yeasty. Finish is lightly bitter. Medium body, slick texture and average carbonation in palate. Better than industrial lagers, but still not more than average...

Cask @ GBBF 2010. Pours a slightly hazy amber color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty aroma with hints of caramel and hops. Fruity malty bitter flavor with hints of caramel. Has a fruity malty caramel finish with a slightly bitter aftertaste.
Cask Stillage at the GBBF, Earl’s Court 04/08/2010 Some hop aroma. Amber coloured fruity and a little rich on the palate with a hint of dryness in a bitter malt finish.

3rd August 2010. GBBF Slightly hazy amber beer with a tiny white head. Light dry palate. Dry malt and watery hop. Very much like so many English bitters. I prefer it when the Italians do their own thing rather than (accurately) emulate bland English beers! And the abv stated for this was 3.7% which seems much more in keeping with it’s blandness than the 5.4% quoted on the entry.

From cask. pours clear and golden yellow with a small white head. Aroma is mild fruity and roasted malty. Fruity and slight bitter. Dry malty. Bitter and malty flavoured. Dry and roasted. malty too. Ends dry bitter.

Draught at the brewpub, 6.5% ABV
Cloudy red color; creamy head. The aroma shows a light infection, but also some Belgian character, and light fruitness; quite complex, intriguing. Sweetish caramel flavor, with light fruitness and good Belgian yeast character, tartness; good body strength, bold bitterness. Very interesting.

Bottled. A hazy golden beer with a huge white head. The aroma has notes of brettanomyces - very lambic like. The flavor has notes of brettanomyces, malt, citrus, and dusty hops, leading to a lightly tart and acidic finish. Thanks fiulijn for sharing.

Bottle 75 cl. Courtesy of fiulijn. Pours a hazy yellow with a dense white head. Dry Brettish aroma. Light body, lightly sweet malt with a vaguely astringent finish. Rather fresh actually in spite of it being clearly infected. 260309

75 cL bottle, courtesy of fiulijn. Pours hazy yellow with a huge white head. Dry wheat and barnyard aroma. Dry wheaty and vague fruity flavoured. Light yeasty. Light in body. Subdued sweetness. Light wheaty and dry to phenolic from back of the nose.

2009-01-06, bottle from the brewery, bottled 08/10/13, 6-3-6-3-12=30
Hazy blond color. The aroma shows grass, hop, manure. Medium body, it’s possible to detect some good malt, but the hop, again, is grassy. It’s not the same batch as the one I had on draught, but also the bottle doesn’t preserve all the hop qualities.

2008-12-28, draught at the brewpub, 8-4-8-4-17=41
Cloudy blond color; creamy head. Wonderful hop aroma (with Saaz), crispy malt and light manure. Good malt flavor, with a very nice residual sweetness; good hopping, light hay, light grapefruit. Well balanced. Excellent.

Draught at the brewpub, 5% ABV
Hazy golden color; creamy head. Wheat aroma, light sourness, light fruits, sweetish. Light wheat flavor, very light banana, a bit dry at the end, alcoholic, missing hop. Weak final.

Draught at the brewpub
Black color; creamy head. Light aroma of roasted malt. Good, round body; caramel flavor with some chocolate and some residual sugars; correct bitterness. Well balanced, very pleasant.

From tap at the brewpub. Pours slight hazy yellow with a lacing white head. Slight acidic and grainy nose. Soft and slight roasted malty flavour. Ends soft with a very minor butterish note. Solid and good brew.

From tap at the brewpub (ABV said 6.2 when I was there). Pours muddy orange with a lacing light off-white head. Malty, slight metallic aroma - medium sweet to dry, has a slight acidic to herbal note to it. Flavour has slight liqourice-like note and is softly malty without being overly sweet. End is soft with a mellow liqourice note - very soft and slight sweet that is.

column2: South Orange, New Jersey, United States
column5: Draft. Pours gold with a white head. Light sweetness, lighter floral notes, low bitterness, and some corny notes. Nothing too off, but not really that good.

column2: South Orange, New Jersey, United States
column5: On tap at Gaslight. Pours a clear yellow gold amber large creamy white head. Light citrus, Sweet, hoppy, nice candied citrus notes.

column2: South Orange, New Jersey, United States
column5: Draft pours an orange golden body with a paper thin white head. Wow this beer sucks, no depth adjuncts and poorly attenuated, taste is copper pennies, this is horrible. I drank 1/8 of the pint before asking the bartender to take this off, and leaving the rest for the drain.

column2: South Orange, New Jersey, United States
column5: 2.8.07 AdamSkillin, in his infinite succor, proclaimed this a belgian wheat(?). I guess not. A fair enough brew but some of thos Gaslight taps are crazy infested sometimes. Weird aftertastes. Clean those lines

column2: South Orange, New Jersey, United States
column5: on tap-pours a thin creamy white head and slightly hazy yellow color. Aroma is smooth, slightly sweet grain, aroma finishes with a zip (hops, vinegar?). Taste is smooth, slightly sweet grain, finishes with a zip, now seems like vinegar. OK carbonation. 3.1

[Draught at the restaurant] Funny place for a brewery. If it wasn’t for the sign "fresh beer" I wouldn’t have guessed that they had a brewery inside the restaurant (actually the lagering tanks were on display in another section of the restaurant, called "Beijing Roast Duck", I believe) Well, the beer came absolutely pitch black with small beige head. The aroma held generous amonuts of chocoalate and some licorice. It was medium bodied with rounded mouthfeel. Chocolate dominates, but there are notes of tar as well. Full flavoured with medium bitterness. As enjoyable as the superb Chongqing Chicken here, and at around a 5th of the price of the beers at Paulaner 300m away a bargain.
[Draught at the restaurant] Hazy deep golden. Fruity malt aroma. Lightly buttery with rounded mouthfeel and a hint of melon. Firmly malty with low bitterness.

Cask in the Falcon, St Johns Road, Clapham. Pretty standard golden ale/bitter. Golden amber coloured thin head. Nose is grain husk, sweet malt, honey, slight citrous character. Taste is pretty standard golden ale. Grain husk, honey sweetness, light citrous.

Hand-pulled pint in The Philharmonic, Liverpool on 7th Feb 2014. Light amber with good lacing coming from a deep white head. The aroma was half hop, half malt, the taste similar but with a semi-bitter and dry finish. There were hints of citrus notes but not too strong. Medium bodied and easy to drink: not too exciting, but nothing wrong with it.
Cask at The Crosse Keys, JDW, Gracechurch St, London 14-11-09 Pours gold with a white rim of bubbles for a head. Nicely hoppy with a little hop sting, crisp, tasty beer. A6 A4 F7 P4 Ov13 3.4

Cask-conditioned at the Bag ONails, Bristol 28/8/08. Deep golden coloured with a slight white head. Grapefruit hop flavour and aroma with a hint of pine resin. Balanced by some fruity malt with a decent dry finish. Good stuff.

Half, gravity at London Drinker BF 08. A Best Bitter with a yellow- golden body under a fragile head. Fresh citric aroma supported by flavours of orange and grapefruit shells. Soft bitter backnotes (afternoon session, 13.03.2008).

A Mes rate: Gravicask at the Bricklayers. Clean gold, good head and in sparkling form. Straight forward crisp hoppage with lots of grapefruit with a nice dusty bitter finish. One dimensional but very enjoyable.

Cask gravity at Bricklayers Arms 2nd Annual Yorkshire BF 08. Pale gold with slight haze and thin white head. Grapefruit hoppy aroma. Good in mouth, sherberty grapefruit on finish. Slightly harsh, but well balanced. Best beer so far. Good hop on finish. Citrus grapefruit. Slips down easily.

Cask at The Volunteers Arms, GBBF 2007. A golden beer with a thin white head. The aroma is sweet and lovely grassy with a slight citrusy edge. The flavor is sweet malty with citrusy almost acidic hop notes as well as some grass, leading to a bitter finish.

(Cask at Wenlock Arms, London, 11 Aug 2007) Pale amber colour with brief white head. Fruity nose with underlying malt, sweetish notes of citrussy, earthy hops. Malty, fruity taste with orange, apricots and citrussy hops in the finish. Medium body. Decent, balanced bitter.
Cask Stillage at the E & S Brewery, Elland 12/08/2006 Hop aroma. Brown golden coloured hoppy and fruity with a crisp and slightly bitter malt finish.
Cask. Very Dark Brown. Malty, fruity, dark chocolate flavoured porter. Fruity sweet aftertaste. Lingering finish. Liked this. Decent. (2008)

Couple of pints, The Crown, Nuneaton. Deep mahogany, ruby edges draped with cream. Fierce and attenuated initially, with a softer cinder toffee and butter biscuit underbelly. Roasted pistachio and barley aroma; good Nutella on burnt toast afters. Had another pint of it- enough said.

Cask @ Volunteer Arms, GBBF 2009. Pours a dark amber/brown color with a small off-whitehead. Has a roasted malty toasted nutty chocoalte aroma. Sweetish roasted malty caramel and chocoalte flavor. Has a roasted malty caramel and chocolate finish.

Cask, Far From The Madding Crowd, Oxford. Deep black, brown highlights. Simple coffee aroma with a dollop of vanilla. Clean, simple roast, chalky finish. Simple and refreshing in a way that I sometime forget a dark beer can be. Really nice!

(Cask at Market Porter, Borough, London, 24 Nov) Dark brown colour with ruby notes, small beige head. Malty and roasted nose with notes of cola, chocolate and coffee. Roasted and malty taste with coffee, chocolate and a nice coffeelike bitterness in the finish. A lovely porter.

Pint pulled at The Market Porter in Borough (London), very dark with a thin white bubby head. A caramal and tart fruit aroma. Very strong roasted coffee flavour with a touch of licorice on a smooth and light palate. Like drinking an cold espresso.

1. Cask Stillage at the E & S Brewery, Elland 12/08/2006 Roast and hop aromas. Dark slightly rich on the palate with some alcohol present. Crisp and bitter malt finish. 2. Cask Handpump at the Jubilee Refreshment Rooms, Sowerby Bridge 15/08/2009 Fruit and some roast aroma. Mid brown dark coloured a little hoppy and fruity with a hint of dryness and bitterness in a roast finish.

Cask, Burton Summer Fest 08. Dark brown with minimal head. Aromas are weetabix and chocolate malts with earthy notes. Sweet berry fruit. Flavours are smooth milk chocolate with sweet weetabix. Earthy with citrus, quite hoppy. Peppery and prickly towards the finish with grapefruit bitterness. Good.
Cask Stillage at the E & S Brewery, Elland 12/08/2006 Fruit and malt aromas. Mid to dark brown coloured and strong in alcohol. Crisp on the palate with some bitterness in a warming malt finish.

On tap @ Papago. A nice light orange with foamy yellow head. This beer exhibits traditional IPA aroma and flavors: citrus, pine, sharp bitterness. There truly isn’t anything that separates it from the 100’s of other IPA’s on the market...good, not great.

Light gold, small head. Decent aroma and really nice flavor. Really good for a regular IPA, easy, big floral hops, sweet malts, bite at the end but quite flavorful...I might get a growler of this to go! On tap at brewery.

Had this cask conditioned with hops. That influences this A LOT. I have since had it non-cask conditioned and its pretty pedestrian CASK CONDITIONED:. This was the perfect IPA, with full hop flavoring, yet with a creamy smoothness that I’ve never seen in an IPA. The stuff was a nice warm pint, that laced like a doily. Golden Amber - I think they really hit paydirt with this cask conditioning. The staff told me they dry hopped the hell out of this stuff, with a bunch of hops sitting in the cask. NORMAL: Pretty boring IPA. It’s in the WC IPA tradition, so its pretty hop forward, which I like. But nothing really striking about the hop profile.
Cloudy orange with a nice white head and thick lacing. Srong aroma and flavor of citrus, pine, oranges and grapefruit. Medium bodied. Good,easy drinking I.P.A.

Sampled on draught at the Papago Brewing Company tavern in Phoenix, AZ. Pours a clear orange amber brew with a fast dissolving off-white head that has some good lacing. Aroma of light roasted caramel malt, some apricots orange and grapefruit zest and plenty of citrusy/pine hop character. Taste is medium bodied, lightly carbonated with a clean IPA hob bitterness. Finish is more dry and bitter than Papago’s Imperial stout but this IPA is quite drinkable.

The beer fresh from the tap, pours a slightly hazy golden amber color with a splendiferous creamy white head that lingers long, finally after its demise, the lacing provides a concealing sheet upon the glass. Schnozzle is greeted by sweet malt, then “BLAM”, Hops all flowery and spicy, citrus like in its crispness, clean, a bodement of things to come. Start has a delightful malt presence, the hops big and spicy at the back, top is moderate in feel. Finish has a sturdy acidity, the hops omnipotent, with the sweetness continued to the somewhat dry aftertaste, a fine representative to the style.

Poured a lightly hazy, amber color with a small, off white head that left light lacing on the glass. Aroma of skunk, floral hops, toasty malts, with a bit of toffee as well. Taste of pine, caramel malts, grapefruit, with a moderate, bitter, dry finish.

Thanks to hopdog for sharing this growler. Pours a lightly hazy golden orange with a medium creamy off white head that left some lacing. Aroma of lots of pine, citrus a bunch of floral notes and caramel. Flavor was a bit earthy, hops, pine, citrus, cereal grains and some malt to balance. Nice bitterness level for an IPA.

Growler aquired in trade with hellbilly (thanks!). Poured a medium and slightly hazy orange color wtih an average sized off white head. Aromas of ctirus, pine, floral hoppiness, and some caramel. Tastes of citrus, pine and caramel. Nice grapefruit finish. Not overly bitter with a decent malt balance. Alcohol content hidden. Very drinkable. Extra point in the overall for having such a cool name ’Hop Dog’ - I wonder where they got that from (I should have a lifetime suppy of this one!).

hazy gold pour with orange tints. sweet piney aroma with some grapefruit lingering around out back. flavor is a well balanced mix of piney hops, grapefruit juice and caramel. classic easy drinker and it doesn’t numb my mouth like the uber hoppy hop father. 7/3/7/3/15 =3.5 points added for cask version of this beer. extra creamy texture and additional hops added to the cask version 8/3/8/5/16 =4.0

Cask at Volunteers Arms, GBBF 2006. A hazy orange beer with a white head. The aroma is sweet malty with light notes of caramel. The flavor is sweet with strong notes of fruit, but also notes of brew mash, leading to a nicely bitter end. The body is thin.
Cask Stillage at the E & S Brewery, Elland 12/08/2006 Hoppy and slightly spicy aromas. Golden coloured and hoppy with some spicy coriander flavour. Crisp and slightly bitter in the finish.
Cask Handpump at the Shepherds Rest, Sowerby Bridge 12/08/2006 Citrus fruit aroma. Copper golden coloured and hoppy with some citrus flavour. Floral crisp and slightly dry bitter finish.
Cask Handpump at the New Delight Inn, Jack Bridge 12/08/2006 Some fruit aroma. Golden coloured fruity and crisp on the palate. Slightly dry malt finish.
Bottle. Yellow with a small head. Bitterness dominates with some hops present. Nice bitter but nothing out of the ordinary.

Cask @ The Speaker, Westminster SW1. Pours a slightly hazy golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty hoppy aroma. Fruity malty and slightly hoppy flavor with some hints of caramel. Has a sweetish malty hoppy finish.

Cask conditioned at Banbury Beer Fest ’08. Gold to amber with white head. Decent hoppy bitter if slightly on the sweetish side, touches of lychees in a perfumed hoppy body. Good enough for a session ale.

Cask (handpump) at the Fly In The Loaf, Liverpool, April 2008. Nice pale golden amber colour. Creamy head. Clean and fresh with some citrus, a smattering of spicy hop character and a biscuity malt backing. Pleasant drinking. Nothing too much beyond that beyond that but eminently fit for purpose. Despite the pale colour this is more of a bitter than a golden ale.

Cask cellar run at Ship & Mitre BF, Liverpool. Gold, no head. It’s an ok golden bitter, not huge on the citrus. Balanced, bit watery in mouth. Hop finish is decent enough. Actually it’s ok, good flavours. Balanced session beer.
Cask Blackfriars. Aroma is sweet sulphur, pale malts and quite eggy. Taste is pale biscuity malts, hints of grass, the palate is thin and watery.

Cask Handpump at the New Delight Inn, Jack Bridge 12/08/2006 Some floral aroma. Clear golden coloured with pear fruit flavour. Crisp and slightly dry on tha palate with a little bitterness in a lasting finish.
Cask Handpump at the Trades Club, Hebden Bridge 12/08/2006 Some grass aroma. Amber coloured with a slightly sour fruit flavour. A little dryness in a lasting wheat finish.

Draft on tap at the brewpub (Pacific City, OR). This is the Willamette version from Fall 2015 Harvest Season. Pours a nice deeper orange amber hue, a gentle haziness, mellow cascading bubbles with frothy offwhite head atop. Nice lacing as a filmy layer with decent ringer head. Aromas are green and fresh, floral and earthy, gentle resiny quality as the fruit shows mellow to minimal life. A bit bready but a mellow malt presence allows a more robust rich floral and fresh hop resiny feel, hop oils protrude and stick around nicely. Initial is a touch more mellow, lighter bodied but a touch heavier on that end with some firmer earthy bitterness, mellow malt presence and a flash of lime. Mellow pithy citrus, some earth, a bit of sweetness as we round the corner shows some bread, biscuit, a touch of caramel. A fun richer nose and pretty pour, the beer delivers some life up front but becomes a bit drab into the finish. A touch sweet, dry, earthy. Ok. Really dug the nose and aroma. Sad they don’t break these out properly.

On Tap at The River Room, Whole Foods, Boise. Hazy deep orange witha full dense sandy head. Nice fresh citrus tangerine hop aroma. Creamy ful bodies palate, modest and smooth bitterness. Great pale malt flavors and a little more late citrus pithiness at the end. Very nice.
Hazy golden color with a lacing white head. Aroma of pine, grass, and earthy wet hops. Dry finish. Not the best beer I’ve had from Pelican.

On tap at bier thirty. Pours out a cloudy golden topped with a sand head. Nose is great pine grass citrus and some spice. Taste is as the nose with a good hop mix and a nice bitter grapefruit pithy end. Pretty tasty and man an I happy to see pelican in out area.

Poured from tap to glass at the Growler Cafe. Hazy golden hue with creamy white head that dissipated to a ring. Aroma is grassy, pine, grapefruit, tangerine. Mouthfeel is refreshing with a medium body and zesty carbonation. Taste is slightly sweet with a bitter finish that extends through the finish. Overall this is a nice fresh hop!

Draft at sb. Pours a clear medium amber. Loose white head and stringy lace. Sharp nose of grapefruit and a bit of ammonia. Creamy medium body with lively carb. Toasty caramel with rich blood orange and light ammonia on the mid palate. Long dry finish.
Pours clear orange finger white head. Smell powdery floral. Taste almost a bit of coco, delicious floral hops Crisp light body. Good.

Tap at Pelican brewpub as "Elemental IPA". Pours a clear orange. Webby lacing. Nose is juicier citrus hops, perfume, moving to something a bit chemical. Taste is chemically bitter, perfumey, sharp ginger bite, white grape juice. Clean, balanced body. Strange, but likeable.

Draft at Brouwer’s. Pours a clear, pale, orangeish amber. Resin, pine, onion, just a little biscuit in the aroma. Taste is lightly sweet up front with assertive (but still quite pleasant) bitterness. Medium body, average carbonation, easy to drink. Solid.

On tap at Brouwer’s Cafe, pours a clear bronze with a medium white head. Aroma brings out quite a bit herbal hops, a little pine, and earthy malts. Flavour brings out very fresh earthy and piney hops. Not really much of a malt backbone, but the hops shine bright. Good stuff.
Cask Handpump at the Penny Black JDW, Northwich 20/10/2010 Sulphur and malt aromas. White head. Mid brown coloured fruity and hoppy with a hint of dryness in a bitter nutty and floral malt finish.
Cask at the Wharf. copper colour with an off-white head. Aroma is malt, caramel, hop, spices, grass. Flavour is malt, caramel, hop, citrus, spices, grass. OK beer.

Cask at The Wharf. It’s a clear copper colored beer with a thin off-white head. Nutty caramel aroma with some dried fruits, coffee grit and sour hints. Roasted coffee-like flavor with lots of dried fruits and a berry-like sour touch. Medium body. Pleasant bitterness in the finish. A quenching and quite tasteful beer but I don’t like the sourness. 101020

Cask@The warf, Aalborg.Pours copper with a thin white head.Aroma of malt, fruitiness, berries and grassy hops.Flavor is slightly malty and sweet with a somewhat bitter and grassy finish.Medium body, soft carbonation.

Cask - The Crosse Keys (JDW), London. Poured with a fine though lasting white head that left a soapy lace atop a dark amber body. Not a great deal to the aroma. Some apple & yeasty tang, bready malts & caramel maybe. A fair amount of yeastiness & earth again on the tongue with a grassy, soapy hoppiness. I felt it tasted a bit like a kit homebrew. Light body, low to medium carbonation with a shortish, slightly dry finish. I wasn’t keen.

Cask at the Edgar Wallace, London. Pours a clear red with a modest, off-white head. Aroma of malt, caramel, light fruits and hops. Fairly sweet with some charming bread notes, along with fruits and only minor bitterness. Light to medium in body with fine carbonation. Finishes sweet and malty. Solid brew.

From tap at Charlies. Pours hazy brown with a small white head. Aroma is roasted breadish malty. Fruity an dark toffee malt, breadish and sligh sweet. Roasted breadish base with a mild bitterness into the finish. Lasting roasted breadish finish.

Cask at Charlie’s Bar, Copenhagen. A deep red beer with a thin tan head. The aroma has notes of caramel and malt. The flavor is sweet with notes of caramel and malt as well as lighter notes of butterscotch and citrus, leading to a dry and bitter finish.
Cask Conditioned handpump Solomon Cutler Birmingham. A classic brown coloured beer with a tight whitish head and lacing. This an earthy malty nutty Autumnal beer. A typically safe Batemans seasonal.
Cask @ Esquire House, JDW. Ruby red colour, off-white head. Aroma is caramel malts, fruits. Flavour of caramel malts, sour fruits, bit spicy.

(Cask at Akkurat, Stockholm, 20 Oct) Golden yellow colour with pale amber notes, small white head. Fruity nose with apricots, citrus and flowery hops. Fruity taste with mild citrus notes and apricots. Slightly soapy, with floral hops in the finish. Fairly ok, but rather unfocused.

Cask at Oliver Twist, Stockholm. Hazy golden with a low white head. Mild aroma of oatmeal, green bananas, dried oranges and some chemicals. Smooth, airy flavour of mild flowers, banana, straw abd grass. Thin body. Short aftertaste of raw yeast, salt, resin and banana-peels. Quite wierd.

[Cask at Akkurat, Stockholm] Pale copper colour. Very vague aroma, hints of glue. Smooth mouthfeel with strong alcohol presence and glue. Reminiscent of a bad pale lager. Harsh, sharp bitterness on a low-medium level.

Cask@Akkurat (4.2%). Deep golden colour, mediumsized off-white creamy head. Aroma of grass, nectar, flowers and slightly glueish hints. Flavour is sweet nextar, fresh willow. Long wet willowwooden aftertaste along with hints of dry fruit.
Cask@Akkurat. Pale copper brown, small white head. Cut grass aroma. Grassy, hayish flavor - gardener’s dream. Hayish aftertaste.
[Cask at Akkurat, Stockholm] Clear deep golden. Lightly citric nose. Medium sweet with rounded mouthfeel. Restrained resiny hoppy bitterness.
Cask Stillage at the Trades Club, Hebden Bridge 12/08/2006 Some floral aroma. Clear golden coloured and hoppy with some dryness in a lasting creamy finish.
Cask Handpump at the Trades Club, Hebden Bridge 12/08/2006 Some fruit aroma. Golden coloured hoppy and fruity with slight bitterness and dryness in a creamy finish.
Cask Handpump at the Trades Club, Hebden Bridge 12/08/2006 Fruit aroma. Clear golden coloured and fruity with some sourness in a dry finish.

Cask at Wenlock Arms. Clear copper with a small white head. Earthy pine tree hops is the main attraction here. Little malt presence with a dry wood character. Finish is rather short with medium bitterness. Simple but effective. Looks like Grand Union have been brewing a new “One Hop” ale almost every mouth for the past 2-3 years. Same recipe but each using a single different hop. While I was in London the Sovereign was the One Hop of the month. I think it would be very instructive to taste them all, and rarely can I associate the word instructive with my drinking habits.

Nice golden colour with a decent white head. Good lacing. Fresh hoppy and fruity aroma. Flavour is fresh with a good hoppiness, bit dry, fruity with some herbal touch. Dry hoppy finish. Too bad its no longer brewed........ :-(
Cask Handpump at the Crown Inn, Stockport 12/08/2006 Dark coloured and strong in alcohol. Crisp on the palate and slightly spicy with a dry roast malt finish.

bottle from Darts Farm. Hazy golden colour, oildy consistency, no head to speak off, perhaps some bubbles. Sweet and sticky with lots of alcohol flavours, and some hoppy flavours in the far background. Very disappointing.

Cask at Merchants Inn Beer Festival, Rugby - 31/10/12. Amber with a thin off white head. Nose comprises dark caramel malt, tropical fruit, ripe mango, booze and a little spice. Tastes of bitter grapefruit, rich tropical fruits, orange pith, sweet malt, candied sugar, light pineapple. Fuller end of medium bodied with fine carbonation leading to a bitter sweet finish. Alcohol is evident but not OTT. Flavoursome and well executed for a 10% cask DIPA!

Bottle from Pig’s Ear festival in London, 2008 Beautiful amber color; too high carbonation makes a huge head. The aroma is hoppy, old, a bit yeasty and fruity; apples; sweaty; strange but actually interesting. The flavor is weird, dusty, a bit malty; bitter but also a bit buttery. Off.

Bottled. An unclear dark golden beer with a huge off-white head. The aroma has notes of malt, fruit, and perfume. The flavor is sweet with strong notes of alcohol as well as medium notes of dusty hops, leading to a dry and bitter finish. Thanks fiulijn for sharing.
50 cL bottle, courtesy of fiulijn. Pours cloudy amber with a huge off-white head. Aroma is fruity, malty and oxidised. Fruity and mild citric. Bitter and dry malty finish.

Cask, Derby Winter Fest 10. Copper gold with no head. Aromas are tofee malts with raisins and woody notes. Raisins with honey and lemon. Resinous fruitiness with hints of smoke. Flavours are sweet toffee with lots of herbal, spicy and medicinal notes. Pine and grapefruit towards the finish. Peppery with warming alcohol on the finish. Very decent.

30th December 2008. Hazy brown beer, very frothy head but it quickly dies away to nothing. Soft and creamy IPA - the hops are juicy and not overpowering and impart a soft marmalade flavour. A nice undertone of creamy malt. Finishes with warming hints of port. Very civilised and tasty!

Bottle 50cl. @ [ Chris O’s pre NYE Tasting ]. Clear medium amber orange color with a large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white to white head. Aroma is moderate malty, caramel, strawberry notes, light to moderate hoppy, orange. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a average to long duration. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20081230]
Bottle at Chris o New Year tasting 08/09. It’s alright. Quite a stable 10% IPA with decent flavours. It’s got a pretty good malty backbone, but it’s ok hop. Not too aggressive.

Bottle from Pigs Ear 08. Lots of cabaonation in a reddish beer. Very full bodied. Loads of malt, hoppy aroma more than dryness, some yeast. Somehow it comes out balanced, the alcohol is not very evident, but that is due to all the other ingredients. Peppery, dryish finish.

column1: Watch City The "CAZ" Scotch Export Ale
column5: on tap-pours an off white head and copper/red color. Aroma is sweet medium malt-caramel. Taste is scotch, sweet medium malt-caramel, secondary hops bitterness. Thicker mouth feel.

column1: Watch City The "CAZ" Scotch Export Ale
column5: Cask pint at Watch City on 9/9/06. Nearly "bright" though with just a touch of light haze. Still transparent and with a large, grey/beige head that is tremendously well-retained and laces quite profusely. The body is a deep copper-auburn with strong mahogany tones. Fresh edinburgh yeast contributes light earthy/soiliness, while some moderate dark malts contribute very subtle dark fruit flavors in concert with the yeast notes. Minimal hop apparency, though some green leafiness and bits of grass do help bolster the livliness of it. Touches of very light caramel, pale sugars and a hint of coffee on the end. Notes are presented cleanly, crisply and the aroma is quite strong and vibrant. No alcohol noted, definitely no flaws that I can detect. Very inviting. A warm, fuzzy-soft texture is alive with fruit, nuts, dry caramel and some dusty/earthy yeast on the end. Snappy esters dry out the finish and give it a crispness that belies the low gravity nature of the beer. Plenty of nougat and dark berry notes packed in here, and just a clean presentation with surprisingly little wateriness, even less than what would be expected/tolerable. Goes down softly and easily. I think I drank my pint in about 2 minutes. One of the better conditions I’ve seen a cask in, here in New England.
Sampled at the place. Shady golden. Bready, earthy, minerally, rustic. Dry, high bitterness.
Draught @ Bahler Neuhaus. Pours cloudy deep yellow with a White head. White crusty bread and floral hops. Grassy and hayish with a twist of lemon. Dry hoppy finish. Boom!

Tap @ Source. Pours golden with a white head. Aroma is loads of bready character, fresh citrusy hops, slight honey, very well balaned - Very czech style alike in malt charater. Creamy, clean, Crisp. Good brew

Draughts@source on the eve and after the Neuhauser Tag der Kommunbrauer, before the storm 02-04-10/2015. - - 1st sample on Friday: Deep golden-greenyellow pour, dense white cap. Amazingly "wild" nose, bretty pollen, daffodil and dandelion flowers on a summery meadow - near-saison like (Saison de Cazeau) - fascinating. At the same time some rubbery smoked notes, near-medicinal like an Islay whiskey - must be that coolship? Lots of confidently bitter milk thistle notes (Saison Dupont), hints of smoked rubber on thick, honey-drizzled pilsner malts. - 2nd batch, post onstorm 04/10/2015 had much less of this wild profile and shows how much batches can differ even at the same Zoiglwirt. Common theme: bitter noble hops (melissa, nettle, thistle milk, dandelion) meet dry vegetable oil, honeylike palate. The most captivating and memorable of all W-Bach and Neuhäuser Zoigls this weekend.

Vom Faß beim Bahler, 19.5.2015. - Goldgelb mit leichtem Orangeton, schwach trüb. - Leichter (noch angenehmer) Geruch nach Bauernhof (Kuhstall), dazu etwas Orange und Gras. - Antrunk sehr mild, zunächst fast dünn; schwach malzig mit einem Hauch von Karamel. Im weiteren Verlauf bittert es unerwartet stark nach mit nicht allzu kräftigem aber aromatischem Hopfen: Orangenschale, Gras, etwas Pfeffer. Schwach rezent, schlank und leicht mineralisch, dadurch enorm süffig: man könnte stundenlang weitertrinken. Schön bitterer Nachtrunk mit Pfeffer. - Sehr schöner Zoigl: schwach gespundet, anfangs mild, dann aber von aromatischer Bittere. Unglaublich süffig.
The head is medium, the body brown and very cloudy. It smells sweet-malty. The taste is malty, aromatic, a bit hoppy, a bit sweet. Overall ok. 11/10/11/11/-/11

on tap at zoigltag in ’09 and ’10, usually worth settling in here for a couple. looks great - faintly hazy golden with a steady white head; aroma of hay, passionfruit nectar and sandstone; crisp and invigorating, grassy, cumquat with some lurking butterscotch. excellent drinking

At Beim Bahler, Neuhaus 11/07/2011. Deep, clear gold with a frothy white head. Biscuit malt aroma with a touch of citrus fruit and dusty hop. Flavour had more fruit, a touch of caramel leading to a hoppy, bitter finish. Excellent stuff.

Slighly hazy, mostly clear, deep gold with foamy head. Aroma is worty-sweet and yeasty. Not the most sophisticated zoigl but still nice. The body is sturdy as are the maltz and the overall impression is sweet, yeasty and sticky but balanced.
Dull gold. The aroma shows a hint of butter. The taste is ok, though, a bit buttery. Fairly bland and sweetish zoigl.

Draught at the Tahquamenon Falls Brewery, Tahquamenon Falls, MI. Cloudy reddish brown color with a small off-white head. Mild floral hops and dry malt in the aroma. Yeast, metal and some dry malt in the flavor. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours a pale light copper with a thin head. Aroma is caramel malts. Flavor is similar, more dry than sweet. Has a light mouthfeel, well-carbonated. This is okay.

tap at the brewpub, sold as "Tannin Red" - Pours mostly clear amber with a lingering off-white head that leaves some lacing. It has a mild toasted caramel malt aroma. The flavor is similar with lightly toasted, sweet caramel malt. It’s light to medium bodied and some caramel lingers in the finish along with mild hops bitterness. Pretty good, actually.

On tap at the brewery. Poured amber with a thin white head. Aroma was weak with notes of malts and a bit of hops. Flavor pretty basic, and quite drinkable with a hoppy flavor. Quite rough on the tongue and a bit too dry.
On tap at the brewpub. Pretty weak and thin. Not much aroma or flavor. Not bad, just forgettable.

Pour of mahogany-tinted red, with fringes of basketball. Head of creamy ivory. Faint malt and pizza sauce aroma. Served ice cold. There’s no carbonation in this beer, it’s becoming to be a trademark of this brewery. Maybe I could at least convince them to serve their beer on oxygen. There really isn’t flavor here, just some dryness that acts as such and there could maybe be a hint of hop sugars. Ick. I think they distilled the tannins from the river water and added it to this thing they attempt to call beer. Palate is exceptionally revolting. It has a painful scorching dryness that scours the tongue and burns the roof of your mouth. Garbage. they really need to go out of business and stop embarassing craft beer.

Draft at CBC. Poured dark amber with an average fizzy off-white head that was mostly lasting with good lacing. Moderate caramel malt and sour citrus aroma. Medium body with soft carbonation. Medium balanced flavor with a medium bittersweet finish of moderate duration. Better than my expectations.
Fun take on a traditional style. Plenty of rye hops to make this interesting and somewhat of a hop presence as well. Overall, quite enjoyable.

Retro. Dark orange-amber pour. Noticed a missing favorite (in-style at least) when updating those. Hoppier than expected (kinda like Hopzeit) but biscuit & spice still king. nice malty finish, lightly bitter.

From May 2008 I got this can in a trade with Wasatch. Thanks John! Yet another Surly beer for me to try. ;^) This pours a slightly hazy amber with a big +2 finger head of billowy foam. I see some floaties but I'm hoping that won't negatively impact the flavour. Oh and there's plenty of sticky lacing. The smell is very nice! Lots of lemon citrus matched equally by lots of rye and some caramel malt. To me, a perfectly balanced nose. The taste...hell, there's no denying that this is a beer using rye as it's right there and it's tasting great. The single hop that they are using gives me both lemon and some pine and the rye and a bit of caramel malt compliments the hops very nicely. Good medium mouthfeel and fairly light carbonation make for a very drinkable beer. This is just a real palate pleasing, easy drinking brew and I could drink a few of these easily without getting bored. With the final pour, I didn't get any more floaties,(a good thing)just more of that hazy amber goodness. Btw, great head retention here. Well done, again, Surly! Bottom line: This is a very tasty and drinkable Rye beer that I wouldn't hesitate to try again. Highly recommended!

On tap at Ellyn's Tap & Grill in Glen Ellyn, IL., shaker served displaying a clear & bright, amber hue, with a presentable layer of persistent, off white froth, and sheeting spray as lacing. The nose was mild grain, toast, with slight hints of citrus & spice. Medium bodied, with decent carbonation, the taste was like notes, including an earthy, toasted/near roasted, dry, and lingering bitterness. Rye made the difference as I appreciated the more German-style approach for a welcome change from the usual caramel sweet, Americanized versions.
Pours slightly hazy golden orange with a thick beige head. Aroma is roasted malts and sweetness. Flavour is sweet but not too heavy but very malty. Finish is a little thick and slightly sweet.

Deep amber in color with some nice spice character from the rye bill. I understand they are wanting to do something different, but stylistically, this is terrible. The style should have little to no hop character, but this has hop aroma and taste. Decent for what it actually is, but a poor representation of the indicated style.

Pours a clear orange/amber with a not too impressive off white head. Aroma is piney cones. Taste is sweet caramel malt, buttered crackers, some palate cleansing rye and a medium citrusy hop bitterness.

Tap - good size foamy head, nice dark copper/Amber color, fairly balanced with some earthy hops and mildly sweet caramelly malts with a touch of eye spice, very good overall ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

not quite sweet enough for me. the rye is definitely unique but i tend to look for more traditional when it comes to oktos. its very smooth and well rounded, no off notes whatsoever. but not quite what i was looking for.

16floz can, COD: 08.22.2017, paid $10 for a four-pack, poured this one into a mug glass. Looks good, amber in color with a small head that fizzles a bit. I can smell that this is an American remix of the style - hoppy like a forest of pines. Rye comes through in the palate, along with buttery biscuit, and herb bitterness. Good as American amber ale/lager (whatever yeast was used).

Gekocht in Duitsland en gedronken terwijl hij goed koud was in een klein longdrinkglas bij gebrek aan bierglazen. Het bier is kraakhelder van kleur met een koolzuurrijke schuimkraag die snel tot een minimum reduceerd. Aroma is citroenachtig. Smaak is wat vlak, beetje zacht in de nasmaak. Ik heb betere radlers op maar alsnog is deze op een warme dag goed te drinken mits je niet al te hoge verwachtingen hebt.
Bottle. Clear pale yellow color, white coca cola head. Aroma of lemon. Taste is sweet lemon.
Süßlich herber Antrunk, süß vom Süßstoff. Künstlich fruchtig, halbwegs spritzig. Okay. 6/7/7/6/6/6

Sampled on draft at the brewery this beer poured a dark reddish-brown color with a small tan head. The aroma is spicy rye and crisp malts. The flavor is sharp and crisp spicy rye with a moderate floral hop presence. The finish is long and bitter. The rye is definitely noticeable.

Dark muddy maple brown colored body with a light tan film of a head. Nose has sweet maple syrup, light wood, brown sugar and caramel chocolate nuts. Texture is the most noticeable attribute of this beer, as it’s incredibly creamy and silky, full on the palate as well, not frothy at all, and not undercarbonated, but just really chewy and savory. The maple syrup component is lighter in the flavor than in the nose, and is complimented by a doughy yeast and toast flavor and some light oak and caramel. Overall it’s very tasty, though a little too sweet, and could benefit from some smoke. I would say it sits between doppelbock and bock, but has the gravity of doppelbock.

Originally rated February 2007. Weird... comes in a bomber, but with a twist-off neck. Pours a dark brown colour with mohagony highlights. Tanned head with nice lacing and a ring that stays (unlike the head). Very slow carbonation. Malty nose with a sweetness of red apples. Thin mouthfeel with very little stickiness. At first, a real bad taste with some rustiness and mild infection. Then, the mouth got used to it, and got better. The red apples are there too, with the malt. Interesting aftertaste, where roasted malt appears and then, some very light chocolat. Alcohol is very well-hidden and drinkability is decent. Will stick with Unibroue for Quebec 9% ABV beers.

500ml bottle from Chez Doub ! Appearance : Clear amber with no head. Aroma : Lots of spices with fruity apricots. Taste : Spicy and peachy. Spicy finish with light fruity notes. Flat carbonation, faint bitterness. Not very good. Dry finish. Overall : Weird stuff. Dead palate, weak backbone. Odd spices. Not good.

Okay clear amber body with no carbonation, decent pillow of head on top. Aroma is a soft mix of malt and fertilizer. Flavour is bitter malts with perhaps some hops in there to add to the bitterness; watery palate. It’s an awkward mix of not-so-interesting things.
nutty, fruity, weak. Like a crazy homo with aids. thanks Daknole... I hope no one reads this.

Bottle thanks to Daknole. Burgundy/mahogany brown color. Aroma of rich ripe rotting cherries and alcohol. Slick mouthfeel. Flavors are sour with grapes and strawberry predominant. Odd and interesting.

Bottle. Brown pour. Aroma is yeasty, fruity and smells quite tart. And damn its tart as hell. At first it seemed like it might be past its prime. But upon reading older reviews we realized the sourness was intentional. Not bad. at all. Sour, fruit, wet earth and wood.

Brown. Flat-looking, slight haze. Deep fruity aroma shows hints of tartness. Very tart palate. Dry, fruity, going Flemish. Dark fruit and wood. There’s two reasons to rate a two-year-old dubbel that’s gone sour. One is that the early ratings indicate tartness so this was always in the beer. The second is that this beer gone sour is actually pretty tasty.
Van de tap in een studentencafé in Pisa. Ik zie dat Huub mij voor was. Licht troebel, gele kleur, wit schuim. Beetje vlak.

Cask handpump @ Orzo Bruno, Pisa (21/5/26). Poured into a glass mug. Hazy pale golden, good frothy white head, good retention and lacing; aroma pale malt, grain, grass; taste medium sweet and bitter, malty, grassy; sweetbitter aftertaste; medium body, oily texture, average carbonation; pleasant but not so special.
Cask at Orzo Bruno. Reddish Amber, this fairly "stock" Irish red ... Malty, sweet, caramel. But while without fault, this is fairly vapid. (#6787, 6/19/2017)

Cask handpump @ Orzo Bruno, Pisa (21/5/26). Poured into a glass mug. Slightly hazy deep amber, good frothy off-white head, slowly diminishing, good lacing; aroma malts,light toasted, grain, bit yeast; taste medium sweet and bitter, bready malts, toffee; sweetbitter aftertaste, toasted, bit sugary; medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation; nice.

Cask handpump at Orzo Bruno - Pisa. Pours clear copper with a frothy, off-white head. Roasty bread in the nose, light grain, dough, berries. Medium sweet flavorbwith more bready malts, light toasted caramel, herbal hops, slight pine, grass, ripe berries, wood. Medium bodied with fine carbonation; good condition. Finishes with more bready, lightly doughy malts, some toasted grains, brown sugar, pine oils, orange, spicy and herbal hops. Not bad overall.
Take away cask @ Orzobruno. Typical english autumn beer with notes of reisin, knäckebröd and herbs.
Draught Aroma-honey, hops Appearance-red, cloudy, white foam, Taste-medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, Palate-medium body, slick feel, lively, long finish, Overall- very intersting
Cloudy amber-red, very yeasty aroma, funky; quite yeasty with crackerlike malt.

Grassy and grainy aromas, mild caramel. Hazy amber, nice off-white head. Flavour drops off quickly, some toasty malt there but the body thins out quickly to a drying finish with not much going on, a little toast malt lingers.
Draught at Orzobruno. Color amber with medium head. Aroma caramel, malt, orange, yeast. Taste caramel, yeast, hop.
Bevuta all’Orzo Bruno di Pisa con Corkscrew; una ambrata molto aromatica e bevibile. Che locale l’Orzo Bruno!!
Draught @ Orzobruno. Sweet, malty, notes of honey, pear Flowery. Tastes like less alcohol.
Draught Aroma-malt Appearance-pale, clear, white foam, Taste-medium bitterness, light sweetness, lightly sour, Palate-medium body, sticky, lively, bitter finish Overall-good
Draught at Orzobruno. Color clear golden with medium head. Aroma yeast, honey, spicy. Taste spicy, orange, honey, some bitterness.

Keg at Orzobruno, Pisa. Hazy amber body with an off-white head. Low carbonation. Light lacing. Aroma of caramel, red apple and a faint bubblegum note. Flavour of apple, mushy pear and yeast. Thin body with a watery, slightly oily texture. Soft fizz. A decent beer, if a bit thin.
Cloudy brown, yeasty, bubblegummy aroma. The taste is yeasty and some biscuity malts help cover it up.

On tap in a bar/restaurant in Rome. Dark ruby with laced beige head served in a beautiful mug in china. Aroma and flavour of biscuity malt, fruit, caramel and spice. Caramel sweetness lingers and the alcohol shows through. A little rough at this point.
Best Beer ever, Red double malt with Honey. Found in "orzo bruno" a locali in Pisa. Really
Draught at Orzobruno. Color dark amber with medium head. Aroma malt, caramel, pine. Taste caramel, sweet, alcohol, hop.
Draft at Orzobruno. Clear amber, medium off white head. Aroma of light pine. Taste of smooth pine resin. Clean, drinkable and dry.
Bevuta all’Orzo Bruno di Pisa dal bicchiere di Elena, al miele ma non smaccatamente dolce, ci sta
Pastosa, di dura beva, ma molto calda e adatta per dolci non troppo gnoppolosi

Draught at Orzobruno, Pisa. Dark amber with laced beige head. Aroma and flavour of biscuity malt, fruit, caramel and spice. Caramel sweetness lingers and the alcohol shows through. A little rough at this point.

Plastic cup of takeout from Orzo Bruno reeling tipsily around the streets of Pisa. Murky ruby with a collapsing halo. Lush dubbel-esque aroma of ripe plum and brown sugar; some boozy banana and coconut tropical esters milling about. Thick medicinal mouth with bags of sweetness, but not overdone; balancing hop with savoury orange and juniper freshness like a Belgian blond, or Tripel even. Goldings, Poperinge, pinch of spice? Strange and lovely balance, milkshake thick and luxurious. Grenadine and dry roasted nut hints kicking in as it warms. Very cheeky little sipper sliding down sweetly with a dusting of Belgian devilry.
Bevuta alla spina al villaggio della birra. Aroma luppolino. Bionda. Gusto con prevalenza di luppolo. Fgp

75cl bottle from Iperconad, Rimini, Italy. Pours hazy orange with small head of foam. Aroma is a nice citrus, with some fruity sweetness. Body is average with good carbonation. Taste is moderately sweet with delicate bitterness. Finish is average.

0.33 l bottle from K-Citymarket Ruoholahti, Helsinki. Appearance is hazy golden with OK head. Aroma is spicy. Taste has malts, even some dark malts. After that comes spices and fruit juice. Interesting coctail of flavours. Must be really special yeast, since this has no spices or fruits, only sugar, malts and hops. Interesting and complicated.

Draft at Bacaro Risorto in Venice. Quite pale with good head which clung to the false quite well. Rather thin aroma but good flavour with strong hop character. Identifiable Belgian character but almost a cross with American style IPA. Overall very drinkable.
Colore dorato con schiuma fine e persistente. Profumata, leggermente speziata con buona luppolatura ed equilibrio.

Bottle. At Virgin oil, Helsinki. Poured amber color with a thin white head. Low carbonation. Spicy notes, some oranges, citrusy aroma. Oranges, spicy notes, Belgian yeast. Nice dry bitter finish. Refreshing.

Dorata opalescente, schiuma bianca di buona persistenza. Aroma di miele ed erbaceo, leggero agrumato che ricorda polpa e scorza d'arancia. Al palato stesse componenti con le stesse proporzioni dell'aroma; coda amaricante erbacea ed agrumata, leggera nota zuccherina. Corpo medio-leggero, mediamente carbonata, molto beverina.

Bottled at the brewery on September 4, 2015. Hazy golden color, medium sized off-white head. Fresh, hoppy, floral, caramel scent. Malty, caramel, bitter taste. Bitter aftertaste. Medium mouthfeel with lowish CO2, high bitterness.
White, frothy, fairly fine head. Straw yellow, cloudy. Fairly intense and persistent at nose. Hay, yellow fruit, herbal. Fine carbonation. Sweet entry and a good bitter in the finiskh
Restrained grassy aroma in a golden pour. Taste is solid with clean bitter finish.

This is a backlog rating from 2011 from a bottle shared by Tmoney99, from notes. When I had this beer it was average to below average for the style and not something I wanted to have again or I just didn't get back to my notes because of my technology at the time. Words to describe this beer are pale malts, citrus, some sweetness, mild bitterness.

On tap. Hazy reddish brown colour, thin beige head. Aroma of caramel, figs, light floral notes, hint of hops. Flavour is sweet, light malty, caramel, figs and prunes, light floral, a bit watery at times, bitter finish. Light bodied. Bland, but certainly drinkable.

Dieses Bier ist mir in Erinnerung geblieben, da ich es in einem Touristen-Abzocke-Restaurant in Rom bestellt habe, da es das einzige auf der Karte war, das mir preislich gerechtfertigt erschien. Zum Essen sind wir dann weitergezogen. Das Bier ist ein reichlich gehopftes Pale Ale, das schon fast ein IPA sein kann, wenn es dafür auch nicht ganz reicht. Gute Aromen gibt es wohl, aber sind mir ein bisschen zu wenig ausgeprägt.

cloudy reddish-brown colour with a persistent beige foam; aroma of caramel and butter; medium to full malt body; some sweetness, creamy mouthfeel with a touch of acidity; long caramelish aftertaste with a floral touch

Bottle @ Argentinian Steak house, Bangkok. Pours hazy orange with small frothy off-white head, orange peel aroma, high carbonation, malty taste, somewhat thick body, medium finish. Interesting fruity taste.

Pours a cloudy colour of rust with a great head of foam. I figured that since it was an extremely slow gusher. The nose is fruity with apple, evidence of mild tartness, flowery and to me, has a mint presence. Apple and some tartness up front, followed by an assertive Brett character. Again, mint and an abundance of bitterness. Medium body with champagne like carbonation. Good points, bad points. The sharpness and uber dryness make it not overly drinkable.

Appearance: Murky brown, good amount of lasting off-white head. Aroma: Slight malt, fruits, metallic. Taste: Malt, fruits, slight wood, some bitterness and hint of alcohol. Ok. Bought: Eataly (Turin), 330 ml, €2.90 Info: 23/1-2016, BB: 8/4-2016
chiara buona schiuma piuttosto persistente naso maltato un podi miele leggere cereale poco luppolo non molto amara piuttosto pulita
ambrato carico schiuma media meida persitente naso terrroso in bocca una lieve castagna poco corpo

Bottled 330ml. -from Eataly Trieste. Dark amber/brownish coloured, minimal off-white head that went away fast, caramel and weak chestnut in the nose. Sweet malty, light chestnut, caramel and light notes of smoke with dry bitterish sweet finish. More body wouldn't hurt for sure.
Wysoka i drobna piana.W zapachu s³odowe z lekko wyczuwalnym chmielem i delikatn¹ metalicznoœci¹. W smaku mocno s³odowe, lekko miodowe, pe³ne, dosyæ ciê¿kie. Goryczka niska.
@HOP! Artisan Brewery Weekend reddish clear. Red berries, winey nose, some herbs. Med bodied, light yeasty flavourful, nice -- rated with beerbasher/winphone
0,2l on tap @ HOP! Artisan Brewery Weekend 2016. Pours clear amber with a medium head. Aroma is sweet malts with some chestnut. Flavor is sweet malts, chestnut and some hops. Decent.
Draught @ hop Artisan. Earthy, fruity aroma, yeast, bit weird aroma. Flavor has ripe fruits, yeast, fruits. Bit messy, but somehow interesting.

33 cl. Lotto 769, 5,0 %vol. Marrone opalescente con riflessi caramello, schiuma beige di media persistenza. Aroma di nocciola e castagna, malti tostati in evidenza. Al palato stessi sentori, finale acido dato sempre dai malti tostati, misto ad un erbaceo che ricorda l'odore di macchia mediterranea. Corpo leggero, molto carbonata, texture watery, troppo sbilanciata verso il tostato amaro, tanto da risultare sgraziata.

From 33 bottle. Pours very pale yellow with adv unbelievable, excessive amount of foam, very fluffy. Aroma is zesty, lemony, lemon peel, a little spiced, little banana, the wheat is evident. Body is light, carbonation is not steering. Taste has some bitterness, but also a hint of acidity. Slight stringency comes with it. Finish is short.
Bottle at 100 piv. Quite simple but classic and good. Freshly cut grass, spicy, very light basementy. Lightly sour.
Bottle kindly donated by friend, many thanks Alicia. Hazy yellow color with medium white head. Lemony, yeasty aroma. Lemony, spicy taste with yeast. Good.

White creamy head. Cloudy pale yellow colour. Aroma is moderately malty with fruity (pear apple banana) and light spicy notes. Flavor is malty fruity with pear and plum tones,ending in a moderately fruity smd slightly sour finish. Light to medium bodied.
750ml foiled bottle. Picked up for 1.50. Hazed gold. aroma is mild, some chestnut, wheat. Flavor has some more tartness, chesstnut, and vanilla. Interesting take on the style.
Parfümierter Geruch und Antrunk, der aber zusätzlich wässrig ist. Minimal getreidig, wässrig, schlecht. 11/4/4/4//4

750ml bottle pours a golden color with a 2 finger white head that settles to leave a few spots of lacing on the glass. Aroma is light fruits and spices with some grains. Taste is a spicy hop bitterness with a fruity malt sweetness with a dry finish. Light to medium bodied with adequate carbonation. A nicely done Belgian ale.

750ml bottle. Pours a very pale straw, with a white head. Spicy, slightly phenolic aromas, citrus, wheat, some hops, honey. Dry, light bodied, low bitterness, balanced CO2. Citrusy taste, wheat, yeast, faintly spicy, malt, hops. Comes across slightly anemic. (2012-03-06)
Bevuta in bottiglia di colore chiaro abbastanza torbido con schiuma abbondante e persistente, ottimi i profumi di frutta matura, molto beverina e rinfrescante.

Light yeast, pale grain malts, light citrus fruits. Slightly hazy gold, small, frothy, white head. Light bitter. More grain malts, yeast, citrus fruits, lemon peel, soft carbonation, light bodied. Unremarkable Belgian Ale, boring. Keg at The Italian Job, Chiswick.

Many thanks to Beerhunter111 for sharing! Pale golden colour, fresh yeasty nose. The beer starts very smooth. Hints of sourness, very refreshing. Easy to drink with not much depth. A bit dry-dusty in the aftertaste with great fresh fruity aroma. The body is a bit watery, refreshing and round. Very nice and easy to drink stuff. Quite bitter in the aftertaste, fresh yeasty fruity aroma, but very dry. Nice!
Trübe goldgelbe Farbe, mittelgroße weiße Schaumkrone. Der Geruch ist zitronig hopfig, leicht hefig. Geschmack ist zitronig, schwach hopfig, getreidig, süß malzig, ok!

White full lasting head. Orange colour. Aroma is moderately malty with fruity (apricot and citrus) and light herbal and hoppy notes. Flavor is moderately hoppy with light tangerines tones, ending in a moderately hoppy and very slightly roasty finish. Light to medium bodied.
750ml foiled and nippe-capped bottle. Scored it for 1.50. Its a gusher. Pours a hazed gold. Aroma is oxidized pear. Flavor is similiar, some herbs in there, dry and effervescent. Pretty boring.
on tap chiara dorata torbida cereale lieve burro lievito poco aroma poco amara

Draught @ GEIB, Grande Esposizione Italiane della Birra 2012, Nuova Fiera di Roma, via Portuense 1645, Rome, Italy 00100. ABV: 5.0%. Clear medium yellow orange colour with a small to average, frothy, good lacing, mostly diminishing, white to off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, toasted - caramel, pale malt, fruity, almond, light straw. Flavour is moderate sweet, light acidic and moderate bitter with a long duration, sour, malty, fruity, cabbage water. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20121215]
Un intruglio imbevibile, francamente non si capisce come una simile birra sia potuta finire al 4:20
From tap at the brewpub. Pours claudy yellow to orange with a lacing white head. Aroma is mild bitter with a light cornish note. Mild acid and bitter flavour with a subdued sweetness.

From tap at the brewpub. Pours hazy amber to brown with a diminished off-white head. Aroma is light acidic with a light fruity note. Fruits and hops shine more through in the flavour. Light acidic berry touch. Medium bitter finish yet with a lingering fruity touch.
strange beer with singular aroma of olives abnd smokey things.even flavor is very particular.finishes acidic. not agreat one

From tap at the brewpub. Pours hazy to murky brown with a lacing light tan head. Aroma is light acidic with a mild fruity note. Flavour is medium sweet with a growing herbal bitterness and mixed with a distinct spiced/berry note. Ends with a steadily increasing bitterness. Interesting yet it doesnt really aim at anything specific. Finish holds a mild lacto/brett note, talking to the people at the place that wasn’t intentional - works fine though.
[Draught at Salone del Gusto 2006] Not a bock but a dark lager; sweet, fruity, aroma and flavour like of fermenting wort.. enjoyable anyway.

11-NOV-2011, @Radisson Blu, Rome. After visiting "Ma Che Siete..." I grabbed this bought earlier in the day. My notes read "duxa" in stead of "Anxa"... The rest of the notes does make some kind of sense:) Very dark for an IPA - amber with lasting white head. Certainly on the malty side for an IPA. Although it does have a lot of hoppy bitter, piney, grape fruity notes - the fruity sweet malty side kicks in as well. Except for the ABV this could almost pass for an IIPA. Lovely creamy and long bitter and malty finish. Great.
buona schiuma persistente ma grossolana mediamente frizzante aromi poco intensi in bocca decisamente secca ed amaro amariccante ed aromatico che taglia nettamente il palata per cultori dell’amaro

500 ml. botlle. Amber colour, big head, with normal retention. Smell is mostly vanilla essence, with herbs and even some barnyard in the end. Light body, with an oily texture and fizzy in tongue. Taste is sweet but earthy, vanilla does not appear that much. To be a bio, I find it a bit artificial, but it’s one you can drink any day.
ambrato scarico torbida schiuma media media persitenza note diacetile acetico acido anche in bocca si avverte un po di malto luppolo poco
una birracon un aroma inconfondibilie miele E farina di castagno le conferiscono un profumo e un retrogusto particolarmente interessanti.

Bottle from A Tutta Birra, Milan Cloudy orange-amber color; huge head. The aroma is pungent, sour; the body is now thin and there is some sourness in the flavor too: unmistakeable infection, which explains the cloudy appearance too. Light fruitness, difficult to say if wanted or as a result of the infection; the final is not too bad. Probably it wasn’t too bad…
Una birra particolare, forse troppo. L’uso della castagna si sente e non poco, soprattutto al palato dove predomina il senso di amido. buona la schiuma, un po’ meno il colore.
una birra semplicemente perfetta, provata in diverse occasioni. schiuma persistente e consistete, buon compo, limpida, aroma e gusto equilibrati.
500ml bottle purchased at A Tutta Birra Milan, Italy for 7.00 euro. Not too impressive.

Bottled. A brown beer with an orangey head. The aroma has notes of malt, alcohol, and caramel. The flavor is very sweet with notes of caramel, alcohol, flowers, malt, and candy, leading to a dry finish.
Brown with a small off-white head. Fruit, chocolate and toffee aroma. Sweet toffee malty flavour with some alcohol.

RBESG 2010, Grand Tasting, bottle Hazy brown color. Aroma of caramel and apples. Strong body, strong caramel flavor, with traces of apples, sweetish; hints of grappa; the alcohol perception is too high, burning. Low bitterness. Unbalanced.

Someone referred to this as this brewer’s take on an Irish Ale. Not even close. The aroma is slightly spicy, peppery. The appearance is a light yeloow/ed color, white head. The alvor is like the aroma, fruity, spicy, peppery. the finish is simply spicy. Medium in body. OK.

Bottle 37.5 cl. RBESG Rome 2010. Courtesy of Alex420. Slightly hazy orangey brown with an off-white head. Sweet dried fruit and yeast in the nose. Quite full-bodied, sweet dried fruit, yeast and friendly phenols. Some alcohol in the finish. 060610

Bottle 375ml. @ RBESG 10 Grand Tasting at the Brasserie 4:20 warehouse. light unclear medium to dark brown amber color with a small, frothy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, beige head. Aroma is moderate malty, caramel, dark berry, wood, brown sugar, phenol. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is flat, finish feel is moderate alcoholic. [20100606]
37.5 cL bottle. Pours dark brown with a small tan head. Aroma is dark malty, yeasty and dark malty. Dark malty, phenolic and overripe fruity. Light liqourice note. Dry and phenolic finish.

6th June 2010. RBESG 10 Grand Tasting at the Brasserie 4:20 warehouse. Cloudy brown beer. Light palate. Low carbonation. Rich sherryish malt with dark toffee and caramel. Suprisingly hot alcohol. A little spice in the finish.

I guess this is it. It said Irish Ale on the bottle but after tasting it I decided it was of Blegian descent. Pours a murky amber color with a sturdy, creamy head that lingers the whole time. Smells of rock candy. Full nectar with creamy effers. The flavors was good exposed too much alcohol. Left a bad taste in my mouth.
irish red 7.3 percent ... deep red ... soft toffee malts nose... deep malt tones ... rich toffee ... soft malt ... big and sweet

Dorato chiaro tendente al limone con schiuma bianca fine e persistente. Al naso molto floreale, crosta di pane e leggera mela verde. Al palato mela verde e pane, lieve metallico. Corpo tendente al watery con carbonazione media e a grana fine.
Dorato arancio, velata, poca schiuma. Molto dolce sia al naso che al palato, fruttata. Poco kolsch.
Hazy yellow color, with a medium white head. Aroma is hoppy, with some yeast notes. Taste is citrus, spicy, wheat. Not really a Kölsch, but refreshing and nice.
E’ stat una delle mie prime birre,non posso raffrontarla ad altre dello stesso stile. Birra delicata,dolce,bel colore profumi floreali e di miele,molto beverina. Da assaggiare sicuramente.
Tasting at Eataly, Rome. Pale, hazed lemon yellow. Pale banana lager. Sweet, very clean, a little banana and dry grain. solid.

[10/17/13] Draught at Open Baladin in Rome. Hazy golden with a white head. Yeasty aroma with fruity esters, light grassy hops and light spicy notes. Sweetish and fruity flavor with light spicy hints and a mildly bitter finish. Light to medium-bodied. Pretty easy-drinking, but too yeasty and fruity for the style.
Bottiglia 75cl. Bianca torbida con schiuma corposa ma poco persistente. Al naso e in bocca molto simile ad una waizen. Cereali ed un poco di agrumi, finale "corto" amarognolo.

Bottle, split at Open Baladin Roma, 21/06/13. Clear pale golden with a decent looking white head. Nose is pale malts, grass, wheat, cereals, citrus. Taste follows. Medium bodied with moderate carbonation, crisp and refreshing in the finish. Ok Kolsch.

Colore giallo dorato, velata, schiuma abb persistente, bianca e non molto fine. Aroma di cereale, frumento. Non molto intenso. al palato ritroviamo il cereale con un finale leggermente amaro. Non convincente
Hefig-getreidiger Beginn, laff. Süffig aber langweilig, trocken herb, zum Ende in Zügen bitter werdend. Muss man nicht gehabt haben. 12/8/10/8//8

Marrone chiaro con riflessi dorati. Schiuma nocciola persistente. Al naso nocciola, toffee, caramello e miele. Al palato si aggiunge la prugna disidratata. Corpo un po' troppo leggero rispetto allo stile.
Tasting at Eataly, Rome. Dubbel sweet caramel malt aroma, some yeast. Sweet, tart caramel grain. Dry tart husk. Some dubbel quality, doppio malto house flavor. Solid, but needs refinement.
Ambrato carico schiuma media non molto persistente naso maltato leggero caramelo un po di esteri un tocco fruttato buon corpo alcoll piuttodto nascosto tendente al dolce lieve erbaceo

Bottled. A hazy amber beer with a huge light tan head. The aroma is sweet malty with light notes of berries. The flavor is sweet malty with notes of berries, lending it a bit of acidity, leading to a dry ans slightly tart finish, where the note of berries lingers. Huge thanks to yespr for sharing.

(Bottle 75 cl) Courtesy of yespr. Slightly hazy amber golden with a dense off-white head leaving some lacework. Aroma of fruit and a whiff of yeast. Medium body with light fruity accents and a vague underlying acidity. The finish is short and dry. 290508

Bottle 75cl @ [ Mafioso Blind Tasting @ yespr, Bottle #34.] Light unclear medium amber color with a average to large, frothy, good lancing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, cabbage, moderate yeasty. Flavor is moderate to light heavy sweet, vinegar with a average to long duration. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. (300508)

[Italian Blind tasting @ yespr, Bottle 34#] Hazy dark amber with large off white head. Sourish aroma with toasted malt and caramel. Sour flavor with toasted malt, caramel and berries. Ends sour. Clearly infected.

Blind tasting @ Yespr. Red-brown with a creamy head. The aroma is sour with notes of apple, orange peel and malt. The flavour has a light sweetness and a sharp, tart sourness, notes of malt and candy sugar. It’s very unbalanced and must be infected.

Bottle#34: 75 cL bottle. Pours hazy redish with a collapsing off-white head. Mild yeasty and spiced aroma. Shows a light note of infection. Flavour is sweet caramel malt with a light citric touch throughout. Mild yeasty touch towards the finish. Citric bite into the finish, sadly also infected.

#34 Bottle 75 cl. [Mafioso testing @ yespr, thanks buddy] Huge thick and creamy beige head that mostly lasted. Excellent lacework. Light cloudy amber color with particles in flow. Aroma of fruit, citrus, metallic, hint of grain. Over the palate came mild spice. Light to medium bodied with a soft carbonation. Light to moderated sweet flavor with acidic notes. Fruity and spicy sour finish. 5 / 3 / 4 / 2 / 11 = 2.5

Bottle, 330ml, bottle-conditioned. A very cloudy golden colour with no head. Sweet aromas of barley, honey, yeast and citrus. The taste is really sour and the sourness hits you as soon as it touches your lips. Tastes strongly of sage, lemon and grapefruit with a hint of barley. A sweet and sour finish. Very light carbonation (I suspect it hasn’t bottle conditioned, despite being given adequate time to do so). How can you rate something derived from a unique blend of herbs, since you don’t know how it’s supposed to taste....? Anyway, if you like sour ales (I don’t) then you’ll love this. For me, this was an experience worth having but not one I’d care to repeat.

330 ml “2015" version bought at HKBWEX in mong Kok. Looks: Clear amber copper colour with a thick ring of dirt-like yeast sediments; Last than one-quarter finger head with soapy off-white foam which fades in 10 seconds; Poor sticky lacing with quite fizzy carbonation. Aroma: Fragrant and sweet full amber malt, with strong caramel, toffee, alcohol, apricots, yellow fruits, floral, sugar, light spices, thick bread, strong yeast, light lemon and grass. Taste: Mid to strong sweet amber malt, with liquor-like alcohol, light caramel and toffee, floral, sugar, light spices, dry bread, yeast, lemon, fair bitter hops and grass. Body: Full body. Quite thick and slick palate. Mouth Feel: Full amber maltyness in a slightly thin but slick background. Pretty much devoid of characters except strong bready dryness and lingering Ambrée-like liquor. Caramel / toffee and fruity esters are traces only. Light flowery with pleasing strong sweetness. Yeasty, light spicy with lemon to round. Boring! Hoppiness: Floral, light spices, light lemon and grass in nose and taste; Bitterness is light for an abrupt, low astringent sweet Amber malty finish. After Taste: Dry. Bready yeasty and light bitter to mouth. Comments: Previously I had the "Tsjeeses Reserva - Bourbon BA" and it was a disasterous sweet bomb. This original Tsjeeses is less sweet, a lot dryer and yeasty but nothing more. It lacks characters in all area, it is easy to drink and inoffensive, but otherwise totally pointless as an Ambrée. One of the most disappointing beers by Struise. Sad.
Bottle, the 2015 variety. The beer has a strong, full feel and a slightly sweet taste. Would be much better without that subtle boozy finish.

The aroma of the Bretts, a bit of straw. Bright straw color, slightly cloudy with good white foam. On the palate, esters, a slight acidity, malt, a little hop in a dry aftertaste. The body is medium, carbonation is large.

Dark golden colour. Very interesting mix. Aroma is very yeasty and has light funk but also candy sugar in the background. Flavour starts with candy sweetness before the dryness and yeastiness kicks in. Finish has a light tang.

37.5cl bottle at home. Appearance: hazy golden with medium sized, pretty stable white head. Aroma: very much like a lambic, much more than 1/10 lambic, as it seems to me. Notes of brett, apple, slightly malty, honey, funky, hint of nutmeg and stonefruits. Taste: above medium sweetness, medium bitterness and ever so slightly tart. Notes of sweet malts, brett, red apples, apricot jam, some clove, hint of grapeskins and honey. Palate: medium bodied, slightly sticky and oily texture, medium carbonation and a rather dry finish. Overall: wow, this is something. To me, this is the perfect belgian beer. The warmth, spice and body of a tripel with the fruits and that crisp tartness of a lambic. Very well done. Maybe not the best sour/wild beer, but a the absolute winner in between the Tripel and Sour style
Thanks to Slacker. Pours hazy yellow with no head. Stone fruits, yeast, apples, honey. Medium body soft carbonation.

Dorada con espuma blanca du duración corta. Aroma con notas cítricas y avinagradas. sabor con alta presencia de brettas, criticas, algo de naranja, levadura. Final ligero, algo frutal y con moderada acidez.
De 32gp. En vaso de pinta inglesa de Ikea. Jugando a Slat the Spire. Correcta, aunque tiene uno la continua sensacion que le falta ese algo especial que da el agua inglesa a este estilo de birras
Degustada en tirador,pale ale cuerpo ligero,color anaranjado muy sabrosa y refrescante.
Aromas florales y terrosos Buen aspecto espuma persistente En boca balanceada, maltosa y fruta madura y un final amargo suave
Slightly hazy golden. Mountainous head. Aroma is hay. Taste is pretty malty with a hint of lemon.
Degustada en la misma masia de ales agullons,birra muy sencilla con monomalta pale y dos clases de lupulo,y lo mas dificil es que salga tan buena,fresca ,agradable,para repetir y repetir.
Tap @ Moeder Lambic Fontainas, Brussels 20160507. Malty and fruity, grassy and spicy with yeasty notes. The finish is bitter, malty and fruity.
Tap @ moeder lambic brussels. Pours dark orange colour beer with a small head. Hoppy with notes of citrus and dishwashing liquid. Dry finish
On Tap . @Cimmeria, Oviedo 06/11/2015 Color amarillo, aroma herval, sabor herval, resinosa.

Sampled from bottle @ Leuven Innovation Beer Festival. Hazy orange color, small white head. Smell malts, lightly hops, lightly sweetish. Taste lightly malts, lightly fruity in the background, lightly hops, decently bitter. Dry bitter finish. Decent body and carbonation. Not bad at all.
Sample at Leuven Innovation Beer Festival. Thanks for sharing today’s beers! APPEARANCE: clear red beer, small unstable white head. NOSE: fruity, fresh. TASTE: fruity, fresh.

Me h guatado se hace un poco azucarada de mas para lo que es de estilo parece aparentemente de abadia pir el dulzor pero el aroma recuerda a una lager. No esta mal. Me la bebi leyendo a un autor japones. Hay mejores cervezas en japon sin dudar

De Club del Gourmet de El Corte Ingles. En copa Teku. Jugando a Baldur's Gate Enhanced. Bastante plana. Levadurosa, con ligera acidez y mas azucarada de la cuenta, siendo pesada de beber a pesar de su bajo abv

I got this OWA Japanese ceramic type glass and decided to break it in with their brown beer paired with some cheese, Polish pâté and fresh bread. The aroma is deep dark delicious figs and candies fruits while the taste is big caramel syrup, dark candies fruits and a rough dry finish. The finish gives some cinnamon spice notes but I’d say it’s a pretty average Belgian Dark Ale. The cheese accentuates the sharply of the beer and vice-versa, not really such a good pairing. The late and bread accentuated the caramel and maltiness which worked very well together delivering a slight boost in flavor to both. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Entre dorada y ambar de espuma abundante y efervescente. Aroma escaso, madera, licor. En boca base acaramelada, y predominio dulce, pero con contrapunto seco y amargo y notas ácidas. Gas punzante, quizá en exceso.
Botella. @Kaisen Sushi Bar, Oviedo 09/12/2017 Con ambarino con corona de espuma blanca aromas maltosos y dulces,el sabor es dulce cuerpo medio

F: big, irregular, egg-white, good retention. C: amber, light hazy. A: caramel, bit nutty, toffee, bit herbal. T: malty, caramel, metallic, tea, herbal, bit nutty, high disturbing carbonation, medium body, ok beer nothing special, 33cl bottle from Bierwinkel De Hopduvel in Gent.
