Dark brown creamy head. Aromas bready, yeasty, toffee, caramel. Flavors bready, yeasty, toffee, slight caramel, slight alcohol in nose. Medium to high sweetness. Not bad but no comparison to the abt 12.

for the style it’s not as good as their flagship, it tastes a little bit more bitter, and consequently takes away from the body forward-ness. The nose is great, the taste is great, just need a bit more body to be great. bottle 3 years before expiration. Online belgian beer factory bottle
Aroma: plum, malt, tiny amount of banana & pine Appearance: dark brown, hazy, beige lasting head Flavour: plum, date, malt cinnamon Palate: medium palate weight with lingering malt

Appearance: Very dark brown, good amount of dark tan head. Aroma: Ripe fruits, dark fruits, bananas. Some malt and spices. Taste: Lots of fruits, sweet, caramel. Some malt, dried fruits. Dessert-like. Bought: Halle aux Boissons (Matran), 330 ml, CHF 3.20 Info: 2/3-2019, BB: 6/9-2022

22 ounce bomber bottle. Smells like Belgium sugar and yeast. Very big off-white head which is thick. The beer has tiny bubbles Deep amber warm rust in color. Alcohol well hidden and medium body. Very smooth. I taste the sweetness of the sugar. Taste some of the bready yeast flavor also. This beer has has a sweet aftertaste This beer is straight up wonderful! Cheers!
Ocena wystawiona na podstawie wspomnieñ z degustacji w ramach uzupe³nienia profilu.
Drukket i 2016. Mistet lidt CO2, men ellers fantastisk rund i smagen, men god smag af malt og karamel.

Vintage. Pours a dark and copper beer with no head. The aroma is malt, sweetness, vinous, fruit, raisin and dried fruit. The flavor follows the nose with additional alcohol and notes of cardboard. The palate is sweetness with alcoholwarmth. Overall a good beer.
Amber color with a medium sized off-white head. Aroma of dark fruits. Sweet malty flavor.
Tasted Dec 2011. Pours copper with a beige head. Aroma is caramel, cardboard, alcohol and bread. Flavour is breaddy caramel, alcohol, fruit and nuts.

tasted sep 2010. clear red amer smooth offwhite head. flowery fruity aroma. faint oxidized hops, but generally aroma is pretty good. has aged really well. flavor is sweet malts, sweet fruits, good bitterness.

Bottle. huge thanks Faroeviking! Pours hazy dark reddish brown with a creamy off white head. Loads of caramel and dark ripe fruit, and barley wine like sweetness. Wow! This has really increased by cellaring. Long sweet ripe fruity finsih. Nice one!
Backlogging: Brown with low head. Sweet aroma of caramel, syrup and brown sugar. The flavour is similar sweet combined with a heavy load of alcohol.

Not sure this is the right one, they called it the belgian red...oh well...On tap at brewpub. Red-orange with a short-lasting white head. Tastes like caramel and yeast, somewhat woody. Dry, sandy herbal hops in the finish. Medium-to-strong bodied. Good ale.

From the brewpub on New York Ave, this draft pour came a slightly hazy with a white head and good lacing. Nose of ripe fruit. Light body and smooth mouthfeel. Flavor is sweet malts with ripe fruit like the aroma. Easy drinking and quite enjoyable.
I had this beer a while back and from what I can remember I enjoyed it. I’ve had this at the pub/brewery so it was fresh. Nothing special about it is popping into my head at the moment.

at inner harbor location, lightly yeasty aroma, not mcuh spice or banana, color was very pale gold, slightly cloudy, very thin white laced head, smooth and sweet flavor, lots of floral and grass tones, but not overwhelming in any one area. nicely balanced aftertaste, solid amount of body for a lighter style, overall a good session beer

(Draught, 2008 & 2009; scored the same) Pours a clear golden body with a medium off-white head. Aroma of grass, soap, coriander, floral, and light pepper. Flavor of mild hops (grass, orange, light herbal), coriander, and some candi sugar.

On draft at the Shirlington location. Poured as expected, full golden color with a generous white head. The aroma was bananas and other fruity type esters. The flavor followed the aroma, this beer coming off like an imperial hefeweizen more than anything Belgian, with spicing and hopping elements near to nil. Mouthfeel was moderate within style.

Draught @ Capitol Hill location: This was served in a chalice. It poured a cloudy, golden yellow color. There was a bit of a white head onit, that left some lacing. The aroma was nice. It had bready, yeasty notes, as well as a slight citrus aroma. The taste was a touch spicy with some coriander. Medium body with a somewhat bready taste also. A slightly tart finish. Not too bad, as I had 2.

Draft on the Hill. Golden-orange with dissipating white head. Sweetish, yeasty nose with notes of oranges and pineapple, other fruits. Moderately sweet flavor with mild bitterness and lively mouthfeel. Tasty but not really exciting.

Draft @ Downtown location. Hazy peach and wheat colored body with a white head. Semi-tart peach rind flavor, full body, chewy, thick, then peppery and fuzzy as times. Muddy wheat and light peach sweet-and-tart flavors, a little too heavy and chewy, more than it needs to be, but otherwise very drinkable.

Beer on tap. Nice cloudy golden with minimal fluffy head. Aroma of fresh citrus with some flower nuance. Palate of bold citrus with wheat, middle palate of grainy-herb flavor with a sweet finish. Drinkable but perhaps preferable in the summertime.

Bottled: Fresh aroma with cirtus notes and hints of herbs. Pale yellow, very hazy color with small frothy, instable head. Flavor is dominated by herbal notes of tea and herbal lemonade. Artificial sugar notes, mint and citrus notes. Astringent, light sweet finish. Quite unusual but thirst quentching beer, interesting herb notes. Sadly too intensive phenylalanin notes.

Bottle from Vin-Gaven, Vodskov, thanks mom. Chestnut brown with a small tan head with good retention, lace and regeneration. Brown bread, brown sugar, wood, light dried green plants, twigs, dark dried fruits. Medium body, mild to medium sweet and medium bitter. Long malty finish.

From Boxbeers. Abv 6.8. In Bavaria hefe glass. Watching Belle. Huge amount lf initial foam, but not feels overcarbonated as its aspect may suggest. Instead, its fairly smooth and has a very pleasant bock-caramel sweetness
Bottle at home. Clear amber body with a small white head. Malt, caramel, light hoppy, citrus notes.

From bottle. Dark golden with a foamy head. Caramel, bread and pilsner hops. Sweet and slightly sour with typical hop bitterness. Like others from Skagen Bryghus. This is a decent beer, well crafted but for me it lacks some character.
Very light pour, clear, yellow, soapy head. Smell of apples, almost cider-like. Very thin mouth feel. Flavor is somewhat fruity. A little apple-like. Some mild metallic quality. Nothing exciting.
From a "tall boy" can... this brew had a sickeningly sweet, wet hay aroma and tasted like fermented urine. Avoid this brew!

I can’t believe this graffiti-and-skyline can contains a beer so rare, so exclusive, that is has been rated only once. The body is so light I hesitate to describe its color, but know that it is as pale as a moderately-hydrated hiker’s urine. A sweet, corny aroma greets my nose hairs. Sweet, strange body, very thin and watery, nothing potent like I expected. Corn and water. Plastic. A must try for the cornchaser.

The ABV isn’t indicated on the 24-ounce can, but this seems rather mild for a malt liquor. Looks like one, urine yellow with a quickly departed head. Smells like corn, generic malts, alcohol, and plastic. I miss the usual metallic elements, but they show up in the flavor. Along with the plastic, alcohol, creamed corn, and a dirty bitterness. Special! Party Pak Liquors, Indianapolis, IN
Interesting label if nothing else. Pours coppey/straw and fizzy. Smells of sweet malt and some peppery hints. A stray hop or two on the taste but otherwise, very watery and bland.
Bottled (4.2%), thanks Zappa Was Right! A golden beer with no head. The aroma is sweet with notes of ccarcboard and oranges, and so is the flavor though added a light metallic note.
Bottle, Stockholm Beer Festival 2007 afterfestival at Per’s Blond color. Quite bad cereals aroma and taste, very dry and metallic, vegetables. Quite horrible.
Bottled Golden color, small white head. Diacetylic, buttery nose. Buttery, sweetish, malty flavor. Too much buttery and cellary flavors for me but new rare country, thanks to Per and Zappa Was Right!
Bottled (4.2% ABV), thanks omhper & Zappa Was Right!. Deep amber colour, not much head. Aroma is really corny sweet with some earthy hints. Flavour is buttery, sweet, earthy with some hayish hints.

Bottled (4.2%), thanks Zappa Was Right! Clear golden, brief head. Buttery cellary nose. Sweet and quite malty with medium body. Has a full array of Soviet style buttery cellar flavours, but in this case the flavours are kept under control and actualy gives the beer a bit of character. Finishes with notes of hay but low bitterness.

I finally sat down to have this brew. Bottle. I was suspecting something really bad. But I was actually wrong. Weak hazy yellow colour with an amazing long lasting head. Some sweet maltish aroma. The flavour is not fresh from tap...but actually allright. Some malty sweetness with an average syrup feeling on the tongue. I will most likely never try a beer from Turkmenistan again so I actually tried hard to enjoy it. Thank you Jamal from Azerbaijan!

Bottle shared in the US. Honestly, delicious. Pours deep brown with a light, foamy off-white head. Nicely aged, with notes of toffee, caramel, brown bread, mild oxidation. Full bodied, lightly chewy, with fine carbonation. Balanced finish, warming, with more toasted bread, dates. So solid.

13 year old bottle from Nikki's, in Providence. Pours cloudy mahogany with a thin, light tan head. Aroma is bourbon, dried fruit and caramel. Taste is raisin and caramel, moving to buttery notes and light roast. Finish is strong bourbon and alcohol heat. For a well aged beer, this one is still pretty hot, but still a tasty barley wine.

750ml corked bottle in a tulip. Pours deep amber/copper with no head. Aroma of bourbon barrels, some light peat/smokiness, caramel and toffee malts, notes of alcohol, and light hops. Flavor the same, but the lack of carbonation hurts this beer for sure. No carb. Interesting and cool, but could have been done better.

750mL bottle. Poured clear, shimmery reddish-brown with just a light ring for head. The aroma picked up syrupy molasses, honey, and vanilla with light charred oak and peppery bourbon when you dig deep.. warm and welcoming. The flavor found lots more honey and molasses at the core with toasted oak and peppery bourbon around.. finished dry with lots of barrel and mild oxidation.. hid the booze fairly well. Heavier-bodied and slick on the palate.. a bit muddled at this point, but it held up fairly well.

Bottle thanks to hophead22. Pours with a hazed golden body. Still. Aromas are of maple syrup, brandy, raisins, plum, dark fruit, vanillin, brown sugar, and alcohol. Light corked aroma. Flavors are oxidized, medium leather, sweet, brown sugar, strawberry, oak, some ester. Finishes earthy, almost a bit peat like. Mostly flat, warming and syrupy.

Blue bottle from MrFacto. Rating #116. Hazy orangish pour with no head whatsoever. Nice aroma, oxidization, a little booze, sweet caramel malts. No carbonation to speak off which really detract from any flavors that I’m getting. (2284)
750. No head and minimum carbonation. Big nose and body of brown sugar, caramel and toffee. An aged beer for sure. Taking on some sherry with age.
(750ml bottle) Pours a clear orange body with a spare off-white head. Aroma of mustiness, cardboard, caramel, and bourbon. Flavor of caramel, bourbon, herbs, grass, peat, and light minerals.

This poured a murky brown color with a beige head. Aroma was lots of caramel and tofffee, with minty oxidation there as well. Flavor was cardboard like, light alcohol and lots of sugars. Eh, just old.
750ml bottle @RBSG-pours a dissipating off white head and amber color. Aroma is sweet medium malt, spice. Taste is sweet medium malt-caramel, alcohol, spice hops.

Cask at the Swan, Farnborough. Floral and malt aroma. Light chestnut. Creamy and bubbly white head. Light-mesium bitter. A tang to it. Citrus and berries. Underlying malt. Medium bodied. Slick. Flat carbonation. Decent lively bitter. Rock on.

Cask Pint at Wibbas Down (JDW), Wimbledon, London in Apr 2010 - Amber (chestnut-brown) in colour. Malty; sweet malts, caramel. Hoppy; grassy and slightly earthy hops. Fruity; mildly citrus orange. Sweet fruity malty throughout with some bitterness in the finish Rather too sweet. (2010-04)
Cask at JDWs in Surbiton. Now up to 5% but doesn’t taste like it. Grassy hops, light citrus and quite a dry, bitter finish. Nice beer.
Cask, 1/2 pint, hand-pulled, Three Judges, Glasgow (28 May 2016), grassy, citrus aroma, deep amber with a thin bubbly head and no lacing, orange, toffee flavoury, dry, bitter finish.

On cask at the Guildford Arms. Appearance - deep amber to red with a decent head. Nose - a hint of stewed apples. Taste - oranges and biscuits. Orange liqueur even. Bitter orange pith on the end. Palate - close to medium bodied with a tangy texture and a long dry bitter finish. Overall - very interesting if a bit gnarly.
Cask at the Guildford Arms. 5%. Pours clear amber with a thick white head. Aromas of biscuit, faint orange, toffee. Taste is more of the same. Clean finish. Not bad, if not particularly exciting.
Cask at the Guildford arms. Pours clear amber, nose is burnt toffee, biscuit, pine, taste is dry, toffee, light fruit, quite bitter.

Up to 5% now. Dark-ish bitter with a strong citrus character and a competing flavour of (very) sweet malt. All finished with a typically sharp and bitter aftertaste. Citrus is not really my thing and somehow the beer doesn’t seem to balance out that well although I’m sure plenty of drinkers will find it more to their taste than I did.
Ascot 2015. Pours a clear brown colour with a white head, aroma is malt with some caramel, taste is bitter with dry finish.
Cask. Dark orange, hazy, small white head. Aroma has orange and lemon. Body is light, pretty foamy, no carbonation. Taste has straw, stick, toffee malt. Pretty nice.
Aussehen : Goldgelbes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone Geruch : blumig und Malz Geschmack : Kräuter und mild

50cl swing top bottle. Pours clear orange golden colour with a small beige head. Aroma of grainy and toasted malt, caramel, some sweet malt. Taste of toasted grainy malt, some nuts, caramel, some spicy hops, not too bitter, overall okay!

Keg at the brewpub, Neu Ulm, 06/02/15. Clear light chestnut brown with a decent off white covering. Nose is caramel, nutty, toffee, mellow dark fruit rinds. Taste comprises light butterscotch, straw, earthy, light spice, fruit rinds. Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close. Ok.
Pours a deep amber with a thin white head. Decent head retention and lacing. Aroma of caramel and toasted malts.

(swing top bottle) Clear, amber colour with a short off-white foamy head. Slightly bready and delicately nutty cara-malty aroma with a touch of herbal hops in the background. Sweet and delicately bitter flavour, light bodied with a well-carbonated mouthfeel. Mildly bready cara-malty base with nutty spots; sweet and slightly hop bitter with notes of herbal spice. Good, just a tad slim. 21.VIII.13

Bouteille(merci, Mr.Quack-Duck!): Deep golden to copper coloured, loose and rather quickly collapsing off-white head, honeyish and caramelly nose, traces of walnuts detectable, some fruits as well; moderate sweet-bitter flavour, relatively light bodied for a beer of 5.5%, but still soft; shorter bitter and malty finish. Nice, but thin…
bottle from the brewery. Chetsnut-golden colour, mid-sized off-white head. Biscuity-malty, slightly grainy with a tiny touch of caramel. Grassy-resiny hops in the finish.
Hohe Karbonisierung, säuerlich bitterer Antrunk. Wenig malzig, trocken, unausgewogen. Spritzig, für ein Märzen nicht sonderlich. 11/8/8/9//8

# 2892 ersma: gibts als 0.5 und als „bügele“ in 0.33-l-plopp. dunkel bernsteinfarben. der geruch ist malzig, süßlich mit karamellnote. der antrunk it leicht malzig, dann schnell hopfiger werdend. zur mitte ist es hopfenbetont, aber auf die angenehme art. der abgang ist etwas süßlicher, mit karamell. der hopfen bleibt jedoch dominant. die flasche sieht ok aus, ob als normal oder bügele. fazit: lecker, aber etwas dünn auf der brust.
Bottled. Golden color, big lively cloudy white head. Grassy hops, yeast and brewing mash in the aroma. Grassy hops, toffee, brown sugar in the flavor. Hoppy and toasted sugary aftertaste.

Flasche 0,33l: Kastanienbraun, Mahagoni, glasklar, deutlicher mittelporiger Schaum; frische Nase, kräftige malzige Süße, Karamell, dunkle Fruchtigkeit, Zwetschgen, Röstaromen, leichte Säure, angenehme Hopfenaromen; frischer Körper, Malz, Malzzucker, etwas Karamell, dunkle Früchte, leichte Röstaromen, spritzig/cremig, deutliche Kohlensäure, dezente Hopfennoten, leichte fruchtige Säure; angenehmer fruchtig-malziger Nachgang

courtesy of Philipp and Tomas - clear ruby-brown beer under a solid creamy dark beige foam; nice lace; aroma of caramel and flowers, light toasted; medium-bodied, sweet, light grainy, lot of caramel in the finish, gently earthy and flowery

Vielen Dank an kevnic2008! Klares dunkel bernsteinfarbenes Bier mit einer geringen beigen Schaumkrone. Geruch nach Karamell, gering röstmalzig, nussig. Geschmack sehr malzig, wenig Karamell, gering hopfig, nussig.
Süßlicher, leicht röstiger Malzantrunk. Leichte Herbe, das Malz steigt an. Süffig, ein wenig fruchtig. Die Röstnoten versiegen schnell, dennoch ein rundes Schwarzbier. 7/8/10/8/7/9
Thanks to kevnic2008 for that one. Not really black, but brownish. Nice head. Starts mild, malty, modest sweet, light hints of caramel. Well balanced finish, quite drinkable. Average, but okay.

The color is dark amber and the head is creamy. The aroma has notes of caramel, roasted malt and light nuts. The flavor has a light sweetness and notes of nuts, caramel, roasted malt and the finish is slightly dry with a touch of dark syrup, nice!
Deep brown color slight head and lace. Malty toast of aroma. Taste is one of hints of chocolate, slightly nutty

Bottle 330ml. [ As Schlumberger Schwarzer Ochs ]. Clear light dark amber colour with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting to diminishing, off-white to white head. Aroma is moderate malty, toasted, caramel, light roasted, light to moderate hoppy, grass, hay, light brown sugar - malt sugar. Flavour is moderate sweet and light bitter with a average to long duration. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20120203]

Bottle: Almost clear, amber coloured, smaller off-white foamy layer; mild aroma of roasted malt, caramel and hidden fruits; moderate sweet-bitter flavour, light to medium bodied; increasing fruity traces in the sweet-malty and shy bitter finish. Quite a pleasant Dunkel......

(bottle, 33cl) Slightly hazy, not very dark for a Schwarzbier but chestnut-brown-coloured with a big and slightly tanned foamy head. Sweet and slightly toasty malty nose with notes of caramel and a tinge of vegetables and metallic hops. Moderately sweet flavour, light to medium bodied with a moderate carbonation. Toasty malt-character with caramel/toffee and shy herbal accents; Slightly toasty and slim but sweetish malty finish with little to none hops character. This is neither a Schwarzbier nor a decent but a pretty lame Dunkel. 09.V.10

Cask Handpump at The Wellington, Birmingham. Gold with a very short head. Very malty scent of barley and citrus fruits. Very thin but with a very dry finish. Very bitter but with a very sterile, almost chlorine taste. So much so that I checked with the bar-staff that I wasn’t drinking pipe-cleaner. But no, apparently it’s just the distinctive taste of Belgian Maryenka hops.

0,33l bottle at home. BB 26.09.2016. dark yellow cloudy color, small white head. smells of grains, some sweetness, spices, peppery notes, light cardboardish, quite average smell. medium to full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes peppery, spices, some cardboard again, tobacco, light sweetness. finishes lighty bitter with some cardboard and peppery notes. not a fan.
Draught: Aroma is honey sweet, malty, light grainy. Sweet, light malty, quite intensive honey flavor. Light astringent, light bitter beer.

Date: 12/17/2006 Mode: Draft Source: Brewpub clear dark amber, fine beige head, nice lace, sweet caramel malt aroma with a nice nutty character, lots of sweet caramel flavor, light bitterness, a touch of appropriate butterscotch accentuates the sweetness in the aroma and flavor, Aroma: 6/10; Appearance: 6/10; Flavor: 6/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 12/20 Rating: 3/5.0 Drinkability: 7/10 Score: **/4

Rating #3000... Cask, I think... Had a chance to stop by the brewpub while in town for a couple days to fix minor tropical storm damage from this past August... Clear, dark, burnt orange ale with a small, creamy, light khaki head. Great retention. Subtle nose with gentle notes of mash, citrus and chocolate. Perfectly-balanced flavor. Mildly tangy and grainy. Light-bodied and slightly creamy with almost no carbonation. Finishes watery and tangy. Nice! Kevin definitely brought this recipe down with him from Virginia.

The server told me about this one, and that it was a new brew that was served a little warmer than typical beer, and not as full of CO2. He was right, but it was pretty good. Smell was sweet, spicy, and it was very similar to a pumpkin ale kind of. Probably a fall seasonal, but I do not want to enter that in without being 100% sure. Taste is smooth and very easy to drink. The most unique beer I drank there. Quite pleasing.
Hazy bright orange pour. Fluffy white head and drippy lace. Banana and spice on the nose. Caramel, clove, and banana
Draft pours a cloudy copper with a 3cm white head. Hints of candied sugar, citrus fruits, spice. Finishes with a light sugary wheat taste.

The aroma was estery with a banana presence and a very light spice coupled with wheat. The beer arrived lightly hazy pale tannis (murky) yellow with a low off-white head. The flavor was wheat with light spice and more estery banana presence with caramel. The body was medium with a moderate level of carbonation and a creamy texture on the palate. A really tasty beer, but this really did not contain the characteristics of a witbier. The finish was ultimately dry with a light lasting spice. Pint at the Brewpub.

Name: Belgian Wit Date: 12/17/2006 Mode: Draft Source: Brewpub hazy yellow, wispy white head, nice sweet spiced orange aroma, light orange flavor, touch of sweetness, easy drinking for the tourists but needs more assertive wit character for the beer geeks Aroma: 6/10; Appearance: 5/10; Flavor: 5/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 10/20 Rating: 2.7/5.0 Drinkability: 8/10 Score: **/4

Bright golden in color with a small white head. Smell is full of lemons and corriander, with some orange notes too. Smooth and refreshing, very easy to drink. Reminded me alot of hoegaarden but it had more lemon flavors. Damn fine! I think the new brewer is really showing his stuff with this and the mild ale, very nice stuff.

On tap at Zierholz, pours a clear pale yellow with a small white head. Aroma is pretty bland, with not much other than dry biscuity malt. Flavour is very gentle, with biscuity malt and a gentle fruity hopping. Bland and pointless, but clean.

On tap. Served a light golden color with a small head and bits of lacing. Aroma of citrus malt sweetness and fresh grain. taste of citrus and some malt sweetness, grain. Nice bitterness and a clean finish. Light body, Crisp and refreshing. Enjoyable beer that goes down easy.
Tap. Palr gold body with an average sized white head. Highly carbonated. Aroma-taste: a subtle fruitiness with a balanced dry finish. Light bodied.

On tap at brewpub. Have had a few kolsch’s before, and enjoyed them for what they are, but this still seemed a bit sub par to me. Poured a clear light yellow, with a small and rapidly dissapearing white head. Highly carbonated. Not much of an aroma, bit of citrus. Flavour was dominated by citrus and a light malt, very refreshing, but still the flavours were far too muted.

(tap) Honestly I can’t say much about this one. It was an easy drinking Kölsch-type beer but from memory it was quite watery and sweet. I was expecting something drier and more interesting but instead I got yet another pale drink with a few beer-type elements. Should appeal to the ladies and non-beer drinkers.

Draught at Zierholz Brewery, Canberra. Pours golden with a small white head. Aroma of malt, fruit and light spicy notes. The flavour is malt and fruit. Light bodied and OK carbonation. A good Kolsch, though I’ve never been a big fan of this style.
Tried at the brewery. Clear pale yellow body. A bit of yeast in the taste, subtle fruit aroma, light in body, clean, crisp and what you expect in well made kolsch style.

My pick of the Zierholz range (though the Hopmeister and Porter also impressed) and yet another Aussie Kölsch that’s better than the majority of the real thing. Bright, clean, fresh, sunny pils malt with some crackery edges, light but noticeable unripe apple and berry esters and not much hop character but lovely soft noble bitterness. Looks good, and nice light but characterful mouthfeel. Delicate, like eczematic says below. A classy beer, the kind of thing that should appeal to geeks and the general public alike. $5 a pint (in happy hour) is insane, too.

I was keen to try any of the Zierholz range on my return to Canberra from Perth. Debacles in Braddon was just around the conrer and had the German Ale on tap so I sampled plenty. A really nice easy drinking beer with just the right amount of flavour and taste for my likings. Not hopped too far over the top and I could have stayed with this beer for an entire evening with ease. The fruit palate is at a perfect level for my tastes and there is no hint of aftertaste. A top drop. I’ve since tried the other Zierholz beers and this is by far my favourite.

Didn’t know what a Kolsch was and not sure I’m any better for now knowing. A spritzy, fizzy, soft drink with grass overtures. Strange drop indeed. Not sure I’d seek out this style again. Similarly had at Debacle in Canberra on tap.

column1: Northern Plains Red River Valley Red Lager
column5: From old tasting notes. Amber brown color. Small bubbly beige head. Faint earthy malt nose. Uninspiring toasted malt flavor. Dryish hop finish.v

column1: Northern Plains Red River Valley Red Lager
column5: 355ml bottle. Mahogany coloured and malty lager. Good body, good balance - not too sweet or too dry. Soft hops. Decent enough quality and quite pleasant.

2016 vintage on tap @ Carwyn Cellars. Pours a jet black with a dark brown head. Aromas are super rich in oak, liqourice, spices and dark roasted malt. Taste is an explosion of amazing flavours. Chocolate, caramel, liqourice, molasses, oak, some bourbon / whiskey notes and other herbs and spices. All of this is over a huge backbone of dark roasted malt. Aftertaste is bitter but amazingly delicious. I can see what all the hype is about. Can't wait to have it again! Have 2017, 2018 and 2016 (Scotch) in the cellar so might need to continue raising the rating.
Svart öl med ett brunt kvardröjande ljusbrunt skum. Doft och smak är rostad malt, choklad, fatlagrad alkohol, mörkt socker och lätta lakritstoner.
Molasses, Molasses, and Molasses. Some vanilla too. Deep and rich. A complete beer
Pours dark and oily with a thick tan head. So much going on. Coolness from the licorice, some cherry from the cherry bark, bourbon sweetness, vanilla, and booze. Lovely viscosity.
Malt caramel chocolate aroma. Black colour good head and lacing. Chocolate caramel malt flavour. Smooth lingering palate.

This classic imperial stout remains as good as ever (2017 bottling, sampled in June 2019). Perfect balance of alcohol heat and rich mouthfeel. Sip at 50 degrees for maximum pleasure. In ‘the day’ this was a top 10 BA brew....it still holds up as a delightful sipper.
Draft taproom. Pours black with a dark brown head. Dark chocolate, coffee, caramel aroma. Flavor is dark chocolate, milk chocolate, Caramel, cookie dough, booze. Really nice.
W aromacie bardzo puste, lekko winne nuty, lekkie kakao. W smaku ju¿ lepiej, pó³s³odkie, subtelna kwaskowatosc. Na finiszu alkohol rozgrzewa i doœæ popio³owe.

like licorice, and ash? Like dark Cherry flavor nicely fruity and moderate in sweetness. Malty and boozy with roasty malt and light medicine. Fuller body smooth and velvety with a transcending lightness. ME too! Big Coffee.

deep dark Brown colour, medium sized beige head; aroma of dark chocolate, dried sour cherry and plum, burnt maple syrup, red wine notes and slight soy sauce; taste of dark chocolate, red wine notes and maple syrup excellent Imperial stout! Many thanks, Chris!

column1: Alt Platz Alt Kürbis Pumpkin Ale
column5: Terrible beer, with a very strong phenolic character, not due to cloves, but due to off-flavors from wild yeast, which the brewer tried to mask by putting a heavy coating of cinnamon and sugar on the rim of the glass. The phenols come through in both the aroma and the flavor, which was also the case in other AP beers. The beer was cloudy, with a sporadic head. Cloudiness bears out the infection. Two of us split ~a 10 oz pour, and we could not finish it. On top of that, we were charged $12 for this minuscule pour. The claim is that this price is due to the high alcohol level, which is EXTREMELY unlikely. Based on palate considerations, it is likely less than 10%, this is just a poorly made beer that the brewer is making excuses for.

column1: Alt Platz Alt Kürbis Pumpkin Ale
column5: On tap at Alt Platz. 6 oz glass, part of the edge dipped in powdered sugar and spices. Murky chestnut brown with a beige ring of froth. First waft is gingerbread, thence on a wonderful amalgam of Christmas and pumpkin spice luring but not revealing the complete picture. Rich and smooth, mild carb. Wonderful to sip and savor. Cinnamon, ginger, cardamon, clove, mace and nutmeg are prominent. Hints of chipotle? A deft spice balance reminiscent of Pannepot. But this is a pumpkin beer and rightly so. Don’t think pie think baked pumpkin, earthy and fleshy, and thats what really makes this beer shine. An American classic.

column1: Alt Platz Alt Kürbis Pumpkin Ale
column5: Virginia Beer Fest 2007. Hazy dark amber body with a small tan head. Sweet pumpkin and heavy spice aroma. Sweet caramel, spice and pumpkin flavor.

column1: Alt Platz Alt Kürbis Pumpkin Ale
column5: I recalled this being listed as 18% ABV and now I see someone has changed it to 7.5% ABV. (NOTE: I now see where and why it was changed. I’m not sure why it lists the 7.5 % ABV on the website and why he told us that it was 16.5% in person unless there are two versions. I’ll try to confirm. UPDATE Got an email response from Tom. This batch was aged 8 months and came out to 16.5%. However, the next batch may not be. He will start brewing in 6 weeks and in 4-5 months, it will be ready and probably a different ABV. We can change it then). This was on at the Virginia Beer Festival yesterday (5-19-07) and the brewer, Tom, confirmed that this was actually 16.5% ABV in front myself, maniac and Cameron from Coastal Wine Connection. So I will be changing it after this review. Came out a thick muddy orange-rust color. Nose was powerful. Lots of spices, pumpkin pie, soft liquor and sweet malts. Maybe candied yams with marshmellows on them as well. Taste is bigger spice but it’s not overdone. Some soft alcohol, candy, sticky sugars and pumpkin pie. Body is medium-full to full. Soft carbonation. Very sticky but no warmth I could detect. Ends with more spices and pumkin pie with sticky sweet candyish notes. This went very quick once it was known to be out and the lines were large. Very well done pumpkin beer!

column1: Alt Platz Alt Kürbis Pumpkin Ale
column5: On tap at Alt Platz served in 6oz glasses. Dark dark amber in color with a thick beige head. Aroma was full of spices (cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg, etc) everything you’d expect in pumpkin pie and lots of pumpkin aroma. Flavor did not disappoint, it was like drinking liquid pumpkin pie. This was by far the best pumpkin beer I’ve had.

column1: Alt Platz Alt Kürbis Pumpkin Ale
column5: On tap at the brewpub 6 oz glass. Dark brown color off white head. Very complex aroma and taste. No alcohol taste this one will sneak up on you. The best pumpkin ale, I have had.

column1: Alt Platz Alt Kürbis Pumpkin Ale
column5: Right place, right time. Scammed some of Immy’s pre-release treat. After all of the seasonal & pumpkin ales I have tasted and frowned upon I wasn’t expecting to flip over one anytime soon, but this one was an eye opener, an awakening of slumbering senses. I think the brewer has his mother chained in the back making homemade pumpkin pie to mix in this brew. The golden-pumpkin-orange colored brew looked like pumpkin pie topped with a creamy off-white head like it was cool-whip. Aroma is every fresh spice you would expect in grandmas pie on Turkey day and then some. Flavor was same, spice combination perfectly complimented the pumpkin flavor in this soul warming spiced brew. Watch out for the alcohol because the high level is very well hidden making it easy to drink and yearning for more. Too bad for the rest of the world but due to the limited quantities only us few lucky locals will be priviledged enough to enjoy this outstanding brew. I know what I am doing for Halloween!

column1: Alt Platz Alt Kürbis Pumpkin Ale
column5: On tap at the brewpub. The owner gave me a sneak peek sample of this beer, to be officially released October 31. Golden brown with a big, thick, creamy beige head. Very complex nose - lots of spices, including (but not limited to) ginger, cinnamon, nutmeg, and a light clove. Lots more, hard to nail them all down. An underlying pumpkin is behind the lush spiciness. Excellent, warming pumpkin pie flavors! Warming spiced finish, alcohol is present but VERY well disguised. Like a fortified wine, the nose blooms from the empty glass. Absolutely wonderful, the best I’ve ever had of the style. I’m no fan of pumpkin beers, but this is amazing. VERY well done, and thanks for the preview Tom!

on draft at papago. nose is a very fresh peach and pineapple hoppiness. flavor is the same hop presence but with a nice smooth malt sweetness. the only thing couldve used is more bitterness but nonetheless very good.

I will fill in the description later. I did like this beer and I saw no actual flaws with the beer. It was very much like the Four Peaks brewery Raj IPA combined with their traditional American-style IPA.

On draft at O’Briens, left over from Wet Hop festival. Pours a clear golden color with a small white head. Aroma is herby, with light summer fruit notes, a nice hop aroma with tangerine and lemon grass. Tartly sweet, with light toasty malts, citrus fruits, a bit of spruce and orange rind. Medium body, gently tingly carbonation.
Tap, O’Brien’s. Medium amber pour. Piney hop aroma. Some spiciness. Creamy hoppiness. Finish is somewhat hoppy.

Draught @ Papago. Dominant grapefruit aroma and fresh hop aroma. Dark gold/orange body with decent head. Flavor is like getting a can of grapefruit juice from grocery store without the acidity. Light bitterness and a good refreshing beer.

On draught at Papago: Pours to a mostly clear copper-golden amber colored body, with the lightest presence of haze. Head is small-medium, white, initially creamy & thick, though it fades to nothing within a few minutes. The aroma clearly shows fresh, juicy, wet hops. I smell grapefruit (though not in the usual dry/rind smell, more of a juicy pulp scent), orange, pine, berries, tons of juicy, ripe, floral hops coming through in the nose. The taste is bitter, though almost less bitter than I would expect from the nose, but then many of these wet-hopped ales tend to be that way. Much more floral and citrusy than bitter hops come through in the taste - grapefruit (again more juicy pulp than dry & bitter rind), very fresh citrus hops, not as much grassy hops as I’m used to in these which is actually a plus as it tends to highlight the more floral and citrus flavors outright. This one also has a clear malt profile that make it somewhat stand out from the crowd here. I pick up some nice chewy crystal malts, hints of light caramel, bread, and biscuit, and there’s even a slight yeast character here too - giving off a slight diacetyl flavor which I’m not sure if it’s due to using an english ale yeast strain of simply a diacetyl problem in the keg. Either way it’s complimentary to the overall flavor profile and not excessive here. Medium bodied, moderate, light carbonation, with the chewy malts making a mild presence felt throughout.
Alpha King Competition: Nice caramel malt aroma on top of citrusy hops. Grapefruit and pine flavors were nice and fresh. Malt showed up in the middle. Moderately bitter finish.

column1: Alt Platz Victory for Freedom Helles
column5: On tap at Alt Platz. Golden in color with an off-white head. Aroma was bready with a touch of hops lurking around. Flavor was a combination of yeast and sweet malt.

column1: Alt Platz Victory for Freedom Helles
column5: Once again the Platz delivers! Had an hour to kill so I stopped by- Glad I did. This is a definate off the beaten path brew. A helles(german for clear) Not many styles like this one but rest assured it is grand! Pours a nice creamy white head with excellent release of aroma, fruity citrus notes- perfect carbonation, just enough to release the aroma- not soapy- first a slight hop bite then an overature of malty sweetness. With a finish that is to be reckoned wth. These go down oh so easliy- perfect compliment to the pretzels ordered with the brew, a salty sweet affair. Not had one helluva helles like this since Austria many years back. A perfect rendition of the Bavarian style. A must have again!!!! The Alt Platz , Das Güte Platz!!!!!!!!!!

column1: Alt Platz Victory for Freedom Helles
column5: Draft at the brewpub, 10/28/06: Helles? This is orange-copper, the darkest helles I’ve ever seen. (Hey, call the beer whatever you want, but check a style guide. Auf Deutsch, Helles=Light, Dunkel=Dark). Again, zero head, zero carbonation. Almost like a sour orange soda. Unimpressed.

column1: Alt Platz Victory for Freedom Helles
column5: On tap with Immy at brewpub. Dark gold, golden ale, foamy white head. Fruity aroma of apple and pear with slight notes of bread. Flavor much the same, sweet malty fresh fruit, medium to heavy body. Very easy drinking.

column1: Alt Platz Victory for Freedom Helles
column5: On tap at the brewpub. Clear deep gold with an off white head. Nose is bready with a light hoppiness. Bready, biscuity flavor, sweet malt. Even malty finish. Nice.

Pint at Clark’s Ale House in Syracuse, shared with Lubiere. Chocolate, burnt coffee, "dark" nose. Thick, black colour and a minimal beige-mocha head. Thin-med. body. Sl. sweetness and sourness with a clean finish. A bit lacking, but still ok.

Rating 2500, what a nice way to start a weekend of beer hunting! Deep dark stout with a thin cremay moka head. Light chocolate aroma with notes of coffee. In mouth, a decent lactic stout with bitter chocolate, light lingering bitternss. Light bodied but well balanced and quaffable. 3.50$. On tap at Clark’s Ale House Syracuse NY. Shared with Kprobst.

column4: Magic Hat Brewing Company (Cervecería Costa Rica - FIFCO)
column5: Poured from a 12 oz. bottle, very dark, nearly black with a small tan head that receded quickly. Little to no lacing. Nice flavor that was unexpected, black malt notes with overtones of coffee and spice (perhaps clove?). Smooth mouthfeel with spice/malt finish. Was pleasantly suprised with this one.

column4: Magic Hat Brewing Company (Cervecería Costa Rica - FIFCO)
column5: Labeled as the Black as Night Winter Lager - Pours near black with reddish hues and a mostly receding tan head. Notes of sweet roast, debittered black malt, and toffee. Medium to full bodied with soft cabonation.

column4: Magic Hat Brewing Company (Cervecería Costa Rica - FIFCO)
column5: Pours black with off white head, aroma is fairly lacking but a bit of roasted character. Taste up thin up front that moves eventually into caramel and roasted malt. Average.

column4: Magic Hat Brewing Company (Cervecería Costa Rica - FIFCO)
column5: (drought at Eli Cannon’s in Middletown CT, 5%) bk, full-body, §head, balanced, a nice "schwartz" T2, smooth and ^drinkable, good thru. i had to stop in a couple more times just for this beer until the keg was empty, it’s the best Magic Hat beer i’ve had.

column4: Magic Hat Brewing Company (Cervecería Costa Rica - FIFCO)
column5: acrid smoke that is flavorful and mild. clearly reinvented as the "wolf" black as night brew i had today. 4.6% abv seems weak for winter but perhaps, a nice winter session with a licorice and hint of pepper it is well enough carbonated at first taste but moderates to a sudsy dishwater, still flavorful in some order. hard to dislike and odour of fruit.

column4: Magic Hat Brewing Company (Cervecería Costa Rica - FIFCO)
column5: 20061007 Tap (Black Lager) at Kennett Square Brewfest 06. Dark brown color, mild mineral, peat, roasted nuts, and mild smoke (peat again?). Smooth, soft body. Quick wet finish with mildly sweet roasty flavors. Decent enough stuff.

column4: Magic Hat Brewing Company (Cervecería Costa Rica - FIFCO)
column5: Mar. 2007 - Dark brown pour, decent head and a little lacing. Smoke was the primary flavor with hints of roast, coffee and chocolate. Nice mouthfeel. Enjoyable.

column4: Magic Hat Brewing Company (Cervecería Costa Rica - FIFCO)
column5: bottle, from trade with 46er3498. drank 1/23. Alright aroma. Minor fruit raspeberry and grape, Smoke, cardboard. Clean orangy dark brown color, Small head that faded quickly. Little to no lacing. Sweet smoky flavor. Lite body, smooth creamy mouthfeel, dry finish. Finished it quickly and it had moments when I thought it would open up into some good, but ultimately was ok at best.

column4: Magic Hat Brewing Company (Cervecería Costa Rica - FIFCO)
column5: I remember enjoying this the first time I had it, but I did drink it with food which could have affected the taste.

column4: Magic Hat Brewing Company (Cervecería Costa Rica - FIFCO)
column5: Clean ruby red brown body with light beige lacing. Light acidic malts to the nose some kind of hidden hop background. Flavour is sweet and light malt. Clean body not to heavy.

Sampled at brewpub with Lubiere. Med. golden-light amber with a small white head and sl. haze. Sweet malt, caramel and a little fruit ont he nose. Med.-full body and med-low carbonation. Sweet and malty with a dry finish and a hint of hops. Aren’t Oktoberfest beers supposed to be lagers?

Light hazed blonde with a thin creamy white head. Light caramel aroma with light hopping. In mouth, a biscuittty malt with lots of fruity esters, light solvent. Overall, nice but this tastes like an ale. On tap at the pub, with kprobst, Oct. 22 2006.

Sampled at brewpub with Lubiere. Nice med. copper colour, clear with a fairly tight, light beige head that fades quickly. Some malt ont he nose, a bit of green hops. A bit musty. Med. body and low carbonation. Celery, vegetal flavour, a touch of sweetness and acidity.

A nice reddish amber ale with a thin creamy off white head. A musty carale aroma, a bit off. In mouth, a decent sweet malt with light hopping a bit lighter than expected but nice. On tap at the pub, with kprobst, Oct. 22 2006.

Sampled at brewpub with Lubiere. Med. copper colour, sl. haze witha small, off-white head. Figs on the nose, a little jammy. Low carbonation and med. body. Starts alittle sweet and malty. A touch of hops and a malty lingering finish. Woody with a sl. smokiness. Drops off quickly.

Almost the same colour as the Red Dragon, a reddish more intense hue, with a thin creamy moka head. A nice caramle aroma with notes of figs and light berrie. In mouth, a restrained woody malt with fruity notes, light hopping an lighter bodied. On tap at the pub, with kprobst, Oct. 22 2006.

Very much like the Scotch Ale I sampled, this beer was a mess from the mash, very tannic, grainy/husky and astringent. The only saving grace was a heavy dose of citric hops, perhaps a touch of new mown hay, that helps to cover the mistakes in the malts. Hop levels not nearly close to DIPA levels, I should mention, but it made for good IPA level hoppings. Nevertheless, the hops don’t sufficiently cover the basic flaws in this beer.

Re-rated at the brewpub. 07FE10. App.: Very cloudy orange-amber with a nice off-white froth and chunks of hops (yum). Aroma: Juicy orange-citrus hops, strong C-hops characteristics, some esters. Palate: Medium+ body, moderate effervescence. Flav.: Classic marmalade, caramel, toffee, nice esters, very juicy C-hops; somewhat sweet with nice bitterness and a pleasant citrus finish. Straight-forward, well-made, very fresh. ********** Sampled at brewpub with Lubiere. Med.-deep golden colour, a sl. haze. Slightly yellow-ish-greenish head. A reasonably hoppy nose (a bit of citrus). Malt comes through. Fairly full mouthfeel, even a little syrupy. Malty and sweet with hops at the end. A little bitter, but not excessive. Fades to an alcoholic finish. Fairly balanced, but too sweet for me. 7-4-7-3-13.

Lightly hazed golden ale with a creamy white head, lacing. A floral hops in aroma with nice light caramel and light orange citrus. In mouth, a creamy malt, lightly oily, mint, a bit of alcohol warmth. A decent IPA, but not an imperial IPA. On tap at the pub, with kprobst, Oct. 22 2006.

Sampled at brewpub with Lubiere. An odd, murky, muddy reddish-brown with no head. Not porter colour! Dried fruit, raisins and a sl. red wine nose. Flat as a board and thin. Reminds me of Newcastle Brown (candy malt and slightly vinous). Vegetal finish. No thanks!

An ugly muddy hazy brown concoction with a very thin off white head. A rather funky chocolate aroma with notes of yeasts, dried fruits and figs. In mouth, a dead beer lacking carbonatation, fails to enhance the chocolate malt, more into brown ale territory. A miserable porter. On tap at the pub, with kprobst, Oct. 22 2006.

column2: Sackets Harbor, New York, United States
column5: Dark golden colour with a thick creamy white head. A chalky malt aroma with light crisp hops. A crisp malt in mouth, lightly sweet, mineral notes, lightly oily mouthfeel, pear notes in finale. Medium bodied. Free sample, with kprobst, Oct. 22 2006.

On draft at 21st amendment. Pourrd a clear golden amber, with a creamy head and light lacing. Aroma of tropical fruit, grapefruit and pine with faint notes of toasty malts. Flavor is also hop-centric, again some light toasty malt sweetness, with massive pineapplr ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Clear golden orange with a fizzy white head. Good strong gapefruit and pine aroma. Pungent bitter pine straw citrus and mild caramel taste.

On tap at 21st Amendment. Odd - this one is listed on the board as 8% ABV and as being dry-hopped with Simcoe, not Amarillo. Oh well. Pours a clear copper color with a nice medium-sized white head. Aroma is piney and citrusy hops along with some caramel malty sweetness. Flavor is about what you’d expect from a well-balanced west coast IPA. Some caramel malt, but hops are the star of the show. Citrusy Simcoe notes evident with grapefruit and orange, as well as some piney qualities. Medium body with very slight syrupiness and some mild palate-wrecking qualities. Overall a pretty solid IPA (or maybe IIPA).

Draft. Golden amber beer with an off-white head. Sweet summer fruit and citrus aroma. Summer fruit, grapefruit, piney hop flavor with some decent malt backing. Lingering fruity/piney hops. Medium bodied.

On draft at brewpub. Arrived in the glass a clear golden amber, with a creamy head and light lacing. Aroma dominated by citrus hops, grapefruit and pine with faint notes of toasty malts. Flavor is also hop-centric, again some light toasty malt sweetness, with massive grapefruit rind, spruce and lemon hops - a bit unbalanced for my tastes, but definitely a hop bomb. Light body and prickly / creamy carbonation.
Bottled (BB 11/2009) Thanks Björn! Golden color, small white head. Very papery, a bit grainy aroma. Cardboardish, sweet malty, grassy beer.
Bottled@Björntasting. Golden colour, small white head. Aroma is herbal, buttery, wooden and also has notes of mild grass and rubber. Flavour is grass, hay, hops, some rubber and also grainyness.

Light yellow colored with little white head. Buttery aroma with cardboard and thin lemon. Thin to medium bodied. Flavor is more lemony with cardboard and butter still, aftertaste dries with thin hops. Nothing special.
Bottled. Clear pale golden, rich creamy head. Buttery soft malt. Fairly sweet with grainy malt and slight salty bitterness.
Draught. A clear gold with a large white rocky head. A sweet malt nose, slightly biscuity. An easy drinking malt palate, a slight hop crispness and a touch of vanilla and cream.
bottle. Clear yellow colour, large white head. Malty nose. Quite malty, not too sweet with some rather harsh but pleasantly aromatic hops in the finish.

Bottle: Sweet-grainy nose with a touch of mushrooms and apples; deep golden coloured with a small foamy layer; light sweetish-bitter flavour, very light-bodied; rather faint sweet-bitter finish. Quite bland Helles....

(bottle, from pivnizub) Clear, pale golden with a foamy blonde medium-sized head. Sweet grainy aroma with a touch of hay and herbal, slightly grassy hoppy notes. Soft malty, slightly grainy initial taste with a upcoming herbal hoppy taste, leading to a dry herbal hoppy finish, light to medium bodied with a smooth carbonation. A Helles, which is rather on the hoppy side. Not bad.
bottle picked up at slunce ve skle 2013. simple and steady - golden with a grassy aroma, hints of appleskin, modest bitterness. pretty good with garlic flavoured crisps
Bottled. A golden beer with a eggs, spicy hops, and straw. The flavor is sweet with notes of straw and malt, leading to a bitter finish.

draft at Ziegler-Bräu in Waldsassen. clear gold, lightly hazed, soap foam white head. minerals, a lot of calcium, some sulfur, some (clean) dishsoap foam in the nose. airy fluffy and very light-bodied, surely going for the classic sweet, simple, lightly-hopped Helles version of pilsner, more pedestrian and basic. some tart buttermilk and starches show up as it breathes, as do some cooked corn kernels and cereals. soft, low carbonation with shortly-lingering hop acids in the finish.
Bottled (BB 11/2009) Thanks Björn! Golden color, small white head. Grassy, green wood aroma. Sweet malty, butterscotch, low bitterness - not much a pils.

Bottled@Björntasting. Yellowish golden colour, small white head. Aroma is hay, grass, some mild notes of fruits. Flavour is malts, grass, hay and mildly herbal notes as well. Refreshing and quite biting Pils.
Bottled. Clear straw colour, small head. Grassy, fruity nose. Sweet and well rounded with medium body. A bit salty, surprisingly non-crisp pils.
bottle. Clear pale golden yellow, large and creamy white head. Hoppy nose. Medium-to full-bodied, solid malty base with some intensive hoppy flavours, very aromatic. Well-balanced and clean Pilsener.

Bottle: Sweet-malty, a bit papery nose with "oaky" hops in the background; moderate sweet-bitter flavour, light bodied and soft; mild, light bitter-sweet finish with traces of the typical "Bohemian" qualities. A pleasant and decent Pils.....

(bottle, from pivnizub) Clear, pale golden colour with a medium-sized, slowly lacing foamy white head. Sweet and grainy aroma with hay and shy herbal hoppy notes, also with a minimal fruity touch. Initially quite sweet malty, slightly grainy taste with a herbal background that gets stronger towards the dry and moderately bitter finish. A bit slim but drinkable, easy-going Pils.

bottle, taken from slunce ve skle 2013 and shared with ungstrup and mowbeer. hazy yellow with a bulbous head; cheesecake aroma; hint of schneider hopfenweiss in the fresh and grassy hop character. tasty stuff
Bottled. An unclear yellow beer with a white head. The aroma has notes of wheat and lemons. The flavor is sweet with notes of wheat, and lemons, leading to dry wheaty finish.

Gering hefig-herber Beginn mit hintergründiger Säure, die sich durch das ganze Bier zieht. Später dezent bananig, wässrig-herb, erfrischend. Im Abgang spürbar weicher, die Wässrigkeit weicht den Hefenoten. 11/9/10/9/7/9

500ml bottle from bierzwerg! The beer in the glass has a very cloudy, light yellow color, the head is high, fine-creamy and very durable. Smells really very yeasty, fruity and slightly acidic minimal. Startis good recent, tangy, yeasty, and above all very sweet and fruity. Something I’ve been treated, never. But I must say, it tastes really phenomenally good! Very tasty, incredibly aromatic and simply pleasant. One of the best german Weizen that I’ve ever drunk so far!!!
Bottled (BB 12/2009) Thanks Björn! Hazy yellow, small white head. Sweet wheaty, banana aroma. Banana, sweet candy, a bit grainy. Decent weizen.

Bottled@Björntasting. Hazy yellowish golden colour, small white head. Aroma is mild spices, some acidic fruits, wheat as well as some mild rotten bananaish notes. Flavour is wheat, fruits, some mild spices as well as yeast.
Bottled. Hazy golden, small head. Sweet with plenty of sweaty banana. Medium bodied with rounded spritzy mouthfeel. A basic but drinkable weizen without much distinguishable features.
bottle. Cloudy pale yellow, large and creamy white head. Wheaty and yeasty, pleasantly fruity but not too much banana. Very well balanced Hefeweizen, I enjoyed it very much.

Bottle: Cloudy, golden coloured, mid-sized stable white head; yeast, cloves and bananas in the nose; moderate sweetish and almost a bit bitter flavour, light bodied; fruity, a bit citrousy and yeasty finish. A rather pleasant Weizen...

(bottle, from pivnizub) Hazy, pale golden colour with a fluffy and stable foamy white head. Slightly sweet and yeasty wheaty and grainy aroma with a light sourish touch. Moderately sweet and a bit sour flavour, light to medium body with a moderate carbonation. Wheat-malty taste, moderately fruity (citrus with light banana notes); malty, slightly fruity and clovy finish. Ok, but nothing special.
Aroma is slightly hops with some honey and malt. Taste is malty, again with some hops.
Bottled@Björntasting. Yellowish golden colour, small white head. Aroma is earth,grass, sweet malts, some yeast and also quite saltwatery. Flavour is quite much the same.
Bottled. Clear yellow, rich head. Sweetish, creamy and fruity. Fairly light boded with restrained hoppiness and low bitterness Clean flavoured and a bit too shy.

bottle, thank you Frankenland. Clear golden yellow, small head, hoppy-sweet-ish nose. Medium-bodied, solid but perhaps a little too shy malty background with some nice hoppy accents. Clean and crisp, although I can’t find many similarities with other Bohemian Pilseners.

Bottle (330ml): Greenish-golden coloured, small white foamy layer, quickly vanishing; faint grainy hoppy and a bit sweet-malty nose with traces of cardboard; moderate to distinctive bitter-sweet flavour, light bodied to watery. Short bitter-sweet finish with the faintest illusions of a malty base. Even though the bohemian border can be reached from Waldsassen easily by bike, this brew is very far away from a Bohemian Pilsener....

(33cl bottle, with thanks to pivnizub) Clear, pale golden colour with a short foamy white head. Quite strong grassy hops aroma with a light-sweet malty background. Initially slightly sweet malty taste with grassy hops; light to medium bodied, crispy carbonation; dry and bitter, grassy hoppy finish. This one tastes more like a Pils from the Sauerland and has not much in common with those brewed in the Bohemian style.
bottled - tasting with ungstrup and mowbeer. more like a polotmavy - dark amber with a minimal head; hints of caramel and wet grass with a slightly tinny finish
Bottled. A brown beer with a beige head. The aroma has notes of hops, caramel, and a bit of butter. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt, bread, hops, and caramel, leading to a bitter finish.
Aroma of dark caramel and creme brulee. Slightly sweet (but not too much)with a medium body and sticky mouth feel.
Wässriger Antrunk von süßlicher Röstigkeit. Geringe Herbe, kein Aroma schafft es wirklich, die Wässrigkeit zu durchbrechen. Trinkbar aber langweilig. 8/6/7/6/9/6

bottle, thank you Frankenland. Clear brown colour, fluffy beige head. Shy aroma of roasetd malt. The flavours are very shy, too. Hints of caramel and roasetd malt, but quite thin. Not bad, but the flavours could be much more intensive.

Bottle: Chestnut-amber coloured, small and stable off-white layer; delicate caramelly nose with a metallic touch; moderate bitter-sweetish flavour, light bodied; metallic traces, again, in the slightly bitter and sweet finish. Brewed in a brewery very close to the bohemian border ("Böhmisches"), but far away from an average bohemian "Tmave"............

(bottle, a present from pivnizub - thanks) Clear, dark brown colour with a short beige foam. Slightly roasted dark-malt aroma with a touch of spicy hops. Moderately roasted malty taste, quite bitter from the beginning; medium to light bodied, moderate carbonation; malty and bitter finish, slightly hoppy with hints of metal.
Clear golden with a medium off white head. Sweet malty aroma with grain and breadish notes. Flavour likewise along with caramel and it finished mild bitter.

Bottle: Hazy, golden coloured, no head to speak of; very present estery-fruity nose (with almost a touch of turpentine), a bit tannic; sweetish, slightly sourish flavour with a fizzy MF, light bodied; slightly tannic (barrique), sourish finish with some sweetish-fruity notes. A very unusual brew, a bit like a heavily diluted "Gueuze".........

(33cl bottle, received from pivnizub) Hazy, orange colour with a very short frothy white layer. Slightly yeasty and slightly sourish strong fruity aroma (peaches, citrus). Barley- and a distinctive spelt-malty taste with strong fruity notes; light bodied with a lively carbonation; malty and sour-fruity finish. Tastes like a mediocre Wheat without wheat.
Cask criterion red black colour. At aroma smokey malt taste same medium body soft carbonation ok stuff
Half pint on cask at Wenlock Arms, London. Pitch black body without a head. Moderate cocoa aroma. Flavour has got notes of candy chocolates and light roasted coffee beans. Medium palate (19.09.2006)
Cask Handpump at the Prince Of Wales, Foxfield 16/09/2006 Some roast aroma. Dark coloured and slightly fruity mild which is a little rich on the palate. Slightly dry roast finish.

Gravicask at The Bricklayers Arms Lancashire Fest, 15th Sept 2007. I agree with Mes, this was the beer of the day. Clear gold colour and a beautiful floral hop aroma, flowers and cut grass. Likewise the flavour is flowers, fruit, straw and wheat. Makes you think of lying in a summer meadow with a beautiful girl on a sunny day! Great body and well-balanced. Fantastic beer.
Cask @ The Bricklayer’s Arms, Lancashire Beer Festival. Golden with no head. Fragrant floral hops with a spicy citrus/orange edge. Medium mouthfeel with some slight grainy malt in the finish.

A Mes rate: Gravicask at The Bricklayers Arms Lancashire Fest. Beer of the day by a country mile. Lovely clean gold colour with a reasonable white head and an excellent consistency. Hoppy, bitter, fresh cut grass, amazing grassy hops infact, the bitterness is superb. Malty notes in the finish balance it out superbly well. Creamy and very tasty with an excellent body. Absolute cracker.

Cask at the Dragon, Worcester 03-03-07. Poured a deep gold colour with some fruity hoppiness on the nose. Taste was pleasant enough if a little too sweet and this sweetness seemed to mask some of the more subtle tastes that may have been lurking there. Some hoppiness and bitterness but not a patch on the other Millstone beer tried in this establishment.

Cask conditioned at The Dragon, Worcester. Pale gold with white head. Quite a sweetish beer and a little flabby for my taste but with a certain fruity character. A touch of alcohol residing on the tongue and aa sweet grainy malt finish.
Cask Handpump at the Prince Of Wales, Foxfield 16/09/2006 Fruity aroma. Clear golden coloured hoppy and fruity beer with some alcohol present. Some bitterness and dryness in a crisp malt finish.

Cask at The Royal Oak, Rushton Spencer. A clear golden colour with a medium white head. Aroma of grain, biscuity malts, some lemon, subtle orange and slight floral hops. Taste of lemon, orange, some biscuity malts, subtle grain and slight floral hops. Light bodied and soft carbonation. A soft, bittersweet, fruity, floral hop bitterness in the finish. A fruity golden ale which is well balanced and refreshing. Inoffensive but sessionable.
Pours a blonde colour. Taste is floral and dry but quite bland. Ok for a session. Quite low on flavour
500ml bottle at home. Poured a clear gold colour with white head that soon spotted. Aroma of malt and slight metalic hint. Taste is malt, light hop, Citric and a bitter finish.
On cask at Congress, Longton. Pours golden with white head. Served slightly too cold. Quite a fruity pale but not overly exciting.

Cask at the Wincle Beer Festival 08. Pale golden yellow with a small to medium white head. Worth a try, a reasonable pale bitter. The aroma was a little odd, might just have been this one, smelled a bit like an eggy burp. Not that pleasant then. Flavour was ok, little citrus and hops with a touch of malts and a slight bitter finish. A little watery but not bad.

Considering the style, Scores ranging from 1 to 5, 5 being the most intense Appearance: Body: &nbsp Clear(1)->Murky(5) : 2 &nbsp &nbsp Pale Yellow(1)->Dark brown(5) : 2 &nbsp &nbsp Still(1)->Sparkling(5) : 2 Head: &nbsp None(1)->Large(5) : 1 &nbsp White(1)->Tan(5) : 2 &nbsp Lasting: 2 &nbsp Lacing : 3 Aroma: Intensity : 2 &nbsp Yeast : 2 &nbsp Bread : 2 &nbsp Apple : XX &nbsp Tropical Fruits : XX &nbsp Soap : XX &nbsp DMS : XX &nbsp Diacetyl : XX Sulfur : XX &nbsp Malt : 2 &nbsp Biscuity : 2 &nbsp Hay : XX &nbsp Toasty : XX &nbsp Caramel : XX &nbsp Nuts : XX &nbsp Honey : 1 &nbsp Cereals : 2 &nbsp Grainy : 3 Hops : 2 &nbsp Noble(1)->American(5) : 1 &nbsp Leafy : XX &nbsp Spicy : XX &nbsp Floral : 2 &nbsp Lemon/Lime : XX &nbsp Grapefruit : XX &nbsp Orange : XX &nbsp Herbal : 2 &nbsp Grassy : XX &nbsp Pine/Spruce/Resin : XX &nbsp Notes : &nbsp Peach/Apricot : XX &nbsp Earth : 2 &nbsp Mint : XX &nbsp Butterscotch : XX &nbsp Smoke : XX Flavor: Initial Flavor : Dry(1)->Sweet(5) : 4 &nbsp Finish Dry(1)->Sweet(5) : 3 &nbsp Sourness : XX &nbsp Bitterness : 1 &nbsp Complex : XX &nbsp Length : XX Palate: Light(1)->Full(5) : 2 &nbsp Flat(1)->Fizzy(5) : 2 &nbsp Clean : XX &nbsp Sharp : XX &nbsp Watery : 2 &nbsp Oily : XX &nbsp Chalk : XX &nbsp Astringent : XX &nbsp Alcohol : XX &nbsp Mineral : XX &nbsp Oxidation : XX &nbsp Metallic : XX Comments: Mild, rather weak blonde ale tat stays sweetish all through.

Cask (handpump) at the Market Porter, Southwark. Full, rich gold colour. Thin white head. Light fruity notes on the nose. More citrus comes through on the palate with just a touch of biscuity malt. A light bitterness develops in the aftertaste but, overall, this is a pleasant and easy-drinking pale beer.

Cask@Market Porter. Golden colour, small white head. Aroma is hops, slight malts and some hints of eggs. Flavour is spices, herbs, eggs and some caramel malts. Flavour is being very mild, so quite watery beer.

Cask Handpump in the outside marquee at the Prince Of Wales, Foxfield 16/09/2006 Fruity aroma. Golden coloured with a slightly hazy appearance. Fruity and pale with some dryness in a crisp malt finish.

column1: Water Street Big Phat Morning Wood
column5: Last draft at the 2006 Washington Cask Beer Festival. Definitely a standout that evening. Big cab nose with hints of thicker barleywine. Loads of fruits up front, middle hoppy swamp, with cab finishing it out. Even on cask it was really nice.

column1: Water Street Big Phat Morning Wood
column5: WA Cask Beer Fest ’06. Pours ruby with an off white head. Aroma is grapes and pine hops. Taste is wine like with a sharp pronounced hop character. Big alcohol flavor. Unique offering.

column1: Water Street Big Phat Morning Wood
column5: Cask. Aroma was raisiny alcohol. Flavor was raisin, sweet malt. Sour finish was a turn off. Not my favorite.

column1: Water Street Big Phat Morning Wood
column5: GABF 2006: Lightly hazy dark amber color with a red tint. Vinous aroma that was fairly sweet. Notes of grapes and apples. Hint of alcohol as well. Sweet and fruity flavor with notes of red wine and dark fruits. Sweet and warming finish. Alcohol is hidden well.
Cask at Wellington Arms, Bedford. Mid gold colour. Faint hop aroma. Fruity taste, slightly sour. Medium, lasting bitterness.

A Mes rate: gravicask at the Bricklayers. Pale yellow gold with a thin white film and reasonable condition. Fairly restrained grapefruity hop aroma with some faint nettley and grassy notes. The flavour is similar to the nose and straight forward hoppy fayre really but with some lovely casky mineral notes. Nice and clean with a lasting but very delicate citric bitterness. Decent but not outstanding.
Cask at the Old Kings Head. Alround rating: Pale malts, sweeter floural notes, zesty hints, balanced and very drinkable.

1. Cask Stillage from the cellar at the Prince Of Wales, Foxfield 16/09/2006 Fruit and hop aromas. Golden coloured hoppy and fruity with some bitterness in a crisp and dry finish. 2. Cask Handpump at the Old Kings Head, Broughton in Furness 13/06/2009 Floral and hop aromas. Small white head. Golden coloured hoppy and fruity with a little dryness in a crisp and slightly creamy malt finish.

GABF 2011. Pours clear copper with a small, bubbly off-white head, medium-short retention with spare lacing. Aroma is fruity esters, caramel and cookie malt, floral hops. Flavor is malt sweetness, cookie notes, fruity esters, medium-light hops, alcohol and a dry finish. Medium-full body, medium warmth, low carbonation.
From the Jug at the GABF Colorado Convention Center, Denver 09/10/2008 Fruit and hop aromas. Golden coloured strong in alcohol fruity and floral with a crisp dry and bitter full malt finish.

This rating is based on the most recent iteration of this confection. This is at 8% ABV. There will be at least three different batches made at the brewery for the 2007-2008 winter season. The first was at 8.3% ABV and the third is under construction. The color is good, with minimal carbonation, tiny head, minimal lacing, nice finish. This is a local cult beer amongst those of us who live nearby and is eagerly awaited. It is very consistant from year to year.

GABF 2006: Clear amber color with an off-white head. Malty flavor and aroma with notes of caramel and cereal flakes. Not much else going on in it. Some warmth to it but I don’t know the ABV. I don’t think it is too high.

Cask Stillage from the cellar at the Prince Of Wales, Foxfield 16/09/2006 Fruit wine aroma. Golden coloured with a little alcohol present. Plenty of malt in the crisp and slightly dry finish. AKA East End Light.

Cask Stillage from the cellar at the Prince Of Wales, Foxfield 16/09/2006 Some fruit aroma. Clear golden coloured with some alcohol present. Hoppy and fruity. A little bitterness in a crisp and dry lasting finish.

Cask Stillage from the cellar at the Prince Of Wales, Foxfield 16/09/2006 Citrus fruit aroma. Clear golden coloured and fruity with some alcohol present. A little dryness and bitterness is evident in the crisp lasting finish.

Cask at NWAF 2009. A dark red-brown beer with a lazing off-white head. The aroma has notes of sweet malt, chocolate, and roasted malt. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt, vegetables, and roasted malt, leading to a dry bitter finish.

Cask @ National Winter Ales Festival 2009, Manchester. Pours a dark brown almost black color with a small off-white head. Has a roasted malty coffee aroma with some hints of chocolate. Roasted malty bitter chocolate and coffee flavor. Has a roasted malty coffee finish wit some bitterness in the aftertaste.

Cask (gravity) @ National Winter Ales Festival 2009, Manchester, England. Clear medium brown color with a small, fizzy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, roasted, coffee, moderate hoppy, grass. Flavor is moderate sweet and bitter with a long duration. Body is medium, texture is watery to oily, carbonation is soft to flat. [20090122]
Cask at Manchester winter ale fetival 2009... Black thin tan head ... sweet chocolate malt nose ... little charcoal again swet malts quite cofee..
Cask@St Albans BF 06. Quite decent, but a touch lighter than what i want in a stout. Some slightly roasty malt notes, with a dry, roasty, lightly bitter finish. needs more body.

Cask (gravity dispense) at St Albans Beer Festival, September 2006. Dark brown colour, with scant head. A light (bur not too thin), and dry, chocolate accented stout, with an undercurrent of dry, roast malt. Not a blockbuster, but an easygoing and pleasant stout.
Cask Stillage from the cellar at the Prince Of Wales, Foxfield 16/09/2006 Some roast aroma. Dark red coloured and slightly rich on the palate with a little dryness in a bitter lasting finish.
Cask Handpump at the High Cross Inn, Broughton in Furness 16/09/2006 Strong hop aroma. Golden coloured and hoppy with some alcohol present. Slightly bitter malt finish.

Most delicious cask beer I’ve had in England. aroma is amazingly full of tropical fruit and floral hops. The beer was amber colored with a white head. Flavor was bitter sweet hops, with tropical flavors, earthy flavors, and grapefruit. medium palate. Fantastic beer.
Cask in Blackfriars, old rating. Aroma is buttery and biscuioty, grassy bittering hop. Taste is similar, not well balanced at all and not very appealing.

Cask conditioned at The Lion Tavern, Liverpool. Gold brown with white head. Reasonable light session type bitter drunk in a beautiful pub. The package is great. Malty, biscuity with restrained hop. Pretty good.

Hazy caramel looking hue covered by a small white film. Yogurty, lactic nose with an unexpected orangey citric character. Also pretty citric in mouth where not much else happens. Non-descript biscuity malts are faint and the finish is barely leafy. A far way from greatness and tough to finish. Medium-bodied, soft carbonation.
Cask@GBBF2007. Golden colour, not much head. Aroma is really sour, some fruits and earth. Flavour is earth, slightly sour earth and much wood.

Cask, GBBF 07. Slightly cloudy goldy copper with a thin white head. Nose is slightly sweet, some hop and wood. Mouth is light and watery. Some burnt and hop tones. Very little palate, slightly dry. Meh.
Cask/gravity at Ipswich Beer Festival 23 Sep 06. Golden coloured. No head. Faint fruity aroma. Rather uninteresting flavour. Some bitterness in the finish.

1. Cask Handpump at the Anglers Arms, Haverthwaite 16/09/2006 Floral aroma. Golden coloured and hoppy with some dryness and plenty of malt in a crisp finish. 2. Cask Handpump at the Marble Arch Inn, Manchester 18/10/2006 Fruit aroma. Golden coloured fruity and hoppy with some bitterness in a crisp dry finish.
50cl bottle. Pours clear pale yellow colour with a small white head. Aroma of mild grainy malt, very neutral aroma. Taste of mild grainy malt, corn, watery palate, good drinkable.
*Old rating from 2010. Many thanks to kappldav123! Malty-sweetish, thin and easy to drink beer. Fresh, smooth, not too deep, thirst-quenching, nice, grain.
Clear yellow with a white head. Sweetish malty aroma. Thin body, light malty accents and a dry finish.

Bottle by 13.09.12. Nose of malt, a lot of Helles here, pours a faint but bright yellow with a soapy bright white head. Impossibly watery body with light bitterness and a steaming pile of cardboard, faint sweetness and some grain. Gosh, I don’t hate it, but what’s to like?

Milder Antrunk, etwas getreidig, sehr wässrig. Auch beim zweiten Schluck ist von Aromen wenig zu erkennen, dafür aber ein Hauch der typischen Bitterkeit, die bei alkoholfreien und -reduzierten aufftritt. Soviel zur Aromenvielfalt.. Test vom 8.2.2008, Gebinde: Glasflasche Noten: 5,5,7,5,7,5 - 5,40
Bottled. A pale golden beer with an off-white head. The aroma has notes of cardboard and malt. The flavor is sweet with notes of cardboard and malt. The body is thin. Thanks yespr for sharing.
Bottle. Clear yellow coloured with a medium sized white head. Malty aroma of grass, grain and hops. Malty flavour of grain and hops. Hoppy finish.
Clear golden with a medium white head. Sweet and grainy aroma. Sweet flavour with cardboard, hints of malt and plenty of unfermented grain.

50 cL bottle, courtesy of kappldav123. Pours clear and golden orange with a with a small white head. Aroma is dry malty, vague grassy hoppy. Bitter, flat malty to vague cardboardish in note. Dry into a mild bitter finish. Medium dry and bitter finish.
Bottled@Björntasting. Yellowish golden colour, small white head. Aroma is cardboard, some grains and mild earth. Flavour is eggy, vegetable, saltwatery as well as slightly cardboardy.
Mead, not particularly sugary but quite fruity, mostly making me think of sweet & acidic apples. Light, smooth, clean and easy to drink. Pretty nice.
Old review. Pours pale golden. Aroma is champagne-like, rather faint. Taste is honey, champagne, oxidation. Meh.
[backlog from webtrunki.pl] Aroma reminds me a champagne. Notes of pure honey are hardly noticeable. Deep golden in the glass. Too thin in my opinion, but highly drinkable.
Na, der war ja mal etwas ungewöhnlich, dabei aber schön süffig und mild. Etwas grasig neben dem ganzen Honig und erstaunlicherweise bildete sich im Hintergrund etwas Apfel nebst Zitrone ab. Klasse.

Sample from Robert - many thanks! The mead has got a deep ligth golden colour with a smooth body. Aroma of honey and herbs, not that intense. Taste of mild honey, flowers, herbs. Mild honey finish with some wild character. Enjoyed it a lot. Very smoothing and warming.

(sample) Pale amber, transparent colour, no head. Medium to sweet, moderate strong aroma, honey , higher alcohol, spices. Medium body, oily texture, a bit watery taste, light to moderate sweet, light dry, low bitterness, spices cinamon, honey, apple, slightly alcoholic a bit woody.Sweet and refreshing aftertaste. Pleasant, moderate strong in taste and aroma, easy to drink. Not bad.

Bottle (25cl): Thanks Geophagus: Served in a shaker: Clear darker yellow colored mead with some bubbles from the pour on top. Aromas of wood, honey, cinnamon, cloves, nutmeg, toast, apples, alcohol and some sweets. Flavours of cinnamon, honey, cloves, wood, bitters, light dry, light sweet, some toast, hint of apples and a dry malty yeasty tone. Aftertaste is a mix of bitters, honey, light sweet, some toast with some spices like cloves and a hint of apples again. No carbo, light watery light dry mouthfeel, medium bodied.
Ocena wystawiona na podstawie wspomnieñ z degustacji w ramach uzupe³nienia profilu.

Slightly sweet, flowery and quite fruity for a mead, I feel plenty of what I believe are apple and plum, maybe some nuts behind them. Moderate acidity, slight bitterness. Light body. Enjoyable, feels less sweet being balanced by other flavors.
4 day old mini growler. Pours clear golden with no head. Aroma is floral with honey and sugar. Taste is sweet with honey, sugar, flowers and booz.
Sample from bottle. Amber still pour. Notes of grassy honey, cloying, light tartness, caramel and some prunes.
Bottle. Aroma of parfumy honey, light nutty. Clear straw colour. Taste is moderate- sweet and light bitter. Medium body, oily feel, off-flavour finish.
Bottle. Pours clear yellow. Aromas of citrussy honey, floral, boozy. Taste is sweet, floral, light citrussy, walnutty.
sweet flowers aroma,golden, clear, minimal head, medium sweetness, medium body, soft carbonation, light dry soft very sweet finish.

Golden coloured and clear. No head. Heavy sweet aroma, notes of honey, herbs. FLavor is heavy sweet, more herbal honey notes, nice. Sticky texture, no carbonation. Earlier Rating: 6/29/2015 Total Score: 2.8 Dark golden coloured with a red note. No head. Sweet aroma, herbs, honey and fruity, raspberries. Heavy sweet flavor, acidic notes too,. Sticky notes. This version has raspberries added and is red coloured.

Bottle (30cl) Thanks Geophagus: Served in a wineglass at roomtemperature: Like applejyice but more golden with a copper glance with some bubbles from the pour. Honey, wood, in the nose with light spice, light alcohol, hints of sweets, plastic (like it was served in a plastic cup) and apple. Flavour is honey and bread with a light spice/warm tone, some sweets, light bitter with some wood, light dust, some funk and spiritus... Aftertaste is honey, spice, wood, warmth and some sweets which are lesse sweet than bitter. No carbo, thicker than water mouthfeel, between medium and a bit fuller bodied.

Eigentlich ist er dann doch wie jeder andere Met. Vielleicht einen Schuss saurer mit leicht zitroniger, esssig-nahen Anklängen. Sehr süffig, sehr einfach zu trinken und die süße Honiggrundlage ist ebenfalls zufriedenstellend ausgeprägt. Daumen hoch.
Sample thx to Grzesiek79 2019-10-05 Göteborg AR: brandy, thick burned honey AP: dark thick amber, no head, nice legs F: brandy, thick burned honey, sweet warming mouthfeeling, brulée pudding
Bottle. Clear amber color With no head. Aroma is sweet Honey. Sweet flavor. Oily palate.
Amber colour. Mderate honey aroma. Powerfull honey flavor. Long great finish. Exstremely creamy palate.

Vintage 2015. Dziwny, nie spotkalem jeszcze takiego miodu, jest tu zbyt mocna przewaga ziol, zwlaszcza nadmierny tymianek, mocno wysuszone, ziolowo likierowy miod. Siano w aromacie i sucha trawa. Mocno drapie w gardle, ze az kaszlec sie chce. Nie jest za slodki mimo ze poltorak, uwielbiam ziola ale z tymiankiem tu chyba przekombinowali.

A pour from 750ml bottle (thx, Alex!). Vintage 2009. Pours a bit hazy copper with no head. Aroma is a bit odd with medicinal sweet notes. Taste is veeery sweet, it drinks like an oil, with honey, dried banana, and sugared raspberry notes. Great stuff.
Bottle - Vintage 2009 - Sweet dark honey with some spice and cooked sugar. Jet clear beprown with a small white head. Decadent, marshmallow like creamy banana and wonderful finish. Brilliant.

Thanks Alex! Very dark brown. Toasty, little bit of raspberry, woody, toasty character. Mega sweet, like dark agave syrup or that sort of thing. Rich honey - not like manuka but the closest is the jujube from Myanmar. Finishes with alcohol, light fruity big sugary honey, wood. Damn, beautiful stuff. Richest mead ever?

750mL bottle, pours a deep dark mahogany. Aroma is decadent as hell, with treacle, red wine, decadent honey, with raspberries, and brown sugar. Flavour is crazily intense, with raspberries, decadently sweet honey, brown sugar, and syrup. Holy crap is this decadent. Body is nearly like syrup. Wow - incredible.
Aroma of honey, sweet. Very sweet, syrupy, thick, mostly just clear honey flavor with very low acidity but with a mild spicy bite in finish, similar to what some honeys have. Tasty.

Butla i etykieta przyciaga uwage.
